CommentsTitle: Well built and fairly easy to assemble!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2019
CommentsContent: The delivery people brought the treadmill right in to room of choice and unboxed and removed all the trash. I laid out all the parts and they are well marked right or left. The hardware is all separated by step as in the manual shrink wrapped to cardboard and labeled by step. The manual assembly instructions are very good. I noticed that the steel supports are really heavy gauge steel and well anchored to the treadmill base. The assembly was pretty straight forward and I did it all myself with the help of a ratcheting tie down strap. I used this to hold the treadmill base up while I did the steps underneath the base like the hydraulic holdup support for when you fold up the treadmill. This hold up support is great, it helps when folding the unit and slowly lowers the base to the floor to use. The only negative thing I can see about the treadmill is the lock on the treadmill mill until you log into ifit and give them info so they can charge your account every month. It’s like planet fitness you give your checking account info and they charge monthly and make it hard to cancel. This is very bad move by NordicTrack and should be discontinued! I should not have to signup for a service that is in fact part of Icon Fitness along with NordicTrack. Now you can bypass this by pressing the ifit button and hold down about 30 seconds. This didn’t work for me and I was upset until I read you have to have your safety key in place for anything to work! Guess what, I didn’t have the key in place. I put it in place and treadmill starts right up. The thing I wonder is wether NordicTrack does away with the bypass which would be criminal and I wouldn’t buy this. As far as I can see the product is well built and functions well. I will revisit this review with updates as I see how product and service goes. We have been using this treadmill for a while now and it is actually fairly quiet as compared to our last treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2018
CommentsContent: You must have an iPad to use this device as shown in the pictures and video.  I should have looked closer.  I'm right at 300lbs, which is its max weight rating.  When I walk on it, I can feel the belt momentarily hesitate with each footfall.  Hopefully this will improve as I lose weight, which is my goal.  The most annoying "feature" is that if you touch any of the controls after you start your workout, it will stop completely and you have to start over.  Even if you've been walking or running for 22 mintues, you better know which buttons you can push to keep it going. This is the only treadmill I've ever seen that works this way.  There is NO PAUSE button.  So if you have to stop for a minute to refill your water, or if you accidentally push one of the buttons, you're done and have to start over.It went together okay, but you can't do it alone.  You need help.  And plan on ONE screw not going in right.  It's not idiot-proof by any means, and trust me on this one, I'm an idiot.  LOLThe heart monitor doesn't seem to work very well, though I do have an alternative method for monitoring that.  It says it has it, and it should have it.  It doesn't work.So if you can find a cheaper one that you don't have to pay extra for stuff that doesn't work, if you weigh 300lbs or more, or if you don't have an iPad, get the cheaper one.  What happened to NordicTrack?
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Treadmill delivered today. Delivery was smooth. Assembly was difficult but we got it done. Registered with IFit as instructed. Downloaded the app, then decided to switch to manual. Turned on the treadmill without a problem, I calibrated the incline as instructed in the manual, set the speed to 1 mph and started walking. When I increased the incline, it went up to level 10 and stayed there. Absolutely stuck! Fortunately, I had registered my treadmill with NordicTrack. I called customer service who walked me through trouble shooting. Nothing worked. The rep, who was very patient and courteous by the way, said it was a problem with the display not communicating with the incline function/motor/sensor. A new controller is being sent but will take 7-10 business days. All this on day 1! I’m tired and frustrated. I’ll update my review once I install the new controller.Update: Installed new controller. Incline still stuck. Called customer service who suggested I perform calibration. That didn’t work either so I’m being sent a new incline motor. Sigh!Update: Based on problems from the start, I began to question this treadmill’s overall reliability.  I made the decision to return. I will say that NordicTrack’s customer service was courteous and responsive.Parting thoughts: Unpacking as well as assembly was cumbersome and difficult. Screw holes didn’t always line up and screws often took a great deal of strength to drive in properly. Instructions weren’t as clear as I’d hoped, despite multiple mediums including the Bilt app.Parts can take over 7-10 business days to arrive and can be a challenge to install. After reading other reviews questioning price fluctuations and whether this treadmill may be a returned or refurbished item, I’m beginning to wonder the same. On the plus side, customer service from NordicTrack and Amazon was excellent. If you have the time and patience to work through assembly and mechanical issues, this could be a great machine. The belt ran smoothly, if only for a few minutes, the folding mechanism is convenient and simple to operate and the display panel is bright and clear.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2018
CommentsContent: There is one huge flaw in this machine...and that is if you intend to use the incline feature you will no longer be able to reach anything out in front of you, meaning you can not reach your water bottle...music device...digital read out display...or even to use the heart rate grip handles.  If you look at the machine in the pictures...you will notice a black plastic insert that runs on top of the actual tread mill just below the display.  As you incline the machine...this part of the treadmill comes closer to you....meaning you have to move more backwards on the machine in order to avoid stepping on it.  You have to move back so far that you literally have to bend over at the waist just to use the heart rate grips.  I found myself keep having to step on the sides off the treadmill and stop my walk anytime I wanted to change my music or change a feature on the unit.  Very very frustrating. If you walk for say 30 to 60 minutes and you watch videos on youtube or something like that...you will have to literally stop walking and step off the machine as many times as the videos run out...or your music choice changes.  I don't hold onto the rail in front of me anyway, but if you are someone who does...you will not be able to do so with the unit inclined.  You will keep stepping on the plastic piece and can literally injure yourself the first time you do it.  Machine seems nice otherwise but this is to huge of a flaw to give it anything but 1 star.  I guess everyone else is not using the incline feature.  And no...I am not 8 feet tall....with long legs. Only 5'10" and my wife is 5'1" and has the same issue.  Just note the above and take into consideration when purchasing. I wouldn't buy this unit again...and already put together and box tore up to return.  Frustrating.

CommentsTitle: Holding down ifit button did not work for me! I still love the treadmill!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I am 218 pounds and 5'10. It shakes a little when I am on it. The handrails are a bit short and the front plate should be further up so people that want to stand really close to the console are able to do so without stepping on it and tripping.All that said I love this treadmill. I personally feel it is sturdy, I LOVE the one touch buttons to change speed and incline. I don't know why I didn't buy one of these for my home sooner. He set it up basically by himself but the delivery men put it where we needed it (for a fee) so we did not have to move the heavy box at all. CommentsContent: In order to use this treadmill it seems like you are required to create an account with ifit including giving them all your personal contact information, and your credit card information!  You can cancel the "free" trial after the 30 days but I find it outrageous that corporations can get away with this kind of invasion of privacy. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent:
Overall seems OK for the price, size and features - would go for another treadmill in the future.

bad stuff.

Belt
-Belt is closer 19 7/8” not 20” - not a huge deal I guess but, I expect actual measurement to be listed, not what they round it up to - especially since these seem to be largely priced out based on how wide the belts are. Belt also seems to flip up slight on the edges.

Lubricant
Belt is self self lubricated so that is good. What I do not like is that they want you to call them if you think the belt needs lubricant. I’m assuming that is so you pay for one of their service people (or vendor that they get cut in on) or try to get you to sign up for a plan. They should just list reasons lubrication would be needed and a recommended lubricant. Updated 12/15/20 - the belt seems to slow down each step when you walk on a slow speed. Not sure if that’s a normal thing but. I’ve tightened the belt quite a bit and don’t want to anymore at risk of damage. It is also kind of tough to tighten each side. You basically have to fish around with the Allen key on each side.

Ifit
I guess they want you to login and create a profile with a credit card. It doesn’t say it anywhere that you can just hold the Ifit logo for something like 10 seconds to bypass it.

Tools
They just have the Allen key included (used to assemble and adjust belt) but you also need to a philips screw driver (which most people have) and a wrench (would be a real pain to use a regular wrench) I used a ratcheting with a 3” extension. Considering how expensive these things are, they could included more tools and design it to were everything is more accessible.

Board
There seems to be 2 random screw holes on the bottom of the board - maybe for an add on item? Maybe they don’t have much quality control and something else is messed up.

Good stuff.

Heavy and sturdy
When assembled it seems very sturdy and hopefully built to last.

Display
Easly accessible and you can adjust speed/incline by pressing arrows or number (1-10)

Price
We got this, this month for $659.55 - for a machine with what they call a 20” belt (19 7/8”) and the incline/decline it seemed to be a good price.

Tips - I recommend not tightening the base screws too tight until your done assembling. It mentioned this at the end of the instructions, I do not recall seeing this at the beginning.

Sorry for all the typos -
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Overall this treadmill is very good and gets the job done, however for its price point I will nitpick at a few things that bothered me. The setting up process was a bit tedious and took a few hours, no big deal, however one of the side arms did not properly fit into the main console and it took a while to jimmy it around to get the holes to align properly for the screws, it fits but there are pieces of the plastic that aren’t sitting right. My biggest complaint is with the ifit program on the screen, if you’re looking to be able to sync your treadmill to the ifit cardio app (the blue one) you cannot do this with this model. As we found out, this model does not have the option to press the ifit button to allow you to enter a code on your phone and sync the two products via Bluetooth, only audio Bluetooth is available. However, you ARE able to keep track of your progress with the ifit coach app (the green one). While there is no Bluetooth syncing that takes place between the treadmill and your phone, logging into your ifit account allows the phone to simultaneously keep track of your steps, what trails you’ve done, how many miles you ran/walked, etc which is nice. My only con is that we had to do a little digging to figure out which app actually worked with this model, and I would have liked it to have been more clear in the paperwork that came without the treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

I tried holding the iFit key down for 30 seconds multiple times before that with no success per other reviews, but worked like a champ in about ten seconds after putting on the magnet.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2019
CommentsContent: The treadmill looks great.  However, they don't tell you that once you buy it for $599.00 + tax, get it assembled ($150.00 although this was included for this deal) -- you can't just plug it in and use it!!!  You have to first sign up for ifit membership (whether you want it or not) -- 30 day free trial, but you still have to provide your credit card information and remember to go cancel it after 30 days if you don't want to continue getting charged.  The reason for the 1 star (there is no 0 star option), is that I still can't get it activated!!!  I've signed up for the ifit membership and I got a nice email that said that the machine was unlocked and is ready to go... BUT the treadmill display still says go to ifit.com/activate -- product live customer support is only during US business hours Mon-Friday... so although delivery and assembly were completed on a Friday evening, the machine is useless until they are back on Monday... Warning for future buyers:  Buy it knowing that getting to actually use it is not as easy as just plugging it in.  I am very disappointing that I won't get to use it over the weekend... And depending on if the activation gets resolved on Monday, I may have to return it, which will be a hassle after getting it assembled... The person who assembled did not mention this little tibit of needing to "activate it" beyond plugging it in until he completed the assembly...
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: What a joke.  How can this be legal?

The first thing you see once you unpack is a big red sign, saying your treadmill is locked and you MUST visit iFit and accept their membership to get your treadmill unlocked.  You must give them your credit card number and although your first month is free, then they will charge you $15.00 a month, unless YOU cancel.  What a scam. CommentsTitle: Heads Up, your treadmill is NOT LOCKED
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2020
CommentsContent: NordicTrack honestly has some down right criminal tactics in order to make it seem like you have to buy a subscription in order to actually use the treadmill, They count on setting up a free trail you will forget about so they can continue to bill your account 15$ every month. Like they didn't just sell you an 800$ piece of equipment. The truth is you don't need a subscription, or contact them. you just have to press and hold the IFit button on your treadmill for about 30 sec, and it can be used as normal. The treadmill itself isn't bad... but nothing special either. if only i had done my research about this company i wouldn't of supported such shady tactics. The only reason i gave it one star is because no stars wasn't an option. Despite what they lead you to believe you never have to interact with this company. Don't visit their god awful website, support their criminal behavior, or give them your card's information.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2020
CommentsContent: The delivery was so unreliable because Amazon handed it off to XPO and despite multiple calls and sms confirmations, they delayed the delivery and only after I complained to an Amazon rep was it scheduled and delivered on time again. The delivery guys delivered it inside the door but it's really heavy so if you want it moved somewhere you will need strong people to move it.From an assembly point of view - it took my husband and me around 3 hours with a tool kit to assemble it. The instructions were really clear with no scope for confusion and all the parts were labeled really well. Thanks to the multiple reviews with the trick to not have to register to iFit, we were able to start the treadmill without signing up or paying anywhere. The screw and bolt for the part that helps in folding the treadmill is very weird and we were unsuccessful in getting that fixed but since we do not intend to fold it and the treadmill stays in the basement it wasn't a show stopper for us.Performance wise it's been a few weeks since it was put to use and there are absolutely no complaints. CommentsTitle: The product is good - but the installation is a hassle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2018
CommentsContent: I had concerns ordering this. Many people had bad experiences and I had one too. This thing is heavy - 200 pounds. So if the item is mishandled improperly, there is going to some damage to the plastic covers (it's very flimsy) and there is no protection on the side, Mine was broken when it came. So I called Amazon on the same day and they approved it immediately. I asked what to do about the installed one. The lady on the line said to dismantle (wrong info)  and put in the box, I forgot to check the return information in my amazon account (my bad). It said that the person who will come will dismantle and take it, but I did it anyway, because of the original info from Amazon support.The installation is pretty straightforward, but you do require one more hand and then go methodically over the instructions. The console support stands are a problem when screwing, so recommend you tilt it to the side and screw them in. The screws are tight. The unit requires 20 amp actually. My 15 amp breaks the circuit (with both units). The good and the bad:Pros- The unit is sturdy and looks nice. The speaker connection is nice.- In low speeds, the unit is quiet- The dampers allow you to run without much force on your feet- the one touch incline is quite nice- the heavy duty motor is good- The 20" wide walking belt is great- The hydraulic support for folding the treadmill is genius.Cons- The Unit is very heavy. Requires two persons to assemble without risk of injury.- Some assembly routines are hard to do- Bolts are hard to do manually.- Not easy to move around because of the weight. Wheels are not that helpful to move it around the room.- Don't count on support from NordicTracCheck the unit when it arrives. If there is damage, call Amazon and let them know. They will ship a replacement. Don't try to assemble it, because it may end up being a waste of time.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great Treadmill For Beginners and Experienced Users
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2020
CommentsContent: This was my first treadmill purchase and I spent several weeks researching various models and reading product reviews to become as informed as possible. To start with, my wife and I LOVE our new Nordic Track! Is it perfect? No. Those who reserve 5 stars for only a perfect item will never rate anything 5 stars. It is a very good treadmill in my experience and while I did read of some people having technical issues, that has not been my experience. I have been regularly using my treadmill for 3 months now, so I do have a decent amount of experience with it in order to leave a fair review.One of the things I really like about this treadmill is the iFit compatibility. There are so many different types of workouts you can select with a full range of beginner to experienced in all categories. You can choose walking, hiking, running, cross-training, walk-run, etc. and there are several series for beginners and advanced users as well. Weight loss, running series, incline series, and more. They have a great assortment of trainers and the treadmill syncs to the workout you choose and adjusts the speed and incline automatically throughout the workout. You do have the ability to easily override the auto adjustments in case you need to slow it down or want to speed it up more, but it is really nice being able to just focus on form and enjoy the workout without having to change speed and incline throughout.I assembled the treadmill myself and it was very easy to do. Only the last part required a second person to assist and in total, it took me about 2 hours from start to finish. The instruction manual is concise and easy to follow. I was missing two small screws that secure the cup holders in place, but one call and they were quickly shipped out to me and arrived 3 days later. These missing screws did not prevent me from using my treadmill in the meantime.I don't fold my treadmill regularly as I don't need the floor space, but I did include a picture of the folded position so you can see how it looks. If you have a lack of floor space but still want a treadmill, this may be the answer. The motor is not very loud in my opinion. It is a treadmill and there is going to be some noise. When the incline is increasing or going down, the noise is more distinct, but it really does not sound louder than one should expect to hear from a motor raising and lowering a heavy treadmill with someone on it.The incline has a range of 0-10 and that is perfectly good for where I am at. I suppose endurance runners and very advanced users may want more of an incline, but it is ideal to me. The speed range is from 1-10 miles and I have only taken it up to 6.5mph so far. Maybe one day I will hit 10mph and wish I could go faster, but I think I am pretty good with the speed range for a long time.I purchased the 3-year maintenance warranty on Amazon and recommend it if only to have it professionally serviced once per year. I do not want to have to deal with extra out of pocket costs if something breaks down and for $89, you can hardly go wrong. You will see when you register your treadmill on the Nordic Track site that they will offer you the same coverage, but it is a lot more expensive. Buy it through Amazon.Finally, some people don't like the iFit membership cost. It is $15 per month or $39 per month for a family plan. I received 2 free months with my purchase and renewed it as soon as my free trial was up because it's such a great feature. If you do not want an iFit membership, you can still use the treadmill in manual mode as well as the 20 preset programs the treadmill comes with. I think it would still be a great treadmill without iFit, but I encourage you to at least use the free iFit trial period before deciding you don't want it.The other models of this treadmill include bigger screens and higher inclines. I may upgrade myself in 3 years, but if you want a great first treadmill, I highly recommend this one.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: I LOVE it. Entertained cheaper options, ECSTATIC I went with this one
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Uh-MAZING. I paid for assembly and delivery to the exact room where my treadmill would go. After months of stalking treadmills online, scouring Offer Up, and diving deep into the Reviews sections of websites, I decided to go with this treadmill as my quarantine machine. Honestly, I wish like heck I had just taken the plunge sooner because this has been one of the BEST purchases of my year. I'm not the best runner, but I like to get a good sweat in and wanted something that offered at least up to 10mph of speed. This treadmill offers that and level 10 incline. The fold-up mechanism is also brilliant! It's so easy and there's some sort of suspension thing that make folding it up/down a breeze. I have had no problems with this treadmill and I've used it every day since owning it--usually, walk/run/sprinting anywhere from 2-4 miles. There are pulse-tracking sensors on the handles, but I don't use them because I have an iWatch. I also don't use the Bluetooth speaker stuff because I prefer to use my Alexa as it works better to annoy my Slytherin upstairs neighbors. All-in-all, I'm enamored with this treadmill and honestly wish I had gotten this thing as soon as the pandemic hit so that "quarantine fifteen" would have been in the opposite direction on the scale. This is a great piece for the casual runner and you can get your workout in any time of the day. For reference, I'm about 5'10, weigh around 185, and have a pretty long stride. The treadmill has a bit of a quake when I run, but it doesn't feel unsturdy. Final take-away: This is a good little machine. Spring for the assembly if you don't like lifting a 200-pound box and doing spatial math. You won't be disappointed!!! Can't recommend her enough! :)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Edit Fixed - Broke after two weeks
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2020
CommentsContent: This treadmill broke after only two weeks of light use. We have never had a treadmill do that. Nordic Track customer is terrible. There is no human you initially talk to. Everything at initial intake is via computer only. We are on day two and have had no contact from Nordic Track. For the amount of money you spend contact should be a human not a computer!Update cutomer service finally contacted us 1/18/20 via email only. They still aren't sending a technician out to fix it. Very dissatisfied with service on a high price item.Second update 1/21/20. ICON fitness parent company to Nordic Trac still hasn't called or emailed regarding a service visit.I finally called Amazon Product Support and they were great! The machine was not broken but needed to be reset. This machine needs to be plugged into a surge protected power strip. Power outage tripped the electronics up and that is why it wasn't working. The gentleman that helped me at Amazon was very good. But Nordic Trac customer service was No help at all. So for that reason I am only upgrading the review to three stars.

CommentsTitle: Assembly straightforward, can bypass iFit, belt keeps shifting all the way to left
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this treadmill now for over two months and have been using it fairly consistently for almost 6 weeks now. I walk and briefly run on it 4-5 days/week. I assembled it by myself, and can tell you while it is possible, it will be much easier to do it with help. For reference, I'm a 44yr old, 5'2" female. The hardest part was putting in the storage latch bar, which definitely screams for another person to hold the tread up while putting the bar in. After assembly, kept trying to bypass the iFit membership requirement but failing before realizing the emergency stop clip has to be on before you can bypass iFit. After that, started walking on it. By 3rd day, saw that the belt was shifting to the left until it was right against the side of the track. Read the instructions on how to fix this, but the fix was very short-lived. Have not been able to fix and the belt is all the way over to the left of the track. It hasnt jumped over the edge of the track though and hasnt caused any issues so I just use it while continuously monitoring the situation. Basic treadmill that does what it needs to, so fairly satisfied with my purchase for the price I paid. That could well change depending on how long it continues to work without issues. The warranty is also NOT 1 year, but a disappointing 3 months. Was not pleased to see that in the paperwork packet.
