CommentsContent: Last August, I bought a NordicTrack treadmill at Amazon. Two months later, it stopped working. I am asking the company for help; they are not finding the solution to the issue, after two hours of waiting for the phone to talk with a representative.  I asked them to exchange the machine, and they answered that they could not exchange it because I bought it from Amazon. This situation is making me anxious and very upset. I am feeling disrespected as someone stilled me.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Shocking customer service from ICON Fitness, mediocre product.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2021
CommentsContent: Short version: Pretty sure the product is decent, but couldn’t even get it fully assembled, and the customer service is an absolute joke. Very unprofessional and super unresponsive. Hopefully your product works good and assembly goes well otherwise you’re in for a rough time trying to get anything done or hearing anything productive from them.Long version: Purchased treadmill at the end of July, began assembling it and noticed the screws on the left handrail that supports the main console could be secured properly. It had to be a defect of some sort as the screws on the right handrail had no problem. We probably could have forced it in, but we didn’t want to compromise the console as that is a pretty heavy portion of the treadmill that should be properly secured, especially with all the impact coming from using the treadmill.We contacted icon fitness (parent company) about the issue and they said that the spare part is on back order but they will send it as soon as they can. After a month, we checked up on the situation, and was told the replacement handrail was sent two weeks later. Unfortunate part, the new handrail had multiple defects INCLUDING the same problem the old handrail had. Not only were the screws unable to be properly secured, but the rubber grip and the plastic cover on back end of the rail were both missing completely.Naturally, this wasn’t ok, and we proceeded to contact them (Icon Fitness) again about this new part, only to be constantly told over the next several months that the part is on back order and will be sent as soon as they can. Given the pandemic at the time, we chose to be patient, but eventually that patience came at an end. We had gotten the product in July 2020, and by October 2020 we still hadn’t gotten anything and our attempts to speak with a representative were met with vague commitments and unprofessional interactions on their end. We wanted to get a refund, but they wouldn’t even give us any kind of options since it was sold through Amazon, even if we’ve had a partially assembled treadmill for almost four months. We managed to get something sorted through Amazon (thank you so much) but the whole experience regarding NordicTrack and Icon Fitness has been a nightmare.But the story doesn’t end there. We had the product returned through Amazon around November 2020. Just the other day (which is why I’m writing this review) we actually got the new handrail delivered. At the end of January 2021, despite receiving it in July 2020 and returning it at the end of October 2020. It ended up becoming more comedic after such a frustrating experience.If you read it all and are still considering purchasing one, I hope you either get it professionally installed, or have a smooth installation experience. Otherwise prepare yourself for a rollercoaster of a customer service experience!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Good overall treadmill. Bad customer service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Overall I would give this treadmill a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Assembly process was not bad. Took about 1.5 hours to complete. Instructions were pretty easy to follow. However, the incline motor for my treadmill is defective. Thankfully I have a warranty but so far customer service has been mediocre at best at helping me fix it. They "said" they ordered me a new motor and scheduled a repair person to come out but that was about 2 months ago.  A less patient person would probably be freaking out by now but Im cutting them some slack with the c. virus going on right now. I paid for 2 years of extended warranty and honestly I don't think would recommend the extended warranty. The performance of the treadmill (aside from incline) is good. Motor runs strong and it's a comfortable run. There are a lot of different runs you can go on with the iFit too which is pretty cool. If they actually do come out and fix the incline I would give this treadmill 4 out of 5 stars (minus 1 star for customer service). NordicTrack it's the year 2020. You guys really need to up your customer service game and make it look like you are on standby waiting to attack any problem your customer might have. Currently I can tell the people you have in place are probably some teenagers reading from a manual while chewing bubblegum and watching anime.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2020
CommentsContent: So I’ve had this treadmill for about a month now. I did so much research on treadmills and read so many reviews. The biggest issue I read was people hated the iFit that comes with the Nordertrack. I can honestly say it is my favorite thing about using this treadmill. It motivates me so much more than I realized. Love love love this machine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: For me the unboxing and assembly took some time. In fact I still don't have the bar underneath  the treadmill so you can fold it upright connected. First off I'm only 5-3 120 and I was able to get the Treadmill from the garage to the basement family room by myself. A don't do this at home idea. As far as the assembly it was a little more difficult compared with other complex assemblys. The parts were all there. That was nice. All you need is a wrench, and phillips screwdriver. There are very few parts. I normally have tons more screws when assembling another product. The manual is clear enough. I wish the holes in a couple of important parts were a tiny bit larger. However, I switched to my own screws and then came back and used there's. In other words it takes a lot of force for there's to go through the steel. A power drill might work better than screwdriver. I had a confusing part with the dashboard cable caught in the bolt hole area and called customer support. They took had me take a photo and she was able to determine how the cord was misplaced. Excellent support help that I might not have figured out.I don't see what everybody is complaing about this ifit problem. My theory is take the one month free and see what the maximum features are and if you want to eliminate the monthly charge just cancel and it runs great without ifit. The features on ifit are fun and I love the way the coachs control the incline and speed according to your exercise. You do have the ability to override the features.The product is typical Nordictrack quality. A very nice treadmill to run on. Its big, comfortable, runs quiet, variable incline and speed measurements at 1/10 intervals. Plenty of room on the sides so if you want to hop off and keep the trainer going while you rest is nice. The bluetooth connect to the ifit works great. With an ipad it works nice. You can realign the belt which I didn't need to use. I haven't tried the ipod speaker idea. There are speakers but haven't had a chance to use them. I like the display with many different features to so and emphasise in front of you. Nice pulse tracker if you like. Being able to just hold onto the crossbar and measure how much effort you are putting into the exercise. Nice easy to read display and I have the smallest one. That is plenty large for me. Again I watch the videos on my ipad which sits nicely on the display.Overall, I wasn't happy during the assembly. Always complaing but that seems to be the norm when its a difficult assembly. Once I had it together I really like this machine. Its heavy, sturdy and made to last. Haven't had it for long but for the price its a top of the line model and glad I didn't go with a lesser known brand. I would recommend.The free one month Ifit just isn't all that bad and you can bypass that idea but I didn't consider that idea.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: I wish I could comment on how this treadmill actually works but after 3 months I still DO NOT KNOW! I ordered this treadmill in October 2020. It took a month to receive the treadmill. I put it together immediately to discover it doesn't work. I contacted NordicTrack that same day I put it together and they determined there is a short in the console.  They ordered me a new console. However after 2 months I am still waiting for said console. I have contacted NordicTrack numerous times to only be told it would take 2-3 weeks, however after 8 weeks I'm still waiting. After the 4th time of contacting them I finally got answers saying the part is back ordered.  No one at NordicTrack seems to care that I've had an inoperable treadmill for months. I normally wouldn't write such a review but I was recently contacted by NordicTrack to write a review in which they stated "We value customer feedback and are willing to send either a floor mat or maintenance kit as a thank you for posting a review!"So here is my customer feedback...do yourself a favor and DO NOT BUY THIS TREADMILL or any treadmill from NordicTrack unless you want terrible customer service from a company that clearly does not care about you after you have bought their product. I imagine any glowing review of NordicTrack it because someone received a free good. Poor business tactic.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Absolutely love this treadmill not a bunch to assemble took my husband about 20 minutes to set up and we used it right away with no problems. The quality is exceptional. Came really fast even during quarantine. Happy customer. No fan but it’s still a great product
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
CommentsContent: I've had many treadmills, from bargain basement price to thousands of dollars: none of them lasted past 2 years without a ton of hassle. I've given up on finding the “perfect” model and now I aim for the middle: a treadmill with decent basics that I can walk and do light jogging on, with some extras but not all the complex bells and whistles I never seem to use. This one fits the bill for my minimum standards.HOWEVER: the assembly of this thing was awful, unnecessarily so because of poor quality control alone. Screw-holes not properly threaded so screws won’t fit. You get exactly the number of parts needed, no spares, so don't accidentally drop a screw or washer where you can't find it. The neoprene sleeves on the handbars were cut unevenly and misaligned, I had to trim them down to get the crosspiece mounted. In addition to the paper instructions, you can download the BILT app which provides step-by-step 3D assembly. If everything had been properly machined and tooled, this install would probably have taken 30 minutes with minimal effort. As it stands with all the problems and crappy quality, I spread it out over days since I had to buy other screws and recover from the aggravation.I’m not using the speakers/stereo functionality of the console (you'll need to manually plug in your device if you want that, very throwback). Display gives you the typical options. Incline works smoothly and you can adjust the shock absorber things under the track if you prefer a firmer or bouncier run. Folding up and down is simple. The console and other parts are mostly plastic and feel pretty cheap. There are wheels on the rear legs to assist in moving but they are pretty tiny: no matter how you tilt, the metal legs are still close to the ground and I tore a piece of my treadmill mat that way. Overall, a decent treadmill and (probably) worth the six hundred or so I paid, if it lasts 2 years.IMPORTANT: don't get roped into the “Free Trial” for iFit unless you know you want to subscribe long term. Just hold down the iFit button on the console for about 30 seconds and it will activate the treadmill for use without you having to sign up for anything.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Love the machine- when it worked. Terrible service!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2019
CommentsContent: I have never written a bad review until now. Bought treadmill and paid to have it assembled. 5 weeks later it stopped working, on Thanksgiving! No one was available to talk to until the following Monday (off for holiday and they don't work weekends in service department). Said they needed to order a part but it was on back order with NO ETA. Continued checking back regularly and finally was told it would arrive by the end of December. It is now Jan 23 and no part.  I've called several times over the past few weeks, sat on hold for an hour before hanging up, being disconnected, or told to call back because they were training employees and not taking calls.  Today, I was on hold for over an hour but finally got to talk to someone! Same news as last time- part should be in within the next 1-2 weeks and then they will ship it to me. I'm not holding my breath. I loved the machine for the month that it worked.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Severe customer support issues with brand new treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I received my treadmill about two and a half weeks ago and hired a professional technician to assemble it.  It took several hours to complete the assembly.  When we finally turned on the unit, a huge tear in the belt (hidden throughout the assembly process) rotated into view.  I registered the product and requested service to replace the torn belt under warranty.  That was two weeks ago, and the company has made no effort to contact me or correct the problem.This is a brand new 300 lb treadmill that I ordered weeks ago and had professionally assembled.  I do not want to return it and start all over again when all that is needed is a new belt.  However, NordicTrack is leaving me with no choice with their abysmal customer service.  What a huge disappointment.My advice is to stay away from this company until they improve on their commitment to customer service and to correcting issues with brand new units.Update 9/18:  I received no response from the three online service requests I submitted to NordicTrack over the course of three weeks.  I finally steeled myself to an endless wait time and called their customer service number.  The rep offered to send a belt but expected me to perform my own repair - for a brand new product under warranty.  I’m not handy, and have no interest in doing treadmill repair.I arranged for a partial return with Amazon, who discounted the product sufficiently to cover the new belt and technician.  I sure hope this machine never breaks, because NordicTrack won’t provide any support.Amazon handled my problem very effectively.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This treadmill has so many issues I'm not sure I can keep it.1. I was able to put it together myself, even though the instructions indicate you need 2. I don't have someone that would come over with the COVID stuff going on. I used bungee cord and these straps that you use to move heavy furniture, as my 2nd hands.2. There are a few problems when putting it together.3. The first, the instructions state to use a screw driver and an adjustable wrench. It was impossible to tighten the bottom screws for the legs to the main body with a wrench. I ended up using a 9/16 ratchet to tighten. The wrench wouldn't even fit where the screws were located (image #1).4. The other issue, the instructions say (p. 12 & 13)  "push the upright wire into the right upright leg" but that doesn't work. The problem is the wire from the console doesn't fit the space that's left available between the leg and the arm. So I had to tuck the wire under the console (image #2).5. The other issue with the console wire,  you can't screw in the right side compartment holder because the wires are in the way of the hole (image #3).6. The leg cover doesn't cover the cords that are left out at the bottom of the right leg so I'll have to cut a space in the cover to allow room for the grounding wire (image #4) and the other wire  (image #5).  Maybe I installed the wire wrong but I don't see another way to attach the wire to the grounding screw from the inside.7. I was excited to use it but first I had to get around the IFIT registration requirement. Everything in the paperwork suggests that you have to register the device with IFIT to use it. First, IFIT requires a credit card to set up, even though they say the first 30 days are free. That seems deceptive to me so I called customer service and they said to push the IFIT button for 30 sections to enter manual mode which will bypass the IFIT registration.8. The motor is soooo loud.  It sounds like a dead engine trying to make it up a hill, this combined with the sound of your shoes on the belt is very distracting.I'll have to try it for a few days, but honestly, the other treadmills are outside my budget.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Waiting for New Panel - UPDATE - PAY ATTENTION!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021
CommentsContent: UPDATE:  In my review below, I mentioned that Amazon/NordicTrack won't just replace the panel, they needed to replace the entire treadmill.  Delivery of the new treadmill arrived this morning.  The drivers stated that they were delivering only and weren't picking up my 1st defective treadmill and that I would have to make different arrangements with Amazon for that to happen.  We opened the replacement treadmill and SURPRISE!  This one also has the manufacturer's defect.  The entire row of preset workouts is missing.  Makes me believe that NordicTrack is just trying to see how many of these they can offload to unsuspecting customers without them noticing.  We refused the delivery and called Amazon back.  This time, they offered me 3 options:  Try a 3rd replacement (no thanks!), return the treadmill altogether for a full refund (we considered it) or they would give us a refund of $258. We felt this was a fair trade.  Not only would it save us time and money, any loss of value if we try to re-sell this in the future will hopefully be accounted for. My suggestion:  It IS a great machine but go buy it at your local store and make sure you have the right buttons on your panel before accepting it.I'VE ATTACHED PHOTOS OF HOW THE PANEL SHOULD APPEAR AND HOW THE PANEL FROM AMAZON ACTUALLY APPEARS.I've scrolled through the customer review photos on this treadmill and see that MANY of the buyers have had the same issue and haven't even realized it.  There is an entire 2nd row of preset workouts on the top row of the panel (the row that has the ifit icon).  It is missing on many of the photos here and was also missing on my panel.  I called Amazon and they reached out to NordicTrack.  It is a manufacturer's defect that they are aware of but for some reason aren't requiring a review of the equipment they have in stock.  The bummer?  They won't just send me the replacement panel.  They have to send another entire new treadmill.  Amazon stated that we could just open the box and take the new part that we needed and put the defective part back.  I hope so because my husband spent hours putting this together for me and I don't want him to have to do it again.Other than this glitch (which is hopefully easily fixable), the machine is a beast.  It is solid and sturdy, substantial and very quiet. I may or may not even use the presets once I get more familiar with the machine, but for this price, I want what I paid for.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Let me start by saying you can bypass the iFit registration. That is NOT necessary to use this treadmill.  Press the blue iFit button on the display and hold until it flashes and beeps. Then you can use the manual or the manufacturer built-in workouts.I assembled  the treadmill by myself, but yes, having a second person to help hold is nice (I’m sure ha ha!).  The instructions are super easy to follow, and the best advice I could give you is lay out all the parts and separate the packaging right from the get go. Keep your work area tidy and put your tools back in one location before you start the next step. Took me about 1 hour to do alone.The treadmill is great for what I need and was looking for. It’s very sturdy and is fairly quiet (I find running is actually quieter than walking). It doesn’t have a lot of bells and whistles, and it allows me to control my workout.A few words to the wise: when you hit stop from running or walking, it stops, like almost immediately. It doesn’t have a slow down, so just be ready for that or put your legs on the sides before you hit stop.  Also, when you stop the workout and have the incline up, you have to push the button to lower the incline before you shut it down. Do not forget to put the incline to 0 before folding up for storage. I also read a lot of reviews that said the customer service was terrible, so I did get the protection plan as well when I purchased and registered it with the company. I also read all the other companies had terrible customer care, so I figured it’s all the same, and hope I never need to call them.So if you’re looking for a great quality treadmill thats simple to use for your daily run, walk, workout routine, go no further.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Great treadmill for the price. I almost cancelled my order when I read the bad reviews. Do not read the bad reviews they are not all correct I didn’t read all but whatever I read  scared the hell of me. First of all do not assemble it yourself. I don’t care how handy you are unless u assemble treadmill on a regular basis. I hired an company they did great job everything works as stated. Heart monitor is exact. One of the reviews mentioned that heart rate is false it’s not. I wear an Apple Watch and heart rate is same as what Apple Watch displays. Yes it came with a plastic part broken during delivery but it’s just cosmetic it doesn’t affect the running or walking factor. Bottom part and motor cover were broken but called manufacturer and they are sending the parts and schedule a tech to replace them.  Amazon was great to give me an extra discount because of that as long as it’s safe. Incline is correct I know because I belong to a gym I know how incline works. I think most of the reviews are from people who tried to assemble the machine themselves . True some said machine came with manufacturers defect but  you always can call Nordictrack and get help.  I love this treadmill especially my gym is closed now.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2020
CommentsContent: As for the treadmill, it seems well constructed, was very easy to assemble and has made my wife pretty happy - win. You can press and hold the iFit button down for approx 20 seconds and bypass the monthly reoccurring membership to work out if you want - thanks to whoever posted that in their review earlier as I clearly do not want to pay a monthly gym membership at home.As for buying large objects like this through Amazon - think it out and set your expectations. I have found Amazon to be completely reliable for printer ink, woodworking hand held tools and equipment, cleaning supplies... coffee... BUT I have not had good luck buying larger freight shipment items. This was scheduled for delivery on July 23rd and we received it on August 6th. We paid for the deliver to room of choice - XPO the subcontracted delivery from Amazon almost left the box on our curb but we heard the truck and went out and after a short discussion they agreed to bring it 200+' up our driveway and roll to our back patio where I assembled it. XPO was absolutely awful. I had to call Amazon to get in touch with them and they are a freight service - not a customer service type business. They could give a hoot what you think, feel, or want... they'll deliver it to you when they are darn good and ready. From the package tracker we saw that the treadmill arrived in our city on the 24th of July. Amazon said we needed to wait until the 6th of August before they would refund or reorder and viola, on the 6th of August in the afternoon it arrived. The box had significant damage. The packaging inside the box was rumbled. The upright rails were scratched and one of the side plates on the belt assembly has a cosmetic dent in it. I say all of this to help you temper your expectations. Prime meant free delivery but ... you might want to pay a local retailer to deliver your machine.As for the treadmill as a whole. This is a very basic model which is exactly what we wanted. If you're looking for a fancy full of features and video deal you'll need to spend some more. As for us, we'll watch TV or listen to our Bose sound and really just want the workout.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this treadmill 2 months ago and am surprised how often I’ve been using it. It is quite heavy but was easy to set up. It takes up remarkably little room when folded up. It seems to be well made and no, you don’t need iFit membership to use the machine. Set up my iPad on the tray and listen to audio books or music during my run. Highly recommend the treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: GREAT treadmill. Especially for the price. Yes, the iFit button hack is one of the main reasons this is a five star and not a three star, but w/e. Can't knock a company for trying to come up with extra monthly income. Let's talk about the machine itself.First off: definitely try to get the delivery people to deliver this as close to the room you want as possible. Especially if you live alone. I didn't think 200+ lbs was that big of a deal when I saw it in the description, but trust me...it is a chore lugging up and down stairs. Thank God for delivery folk.Next: just putting this together can be daunting if you don't have another person. The first couple of steps are manageable by yourself. Putting the handrails together, getting the wire through etc...it's annoying, but definitely simple and straightforward. HOWEVER: at the end...when you are trying to get the hydraulic lift pole thingy in place by holding up the 200 lb machine and unscrewing then screwing in bolts...yeah. That can be a real b-word if you are trying to do it yourself. I highly recommend having a friend or husband or large dog or something holding the machine up while you work it lest you have it just fall on you and kill you.Running on this thing has been pure joy. Thanks to COVID, we're all trying to avoid icky germs and being around other people. Hence gyms = nono. I found this machine as good as any that I have used at most of the gyms I've been to, though it is without some bells and whistles and it is only ever going to be as sturdy as you make it since...well..you are putting it together.It's a good buy. Worth the price for sure. Just remember what I tell you.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Three stars because once it's assembled it's great
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2020
CommentsContent: First and foremost, I had quite an issue in the beginning. Like many of you, my treadmill came broken. Initially, I didn't mind it at all, I just called customer service and said that I don't mind keeping it but I am not willing to pay for the full amount only because it's not brand new, it's broken. They honored that and I was happy. However, as my boyfriend and I were building this thing, *note i highly recommend at  least two people* we realized that there are missing pieces. So then I call amazon again, after a hour of being transferred like three times, I was able to get a brand new treadmill for the same discounted price. Especially since it took HOURS to put this thing together.Like others as well, DO NOT SIGN UP FOR IFIT! Press the blue button for about 30 seconds and it'll turn on. Don't get scammed into the credit card scheme. I'm sure it's great and all but I don't like things being forced on me.Now in regards of the treadmill, it's pretty nice! Granted it took forever to build. Assembly directions are garbage. Google or youtube it, because there's a step at the end that you need to do actually in the beginning. It's like the wire covering sliders that goes over the wires on the sides. You need to do that like in the beginning stages, youtube it you'll see what i mean. The directions are written poorly. The screws sometimes don't even fit, you'll see what im talking about. We used a hammer etc.The treadmill after it was put together, it was great! I did my workout a few times, it's a bit loud but that's normal in my opinion. It's like as loud as going to the gym and using one of their treadmills.  The speakers are a nice touch, ipod is a bit outdated lol. Overall, without the ifit program, it still inclines up to level 10, speed goes up to 10, measures your pulse by the grip, time, calories, and distance. The important stuff, i hope this review helps.Ps. yes the exchange was annoying but it was worth it for me because i'm not paying 900 something (protection plan included) for something broken. Cheers!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: Got the product, and the plastic frame around the belt was broken. I will update my review once I receive the new one in (hopefully) new condition.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: 30 second trick works! LIES! You don’t need subscription!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: First let me start by saying the treadmill is amazing. One of the delivery guys was bringing it in and their first comment was man this is heavy you can tell this isn’t a cheap one. It’s incredibly sturdy and everything works as desired without unnecessary frills. I’ve been on treadmills with fans before they don’t do anything :) The delivery guys were fast and polite.Now the negative which has nothing to do with Amazon or the treadmill itself, but the deceptiveness and out right lies that are printed inside of the manuals and the screen when you purchased this treadmill claiming that it literally will not work if you don’t activate the iFit subscription. This is not unique to just this treadmill, it is the new wave sweeping exercise equipment. They will outright claim that you have to subscribe to their subscriptions or equipment will not work and it is not true. To be honest I’m really surprised this is legal. However....The 30 second trick does work! Hold down the blue iFit button for 30 seconds and it will get you out of the screen telling you to activate ifit and your treadmill will immediately start working!!At the end of the day I would recommend this treadmill  and hope that lawmakers stop this immoral  practice praying on people who fall for their lies.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: This is an awesome treadmill! I'm 200 pounds and I can run on it just fine. IFit  is predatory and annoying, but I knew from other reviews to override it and never give my credit card information (it works great without it). The programs and incline are great, and I haven't had any issues so far. It is a bit noisy but if you shut the door it isn't that noticeable. It is heavy to carry up the stairs, so make sure you put it where you want it to stay. Some of the reviews said it was hard to lift it to fold up, but I don't think it's heavy (I'm an out of shape 200 pound woman). It took my husband a few hours to put together. The cup holders are super huge which I love because I can fit a large mason jar of water in them. Thanks!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2019
CommentsContent: So far I love it. It's the perfect price. Some people don’t want to get this because it says you have to subscribe to the iFit program. I never had to! I learned that if you hold the iFit button for about 20-30 sec it skip the whole having to sign up to it. Doing that I didn’t have to worry about having to call to cancel the subscription. It comes with 4 programs that have 5 different levels in each-20 in total! They are not all that easy I have to stop on one about 15 min into it because I couldn’t keep up! I know I’m not that in shape but I’m not that out of shape either. I’m 5’7’’ 125 lbs and have had 4 kids. The hear rate monitor works- at first I thought it didn’t because it would start to blink like it was going to give me my results and then it would disappear. I learned that even if it did that you have to keep your hands there and your heart rate WILL appear-you just have to be patient.The incline works great! Haven’t had a problem. Same with the speed.Unless you know for a fact that you can run/sprint more than 10 mph then you can consider getting a faster treadmill. I could barely keep up going 6 mph for a little bit. Cup holders are great. It does have a plug for an auxiliary cable if you want to use your phone with its speakers. The side rails(not sure if thats what they’re called) help when I lose my balance to get back on track. It also has the emergency stop that you can clip on to yourself in case you fall.It won’t fit through all door frames so measure! It helps if you know what room your going to want it in so it gets assembled in that one room. It not too noisy- I don’t think I’ve ever used a treadmill that was dead silent before. It doesn’t have a fan but even the ones that do are not even that strong! I think the treadmills that have them are just to make it feel more like your outside rather than to cool you off. Just grab a fan you already have at home and done! Overall I believe I made a great purchase!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Most Frustrating Purchase of My Life
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2020
CommentsContent: After a lot of research I purchased this treadmill for my birthday. I immediately loved it! The I-fit software is fantastic and I really enjoyed just being able to run or walk without having to think about adjusting my speed. It really improved my fitness. That is, until one day I was running on it and my treadmill started going crazy. The belt started moving EXTREMELY fast out of nowhere. Fortunately I was able to react quickly and pull the key but I could have been terribly injured if I hadn't done so. After that each time I would turn on my treadmill it would do the same thing. To make a long story short I bought this treadmill in January of 2020. It stopped working March 2020 (yes just 2 months later) and guess what? It is now September and I still do not have a working treadmill. Nordictrack cannot get me the part needed even though its still under warranty. They keep blaming COVID even though it has been months. I am very understanding of the issues caused by COVID especially with shipping from overseas. But this is beyond ridiculous. Their customer service has been terrible. Meanwhile I'm still paying for in I-fit membership I can't use. I wish I could say this was a one off situation but if you google issues with the control board, you will be shocked to find this has happened to many people. I highly caution anyone who is considering buying this product. It is a shame because it could be such a great product if it actually worked.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 14 InchesStyle Name: T 9.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Body frame is crooked, not usable. customer service is slow. issue not fixed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Manufacturing defect:I was very excited to have received T Series 6.5S Treadmill. However, upon assembly I observed the main frame of the treadmill is crooked and is very wiggly when on the floor and impossible to fold up because the main body (that houses the belt) gets stuck at the right arm because the frame is tilted to the right. That part came pre-assembled. Check the picture and the video. This is an obvious manufacturing defect.NordicTrack Customer Service:The package included a big signed " Please do not return to store" and it has an email address. NOT A PHONE NUMBER.I sent an email with the problem, with pictures.3 days passed. no responseThen I visited their website and I found chat support.  Waiting for 30+ min in queue. the agent responded. explain the issue again.The agent said this is fixable. Please don't return. But you need to register the product first.I registered the product.the day after received email asking me for my info to verify me. I replied with the info.the day after received another email asking me to confirm all screws are in place and tighter.I replied right away that screws that I was asked to install are in the right place and the highlighted AGAIN that the crooked piece came pre-assembled.3 days passed and no response.I believe Nordic Track customer service are testing my patience.I will update this post with my experience and see if the issue is resolved or I had to contact Amazon to get someone to take it back.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020
CommentsContent: This is certainly a very impressive machine, and help you with many functions.  I am surprised that such a powerful machine, with its strong name, takes away services, instead of adding it.1. The machine will not start working unless you join the IFIT, including a charge card, something I don't like to give so easy.  So I press the join bottom holding it for a while, and this lets you overpass their request, but they don't tell you that.2. Most machines have an automatic coll down button, this one doesn't have it.3. Most machines have at least 10 pre-program exercises for 30 minutes each on the different levels, this doesn't have it anymore, unless you join them and pay a Monthly fee.Overall is a good machine for basic people like me, if you expect a high level of functions, you better pay the Monthly fee.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Glad I purchased the Nordic Track Treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: Assembly was a little tricky and really takes two people.  One needs to hold certain parts while the other tightens screws.  However my 17 year old grandson was able to assemble in about 30 minutes.  It is very sturdy and did require two people to move.  It weighs over 200 pounds.  As it is in the basement, I have no need to fold it up so I can't review that option.  I like the solidness of it compared to some less expensive models.  It has a bluetooth connection and can be used for live Interactive™ Training with IFIT.  This is free for a month and a monthly subscription after that. I have not used this option, but it is a nice feature for some.  The only complaint I have is I wish the bed was a little longer, when on incline my foot keeps hitting the motor cover and the hand rails could be longer also.  In order to use the handrails, I also tend to step on the motor cover.Overall, it is a great  treadmill and I am very happy with it.  I use it almost every day as does my husband.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this after finally realizing my days at the gym were over. I researched treadmills FOR WEEKS. Finally, after asking for recommendations on social media, a friend gave this treadmill such an amazing review, I purchased this immediately after her response.It arrived as scheduled. It was bigger than I thought but that’s not a bad thing. I’m 220 pounds so I wanted something secure. Note: It takes two people to put this together quickly. And, it takes some muscle getting it in the house.It took us a couple days putting this together because we didn’t follow the instructions. 🤦🏾‍♀️Once we got it together, we found a faulty wire. I called support and they have a great method to provide service. I downloaded an app and the app allowed her to see my treadmill. It was like FaceTime via an app. She saw the problem and sent me what was needed.After getting everything together, my free iFit membership was about to expire. I sent them an email and asked for a couple weeks to try it out. Without hesitation, they gave me a new 30 days!I’ve used this treadmill a lot. I really like it. It has two huge cup holders and a ledge to hold a book, tablet, or phone. I learned how to silence the beeps so it’s not waking my husband up in the morning.It’s easy to fold and unfold.Pros: It does what it says. It’s sturdy. It’s high quality.Cons: It’s not as quiet as I would like. It may be due to me putting it together but there is a sound of the belt when using.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this treadmill about 2 weeks in to the gym being shut down during the pandemic. It kept me sane until the gym opened back up and now that the gym is open I still find i am using it quite a bit to jump on it in the middle of the day or when i log off at work at night to get steps in! It is very easy to use and i did NOT purchase the NordiTrack software it said you "have" to buy. I read a review on here that showed you how to bi-pass it and i have had no issues. I would definitely recommend.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a nice solid treadmill.  All pieces were securely wrapped in the box, which came undamaged.  We are slow but it took about 2 hours to put together.  Time went fast.  This thing is heavy, which is good when using it, but not so great for moving it around.  We like it enough to deal with that though.The iFit... I know you don’t have to subscribe but we took them up on the free trial.  We didn’t have to put in a credit card number.  That was optional.I thought iFit was going to be glitchy and gimmicky but it’s really great for keeping you company while walking and also keeping your mind off of how long you’ve been on the treadmill.  For walking, there are guided tours of so many places around the world and you learn so much.  The treadmill automatically adjusts the incline and speed so you get to keep up with the tour guide and get a workout at the same time.  It’s very smooth and not choppy when changing the incline and speed to match terrain.You can use this treadmill manually without IFit, but it really is worth trying out if you have some sort of tablet.  We are using a 2nd generation iPad and it works great.The belt is longer than our old treadmill, and it is wide enough that I dont scrape the sides constantly.  I feel like we got a decent bargain getting this treadmill.—— update——-We have had this treadmill a while now And it still runs great.  Still loving IFit.  Even my husband is using it.  Nordic track customer service has been good too.  I had to call because it was squeaking and they sent a free bottle of lubricant for it.  It takes a while to get them on the phone but once you do they are very helpful.  Love the new treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2020
CommentsContent: After reading numerous reviews, I decided to take a chance on a treadmill I was not able to actually test out in person...happy so far, except for the weird stuff required for activation, signing up with IFIT-which I have no interest in continuing with. The good thing, is, I did not have to give IFIT my credit card info. I was really amazed at the quality of the treadmill and how big it actually was. My husband put it together in about an hour. Have only had this for about a week, so will add more to my review if I have more to say-good or bad.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: No Need to Pay for iFit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2020
CommentsContent: So I am giving this product 4 stars but only because they truly try to force IFIT on people. You don’t have to register the IFIT to make it work or provide your credit card. Simply hold down the IFIT button for about 15 to 20 seconds and it will unlock the treadmill. You also only have to do this one time. Nordic Track doesn’t advise customers of this either. So that to me sounds a very deceptive practice.As far as putting it together, you do require two people as you’ll need to have someone hold up the panel while being installed. The tools needed were socket wrench set, a Philips screwdriver, along with the tool they provided. My 20-year-old son put this together and without any issue. So it is not hard to put together and save yourself on the installation fee.The machine works perfectly for my needs. I also paid the $19 to have it delivered to the floor I plan to have it installed and it is a great idea as the machine is heavy. I also purchased a mat for the treadmill to sit on to keep it from damaging the carpeting. Raising and bringing down the belt for storage is very easy as well.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Literally would purchase 4266284 times over. I despise running with a passion and I am now running between 10-20 miles a week which is unheard of for me. I love the recorded sessions, and I am absolutely in love with the fact that the instructor controls the incline and speed. I think over time I will go ahead and purchase the more expensive version but at this time this is absolutely perfect for my beginner/intermediate  running level. I’m slowly climbing the classes intensities and am beyond happy. A piece arrive broken and the customer service was prompt and sent me a new piece immediately!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2020
CommentsContent: It's been a couple of months since we bought this NordicTrack treadmill. Our overall experience has been good, my wife uses it to walk and I use it to run, it is a solid and stable structure.The model we bought does not have any fancy screens or functions but it works great if you are looking for a very functional treadmill to walk or run.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: This treadmill is awesome. Great value. Feels like I am running on a treadmill at the gym.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2020
CommentsContent: My previous treadmill stopped working. It was 8 years old. So I decided to replace and started my search. After a few weeks, I decided on this model. This treadmill is awesome. Great value. I have only had a couple days. But I am very satisfied so far. 1st of all, the delivery was on time. The delivery folks were awesome. They had me all setup in ~ 45 minutes. Secondly, I did read all the reviews before I decided to purchase. Was concerned about the ifit and having to register in order for the treadmill to work. It can be bypassed without registering! There was a review on how. So no worry there. Thirdly, after 2 days and 2 runs so far, I can say this treadmill feels like I am running on a treadmill at the gym. Very happy with purchase. Will check in again in about 1 month to provide an update.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Worth it, but some considerations to note
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2020
CommentsContent: After 1 week, overall I like this treadmill for running and walking and think it was worth the money.The biggest potential issue I see is the 2.6 hp motor which is on the small side if you plan on running. Time will tell how this holds up to regular light running. So far it is smooth and works flawlessly. The i-fit thing is a bit of a joke, but as long as you know how to bypass when you 1st plug it in (hold down the i-fit button), it doesn’t bother you after that. I do find it annoying that the manual does NOT tell you how to do that.Dislikes:- At a slower walk, the motor does not run smoothly, it has slight jerks twice a second. It’s a bit distracting and doesn’t feel great, but I’m getting used to it. At faster speeds I don’t notice it- Cannot resume your walk/run after stopping for 1 min. It still shows the details for your recent run/walk for about 5 min, but if you attempt to resume, it just gives an annoying quadruple beep. This is really annoying if you have to stop for a minute, you have to start over. Also the backlit display stays on indefinitely unless you pull out the magnet, which is not a big deal.- Bluetooth capable but only works with i-fit app and some heart monitors. This renders the speakers in it worthless unless you want to plug in an ancient ¼” jack (if your device even has one). I tried this and found the speaker in my phone to be vastly better.Likes:- Number buttons allow  you to easily dial in the incline and speed without holding down the up/down buttons- Assembly was fairly easy, but there are a couple things that require 2 people- Pretty stable even when running. It has a little bit of wobble when running, but for the price it’s great. I run at  6-7 mph and the motor seems to handle it just fine
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Love, love, love. Much better than I expected - solid machine and seems like it will last.It was a little challenging to put together - as some people mentioned, some of the screw holes are tight, but it nice together it’s easy to fold/unfold and has a mechanism to support the weight as the bed is laid down.Works on full speed/incline and has already been a great addition to my fitness routine - definitely recommend!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: So far good after first few runs.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2017
CommentsContent: My initial review here.  Will update after additional usage:This is a solid mid-range home use treadmill.  As someone who has only every used professional grade ones at the gym, I was a bit afraid I'd see a big step down.  I don't.  The treadmill does a good job maintaining consistent speeds and is rated to up to 300 lbs (I weight about 165).  The track bed is amply sized for my 6ft height yet folds up conveniently.  NB, it is still big even when folded up.  There are a bunch of preprogrammed workouts but I have no intention to ever use these nor will I pay for IFIT.  The controls are intuitive, but I do have a few gripes.  I wish it listed pace not just speed.  I wish you could see distance and time at the same time, but they alternate back and forth.  I also wish the speakers were a bit louder.  Some have complained that the treadmill is loud, but it is no louder than any I have ever used in the gym.  The acoustics of a small room might perhaps make it seem loud.Delivery was on time and they brought it right inside.  It is heavy so make sure they do.  Assembly was a mix bag.  Scheduling and rescheduling was a pain.  When they did come, the gentleman was nice and efficient but he made a few mistakes while assembling.  I fixed these but how do I know there aren't more.  For the discount price of $15 not a bad deal, but I might be really annoyed at $80.So far I am pleased with this purchase.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2019
CommentsContent: WARNING!! If you are using this on a second floor then pay the extra cash for 2nd floor delivery!! I did and I'm glad I did it, this thing is well packed in a wood/cardboard create it's huge!! Delivery guys were EXTREMELY fast and professional. As for treadmill I love it, I'm 6'4 and 242 pds it's feels solid when I run.. I do sprints at 9mph on it and its solid as a rock.. My only complaint is the screen is really HD clear, but I wish i could use my iPAD screen to watch the ifit videos on it instead, next time I'll buy the larger screen.  the create your own maps feature sucks really bad, it's a joke!! BUT the ifit training videos well make up for it!! They really are something else.. The only reason I dont give 5 stars is because I cannot use ipad to watch ifit video on it.. You can stream sound to treadmill speaker for music but I have a Google home speaker next to it with a Bose Bluetooth speaker so I have my spotify playlists..  Aside from me crying about that lol It is a well built fast treadmill.. AND because of this treadmill (and diet) my Cholesterol dropped 50 points!!!!!!!!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Works well, even with antiquated tablet-style screen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: So, we’ve put  one to 200 hours on this treadmill and like it a lot.1. Install: we paid extra for install (it was on-sale), so I couldn’t be blamed for any warranty claims we might have in the future. The install did not take long, but, in the end, the installer handed me the remaining lock-washers, which was...all of them, still seals against the cardboard. I asked the installer if he needed these, whether he used all of the parts required in the instructions, and he said, “yes”. He seemed like a nice fellow, so I guess I’ll just have to trust him. Nothing has come loose so far!2. Touch-screen: This thing appears to be as low-budget as you can get. It’s sloooow to respond to touch inputs and transitions slowly between screens. I’m not sure if it’s related, but animations for guided workouts run at around 1 FPS. That might just be to save on space, not the screen, but I thought it was worth mentioning.3. Workout: flawless. The speeds seem accurate, the buttons are easy to push for speed and elevation changes, and the failsafe magnetic dongle is very easy to knock off in case of emergency. I’ve only had to do this once, when my daughter decided to climb onto the treadmill while I was running. The track stopped nearly instantaneously. I don’t attach it to myself while running, but it’s within easy slapping distance to swipe off and kill the mill.4. Outlook: with the wonky touchscreen I opted to buy the 3 year maintenance and extended warranty. This will cover annual maintenance (probably just a check of tightness of the belt and other visual checks); however, more importantly, it will cover any issues in this period. I’m hopeful that if something like the screen were to go bad, it will do so within this period.I’ll update this review with any issues, should we experience any.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Disabling iFit and needing a rubber mat
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2019
CommentsContent: We're happy with the treadmill overall. It's the cheapest one, by a well known brand, that can have the elevation raised and lowered without getting off the treadmill and doing it manually.Like a lot of people, I didn't want to be forced into buying iFit or even answering the personal questions they ask in order to get a free trial. I went to the iFit website only after I was unable to bypass iFit on the treadmill.Note that in order to bypass iFit on the treadmill (using the 30 second hold down method of the iFit button)  you must have the safety key in place. I did not at first and it wasn't obvious because the treadmill powers-up the first time regardless of the safety key being in place.I'm also happy that I put the treadmill on a rubber mat even though I have it on carpet. Rust came out of the treadmill during assembly and would have potentially ruined my carpet, something to think about.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: Step 10  page 13 written instructions describe connecting 2 sets of wires M to N, and O to 81, but there are 3 set of wires. The 3rd set is in the middle on console assembly and console base assembly. There is no mention of the 3rd set of wires. On the phone with the Icon Fitness for 2 hours asking what to do with the extra set of wires on the console assembly and console assembly base. My husband downloaded the Visual Support app as recommended to assist ICON in trouble shooting.  Patrick and his supervisor  recommend to keep going with the assembly and worry about the extra set of wires later if treadmill does not work.  This is not the answer we were hoping for. Icon Fitness team leader Savannah reached out by email and phone. She says a technician will call in 7-10 business days to tell us what the extra wires are for.  We buy a treadmill from Amazon with a 3 year extended warranty but without an expert to answer a basic question . Icon said they will send a technician out to assemble for $165. My husband is very handy.  If Icon service support  knew their Nordic Track treadmill  product they would be able to explain this step to my husband over the phone. The written instructions are incomplete. If anyone has experienced with this problem please reach out to Amazon with the solution.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Loosing weight is not easy. Using this Nordic Track foldable treadmill makes it easier. I had the Amazon delivery with included assembly and I’m so glad I did. The only thing I have to do is push the metal bar with my foot and down it comes into its regular position. Perfect for at home use and great to get in shape while watching tv. I like that this has several options for speed and incline and even built in work out modes for high intensity interval training if you’re into that! I appreciate the design and ease of use from this machine. You will not be disappointed by the price point or functionality of Nordic track. You get what you pay for and I believe this treadmill has it all!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: tablet is a bit clunky, but solid machine. Dont forget to turn balance track!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: pro:Solid machine, gets the job done. ifit videos at least interesting, but definately not worth the giant recurring fee once trial runs out.Interface no longer requires ifit to start up, but will block all but the basic features as soon as trial runs out as far as i can tell.Leaderboard is a neat feature.Con:Tablet interface and ifit app really clunky and slowMachine takes a solid 2 minutes to boot up every time you turn it on.In 2-3 weeks, ifit has lost 2-3 of my workouts to errors and bugs.Becareful of sharp edges during assembly,Generalsome steps really do require 2 people to safely assemble!Would be nice to be able to take existing workouts and just be able to say " do video with trainer, but add x to baseline speed. You can adjust manually, but once you do, it will no longer adjust with the trainer if you do so.I had to manually set the belt! Its a good thing i knew what was going on from past treadmills, since 3d setup instructions didnt make mention of making sure belt doesnt walk left or right. Turned mine on at 1mph, and belt ran off to right almost immediately. Thankfully i caught the issue before the track was damaged. Hole for balancing the track wasnt exactly lined up, so took some flopping around to get the hex tool into the set screw.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Great value-minded treadmill, and easy to skip iFit trap.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this treadmill for a couple months now, and have really enjoyed it.  First, don't fall into the iFit trap if you don't want/need it.  Just hold down the iFit button at first start-up, after 15 seconds it will proceed to normal operation and you'll never had to do that again.  Being 6'4", it works great for my power walking, occasional jogging needs.  The deck may be a tad cramped for long-legged running, but that's not my thing.  Operation is smooth and quiet (so far), and it easily folds up vertical to be out of the way.  Features are fine, decent variety of programs and settings.  All in all, for the price, features and fit for my needs, it's been a great treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I love walking and this is the perfect treadmill.  I have been searching for so long.  I wanted something that would have an automatic incline, long and wide belt.  I weigh 260 lbs. and needed something to hold all of me.  I can do all kinds of workouts on this.  I can even dance on it because there is room.  I have it in my bedroom.  I live in an apartment on the second floor and sometimes use it at night.  I asked my neighbor if he could hear it at all and he said. "No."  Runs nice a quiet.  I actually put this together by myself.  it would have been faster with another person but it is possible.  Easy directions to follow.  I recommend this to anyone that makes excuses for not being able to exercise.  You have everything you need to feel good and stay healthy all in one place.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2020
CommentsContent: We purchased this treadmill when the fires took hold in California in 2020. All this telecommuting and now our exercise being taken away? We were going nuts. We saw mixed reviews, but mainly they hinged on the use of the app. We found the workaround, implemented it, and never once have been pestered about the app again. It's a fantastic treadmill for the price. (Note: I'm 220 lbs, run in minimalist shoes, and at 5-7 mph on the treadmill.)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Fine for a basic treadmill - basically no extra features included.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2018
CommentsContent: I just received this treadmill yesterday. I've only run on it once. I have some pros and cons:Pros:It's very sturdy,not super loud,feels solid wile walking and running (I only got up to 5.4 MPH),the display is a good size and easy to read.Cons: I was VERY disappointed when I realized that while the ad says it is totally iFit compatible (but does clearly state that you have to buy a subscription), but it is only compatible when you buy a separate module for it (I got on an online chat with iFit and they told me the module is $180). I won't be doing that.I'm also not happy with the "settings" feature. The settings are: Demo on or off, and English vs. Metric for distance - that's it. It seems there is no way to set your weight - so the calories burned feature is totally useless. I'd also like the ability to see Minutes per Mile instead of Miles per Hour, but there seems to be no way to change that either.The free scheduled shipping was a bit of a disappointment as well. It did come exactly when they said it would, but this thing is a huge box that weighs almost 200 lbs. There was only one delivery man on the truck and it had to come it up a full flight of stairs. I was very lucky that my husband and another man were here at the time and it took all three of them to get it up the stairs. If they hadn't been here it would have been sitting on the porch. Even the paperwork that came with it said "2 man delivery".I will update this review later if I find any ways to improve the settings feature.My overall impression is that is a very sturdy basic treadmill. If you want to simply turn it on and walk and/or run and don't care about tracking anything other than your MPH, distance, and time on the machine; it's fine. I paid $599.99 plus tax (free shipping) so it's not a terrible value. I will say that I feel the ad description regarding the iFit is deceptive.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great Quality at a Good Price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a great quality, sturdy, treadmill, with the features we wanted: up to 10% incline, up to 10 mph, foldable & moveable, and 200 lbs, not as heavy as the commercial model so maybe the two of us could move it if needed. The delivery guys unloaded it in the room of our choice on our waiting floor mat. My husband (mostly) and I had it together in a couple of hours. If you are more mechanical than we are, maybe not that long for you. We deducted a star from 5 because of the Ifit scam! Thank goodness I read reviews so I found the work-around for this, but shame on Nordic Track for doing this to their customers--as least put the over-ride on the front cover. Sheesh.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2018
CommentsContent: I've only had the treadmill for one day and as far as the product itself and its functionality goes, it seems fine so far. The biggest issue and reason for my 3-star rating is that the item description on Amazon was incorrect. The description incorrectly states that the speed is adjustable up to 12 mph, but in fact it only goes up to 10 mph. That may not be big deal for some but I was specifically looking for a treadmill with a max speed above 10 mph for those high intensity workouts. I'm in the process of returning it and replacing it with a different model (NordicTrack C990) which costs about $300 more. As I said, the product itself seems pretty good but just be aware that the true max speed is 10 mph not 12 mph.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Update!After constantly contacting Amazon customer service for more than two weeks of returning this treadmill,  I finally got my refund.  The customer service has been horrible in this particular c purchase of this treadmill.  They keep stalling me by telling my request has been sent to the return department so I called them and that's when they refund me.whole thing is garbage. I will start by the package.  It came in ONE box that was almost impossible to move so me and 2 other people had to tear out the box and take the parts inside. Assembly was a nightmare ONLY because they can make more money in assembly services. I read many reviews and thought that the bypassing ifit registration would work for me as well but it didn't.  In fact when I tried second time and pressed the button for 30 seconds the whole screen went blank. I went online to do troubleshooting...nothing worked. I chat Amazon they immediately told me to contact the company.  I contacted them they said contact their special department so I did. Then the "special" department automated system told me No agent will attend your call unless you register, which means I have to put my Credit card info. There is NO WAY to use this treadmill without monthly subscription. I decided to return this item and so I contacted Amazon but now Amazon wants to SPECIFICALLY DISASSEMBLE AND PUT THIS WHOLE TREADMILL BACK INTO A "BOX" How and where am I supposed to get a box this huge that can Carry this over 200lbs treadmill.  I m warning everyone out there to NOT buy this treadmill you can get a Gym membership for less than $15 a month.

CommentsTitle: Dead on arrival and POOR Customer Service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Treadmill goes up but will not go down.  Spent two hours with customer service.  They informed me that they would send a new incline motor and after i receive it to schedule a service person to come out to replace the motor.  This will be another 10 days to two weeks. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2021
CommentsContent: This treadmill is AMAZING for the price. We wanted to get a cheap treadmill without spending thousands. We wanted a very basic treadmill, with incline, that was narrow for our bedroom. We specifically only wanted a treadmill for walking on incline or power walking. This one gets the job done. We paid for amazon to deliver and set it up. They were in and out in under and hour! IFit offers a one month free trial, but after that IFit is not required for use of the treadmill and you could cancel IFit. I tried out IFit and it was great, but the only downside is that the treadmill does not offer decline. IFit has many walks with decline so while they talk about how nice your decline break must be, your just walking on flat surface. Not a big deal, and nothing to take a star away - just don’t use the IFit if you don’t like it. The treadmill itself is pretty quiet, good quality. This one is better for walking or power walking. You could run, however the treadmill does tend to bounce side to side a little with heavy feet and quick movement. I would recommend a different treadmill if you’re main purpose will be running. But if you want a treadmill for the same reasons as us, buy it! You won’t regret it!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I had my original NordicTrack for 12 years and was finally ready to upgrade. I used my previous one regularly, so it was worth it to buy a good one in the mid-price range.  I love this one!  My husband and 18 year old son assembled it in about two hours and set up with iFit was relatively seamless.  I initially figured I would just use the trainers every so often, but I am now hooked on the various training series.  I just recently climbed Mount Kilimanjaro w/ Jake Norton and today walk/jogged up to Germany's Neuschwanstein Castle w/ Casey Gilbert (which was fun because I have actually been to the castle in real life).  I can't imagine walking on my treadmill without the videos now.  However, it's fully equipped to operate either way. I can do manual runs/jogs and follow a regular track, as well as follow an iFit trainer. The belt is smooth and I love that it saves my workouts and charts my progress.  I bought a portable fan (which I desperately need because I'm in Florida), and it gives me ample space for my phone, water bottles, etc. It's sturdy and the handrails are well situated.  I actually love getting on it every morning.  I've been using it daily for over a month and so far so good!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership
