CommentsTitle: Great price, good treadmill.  Do Your research.  Check out Treadmilldoctor.com
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2019
CommentsContent: Arrived on time and in good shape.  Took two hours, two guys with experience and knowledge to put it together.  Did not work immediately.  Wanted me to do the I Fit registration.  Called in to NordicTrack... they were immediately helpful, less than 1 min call.  Simply hold the sync button down and it reverts to a traditional no frills treadmill.  It is nice.  It is light weight.  That can be good or bad depending on size of person and how many persons will be on and off of it.  I want it for only walking.  Was told this would do the job.  I'm sure it will do running but that was not my purpose.  I am 70.  I do know a little about fitness equipment and I never recommend treadmills for the bulk of your work out.  It is hard on your back and your knees.  Sometimes weather does not allow that but down here in Texas, outside is best for walking/running, but weights and classes are best for our age group.  Seems to be a good machine.  It is best suited for someone at average height  --- 5'4'' to 5'10".  I think if a stabilization bar were added between the uprights, it would really make it an excellent medium machine.  It is just right for the price.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this treadmill about a month ago and while I was lucky that the installation wasn't too bad, I didn't have horrible problems like other people mentioned, this stuff is heavy... You will need two people. There is a step where you have to hold the belt in an upright position and attach this bit at the bottom of the machine, it's unsafe to do alone.There are a few things they don't tell you you're going to need.- wrenches, the instructions say an adjustable wrench, but there are a few places where an adjustable just wouldn't fit. I think I used 5/16 for those spots.-Phillips screwdriver, most people probably have this at home.- surge suppressor, has to match their ratings. You can look on their manual for that. Amazon customer services was helpful in finding one that worked.I had one issue with the motor hood arriving cracked in several places, not due to any kind of shipping damage. I had to register my treadmill with Nordic track but then they replaced the part. (although the little connectors I had to pry off the old hood to install the new undamaged hood because they didn't send me any hardware... But it works)As for use, it's quiet so far. My walking on it sounds louder than the treadmill, to me. It's easy to fold up, though I don't unless I'm cleaning. I've had it trip the breaker when I tried going directly to 3mph from 0mph, but I also tested it to 7mph with no problems, I had nothing else plugged in and I didn't try to go past 7mph. I'm not in great shape, I'm pushing it at 3mph right now 😁.I took off a star for the ifit stuff, it's annoying but easy to get past. Just press the blue ifit button until your screen changes to show the regular display. (Time/distance/calories/etc) it should say LAP 01, if it's like mine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2021
CommentsContent: The treadmill seems to be working well for my purposes.  I like to jog at a relatively slow pace and add the incline.  I really love the fold up/down feature.  It seems to be designed well and operates on a piston.  As other have noted the company gives the impression that you MUST sign up for their program which is not true.  I didn't appreciate all the warnings in the packaging but I was aware of the workaround from the Amazon Reviews.  Also, the treadmill delivered with my original order was damaged and the end shipper would not accept it.  I have to thank Amazon from scrambling and getting me the replacement in time for Christmas.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Terrible customer support; does not honor warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2018
CommentsContent: This is a very sturdy, robust treadmill. The belt moves smoothly, with consistent speed. Controls are responsive. I cannot attest to long-term reliability, as I have had the product for 1 day only .. however, should I experience any major problems, I would be very concerned with how customer service would handle them and potentially apply warranty .. see notes below. Amazon delivery was excellent.Assembly was surprisingly straightforward. I did it by myself in 3 hours, with some occasional help from my wife (eg, hold the console for a moment). You will need some basic tools. The assembly instructions are good, but a couple videos on youtube were helpful. The package is  heavy (200+ lbs), so I recommend to spend the extra $20 for the delivery guys to place it in the room of your choice. For clarity, no heavy parts have to be moved to assemble the treadmill.The user interface looks more like from the 20th century .. eg, iPod connection or no bluetooth connectivity .. but not a big deal.The built-in HR monitor using handgrips is useless at best. The values jump completely randomly around in a 65-170 BPM range, in about 5 second intervals. For example, something like this: 110-168-135-70-126 .. all this during one minute, while consistently walking and steadily holding the grips. My true HR was about 85. But more importantly, this brings me to my earlier point about customer service.So I called Nordictrack to let them know about the heart rate monitor problem. The troubleshooting process went as follows: (1) They told me that I should not move to get accurate readings .. ironic, given that we are dealing with a treadmill .. so I tried to stand on the side rails, without any movement .. no effect on the erratic HR readings; (2) My hands cannot be wet .. hmm, isn't the treadmill meant for exercise?  .. anyways, wiped off my hands, problem not solved; (3) Then the rep said that it is the light dimmer switch that is interfering with the monitor .. turned off lights, no effect .. the rep says it's the dimmer regardless whether lights are on or off .. so I shut down the entire circuit breaker for the dimmer & lights, to no avail. After that the rep says that the HR monitor is not supposed to give accurate readings anyways, and there is nothing they can do about that. Upon a warranty question I posed, they said that warranty did not apply to problems that cannot be fixed. They would not replace the console. They would not dispatch a service rep to fix the problem. If I want, I can return the unit to Amazon. Nordictrack is not responsible.Frankly, I don't really care that much about the HR monitor. The only reason I am sharing this entire customer service episode is to provide feedback on that part of Nordictrack's business. What left a sour taste in my mouth was two-fold: A) Nordictrack tried to blame the customer for a problem they evidently knew about, and B) their absurd claim that warranty did not apply to problems that cannot be fixed. I can only hope I won't have to deal with customer service with a bigger problem.Bottom line: sturdy build, smooth run, out-of-date user interface, HR monitor useless, terrible customer service, warranty not honored. Wishing good luck to anyone who encounters problems with the product and would like to apply warranty.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Terrible service, but pretty good product. DO NOT TELL THEM IT IS IN THE GARAGE! WILL VOID WARRANTY!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2020
CommentsContent: When I opened the box, I noticed that there were shards of black plastic everywhere. After I put the thing together, I realized that all the plastic pieces were once a part of the bottom right foot of the machine. It's not a structural piece, just a cosmetic piece that surrounds the rubber foot. I tried calling, but that was no luck. Their livechat service was also not helpful, since it's not even a real person, nor does it let you connect with one. I emailed NordicTrack customer support regarding the issue, and I included the part number as well as pictures. After a week or so they finally responded with some generic questions, so I answered. Another week or so goes by and they respond with some more questions, that are not even relevant anymore, I respond. It has now been 3 months and I haven't heard back from them.I also purchased the 3 year maintenance plan. The way that is has been going, I'm pretty sure that was a waste too.Overall the treadmill is good. It goes to 10 incline and can speed up to 10mph. There are minor creaks that I hear, but other than that, it's all working good.UPDATE: Finally got in touch with Icon Fitness, and they told me the warranty is voided because the treadmill is in the garage. Even though I clearly mentioned to them that the damage had occurred during shipping. They were persistent in saying that since it is in the garage, it must have been damaged by the garage door or a vehicle. Except that the garage is now turned into a home gym, and we do not park cars in there... If you have any issues with your equipment, DO NOT TELL THEM IT IS IN THE GARAGE! Move it back inside the house before you contact them and send images.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill for at home workouts
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2020
CommentsContent: TL;DR If you are looking for a affordable basic treadmill that can do moderate speed and incline this is the treadmill for you. (Hold down ifit button for 30 secs to skip activating ifit membership and use basic functions on treadmill).I’ve been really happy with this treadmill, bout it a little over a month ago. It was relatively easy to assemble (I was able to assemble it myself, and I’m a 5’1” female) — the instructions were a bit difficult to understand but I was able to find YouTube videos which were really helpful. The belt was very off to one side so I did have to adjust quite a bit.In terms of working out, it’s great my runs are typically 30-45 mins and I run 3-4 days a week (did 6 days the first couple weeks with no issues). With moderate speed and lower incline so this treadmill has been perfect for me. I like that as I make improvements to my speed and endurance I have room to increase both speed and incline. From what I can tell it uses low energy as well, have not seen a large impact to my power bill at all— to be fair I also don’t keep it plugged in when not in use.In terms of space it takes up very little space I have it in my living room near my patio and there is plenty of room to pass by without bumping into it. I normally keep the deck down because otherwise it feels like it cuts the room, but I like that it’s easy to fold when I need to vacuum or if I want to do a circuit and need more space. Deck is also cat approved.I know a lot of reviews complain about the ifit registration, I did research beforehand and knew that I wouldn’t need to activate the membership to use the machine (just hold down the ifit button for 30 secs). I can’t speak about the work out programs or HR monitor because I don’t use either feature, I prefer to set manual workouts and I wear a fitbit versa 2 when working out that tracks my HR and workout automatically for me. Overall this has been a very versatile machine I’m personally happy with.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Using it for rehab. We like it. Step 8 is Outrageous.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Using it for rehab. We like it.I have been in gyms pretty much all my life—back to the days of Jack Lalaine.  This treadmill is an impressive midrange machine. No question, it’s not gym strength, but for home use it appears to be an outstanding choice. Couple of points. One, get the install . Unless you can tap a hole, you need to get someone to put it together. Delivery was very good as was the packaging. We ran into trouble on step 8 which involves attaching the crossbar. Short story, I had to retap the holes with a 10/24 tap and buy 10/24 1-1/4 screws. Also, the replacement grounding screw was unusable so we used the shipping screw. Anyway, unless you are comfortable taping a hole get somebody to assemble it. Customer service (Donna) was a pleasure to work with and did what was possible with step 8, but we couldn’t fix it without retaping the holes. Search the reviews for step 8 for all the horror stories. This machine has all the features one would expect in a treadmill. You can get better features (larger screen, industrial strength, etc), but you have to “open the vault” for those. Much was made about iFit, but I feel it’s irrelevant to the machine itself. One last thing, the machine goes to 10 miles an hour and that’s nice, but since we brought it for rehab it is more importantly to me is that it goes down to .5 miles an hour. Nice machine we’ll see if it lasts.More on step 8. Like many others, we got stuck at step 8  (search step 8 in comments). The problem, I believe is that the screws do not match the tap used for the holes. For one, they are wood screws. Anyway after the usual unsuccessful calls, we re-tapped the holes with a 10/24 tap and brought the corresponding 10/24 by 1.25 inch machine screws. It's fixed. I do not recommend this to anyone, it's just what we did to get to step 9. Photos attached. PS. we watched the YOUTUBE video on assembly, and wow! nothing on step 8 . Also, the grounding screw was uninstallable and we just used the original.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

So far it seems very sturdy and works well. I skipped the iFit subscription because I hear its garbage, but I didn’t get the treadmill for that. Paid for amazon assembly. No complaints!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2019
CommentsContent: This may be the most expensive piece of junk I’ve ever purchased. Preface that I’m an engineer, so this isn’t my first assembly rodeo.In assembling the treadmill, there are multiple screws you have to take out before assembling it properly. Some of them make sense to keep the parts together during transit, and some are just an unnecessary pain. The best part is that the user manual doesn’t even list some of the extra screws! And those ones in particular, when removing, don’t properly fit.Loved scratching the metal getting them out so that I could install the ACTUAL screws that belonged from the guidance in the manual.Now let’s talk about the app. Created my account online and then downloaded the app. Tried to use the same login information on the app and it didn’t work. Tried sending a link to reset my password and it’s been several hours with zero email. So I went online, logged in, and changed my password to the good ol 12345678 just in case for some reason I couldn’t type like a normal human being. STILL didn’t work on the app. And their helpline is only available 8-5 MST, so looks like I’ll be calling during my lunch hour to figure this out. Another fun finding - some of the links in the mobile view of the online website are broken.Piece of junk, through and through.

CommentsTitle: iFit software is not ready for primetime; so much potential, but we are unhappy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This review is for the NordicTrack T9.5S we purchased in November 2019. We have had other NordicTrack products before and were happy. This time, not so much. Assembly was challenging, but not so bad. No complaints on that front, really. Fit and finish are pretty good. It makes some strange noises now and then, but generally it is pretty solid, and the buttons do as they should.The real problems have been with iFit. This unit has an Android operating system that drives the screen, and all of the basic functionality (even the ability to start walking or running) depends on this. iFit is the app they use for managing your workouts, following coaches/trainers, etc. And when this works, it is VERY nice. I have been walking and running in Portugal, Morocco and Costa Rica so far with three different trainers. The machine automatically increases/decreases its speed and incline based on what the trainer decides in his workout. So as you climb a big hill, they typically slow down your speed and of course do a big increase in the % incline, up to as much as 12% I think (maybe it's 15 - not sure). And the trainers typically do a 15 or 20 session workout plan, one per day, so you can stay in shape, with each session getting progressively harder. It is NordicTrack's answer to what Peloton is doing.Where we're having REAL issues is with the login and user management of the iFit software. Because NordicTrack/iFit are so worried about people using the apps without paying, you can't do much of anything without signing in, and that has been a big problem. My wife's account somehow got replaced with my son's, and we cannot get her back on the machine. And when I logged out of the system for my account, now there is no way to log back in! All it does is tell you all of the great things you can do with the software and offer to sell you an account. You can ADD a user (which fails if the user already exists), but there is no LOGIN button! It's really dumb programming. This has been the theme for iFit in general. They have so much content you can access but the organization is TERRIBLE and DISORGANIZED. NordicTrack should have probably have chosen a different partner than iFit, unless NordicTrack OWNS this brand/company.  And of course they only have live chat and telephone support Monday-Friday 9-5, or something like that. Real people tend to also work out on weekends, and that's when stuff happens and when we need help.I hope they respond to this review and tell us why things will be getting better soon.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 14 InchesStyle Name: T 9.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I received my treadmill a week ago Saturday (09/05). Two men brought it. One was holding what looked like a scanner, while to other man did all the work. When taking it off the dollie he tried to push it through the door. It caught on the top door frame. He (alone) adjusted it until he could tip it to clear the door frame. He was obviously worn out and frustrated. As so as it cleared the door he PUSHED it over onto the narrow side. After it slammed onto the floor he shoved it on inside. But wait... There is more....I found the directions and it calls for a special surge protector that I could find at the hardware store. I went to three  popular stores. In one I had three people trying to find one. I looked online. I could find one that meet all of the qualifications. So the box is setting in the entrance hall, the base is in place, and all the parts are setting around it still in the plastic/cardboard. I did not want to put it together until I have what I need, so nobody it temped to use it.The following Tuesday (09/08) I submitted inquiry on the NordicTrack website (I do not use a phone, so could not call). I asked if they could give me the name of a surge protector or if they sell them. Thursday (09/10) I was contacted and told I could get one in a maintenance kit, that they sell and was asked for the model number. I replied the same day. Today (09/14) I am still waiting and everything is still laying around.So I have had this for more than a week. Not only have I not been able to use it, the  return time and warranty time is passing by even though I have not been able to use. Needless to say, this experience has not been a good one. I am considering just returning it and getting one elsewhere. For all I know, this one is not going work anyway since it was dropped to the floor.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I actually ordered a different treadmill from a different company but it was extremely damaged when it arrived so I ended up online searching for another one and I must say some of the reviews on this treadmill almost changed my mind on getting this one but I took the chance . All the features and the size and everything was exactly what I wanted so I ordered it and crossed my fingers it arrived in better shape then the last one and I was extremely happy to see it arrived perfectly and it's been a great machine so far ..it's sturdy and very well made and I had no problem with exiting out of the ifit , I held the button down for a few seconds and the treadmill was ready for me to use with no problems . Putting it together took awhile but my husband had no issues whatsoever and I was happy about that bc reading some of the reviews some have said they had to try calling Nordictrack for help and were on hold for hrs and that right there almost kept me from purchasing bc if you can't easily get a hold of the company something is wrong somewhere ! But while my husband was putting it together I figured I would test that theory to see if I would be left on hold forever, so I dialed customer service , put it on speaker and went about my business and I kid you NOT I was ON HOLD waiting for customer service to get to my call for a WHOLE 3 HRS AND 42MINS !!!!!!!! That is insane and unacceptable !!! They need to fix that issue and I pray I never have issues like many have to where I ever have to call them again and if that wasn't bad enough after purchasing the treadmill I returned to try and find a review with some helpful tips on putting it together and I wanted to show my husband so I signed on to Amazon and starting looking through the reviews and my husband was like are you sure thats the same one we ordered and I said yes why ? and he said didn't you notice the price drop from just 1 day ago ?! I about lost my lunch when I looked up and saw the price was 300$ cheaper then when I had ordered it the day before !!!! I have shopped on this site for years and have never seen that happen ...I was instantly sick to my stomach !!! 300$ is a huge difference ! My husband was shocked too but he assured me if I contacted Amazon they would more than likely refund the difference since we just bought the damn thing and I was thinking he was right bc I know walmart and other stores do exactly that ...so I contacted Amazon and was told they no longer do that , so ya I was out an extra 300$ for a treadmill I could have waited just hrs later to order and would have gotten it way cheaper... I frankly think that'd pretty sickening BUT the fact the machine is everything I was looking for and has given me zero issues I will be happy with that but I might shop around a lot more next time before ordering from Amazon again ! They are a billion dollar company ...300$ shouldnt be anything to them but their greed has gotten the best of them !
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill!  A bit tough to put together if you're a smaller female
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent: So far so great!  This treadmill is wonderful!  Quiet, easy to operate, it does exactly what I need it for.Delivery was great, they texted for a delivery window and were on time.  The folks delivering it were super nice and helpful. There was some minor box damage which was noted on the tracking information, but there was no damage to the machine at all.  All the pieces required for assembly were there.  The assembly instructions were very clear and the diagrams were spot on.One note on assembly - I'm a 58 year old female, 5'2" and weigh about 140 lbs.  This was difficult for me to put together because I didn't have the upper body strength to hold/position/lift several of the pieces.  It definitely is a 2 person job at some points.  If it weren't for the current pandemic, I would have gladly paid for assembly.  As it was I did get it done, but it took me several days because of my own strength limitations.  It was my issue, not NordicTrack's fault by any means.  I look at it like I got a bonus workout just from putting it together!  lolI did not sign up for iFit - I held the button down to bypass it as described in the top comment.  Worked like a charm.  I may sign up for iFit later, but I want to choose to do it, not "have" to do it just to try out the machine.The treadmill's display works great, the interface works perfectly and is easy to use.  I did have to set it to "English" as opposed to "Metric", that was the only change I had to make.I purchased a mat to go under it so I wouldn't risk damaging the floors.Overall this is a fantastic treadmill and I'm looking forward to getting into better shape with it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Not good if you can't use it...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2020
CommentsContent: So I bought this a year ago. It was tough putting together, but not too bad. I used it for a few months, then an injury kept me from using it for a couple of months. Then the pandemic hit, and we had to stay home. My inquiry felt a bit better so I was hoping to use the treadmill again. Wouldn't start.I was still under the 1 year warranty, plus I purchased a 3 year warranty. I contacted their support. Automatic reply, no person ever contacted me, though. I tried a few more times. Absolutely nothing! What did I pay for??So, I turned to Twitter. The person in charge of their Twitter responded and tried helping me. It's sad how am SEO person or more reliable for support than a customer support representative...Eventually I had to call in with a number the SEO person helped me with, and I talked to a real person! After discussing the issue and doing video of the treadmill, she sent me a new part for it. It took a long time to ship, and when I got it I had to suddenly be my own treadmill technician and take apart the whole thing!The part didn't work. Same as the old part.I contacted her again and she sent me a different part that took about a month to ship. At this point it's now late July or early August. Seeing how bad the last experience was, and how hard it was, I procrastinated for a few weeks until I finally got it done.Guess what? Part doesn't work.Contacted her again, and she says "I am not sure on other solutions. I would call back in so that we can see what is going on with the machine."It's literally the same thing, as before, but fine, I'll call. I ask her where to call... No response.So I'm here, with a broken treadmill, and a 3 year warranty... With no way to use it. I can't exactly get a refund, either... No one coming to fix it, or correctly figure out what is wrong.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Don't buy this - the treadmill doesn't work at all without wifi.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Don't buy this. If it didn't cost more than 50% of the treadmill's price to return it (between shipping, "restocking fees", etc), I would have sent it back already.If your wifi is down, or if it has poor access, this treadmill WILL NOT work. At all. As in, you won't be able to just start a simple run. I'd understand if the iFit features were disabled without internet, but the fact that the treadmill itself can't do the most basic task of letting you run is just ridiculous to me. I asked their support why this strange limitation existed, and was told "That is the way the machine is designed. You will need a WiFi connection to use both the manual workout feature and the iFit content with your machine."The second reason I wouldn't recommend it is a smaller, but still persistently annoying issue: you can't turn off "warmups". So any time you do start a workout, it's just a bunch of extra and unnecessary taps to end the warmup early and reset your speed.And the last reason I wouldn't recommend this treadmill is the belt/motor dynamic. It's adjustable, but the "fine point" is very narrow and you're likely to either end up with the belt slipping regularly or with the motor straining under an overly-tightened belt.Now, there are some good things about this treadmill, and I do want this review to be honest and complete:- The fan is a great addition. On warm days, it's a lifesaver.- If you're putting this on a perfectly level floor, it's surprisingly quiet and stable. If your floor is not perfectly flat and level, do NOT get this treadmill - it doesn't have any leveling features, and we used a bunch of shims and cardboard to fill in the gaps.- It folds up nicely when not in use to reduce the footprint.- It's reasonably simple to put together, but the parts are somewhat poorly machined so don't be surprised if you end up with some gaps.All in all, this could have been a great treadmill. But the issues I listed at the beginning are just too much. Don't buy this.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2020
CommentsContent: COVID has changed my life.  I now work from home and am no longer teaching water aerobics or doing Pilates.  I went from a fairly active lifestyle to sitting and not getting out.  My body has paid the price.  I finally purchased this GREAT treadmill to get me going again and I LOVE it!!!  I just wish I had purchased it sooner!!  I felt better after the first use and continue to feel even better as I continue to use it.  I’m very grateful I was able to purchase this treadmill as so many in local stores were out of stock - many other people doing the same as me.  I felt like the price was reasonable, too, for such a high quality treadmill - paid $630 (tax included).  I did a lot of research before purchasing and I’m glad I ordered the NordicTrack T Series 6.5S.  I didn’t need all the bells and whistles of the more expensive models - I just turn on my music or catch up on programs I like to watch and I’m good to go.  I love that it folds up & down easily, too.  It is a cold wet day outside, but no worry, I’ll just hope on my treadmill INSIDE and get a great workout!!  THANK YOU!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this for a little over a month now.  I use it at least 5 days out of the week, usually jogging 2-3 miles a day.  I'm a fairly big guy at 220lb 6'2" and I haven't had a problem at all with the machine not performing as expected.  It does get a little shaky at speeds above 5 but a mat under the treadmill helped out a lot with that.  The heart rate sensors are complete garbage as they do not give an accurate reading, nor are they in a position where a person as tall as I am can grab hold of them while walking without stepping off the front end of the treadmill belt.  So in summary, if you want a machine that can keep up mechanically and do what it's supposed to do to help you get fit, it'll do the job.  If you want frilly stuff like a big screen, flashy buttons and that sort of thing, you need to buck up and pay more for another model.  And finally, just like all the other reviews will tell you, it SUCKS that they try to make you think you must have a subscription to the iFit service to use the machine.  That is a flat out lie!  Dam them for such deviousness!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great quality - pay for the assembly - Totally worth the $$
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: Love the options, had to have at least a 7" inch screen and be sure to sign up for a year of IFit Training because it motivates you to stay on track every day with so many variations and workout with different trainers.  It is heavy and  Fed Ex left it at the door - they are supposed to place the machine where you want it but we didn't know it had been delivered.  Amazon made it right and we hired a couple strong teens to move it.  Then the installer came and it took him a couple hours.  I could not imagine trying to put this together so spend the money for assembly - totally worth it.  I have been using the treadmill every day for 2 weeks and feel stronger with more endurance already.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Excellent Home Treadmill at a Good Price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2020
CommentsContent: This treadmill seems to perform as advertised. Packaged it weighs over 200 lbs. and is not easy to move, though once you have it assembled, it can be moved more easily. Getting it upstairs would be another story altogether. Assembly is straightforward but does go easier with two people at some stages (my wife was hiding out at that point). All parts were included, as well as an allen wrench. The so-called "User's Manual' is not - it is basically an assembly guide. There is very little info about how to use this device, which would be really useful. Previous reviewers are correct - you can bypass the IFit stuff by simply holding down the IFit icon for about 30 seconds and it will start right up. Only challenge is there is no guidance as to what the various programs will do. Be careful here - the belt will move very fast at any speed above 4 - you must be ready to run or be tossed off. Just exercise caution. I have spent several days exploring the various programs and there are a nice variety for interval training, which my doctor recommended. The machine is acceptably quiet. I bought an extended warranty as I plan to keep this think for a good while. Overall, I think I made a good purchase here, as I have decided I will not be going back to the gym anytime soon. Together with a Teeter cross-trainer, I can get most of the benefits that the Y offered.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great for Diabetics, lowered my A1C
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I am writing this review after having the NordicTrack for 3 1/2 months and can say , as of today, that I thoroughly enjoy it and it accomplished for me what I wanted it to, which was to lower my A1C. I have been a type 2 diabetic for about 7 years, but by watching what I eat and exercising have kept my A1C mainly below 6.5. I have never taken any medication for my diabetes and am very thin, but 4 months ago my A1C jumped to 7.2, most likely because I'd been cheating with food and exercising less, especially through the winter. I immediately bought this treadmill instead of turning to drugs and now after 3 1/2 months of daily use, my A1C has dropped to 6.7. My doctor says I don't need drugs unless it stays above 7 so I'm very satisfied that this has worked for me. It does help if you like walking to begin with , but now there is no worry about bad weather and I use it after almost every meal. Music for me is the key to enjoying it and not becoming bored. I do 2 to 3 hours a day total. I do not use any of the preset programs but set and vary the speed and incline myself as I walk. I find it to be fairly quiet and can't hear it at all with earbuds in. It can be assembled by yourself if you use something like a short step ladder as a stand-in for someone holding a section up. Assembly was not easy but once together it works great and I hope it lasts many years.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Beware! In order to get the treadmill to run, you have to register with iFit and then give them your cc information for a free trial after which you will be charged a monthly fee of $15.One reviewer wrote that you can actually activate the machine without registering. Unfortunately, I didn't read his review until after I gave my credit card information and registered.Forcing buyers to buy another product in order for the product they've already PURCHASED merits a one-star review. I will NEVER use iFit and I will cancel my subscription ASAP because of these unethical practices.The treadmill itself seems solid. Installation wasn't the easiest, but the instructions were decent and the parts were well organized.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Perfect tread to use with Peloton App!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this tread to use with the Peloton app and it works perfectly!  I’ve used it for a power walk, a run and 2 tread boot camps.  The 1-10 shortcuts work very well to adjust to each of the instructors ques.  If you hit 2 numbers consecutively, it will jump to that tenth of a mph.  For example, if you hit 7 and then 2, it will jump to 7.2 mph speed.  Also, there are arrows to adjust the speed and incline up and down.  The iPad holder is perfect and a standard iPad doesn’t block the 5” LCD screen.  The tread is sturdy and long enough for most strides.  When setting it up, be sure to attach the red emergency stop magnet.  Also, hold on iFit button for 30 seconds to bypass paying for iFit.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The product (T6.5Si) could be a great treadmill, but they neutered it with iFit.  After about 6 months, it won't allow me to continue using without registering. Perhaps its a software update. The iFit app had previously allowed you to use it in manual mode if I clicked on all the small text links to run it manually in iFit.  Now a new screen pops up and it seems I have to register an account (and have wi-fi based internet).  Maybe after registering with iFit I can get manual mode back, but I shouldn't have to!  All the technology is there for a great machine, but I do not want to make an account or pay for iFit and I shouldn't have to!  They should just be honest, say that the company making the treadmill is also the company making the iFit system, and advertise that an account with or without  a subscription is required for the features you would expect.Perhaps I have missed something, but they took a good basic touch activated system and stripped all options to funnel you into using iFit.  Maybe the software will be changed to do this, but I doubt it.Update:  I realized that when I started it a 6:00 am, I had mistakenly hit the larger 'log in' button when I was trying to press the smaller 7 point font that says 'continue without signing in'.  At the log in screen there was no back button.  I had to enter the android operating system and force the app to stop.  When I restarted the app I was able to operate the treadmill using iFit in manual mode.  This only worked because I had earlier learned how to access the operating system.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Basic Treadmil with no frills that will hopefully be reliable.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Pros:  Works. Can walk, jog, incline, and run. Nice water bottle holders. Keeps track of time, possibly distance, and maybe calories.  For the price and brand, very satisfied.  If the treadmill last 5+ years with belt maintenance and lubrication, will have no complaints.  NordicTrack sells a lubrication kit separately.Cons:  Needed 2 “people” meaning 2 The Rock Johnsons to build. Took 3 people to build. A challenge to build, took time and effort. It has been a month so far and every week have had to adjust treadmill belt right or left. Easy to fix but then it moves the other way. Folding is very heavy and wonder if mechanism is safe. NordicTrack customer service referred me to You Tube videos on other treadmills to do routine maintenance, but manual is vague and states not to use silicone to lubricate.Not Important:  Oversized console feel like I am at Worf’s Station on Next Generation, heartrate monitors only work 1/10 times, speakers are basic but work. Do not need to fold, nice if needed to move it though.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I was hesitant with the mixed reviews on reliability and some being broken upon arrival, but we have had great luck so far. It was delivered on time and was easy to set up and everything works great so far. We purchased the 6.5s so it doesn't have a large screen but very easily syncs (a push button) with the ifit app on our ipads (which have large excellent screens) which play awesome videos and control our speed and incline.  It also has a perfect little holder for the ipad. We have really enjoyed this machine and hope it is durable and lasts us a while. We are loving ifit and all of the videos- they have so many from walking tours of places around the world to 10k running training series. We actually both look forward to running on the treadmill!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Does not work properly  --- Just Don't Do It!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Does not work properly and it is all but impossible to get technical assistance from Nordic Track.The treadmill works nice. Love the easy lift and soft close feature for lowering. The problem is the incline does not work. I went thru the calibration steps and it does not even calibrate. Called the tech support line and was on hold for 45 minutes and then the call was disconnected be anyone answered. Then tried online chat. They could not help me with this type of issue. Refer me to another website that only offers to sell you replacement part? What? It is brand new and never been used and you already pushing replacement parts??? Well as you can tell this one was not a good experience for me...  After 3 Weeks, we actually spoke with a person today.  However, we were on hold 35 minutes to get to that person.  She pushed us through several hoops, including an app that allowed her to see what we were doing on our end.  She then determined that it probably could not be resolved and placed us on hold.  After an additional 15 minute the called was terminated from her end.  I guess this is going to have to go back.  Very disappointed and frustrated.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Has not worked right since Day 1.  I have a very expensive lemon!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2021
CommentsContent: This treadmill has never worked correctly.  From day 1 the incline function did not work.  I contacted Amazon who passed me to the companies customer service (ICON).  They were great on the first phone call to try and diagnose the problem.  Then they started shipping parts.  Not much substance just a package in the mail with a motherboard or a cord to replace with hard to understand instructions.  I had someone to email back if it did't work and when I did that I randomly received a part a few days later.  I have changed out almost every part and still...nothing.  It does not work.  This is a very very expensive lemon at this point.  I just called Amazon again to assist and they are trying to get the company to help, but they will not do anything as it is outside of the return window.Bottom line - Buyer beware here.  I wouldn't buy this treadmill again.Also, read up on iFit.  It basically requires a subscription to work...that should have been disclosed...it isn't free.  It is one of those monthly subscription services.  There is a work around, but it is not straightforward.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: BE WARNED: Customer Service is non-existent, things will go wrong
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: From the day we received and assembled our treadmill the incline setting did not work.  We immediately submitted a support request online and went back and forth over several months with support until they requested info to have a service technician come out.  Ever since then all communication has ceased even after repeated requests for updates.  Why would support be so responsive until it's time for a service request to come onsite?A few months in the motor started making a squeaking sound and has been getting progressively louder.  We submitted another support ticket, and after going back and forth a couple of times gathering issue details their support disappeared again and stopped responding even after repeated requests for updates.So here we are stuck with a 220lb faulty treadmill with a broken incline and a gradually failing motor, and two support tickets, one of which is almost 5 months old and support has gone silent.Until they get their support act together I would recommend steering clear of this brand.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2020
CommentsContent: So lets start with the bad, the assembly. Getting the packaging off alone kind of sucked. It took forever and getting the deck out of the box was HARD. I had no problems with damage from shipping though so for that I am happy to deal with the unpacking.  I did assemble this beast myself. It would have been a piece of cake if the majority of my assembly time wasn't spent fighting improperly pre-drilled holes. The grounding screw was a nightmare! I tried and tried but couldn't get it to find any threads. I think it was overly powdered coated. I finally forced it through with an assist by the place holder screw (which I could barely get out to begin with). Then on the other side one of the 4 bolts on the base would NOT go through. The O was shaped like a D so no amount of force was going to make that work. Anyway, after all my frustration and struggle to assemble it started right up and runs like a dream. It is wide and comfy, very stable. It is more like a machine I would use in the gym than other home treadmills I have tried. I think the heart rate monitor is way off though. It was 40 - 20 BPM's away in both directions from what my Apple watch said each time I check but I don't really need it so I don't really care. I had no trouble bypassing iFit at all! Thanks for the tip to hold down the button for 20 seconds. It cleared the iFit stuff and it didn't come back even after unplugging the machine for a while.Edited to add photo of the grounding screw that wouldn't fit. It just kept spining and collecting shards of metal. I did eventually get it in there by pushing the place holder screw through first but it took a lot of work and fustration.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great delivery, no damage, very quiet!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2020
CommentsContent: The delivery was near perfect, the dudes should have had masks on, but it was on time, well communicated through the chat feature in the app.It's a lot to put together and you need a pal, but it is totally doable. Some screws and bolts need a LOT of elbow grease, but it comes together solidly.  It was WELL packaged and not a scratch or scrape.  I think maybe they've improved the packaging since so many were received damaged.Holding down the ifit button bypassed that nonsense just fine.  We use it every day and it is an excellent value for us.  We are shocked by how quiet it is.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019
CommentsContent: Excited about the treadmill at FIRST.  I had paid an experience service to put the treadmill together for me.  I am so glad I did as it took this couple exactly 1 hour to put it together and this what they do, so I am sure if I would have done it myself, it would have took longer.  Paying $99 was well worth it!  The next step, is where it went down hill.  In order to activate your product /warranty,  you have to take a picture in order to photo register within 30 days to extend your warranty by 90 days  My treadmill had the wrong serial number as it kept saying I had a different treadmill then the one that I had purchased.  Trying to get ahold of customer service at Nordic Track is a joke!  Nobody picks up the phone, if you email them, they do not respond.  Maybe that is their intention.  To get you all worked up so you will get on the treadmill to run all your frustrations out?  I have no issues with the machine at all.  You can manually do your own work out or you can use the programs designed by the trainers. The programs are fun with different courses so you do not get bored.  The product itself is made well and sturdy.  I love my treadmill and would recommend this product.  I just hope you never have to call NordicTrack because you will be disappointed.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: I think Nordic track is one of the worst company to do deal with
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2018
CommentsContent: No owners guide  inside the box or anywhere, tried calling Nordic track but  their  recording I must  register the treadmill first on their website,did that and no one called or  respond to my requests , and after 10 days of waiting I called them and I was put on hold for 45 minuets to no  solution to my problem!!!! I think Nordic track is one of the worst company to do deal with.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I did my homework like I do before all my larger purchases and I was skeptical at first with this treadmill. Not because of the name, but because it has Ifit built in. Many if not most treadmills do today. The problem is out of the box after assembly it tells you an online registration is required before it will even turn on. This is a ploy to get you to sign up for the Ifit program at $15/month so you can use the online features of running to scenery or to work along with others. Hey all I wanted was a treadmill, not a subscription to a service I didn't want. Well it takes a solid 2 hours to setup unless you're a pro installer and you will swear a few times. Holes don't line up, screws won't go in and you'll struggle a bit but unless you pay the $60 setup fee expect that. Mind you this thing is heavy. 206lbs in the box so you'll need help. Got mine set up and works like a charm. Now, the jewel of this review, how to unlock the treadmill without registering! After setup install the red key on the console, then power it up. After you see the "Registration required before use" on the screen, hold down the Ifit button for 20-30 seconds. It will then unlock your machine forever. I also like this treadmill because it has a 300lb capacity and with most treadmills having a 220lb limit this one suited me best. It's solid and has a good warranty on the motor and parts. And Nordictrack must get a kickback from Ifit because I hear even installers won't tell you how to unlock the machine without registration and it's certainly not in the manual. They must make millions off Ifit so of course they won't tell you how to disable it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Been using it for about a few months now, so far so good. Its delivered with motor and belt assembled already, you only have the handrails, console and hydraulic latch to put together. It's sturdy and no louder than any other treadmill. You can't find a NorticTrack for this price. Only problem I found so far is the quality of the speakers, which are not that loud and the sound quality is not that great. But other than that, this treadmill it's a good buy. One person can assemble this on their own, it will take a few hours and you will need a stool or chair to hold treadmill up while you install the hydraulic latch to make your job easier. Oh and once installed, hold the iFit button for 30sec to skip the whole activation process.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased the NordicTrack NTL17915 T 6.5 S Treadmill for $599. So far very pleased with it, but there are a few issues to be aware of when ordering and setting it up.I had it delivered to work and used a dolly, a medium size SUV, and then carried it in pieces with my son to an upstairs room where it was set up. The box is about 32"x74"x10" and weighs 375 lb - not light for two people to move. Even in pieces, the largest, main unit is well over 200 lb and requires a strap (not included) to keep the folding base from opening, to carry. The set-up instructions are sufficient but not IKEA level of hand holding. Also, in addition to the tools listed on the instruction manual, it is useful to have a 9/16" socket wrench, and based on other reviews and my experience, you will likely need to open up a hole with a ~7/16" drill bit, which usually requires a drill with the larger, 1/2" chuck. I used a drill press.I am very impressed with the engineering of this machine. It was designed to be at the upper weight limit of what can be handled in a home. Took me about an hour to assemble, but most of the time spent was reading the instructions ahead to understand how it all comes together and drilling out that one undersized hole. I give an A to the engineering and value, C to manufacturing because it is unforgivable to have an important structural bolt hole too small, B- to the assembly instructions and F to some genius business executive who decided to plaster all over the box and the manual that it cannot be turned on before activating iFit - with your credit card of course. !!! IGNORE ALL THOSE WARNINGS !!! As many other reviewers have pointed out, after it is assembled and powered, you just have to hold down the blue iFit logo on the panel for about 20 sec to get past the initial registration block. Our unit is quiet and so far works great.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this to work out, mostly walk at home. The quality is excellent and very sturdy. It did take 3 people to drag it in pieces up the stairs to the room it was going into. Take everything out of the box and transport in pieces. The track is very heavy but easier that way. Once together, it was easy to set up and run. I like the larger screen and would not want smaller. Everything works great, but the hand heart rate sensor is poor at best. It only works on the right hand, and is never close to accurate, so I ordered the iFit chest strap heart monitor. That works excellent and usually in the first minute of a workout it is recognized and giving your heart rate. The machine is fairly quiet, though the fan if you use it is a little loud. I love the iFit and its worth every penny, and the first year is free. I am 6’2”, 205 lbs and this takes everything I can throw at it. I wanted to walk, but I’m now running intervals and working up to a half hour of running with the help of an iFit workout trainer. I am very happy with this. I did purchase a 6 year service because I’m putting in about 35 min a day 6-7 days a week. So things will wear out. All in all, excellent machine for the price and quality.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 14 InchesStyle Name: T 9.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: NordicTrack 6.5Si Was the Right Investment For Adding Cardio to My Workout
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2019
CommentsContent: After searching for a good price point on a treadmill, on Amazon PRIME day (July 15, 2019), I finally pulled the trigger and purchased a NordicTrack 6.5Si, which I had delivered to my home. I'm an older guy who works in an office and previously could never seem to get enough cardio. Though I've heard stories about how the average treadmill becomes a coat hanger after six months, I was determined to never let this happen to me. I looked at several pre-owned units that were for sale on various classified ad websites and also a number of new units on the major reseller websites. After carefully considering all the collective info, I eventually decided on the NordicTrack 6.5Si as the best value for the money to meet my goals.DeliveryThe unit was delivered on-time and no parts were missing upon receipt. I'm SUPER GLAD I had the unit delivered because there is a small set of cement steps leading to the entrance to my home and the shipping carton was very long (5+ feet) and extremely heavy. Two large men took a fairly long time to negotiate the cement steps/doorway area into my home and were greatly relieved to finally be able to set the unit down once inside my home.AssemblyThough I'm fairly mechanically inclined, it took 9-hours with only a few breaks (far longer than expected) from the time I slit open the carton to the time I tightened the last bolt on the treadmill for use with only a few breaks, so plan your full Saturday or Sunday accordingly. The project wasn't technically difficult, and instructions were clear—just a significant number of time-consuming steps involved in the assembly process. Also, there’s a point toward the end of assembly in which YOU WILL DEFINITELY REQUIRE a second person to assist for a few minutes. No human can simultaneously bear the weight of the entire treadmill deck (belt area) while tightening the underneath bolts that are attached to the frame, unless, of course, your arms happen to be five-feet long and you can also bench-press 300-lbs. Trust me, I tried to accomplish this alone for a long time beyond what I can describe and still failed.WorkoutThe next day, though I was still pretty sore from assembling the treadmill, I changed my routine to include getting up ½-hour earlier for my treadmill workout; bio break; two glasses of water w/a handful of raw spinach; then force myself onto the treadmill regardless if I’m tired/sick/lazy….As part of this, I also made a stalwart commitment to NEVER miss a treadmill day—no matter what. For the first couple months, my treadmill routine strictly comprised “Manual” mode in which I manually shifted between treadmill Speed 4 with the incline feature on Level 4, then to Speed 5 w/no incline, then to Speed 7.5 w/no incline, and repeat this cycle for 30-minutes. After a while, my body adjusted to running on the treadmill five times p/week, and I started to mix it up twice a week or so with the available On-Demand workouts to prevent boredom. These modules are interesting to watch and run the gamut from fairly easy novice to insanely challenging expert level. Though I also purchased the upgrade for a personal trainer package, I have not yet tapped this function to date, since I’m still not ready for that high-intensity level of cardio (suspect some of these pro trainers must be T-800 model Cyborgs). Astonishingly, between following Mark Wahlberg’s diet (older ripped guy, right??), along with a very light weight-training/push-ups/sit-ups regimen, I’m actually starting to get ripped—despite in my ever multiplying 50+ years…. Doesn’t matter if it’s raining or 100-degrees outside, every day I get my cardio. Never thought I’d see my abs again, but right now I can probably squeeze out a four-pack. I’m convinced the treadmill is the key to this, since nothing else has really changed in my routine, save for the treadmill portion.Treadmill OperationOverall, the NordicTrack 6.5Si is a great little unit and I’m super-happy with the investment. Precise and well-crafted, the unit smoothly folds upright to reduce the footprint in my living space. The console immediately synced with my home WiFi. Graphics/audio on the 10-inch monitor are crystal clear. However, the console’s operating controls must have been designed by a millennial or someone else with 20/20 vision, because I can’t see the 8-point font displayed in white on the control buttons without reading glasses, which I don’t like to wear when I’m running on a treadmill. Moreover, the issue is exacerbated by tiny control buttons that are way too small on the touch screen. It’s like trying to hit a tiny moving target while running. Inevitably, I’ll hit the wrong speed or incline button, which is a distraction from my workout. It would be great if some day NordicTrack can add a voice activation function, so users don’t have to push buttons whatsoever while working out.The On-Demand modules are interesting, and the aesthetics are breathtaking. Sometimes, it kind of takes the sting out of a challenging run, since the vibe feels like you’re running next to a pro trainer on a beach or through the woods in some exotic location. There are countless varieties/workouts/levels to choose from. That said, I wish there were a few in which the trainers didn’t speak at all. Most of them won’t stop yacking, which is disruptive when I’m trying to get my head in the zone. Also, it could just be me, but I was unable to find a headphone jack or any way whatsoever to sync my Sony XM wireless headphones to the treadmill. The only option I could find was to play audio or my own music through the treadmill’s built-in speaker system. This is not a plausible option for me, since I’m not confident other people in my home would like to listen to Slipknot or the equivalent cranked for a 1/2-hour every morning. As a work-around I usually listed to music on my iPhone with headphones and turn the sound off on the On-Demand modules.The motor/belt have worked perfectly with plenty of power under constant change. However, the console software frequently gets “hung-up” while updating and I have to reboot at least once a week. In fact, a couple weeks ago I had to perform a “hard reset,” which was a hassle because it seriously delayed my only window to work out in the morning and killed my routine.Overall, I couldn’t be happier with the NordicTrack 6.5Si. For me, selecting a treadmill was a big investment decision, which, fortunately, turned out to be the right one.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Broken piece - waiting for over a month for replacement.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I wish I could rate this machine but I have been unable to use it at all. I received the machine on December 2020. The box was a little beat up but I decided to inspect it further before sending it back. I did not see any further immediate evidence of damage from shipping. I began to assemble the machine until I got to assembling the heart beat monitor cross bracket. The bracket was bent on one side. Not due to shipping but rather a factory defect. It would not fit on the machine. No problem. I got an extended warranty from NordicTrack. I sent them a picture and asked for a replacement. I was contacted that day and the replacement part was ordered. It is now February 7, 2021 and I have not received the part. I called customer service and inquired about three weeks ago and was told the part was on back order. The tracking number they gave me just says, “In Progress” as the order status. They told me that the part was going to get to the factory on February 2nd. I am not inflexible and can understand that the part is on back order and I just have to wait. Today, February 7, 2021, I still cannot use the machine because I have not received the replacement part to make the machine operable. The tracking status still says “in progress.” I am beyond frustrated at this point. If I have a customer that has been waiting for over a month for a replacement part I would make sure to expedite that order because that is unacceptable under any metric. I wish I was hopeful to receive the part before spring but I am not. I am going to give them the benefit of a couple more weeks and then try to send the machine back to Amazon.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Picked this up due to covid gym closures in my area. It's a nice basic model with everything I wanted, minus the fan (but no biggie, I have a standing one near by).Assembly was easy, and I was able to put it together in about 1 hour max. Instructions suggests 2 people to assemble, but I was able to do it myself taking extra caution when needed. When attaching the folding spring under the unit, I used a chair to prop it up as I saw someone in another review. It worked great.The treadmill is super heavy, so if you're moving it upstairs, you'll def need two people. It's pretty sturdy, though not as solid as a commercial treadmill.I don't care for the ifit programs and was able to set this up and bypass the sign up prompt by pressing the ifit button for 30 seconds (as mentioned in other reviews). Contrary to the unit saying it's locked and can only be started by using the ifit program, you can get around it with no problem!It has nice size cup holders that can hold 5 lb. dumbbells (I use these intermittently when I power walk). And it has a good size ledge that can hold a iphone, ipad, remote and skinny water bottle all at once.All in all, 5 stars from me! I do recommend this for anyone looking for a decent basic treadmill with horsepower to run, jog or walk, along with a push button incline. And I believe it's made in the USA!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Its too difficult to return so im stuck
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2019
CommentsContent: This treadmill works. The belt moves, the speeds change and the elevation also changes. If youre looking for something that will measure your heart rate or accurately account for how many calories you have burned or the distance you've gone then pass on by. None of those features work properly. Not to mention the frustration with the Ifit program that several other people warned about in prior reviews. The trick with holding the button down did not work for mine. I had to sign up for the free trial and then go into my account and cancel it right after to make sure i was not charged later on. I'm very disappointed that the heart rate monitors are way off. Telling me my heart rate is 40 after running for 20 minutes even when trying it standing completely still. It also will tell me I have burned almost 1000 calories in 45 minutes. I am in shape but I'm no olympic runner. Its completely off. Buyers beware.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: READ FOR iFit BYPASSING TIP AND EXPERIENCE
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2020
CommentsContent: IMPORTANT: You do not need to sign-up with iFit to use this machine. You have to use the Treadmill KEY (The small red rectangular shaped piece of plastic attached to the black string with clip on the end) to bypass iFit and workout on the machine, manually (access-wise) or “old-school”. I registered and signed-up for iFit because I was interested to see what they have going on but it is not for me. I like to hear my own music when I’m running and not someone talking in my head/ears. It’s cool though but not for me.MACHINE: Absolutely love this machine! This is perfect for busy parents with little to no time to workout during the day so we can put in the work after the children goes to bed! Assembly took about 2.5 hours maximum (1 person plus some help here and there). It is very HEAVY!!! It is very easy to fold and unfold too. It is not very noisy so that’s good. The 5 inch screen is small but it’s budget friendly and we manage. Nothing too fancy but it’s okay. I would recommend getting a treadmill mat to protect your machine and floor. Delivery was good to so I highly recommend!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2019
CommentsContent: This was professionally assembled by Amazon services. The control console with screen and handles wobbles sideways very severely when walking, even worse at higher speeds when running. The Amazon assembly man said this happened on all of these Nordic Track treadmills and could not be fixed. Even at 3 mph, the whole top that you hold onto swings sideways. left-right-left - with EVERY STEP YOU TAKE! This made me quite seasick when watching the workout progress screen and I have never been seasick in my life before. I have worked out on treadmills for 25 years and never had this issue before. My wife had same problem, saying even walking on this treadmill was like being in a small boat during a storm. The faster you go, the more severe the side swaying/wobbling. Going to have to return this to Amazon.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2019
CommentsContent: I think it's important to leave reviews for others on a purchase of this size.  Especially considering there are so many negative reviews.  My package was delivered without any issues.  No damage, and it even sat out in the frigid Upstate NY air for over 24 hours before being brought inside.  I also opted for the free service which meant it was delivered to my front porch.  It's heavy, don't get me wrong, but two people can easily carry it up a flight of stairs.  When I say "two people," I mean two women, one of which has zero upper body strength.  Talking about myself here.  Anyway, assembly is certainly complicated, but not impossible.  The hardware is all labeled by each step of installation.  I think it's important to read each step carefully, and even jump ahead 2-3 steps to get more information.  Some of the parts has screws already attached that were discarded before assembly.  Just pay attention and you'll be good to go.  You only need a second person for installation of the hydraulic leg for folding by the way.  Everything else can easily be managed on your own.Enough about this iFit nonsense.  Get your phone out, indicate that you have the standard screen (not color touch screen), and select the option to skip set-up using your smart phone/tablet.  It unlocks the treadmill practically in an instant.  Anyone with a healthy set of eyes should be able to figure that out no problem.So far so good on the operation of the machine.  It's not any louder than any other treadmill and the flex step definitely absorbs a significant amount of shock.  No wobbling, squeaking, shaking or anything else that shouldn't be happening.  I'm a bit confused by the way it tracks distance by the 100th of a mile instead of 10th, but I can get used to that.I prefer to run outdoors; hate the gym setting.  However, I've still got my Planet Fitness membership when a feel the need to run with a buddy while the sidewalks are covered in snow.  Really excited to have this treadmill for those quick morning or evening workouts that don't require driving, let alone changing in a smelly locker room.  I'll update this review if I find any issues with continued operation.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Rewarding encouragement to go as far as you can
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve been wheelchair bound for 5 years, then used a walker. Remain unstable on a cane. This treadmill can be set to 0.5 speed setting. Warning always start the warmup and trail with feet straddling the track. The video gives me focus to keep going. A mirror in front helps with foot placement. Started doing just the warmup. Now up to 15 minutes at speed 1.  For me I see my feet work better going up hill. Taught me to add stretches to improve walking on level ground. I may walk again normally with practice.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve had my T 6.5 si treadmill for a month and have used it every day. I’m so incredibly happy with this purchase. I assembled the treadmill by myself without difficulty and have had zero problems with it so far. The only issue I had is that there was no code for my year of free Ifit included in the box, but I called Ifit support and they immediately activated my membership over the phone. I cannot recommend the Ifit program enough. The quality of the videos is outstanding, the trainers are fantastic, and the workouts are incredibly fun. I enjoy them so much that I have to talk myself *out* of working out several times a day so I don’t overdo it. My only complaint with Ifit is that the user interface leaves a bit to be desired (difficult to search/sort through available workouts, etc.), but everything else about it is so great that it makes up for this inconvenience. I’m a very happy Nordictrack/Ifit customer!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2019
CommentsContent: The assembly of this treadmill is easy and straight forward while following the directions. Once I finished assembly and turned it on I was immediately impressed with how solid it was when I ran on it. I haven't used the iFit programs yet, but I have used the basic run program. It's great to see the run time, speed, and distance all at the same time on the display. It's easy to connect to my wireless gateway, the bluetooth is great to connect to my phone, the speakers and display are awesome, and the fan works great.
