CommentsTitle: Best thing I ever did was buy this machine!!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I recently bought my Nordic Track T series 6.5. I love it. Even my husband loves it. It took me a morning to put together, yes I needed a little help from my husband but was able to accomplish most of it on my own. Caution on step one. I had to take the monitor off to get the bolt covers for the feet on. My fault I didnt read the instructions thoroughly. The instructions were Easy though. A few questions but you also get a 3D aid if you use BILT app to help you put it together. (I didnt know this before I put it together. Again I should read the papers that came with the machine better.)As for needing to use the IFIT machine to get it to work. NO YOU DON'T! THERE IS AN OVER RIDE. PRESS THE IFIT BUTTON FOR 30 SECONDS. You can you the treadmill just fine without using the IFIT. I was scared of some reviews that complained about this. IGNORE THEM.1 free month trial with Ifit? IFit offers it regardless. Although I am doing the 100% free trial and am really enjoying it. Even contemplating buying a subscription. It really motivates me and keeps me on my workout routine.  You do not have to pay. Just do not put in payment information. I have a receipt that says $0.00 for my month of ifit subscription. Using caution I also used a throw away email in case they asked for to much info. They dont. Bare bones. Height, weight, sex, email. That's it. Again you DO NOT HAVE TO PUT IN YOUR CREDIT CARD INFO to get your free trial.I am a stay at home mom since March of a toddler and have packed on the pounds. I am so excited to get my weight back under control and my Nordic Treadmill is going to help get me there. Also my husband is so glad I got this so he too can use it. We've both packed on some weight since becoming parents and then dealing with the stress of the pandemic. He's using it as much as I am. Even made sure we got new good shoes while we use it to keep our knees happy.I can not praise this treadmill enough. If you are on the fence or have doubts. I was there too. I got mine for a steal at a little over $600. Watch the price and buy when you can. I have no regrets.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: I am loving this machine! I love I-Fit!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2019
CommentsContent: First off this thing is big.  Two men carried it from the truck.  It stayed right where it was until the assembly team showed up a few days later.  The thing I love the most is the I-fit integration.  This takes my workouts to a entire different level.  The trainers really push me.  When the workout is over I am really sweating....something that seldom happens when I  simply spend 20-30 minutes on a treadmill.  The I-Fit combo is what takes everything about this to the next level. It seems there is a workout for wherever you are on your fitness journey.  I am a 61 year old man....and they  have a lot for me to choose from.  Buy the machine....sign up for the I-Fit...it will take you where you want to go.  A great value.  Rock solid machine.  My only negatives.....heart rate monitor is wildly inaccurate....it sure deserves a fan.  Note to all treadmill designers.....why is the on off switch always in an awkward place typically at the floor....come on.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Amazon freight shipping guys dropped it in our garage for us.Took 2-3 hours for us to assemble. Probably if you know exactly what you are doing, can be done in 30 mins.Have had it for 3 months, so far so good. Use for ~30 mins 4x a week.We were looking for something relatively affordable, sturdy, didn't care too much for features beside incline and speed.Seems sturdy enough when running, no wobbling unless the ground is uneven.Will update if anything changes in the next few years.Some things to keep in mind:- Hold down bluetooth/iFit to bypass iFit subscription when you turn on for the first time.- Walking belt slows down with every step on slow speeds (1-2MPH).- Can run fine, tried up to 8MPH. Maxes at 10MPH.- A little loud, have to turn up music when running.- Speakers not good for music.- Bluetooth is only used for iFit, not music connection.- Heavy. Fold up function is nice and helps when you need to move it (on its 2 tiny wheels).Also appreciate how generous ICON fitness was, by offering me a small giftof either a maintenance kit or floor mat in exchange for a positive review.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Nothing special of a treadmill, based on the reviews I was hoping it was better quality.Assembly was easy, just follow directions. I see other people saying how unsafe this machine is, it is a treadmill people. It has moving parts, learn how to walk in real life and you can navigate this machine.I will say it is REALLY LOUD compared to what I expected.If this is near a bedroom, you will not be able to sleep if someone is on it.This thing is LOUD at 6am, when sound travels through the house. I installed wall to wall foam gym floor in the room, and I just ordered foam acoustic panels to place under and around this thing, hoping it helps absorb some sound. Definitely wouldn't be able to use in an apartment complex. I will see how the panels work in a few weeks.I am 180 pounds and 6ft, it can handle my weight easy. I can't run on it while others are sleeping due to the noise, even walking on it seems to be loud if someone is sleeping.Better than nothing when it comes to the closed gyms due to Covid19, but kinda wish I dropped another couple hundred of my Trump bucks for a better (quieter) machine.I expect this to hold up to the miles I plan to put on it, so I would recommend, just know it is not as quiet as I hoped/expected.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: RETURNING IS A NIGHTMARE SO MAKE SURE YOU LIKE IT
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Took me 45 days to get this product out of my door when I tried to return it. I spent hours and hours on the phone with amazon and the pick-up service they use. The pick-up service was TERRIBLE. They wouldn't call me back, they would schedule a day without telling me, they would come to my house and refuse to take it, etc. It was a freaking nightmare.About the treadmill though:I am quite short so my legs are quite short (5'2) but they would always hit the top cover that hides the motor when I ran. I could scoot back but then I'd practically be off the treadmill, and it is hard to scoot back when you have it all the way inclined. That being said, the incline worked fine. The screen was quite good. The folding up wasn't very good. When you go to fold the track up, it always rubbed against one of the handles (left one). The iFit is annoying. We accidentally subscribed so I had to call them directly and cancel our subscription (which thankfully was very easy and the guy made it a breeze). The treadmill was just not worth the price.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Slowest delivery ever (but item is great)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2020
CommentsContent: The machine itself id great (After I bypassed the iFit thing)  There are other apps or YouTube channels that provide similar if wanting a virtual trail walk or something. If you really want the iFit option, go for it, Im sure its fine.Ordering was fast and easy, not Prime. but it was sold by Amazon so there was a delivery option. I chose the earliest available which was 2 days after purchasing. Delivery was set for Sunday!Excitedly waiting the item to arrive but let down hard when the time passed and nothing. Contacted Amazon and assurances were made and credits provided (for Amazon items of course)11 days after it was first ordered, 9 days after original delivery date the treadmill finally arrived.  Just in time too, expected to snow for 2 days.. The guys that delivered were nice however so I appreciate that but the whole 9 day fiasco was ridiculous. I have never had this bad of an experience from Amazon in the 15 years I've been ordering from them. One of the support people even had the gall to tell me "Its not Prime you know"As for the device itself.. Assembly was not bad at all, went up in about an hour. Like some purchasing the machine I bypassed the iFit by holding the iFit button down till the screen activated (make sure the magnetic stop key is inserted first lol) Device worked great! cant wait to start using it on a regular basis.*Note to fitbit users.. doesn't seem to register steps so keep those arms swinging!Youtube has some virtual trails, or other apps in the App stores.. check them out!So far, I recommend buying this device, I just hope shipping doesn't effect you as it did me
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Scheduled service to assemble track 10 days ago.  The appointment was for today at 2PM. Got a call at 11AM saying earliest date technician could assembles Oct 1.  That's five weeks out.Person on phone was very nice, very apologetic buts that's not what Amazon promised.Just lost 5 weeks off my warranty.First time I have used Amazon's service calls and it's not a good start.Will keep you posted but if you are buying this for near term use----don't count on Amazon assemblyUpdate No. 1: Spent a few hours putting it together. Instructions are very clear.  The unit is securely packed to prevent damage. Small parts are packaged to coordinate with the steps in the instructions. Large parts are well identified Very well engineered, clear instructions, easy to follow.  I feel the two fit peopler are required to unpack and position the track.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2020
CommentsContent: First off, pay for professional installation. It took me three hours by myself and they don’t even give you tools to screw in the bolts. Luckily, I had a mini wrench that I found but it wasn’t strong enough to make the bolts flush. I will have to go out and get a socket wrench. I researched many treadmills with the iFit model. I definitely need motivation and I get bored on machines. This was the cheapest one, brand-name, with iFit. I wear a Fitbit So I wasn’t concerned at all about the machines heart rate monitor which was completely inaccurate. Additionally, the calories burned on these preset programs on iFit was also inaccurate. Do yourself a favor, get a Fitbit watch or something similar to track these yourself. This treadmill is very flippin heavy. There is absolutely no way one person can move it by themselves. It is well-built. It is quite it has the same quality of the treadmills at the gym. I have not tried the speakers yet so I cannot review them at this time. You do not have to get the iFit as others have stated, but again, nowhere does it say that. At $15 a month, if you need the motivation and you like to see the world, get the iFit. You can cancel at any time. The trainers that take you around the world are immersive, and takes your mind off of what you are doing at the time - working out. Overall, I think this was a great buy considering I was looking at other treadmills from $500-$1000 more. This thing Works. I was sore for a couple of days after my very first workout with I fit which was a simple 32 minute walking tour through London. The last couple of minutes had me going up a hill. The incline and speed adjusts automatically. I did not have to press any buttons myself. I was quite shocked that I was even sore as I walk at least 10,000 steps a day and walk all day long for 10 hours at my job. I do not regret this purchase.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I had great hopes when I bought a Nordic Track. Great well known name, what could be better?Unfortunately, that became what could be worse?Assembling was difficult b/c the bolts and holes weren't smooth and easy to thread. Usually, threads are cleaned out by machine during manufacturing, they must have skipped this step. Most bolts were hard to start and tighten, which I've read in other reviews.After assembly, spouse got on it and found it squeaks while in use. I tried several lubricating steps recommended in other reviews without success. Not a bad squeak, but annoying on a new machine.We contacted Nordic Track via phone and on website. No response. I also contacted Amazon, and Amazon left a voice mail with my number. I got no response. Finally got a case opened via Facebook. Their response? "Your feet are probably dragging on the belt, please take care not to do that".Because of the significant cost, we decided to return it due to an unresolved noise and poor/no response from manufacturer. The only way to return it is to have it disassembled and packed in the original box. In the end, I'm out 3-5 hours assembly/disassembly and moving this up/down stairs.So, yeah, not worth the hassle. If you find this review helpful, please click on the helpful button so that others may avoid the pain.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: Treadmill arrived with damage to some of the cosmetic plastic pieces that cover the electronics and mechanical parts. No big deal, I had purchased the extended warranty just in case, so Nordic track agreed to ship replacement parts -- for me to install. The bigger problem was that when I first turned the treadmill on (and by-passed their attempt to "up-sell" you into their online workouts which involve a  monthly  fee) the instructions directed me to calibrate the incline motor. When I started the calibration process, the incline motor immediately jammed and would not function at all. The belt would turn but the deck was inclined and would not adjust. I contacted Nordic Track and after a half-hour wait to talk to someone and another half hour of troubleshooting, they agreed to send me a new motor. They offered to send a technician to install the motor, but said it might take weeks to schedule. So, I waited 2 weeks for the new motor to arrive, installed it myself and the new motor immediately jammed as soon as I powered up the treadmill.  When I contacted Nordic Track again (re another hour on the phone) they agreed to send more parts and a technician.  A few days later, I received an email from Nordic Track threatening to void my warranty because the treadmill was located in a garage.  They demanded photographic evidence of the treadmill's location.  I sent a photo of the unit in my finished, insulated, climate-controlled garage along with the large flat screen tv and home gym set-up that are located there.  Nordic Track did not respond, so I arranged a return and refund thru Amazon. Amazon's customer  service was AMAZING!! I highly recommend that if you do decide to take a chance and buy this questionable product, do it thru Amazon, because Amazon will take care of you when Nordic Track inevitably screws you over.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Works well, but you have to enter into their iFit scam in order to get it started.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2020
CommentsContent: So Nordic Track decided to try to get people to pay a gym membership to them from their homes with this iFit scam nonsense.  This seems to be the norm with a lot of these treadmill companies.  So you sign up for iFit, and then cancel it immediately.  That's fine.  I'd spend the $80 bucks to get some poor soul to install it at your house.  I chose to do it myself to save money and it was a huge pain in the neck.  Folding this machine is some what easy, but it's definitely not portable or easy to move.  There are wheels that are less than 2" in diameter that you're suppose to pull it with.Again, when using it as a treadmill, it works great.  Just look out for the iFit scam.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: It is a decent value for the money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I wish this treadmill had a fan built in like my previous treadmill.The fact that you are forced to sign up with ifit.com before being able to use it is very annoying and not very fair to the consumer. I should not be forced to do anything by a seller or product.However, as someone else described the procedure to bypass the mandatory registration with ifit, simply:1. Attach the safety cord2. Press and hold the ifit button for 30 seconds.This procedure will allow you to use the treadmill without having to register. You only have to do this one time.On the positive side, the treadmill feels comfortable during its intended use. It is not very noisy except when changing the inclination. Folding and un-folding is done easily and quietly.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Exactly what I was looking for to use with Zwift!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2020
CommentsContent: First off I want to tell you that I did not even try the iFit trial, so I can not speak to that. I was looking for a good treadmill to use with Zwift and have found this treadmill works perfectly for that. I needed to be able to pair it with the Zwift program and found that the Zwift Runn paired with this treadmill and the speeds matched exactly with no calibration of the Runn needed. I had first tried the Zwift running pod, but found the speeds it recorded were not accurate. I highly recommend this treadmill for indoor running, especially for pairing with the Zwift platform.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve had this for about a month now. I’m a 50 year old that is trying to get back into jogging again.Assembly. Took about two hours by myself.Now...I’m not counting the hour I took looking for another screw (Step #1) because the supplied screw did not fit.After that...things went smooth.I love this machine. I bypassed the Ifit like every one said and held the button down about 10 seconds. I may consider it in the future but just starting out.I just figured out this morning that you can adjust the cushion on the track. Looking forward to running on that tonight.I was honestly looking at the $350-$400 price range but after reading soooo many reviews, (mostly bad in that price range in reliability)  this one seemed like a worthwhile gamble to spend the extra money. I use it about 30-45 min every other day. For the price I really think it would be hard to beat.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2020
CommentsContent: We have had this treadmill for a month now. My husband and I both use it a few times a week. He is the runner and I like to do inclined power walking. We are both very happy with this treadmill.It's by no means "gym quality" but it fits the bill for an average home user looking to get or stay in shape.It has plenty of features that make it impressive for the price point. We love the folding feature because it gives us a bit more space when it's not in use. The belt is plenty wide and long and the motor keeps up with my husband's runs.The only couple things that are slightly disappointing are there is no fan but that's easily resolved by placing one nearby and the speakers in the console are not good quality, but we have a Bluetooth speaker in our workout room. Neither of these are deal breakers for us especially considering the price tag.As other reviews have mentioned, the iFit membership can be bypassed by holing fown the iFit button for a few seconds, then you're ready to go.If youre looking for a good value treadmill with lots of features I would recommend this one.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I had my eye on this treadmill for a while and I’m happy I pulled the trigger! My treadmill did arrive damaged, but Nordic’s customer service was excellent and they had a replacement piece sent out to my house as soon as possible. I did see a few reviews say that the ifit membership was required in order to use the treadmill, but that’s definitely not the case. Once the treadmill is powered on, hold down the ifit button for 30 seconds and then your treadmill is ready to be used without having to pay for the membership fee.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Just what I needed, so why only 1 star?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a good quality treadmill for the money, easy to assemble, and easy to use.  I don't need any features other than some simple numbers for speed, time, and distance, and this machine is fine for that without anything else.  It comes with a large red stop sign that says the machine will not work until you go to iFit and activate, whatever that is.  I called the phone number instead, nobody home.  So I went to iFit and the only option was to type in a credit card.  I did, and then and only then found that if I would just hold the iFit button down for 20 seconds or so, that would activate the machine without whatever iFit might be.  So I logged onto my new iFit account and set the status to cancel whatever it was that I signed up for.  This is pretty shady and if I would have known about their methods in advance I would have looked for a different machine or company.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: This is a pretty great treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I've been using this machine for a little under a month. So far, I have no complaints, except for some intermittent connectivity issues. You don't have to sign up for ifit; there are instructions in the reviews and q & a section for activating without it. However, I'm using ifit just to test out the different workouts, and I'm enjoying it so far. I only did a little bit of research to find a treadmill. It can get overwhelming, but this brand and model seemed to meet all of my requirements and reliability. My husband moved and assembled it for me. It fits well into the corner of our fitness room, and it folds up conveniently so my husband can pull his bench out. There haven't been any noise issues, and I haven't used the speakers, since I normally use my headphones. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I was going crazy, being locked in the house during COVID. I have two children, the youngest still being a bit of a loose cannon and we live on a busy road. I didn't feel like I could safely go for a walk with her and even my oldest isn't old enough by legal standards to stay at home with her. I'm working from home, sitting all day. At least at the office, I'd walk the building, around the building; but at home. . . it was just sitting. This machine gives has been a God-Send, best 700 bucks I've spent in a while. I use it daily to get my exercise, burn off steam and get the endorphins going. So far so good, it gives me a good quality work-out every time. I will say assembly was a challenge at  times, as was moving the package. I had to open the box in my foyer where they left it and carry the pieces to the living room for assembly. It says you need two people and you're probably better off - it is heavy and cumbersome. I didn't have that option though, so me and my 11 dollar tool kit that I keep around the house got this thing assembled in about 6 hours. I did follow the instructions, but I also followed a video on Youtube and I had no issues with having to disassemble or redo anything. Even managed to adjust the belt and felt very accomplished afterwards. I love it, best thing I could have done for myself. The only thing I did not like was IFit- so I couldn't bypass it and it sounded cool. I did the trial, I signed up for a bunch of classes that sounded awesome- walk through the pyramids of Egypt, yes please. I started the first, only to have my treadmill literally take off under neath me. I had to pull th cord and shut it down, the instructor wasn't even moving yet. IFit would have been great if it didn't control my machine, I need to control my pace and incline. I cancelled it that night.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2020
CommentsContent: The delivery drivers notified me when they were on the way, the box was in pristine condition, it was on time, and the instructions were very straight forward. It runs perfectly and is exactly what I wanted.There are two cons:1. You must have a second person to put this together.2. NordicTrack makes you think you have to register for their iFit program for your treadmill to even turn on. This is not true. You can bypass the registration process by just turning the machine on, putting the safety stopper fab into its place and holding down the iFit button.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: an i fit account is required to activate treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I did not realize when I purchased this NordicTrack T6.5S Treadmill that it is considered a "smart treadmill." The NordicTrack T6.5S Treadmill is locked and in order to unlock it you must set up an account with if it.com to activate the treadmill (give credit card information, personal information, etc). You get a free 30 day trial but if you not cancel there is a monthly/yearly charge of $180.00. You can join a gym for as little as 10 per month. After setting up my treadmill I attempted to cancel the free membership and I am unable to do so. I am so pissed off that I would recommend to anyone who would listen not to purchase this treadmill and Amazon should warn you before purchase. I am filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau. BEWARE, DON'T PURCHASE TREADMILL
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Hey all,I brought this treadmill because all of my gyms closed down on the post I work for in the military. I have to stay ready at all times. There were a lot of treadmills I researched to get to my final destination. I wanted the high-end ones but this works fantastically. I have no complaints. The screen works clearly and the touch configurations work great even when you're covered in sweat. I can see and touch my buttons even with my glasses off. I had to build this alone because I brought some new shoes with this purchase, and my spouse was at work. I was too excited to start back running. It took me a couple of hours (I was watching law and order and eating lunch). The delivery team brought it to right to my doorstep that helped a lot. This treadmill is worth the money especially the IFIT that comes with. The coaches keep me engaged and ready to go. The stats are saved by my wifi too. Overall dreams come true.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I just got into a workout routine before Covid, but thankfully when the weather turned, I was happy to get outside. My parents bought this treadmill on Prime day and I realized that I wanted one. It is great to be able to walk whenever, day or night/ or even in this cold weather. Two things though, the ground hole needs drilled a bit more when assembling and the ifit can be bypassed when first turning on, by holding the ifit button down for over 10 seconds. I haven’t used ifit, but it seems like an unnecessary monthly membership fee. I’d totally recommend this item.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I didn’t want to sign up for the iFit program so all you have to do to get around that is press and hold the iFit Bluetooth symbol next to the phone and iPad symbol (it doesn’t look like an actually button to press but that’s what you have to touch)  and it went to the home screen! Super easy to assemble.I do have a complaint tho, my delivery wasn’t the best experience. They scuffed up my trim when they put it into the room and the box was damaged and dented in multiple places. Definitely not professional.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Pretty sturdy, pretty good so far...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: First, I was disappointed to discover this treadmill was made in china.  Delivery was quite fast, but the box was damaged and the treadmill suffered minor scratches.  Moving the treadmill from the front porch to the assembly location was thought, it’s very heavy.  I removed the parts from the box to move them easier.  Assembly was ok, fit of the parts was ok, we’ll see how durable it is.  Activation is a pain.  Eventually we figured out by holding the Bluetooth button down for 20-30 seconds, the online activation is not necessary.  The treadmill work fine, as expected.  It seems powerful enough for walking, jogging, maybe a slowish runner.  Not sure a sprint would be supported?  But, it does feel powerful.  Several workout programs are offered.  The display is nice too, easy to read track graphic.  Overall, it seems ok so far.  Wish it was made anywhere but China.  Probably wouldn’t have bought something else had I known.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Everything but the delivery was good. The assembly, although it had annoying terrible instructions, wasn’t too bad. The delivery was just hell. It seemed like they were delivering to the room of choice and assembling the thing but they just dropped it off on our hallway and pretty much said good luck. Over 200 pound product and we had to get it to our basement, back corner gym, while trying not to scratch up the walls. Everything else was fine though. They can definitely use a pointer or two from ikea on how to create assembly instructions. Luckily we had the tools necessary to make the job a bit easier but if you have no tools, good luck.So far the machine seems to working pretty well.Also, DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THEIR FIT THING! Turn on the machine, put the key in it’s spot and just hold down the blue fit icon. You can bypass their stupid registration and just use the treadmill as intended.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: You don't need ifit to unlock the treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2019
CommentsContent: The Good:  Solid, well-built machine.  Excellent motor warranty.  The Not-So-Good:  Tracking adjustment access is horrible.  Aligning the hex wrench with the roller screw is difficult because there is about 1 1/2" space between the hex wrench access hole and the roller screw head.  The area is covered by a trim piece with limited visual access from the side.  Even using a flashlight, it was difficult to get the hex wrench fitted into the roller screw head.The Worst:  The owner,s manual does not tell you that the treadmill can be unlocked without signing up for ifit.  The ifit deal wants you to sign up for specialized programs for a monthly fee.  Guess what.  The same company owns both NordicTrack and ifit.  You can unlock the machine by pressing and holding the ifit logo on the console for 30 seconds.Thankfully, a prior reviewer made that information available.  If you just want the basics with out paying for the extra frills, you don't need to subscribe to ifit.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Never worked and extended warranty unresponsive
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2019
CommentsContent: DO NOT BUY.  I purchased this treadmill and the belt never stayed where it was supposed to be.  I purchased an extended warranty and asked them to repair.  They said it was A KNOWN PROBLEM and sent me two screws to put into the treadmill. There are no screw holes where these are supposed to fit.  As if today, I have made many requests for warranty repair service but they have not responded. Total ripoff and appalling customer service
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Beware! I fit Code locked. Code not valid. Serial numbers dont match.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2021
CommentsContent: Missing a whole row of buttons!!!! Machine looks great lets make that clear but... assembly isn’t that complicated... its horribly calibrated... theres dents and scratches everywhere!! Ifit code locked. You must purchase ifit subscription!!! The one that comes with the machine IS NOT VALID! Also the machine i got... the model and serial numbers on the box do not match the ones listed on the machine! Therefor you must be careful before activating. It will not unlock so its useless. I contacted customer service and refused a replacement was asked to ship back and pay shipping out of my own pocket for this huge box!!! Its expensive! Horrible experience. I do pay for prime, so why do i have to pay for return shipping on a useless product??? Amazon CS responded: contact us after 24 hrs. Seriously!!! Ive contacted them 3 days and they keep asking for tracking number!!! Or i will not keep my refund. Crazy!!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: If you can afford a better one, get a better one, and get it pre-assembled
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I use this without the app by pushing the connect button for 30 seconds.I like this machine sort of.  It works. The price was good. BUT it shuts off several times per  work out. I detach the emergency stop tassel/pull and put it back in and it starts back up, but it continues my timer/distance while it’s paused . Makes ZERO sense.For whatever reason, it was IMPOSSIBLE ago assemble. My husband made it work but in some areas they did not bore the holes aLarge enough for the screws and it explicitly says “do not use power tools.” Well, we had to. The screws were too big to fit through 🤦🏻‍♀️Overall it’s a good-ish machine. I like the one touch speed and incline buttons. I like that you don’t have to use the app with it (the app was terrible for runners tbh.) It fits in my large closet. It’s super quiet!!! It’s very stable with no shaking even while running. Displays are confusing. No idea what half the buttons do. And I can’t for the life of me figure out why my machine is stopping every 5-10 minutes. Are all treadmills like this?
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: We usse it more than I thought and love iFit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: When looking for a treadmill I was looking for a dependable brand that was as low cost as possible.  And then I learned about iFit and decided to make that a requirement and I'm glad I did.  This one is perfect because its low cost so it doesn't have its own screen and we just use our iPad which works great.  The iFit software is pretty awesome as it has training series where the trainer will run through Thailand or Greece or wherever and then the machine's speed and incline will automatically change with the trainer as she / he goes through the run / walk / hike.  We love it.  Only downside is that the treadmill now makes some more squeaking noise as it moves so I'm going to check into oil and the like but I'm not worried as it seems to be well constructed.  All in all - we'd recommend.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Comes with fake outdated iFit code -scam!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: Does not come with iFit code free trial as it states. It came with a card with an authorization code that has already been used ifit was no help they said this is a scam, it’s been months of trying to get a hold of a real person that I can even get this sorted out with....the treadmill itself is sturdy and does the job but it would’ve been nice to actually get what is advertised on the Amazon listing as that is what swayed me to buy this over another brand....disappointed to say the least in the seller.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2019
CommentsContent: Replacing a 6 yr old treadmill by another manufacture. That machine worked well for a long time.  Wanted a basic treadmill for the wife and I to walk on with some slow paced running.  Bought this product.  Assembly was okay. Had to disassemble some shipping screws and re-assemble with correct screws as part of the assembly process.  All in all the fit and finish is what I expected.  The belt seems to work just fine thought I wish it had a system where the belt will self adjust as it wears or an indicator that will show when the belt needs tightening.  Hello! Ever hear of a constant tension spring?Use- You MUST sign up with iFIT to get it to work. If we were hard core workout people then iFIT is something that we will use. And maybe we will grow into it.  Did not like that we could not assemble and turn it on and have it just work. Now I have to go back and remember the username and password, as if I don't have enough of those already, to discontinue the iFit subscription.  Wife used the most basic program to start and that was soon too much for her as it went from an incline of 2 to 6.  She is using it now mostly on manual mode where she has to input her own selections as she works out.  Really this machine is made for a more advanced runner than a light walker, jogger.  Time will tell if we use it more or less than our old machine.  We don't fold it and unfold it as it is part of the gym so it just stays in use position.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Why in the world would you have some many different types of screws and bolts? I had three different size bolts just for the side rails. When you install the side rails, do not tighten them up just leave them a bit loose or you will never get the pulsebar installed.  As for the IFit, Amazon should be ashamed of itself to allow NordicTrack/ IFit to hold an expensive piece of equipment hostage until you provide IFit with your credit card in order to turn the damn thing on.All three of you can do better on this.  The bypass trick of holding the IFit logo down for 30 sec does not seem to work in the newer purchased units. I know you don't want the average Joe to assemble these machines' when you can have a service person do it for another fee. There are assemble videos available on Utube take a look at a couple before you start,
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2021
CommentsContent: Once we got it working, it is a nice machine.  It is big and heavy so plan your location (including proximity to power), get your mat, surge protector,  before you start assembly.  It does fold easily but it still will not go through most doorways assembled.As luck would have it, ours came damaged during the pandemic.  We did not unbox for a while (time, procrastination) and thus missed some options like return although that would have been challenging during the pandemic as well.  The damage was a dead-center hit of one of the poles in the box with the electronic console knocking a crippling indentation on the display.  We were sent to NordicTrack for resolution and they agreed to replace the console upon appropriate documentation.  It was quite a wait for the part.  I suspect replacement part fulfillment was competing with new production but don't know.  Anyway, after 3 months we got the replacement part, figured out how to do the repair, and things are now great.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I was 47 yrs old, 5"10" and 231 pounds when I bought this treadmill.I am very pleased with this after a couple months of daily use. I find this treadmill to be very comfortable to run on. The track is large, and very fast. I have yet to go past halfway on the speed.What I like the best is that I only bought a treadmill, not a computer station with it. I don't need anything beyond how fast and how far. That's what this offers.Very easy to fold and unfold, I am very happy with this machine overall.I had no issues with the assembly, it was easy and the instructions were simple.The one issue I had was with the iFit connection. The treadmill comes with giant warnings saying that it is "locked" and that you have to make an iFit account to unlock it.I did that to only find out that I never needed to do so. All I had to do was hold down the iFit button for 30 seconds and the machine was unlocked. This was in the way back of the assembly instructions.That really upset me because I had already opened the iFit account and put in my credit card info.Why lie to me NordicTrack? I don't care what iFit is paying you, that is simply unethical to make me think that I needed to open an iFit account with a credit card to use the treadmill that I bought, then recant this at the end of the instructions.So if you buy this, and I would definitely recommend it, please be aware that if you don't want the iFit account, you don't have to make one.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Random Bargain for a Great, Basic Treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I happened to find this treadmill for about $685 and quickly researched and then purchased. I'm glad I did because the price immediately went back up to almost $1,000. Although I don't remember the description mentioning the machine folding, I'm glad that it does. The deck is long and comfortable to run or walk on, and the incline feature works great. By the numbers the deck might not be quite as wide as what you may use at the gym, but I can't feel the difference. My one and only gripe is that the front of the deck ends too close to the controls for my liking, so I'm constantly feeling like I'm too far back compared to machines that I'm used to.  The iFit nonsense is easy enough to bypass and at this point it's obvious that it's there. The whole number speed and incline buttons are nice and work well, but I wish the "+" and "-" buttons felt a bit more responsive on the display. The start to 1mph and stop ramp up/down a bit faster than what I'm used to, but I'll get used to that. Overall, the quality feels solid and the machine isn't overly loud - I have it in my living room for reference. The additional cushioning for the running deck is nice too. Lastly, you really don't need a media screen for double the normal price of this machine. The phone/tablet ledge works great and I can watch shows on TV or a device while running just fine on this machine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Seems Nice Overall But There Are Concerns
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I'd like to start by saying this thing was terribly frustrating to put together. The instructions are simple, but you have to fight the bolts to get them in place. It took me 30 minutes just to get the handles attached because the bolts catch so frequently.Two parts of it were damaged upon arrival (that I have noticed this far). A metal bar along the bottom and the top of the arm where the handles attach. I have yet to reach out to customer service.I have ran on it four times so far, and one of those times the screen was stuck on a loading screen image, but I was still able to control it manually and run, but it did not save my workout data.It feels great to run on, but I've been a little nervous considering the cost.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021
CommentsContent: We moved and the club we belonged to just no longer worked.  We debated and opted to purchase a treadmill.  We got the iFit included and wow what an experience.  My knees are not allowing be to run but with the iFit and various walking trails, it's terific.  The speed and incline are automatically adjusted to keep you going.  My wife uses for running and she has been all over the world.  HIGHLY recommend.  I am not the greatest mechanic but was able to assemble after delivery put in place I wanted.  10+ rating for me.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Everything I Hoped It Would Be
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I was worried about the negative reviews, where the product arrived damaged. Mine arrived fine, although I'm slightly unhappy that Amazon lets you "choose" a drop-off time window and UPS unilaterally changed it. I chose 0600-0900 on Saturday and UPS said 1400-1800. However, UPS delivered it in the original Amazon time window (at approximately 7 a.m.), and not during the UPS updated window.As for the product, I don't plan to use the fitness app, and I was able to disable the prompts immediately by pressing the iFit app button for several seconds, as another reviewer noted.As for the treadmill, I was able to set it up by myself, with a bit of difficulty. It is probably far easier to set it up with two people. As another reviewer noted, it is probably better to set it up in the room in which you intend to use it. It is fairly heavy, but the track lifts easily for storage. The cup holders kinda suck for most things other than cups, but there is a ledge you can use for phones/TV remotes.The functions are suitable for my purposes. I mostly intend to walk with it to increase my exercise while I watch TV. I tried the faster speeds, and this thing is FAST! I find walking to be most comfortable between 2.5 and 3.0. You can increase speeds and incline incrementally by 0.1 of a unit. I do not really use the incline, but it's a neat feature I might explore if I advance in skill. I disabled the sound beeps, and it is now fairly quiet to operate. I can walk (at a fast clip) and watch my shows without disturbing my housemates one room over. I'm happy I went with this model over the cheaper budget units. Although I'm not ready to use all the features of this model, I'm glad I have that option for the future.Solid device, and about the only model at this price point with the features I wanted.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2019
CommentsContent: My biggest complaint with this equipment is the ability to play music. It has 2 large speakers but if you don't subscribe to iFit then they are useless. They have a port which the instructions state you can insert your iPod in.  I think I stopped using an iPod back in the 90's. At this price range you should be able to use any of the modern devices to play your music. But they have seen fit to partner with iFit and limit your music choice to only them.  I hate it when a company tries to force you to use a product that you don't want and certaintly don't want to pay monthly for.It folds easily but still leaves a big footprint in the folded position because it doesn't fold up even close to vertical.I paid to have this assembled for me. I'm glad I did because it looked like a difficult task.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Scam company. You don’t need to register for ifit to make it work.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This company is scamming people into registering for ifit and paying extra for a treadmill that’s already not worth the price. They mislead you into believing it won’t work without ifit. They should be sued for that alone.Also they give you the wrong screws which make it IMPOSSIBLE to put together yourself. I had some extra in the house so I used them instead. If I’m paying Over $600 for something I expect to have the correct items to put it together.UPDATE::Treadmill is still trash. The belt ALWAYS moves to the left side and rubs against the side rails. I hope this company is happy with the money they stole for a terrible product.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Good for the Price - Handlebars too short - Fully Manual if you do not plan to use gimmicky iFit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: I have owned several Treadmills in my time including: Landice, Lifespan and Life Fitness. I knew what I was buying this time around getting a simple, low cost unit; as I no  longer pound this by running, but merely walk briskly. It is well built for the $1000 price point, but that is where it ends. The iFIT is useless to me and therefore it lacks Basic programs like Hills, Intervals, Weight Loss, etc. use. It is literally manual for speed and incline. It does not even have time set, just time elapsed. I tried to like iFIT but it only has lame slow "walks" and nothing over 45 minutes. So, you constantly have to adjust the treadmill the entire time to go faster/slower and the worst part is taking a break and then set up another walk/run after a typical 20 or 30 minute session. CONSUMERS NEED TO KNOW! - If you plan to not use iFIT... this is 100% Manual with ZERO built-in Programs.The screen is nice, but would be better to have WiFi used for TV or Internet. No Bluetooth? No way to turn the Monitor off? Shutting the main switch is a pain as it takes 10 minutes to boot up and start exercise the next time. It feels super clunky and like hollow plastic, but I forgive this for the price point. The biggest complaint is by far the Arms/Handles. They are not long enough! It forces you to be close to the console and therefore kick the heck out of the motor cover. That cover is very poorly designed and no reason it should extend and rise in the front. Likewise, the arms have almost no padding but an 1/8" of foam and this numbs my palms. I have read many complaints of the same items. No one buying this level of treadmill is a world class athlete and therefore holding the handles/arms should be considered. I am sure it is all a cost savings like dropping the feet or wheels in the very front as was done recently. You have the chance to own the market as Sole is the only competition in this niche. I don't hate the T 6.5si, but it is a shame I don't like it either. Icon Fitness can easily make these changes for improvement and charge another $100. For now, I have adjusted my workout routine and use handlebar foam tape on the arms for some padding. From an engineering standpoint, the product should work around me and not the other way around. I would not buy it again and would have chosen the Sole 63 instead.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: This Treadmill does just what I need it to do.... provide a level walking service for 72 year old me. Considering:1. The delivery guy dropped it on the front patio, considering that the unit IN THE BOX would not fit thru the 36 inch door. We had to "de-cant" it outside and take it inside.2. We are both in our 70s and it is very heavy... thanks to an appliance dolly.. we got it into our living room3. Assembly went okay.. the manual has clear instructions.. but there are a couple of YouTube videos that helped (google search: assembly of Nordictrack  6.5S) One by I Con Fitness Assembly Help (NordicTrack T-series Assembly) ... and .. one by M A Furniture and Fitness Equipment Assembly.  It helped to watch them put one together first.4. We planned on putting it in the office... but the width is 36inches and would not fit thru the 30 inch door without a MAJOR wrestling match.... so we put it in the living room (at least I can watch TV in there)  And because it folds up.. it does not take up as much room as you would think...5. Order the SURGE SUPRESSOR (different from a Surge Protector).. when you order the treadmill... we had to wait 3 days to get one.... we did not want to risk the computer processor with our rural electrical grid.6.Treadmill...check.  Surge SUPRESSOR... check..... Major BUMMER the console would not light up.... Holiday weekend...Online to Activate with Ifit...signed up... did NOT get an activation code... Called AMAZON... they offered a replacement... at no charge.. to be shipped the next business day (10 days to get it by freight...)TURNS OUT... a couple of wires had pulled loose from the main connector... pushed them into the connector and everything works fine.  So.. we cancelled the replacement.This treadmill will work fine for what I need... walking...  the hardest part, for me, is holding it up and triggering the release latch with my short legs while standing on one leg.... the unit practically lowers itself down.  The balance is such that I can easily lift it up again for storage. It is somewhat easy to move.. if you need to.  And it is stable enough I don't have to worry about it falling over on the cats or the dog... even if bumped.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Bought this, then price changed by $196.00. Price adjustment denied. Not right!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this treadmill Sunday evening, Aug 16, it delivered today, Saturday, August 22.  I just had it assembled.  I just looked online to get the name of the app and see it is 196.00 cheaper, same seller,  and Amazon rep said they don't honor lower prices post Purchase. I opened a cc with Amazon to get this treadmill.  I am a widow and had someone assemble it. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: We just put this up today. Took two ppl about 44 mins to complete the assembly. Wasn't too bad. So far so good! Dont worry about it being "locked"...hold down the ifit button for a few seconds and it works. No need to pay 15 a month if you just want basic workouts. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: pass if small kids will have access to the area you keep it in
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a Pro-Form treadmill previously, and I liked it a lot more than I like this one, so far. The iFit "scam" is easy to get around... just hold the iFit button until the screen comes on. But, if you will have this treadmill in a room where small children may roam, you might want to rethink your plan to purchase. I bought this because I appreciate the fold-up feature, but it doesn't fold up as perpendicular to the floor as my old treadmill. It sticks out at an angle and the only thing keeping it up there is a hydraulic lock bar. I would be so nervous if I had toddlers in the house! I can easily imagine the bar "unlocking" spontaneously and descending upon someone's head. It doesn't drop quickly (another hydraulic benefit), but it's not a safe look.If you want to store this in a corner and wheel it out to use it, think, again. You store this in the corner, you use it in the corner, unless you want to exercise before getting on the treadmill. It's very awkward to move because they didn't put wheels in good places and it's a very heavy treadmill. There are only 2 wheels on the bottom and they are not in a spot that makes it easy to move. I'm really surprised that a product made by such an expensive and well-known brand is so poorly designed. I never thought they'd place the wheels in such an unhelpful location.Folded, the treadmill is an eye-sore. That is largely true of all treadmills, but I had a Pro-Form before that was designed better, so the running platform didn't stick out while folded. The console is huge for how average it is. The layout of the screen information feels crowded and poorly designed.I'm happy to have a new treadmill, but this is the kind of treadmill that belongs in a dedicated workout room. If you are into minimalist living and/or you have adventurous toddlers, maybe try a different machine.Also, I put this together completely alone. It took about 3 hours, but only because I kept wandering off to do other things. My downstairs neighbor says she can't tell I bought a treadmill, which might speak more to the construction of our building, but it's a plus. The treadmill is as noisy as most treadmills and it seems the shock absorber feature works decently. The width of the belt is perfect, but I don't feel like the motor provides smooth action. I felt some slight hitching as I walked this morning. Overall, I think this treadmill is overpriced for the quality.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: The screws don't fit in the holes!! Cheaply Made!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2018
CommentsContent: This treadmill could and should have been put together at the factory. Most of what I had to do should have been done there. The screws don't even fit in the holes. They say not to use power tools but there is no way to get the screws in if you don't. Then on the bottom front there is a bolt on each side of the treadmill that you can't get in all the way! Used it twice and it makes a squeaking noise. The belt on the treadmill is thin and flimsy and is already flipping up on the sides!! What a rip off!! For what they charge they should put it together completely and stop using cheap parts. I would never buy from Nordic Track again. I was on the phone waiting for customer service today for over an hour. Finally I had to hang up. Poor quality, poor customer service. Amazon should stop selling their equipment or they should take the blame and send someone out to fix it. I could go on and on about how terrible this treadmill is, but I think you all have the picture. DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: The treadmill works perfect. That said, even though it should take you only a half hour or at most an hour to install it does not. Why? The parts provided by the merchant were the wrong size. I had to go back and forth to the hardware store to get the correct size nuts/bolts/screws before I could build the damn thing. Took me 5 hours of back and forth and a lot of frustration. Do not struggle trying to make a square peg fit in a round hole. Use common sense and take a picture of the problem, go to the hardware store, explain the issue and have staff help you with a workaround. That is what I did. I should not have wasted my time trying to use the factory provided screws/bolts as they were the wrong size. Also tools are key. Some tools demand an extension or they will not fit in the tiny area so make sure you have the right tools to install. Other than the installation (which is easy if you have the right tools and parts) it works great. Lost 7 pounds so far on the treadmill after two and a half weeks. I walk, steep incline for 45 minutes twice a day, at 3 to 3.7 speed and poof weight falls off me like water out of the shower.  I also read my e book as I walk when I use the lower speed of 3.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: So my wife and I purchased this on 5/31/20. I wanted to give it some time after I wrote a review. The IFIT is a great tool, however we noticed that while the machine is adjusting on the inclines per the program, the treadmill itself is making a loud clank per the adjustment. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Machine arrived defective in many ways from the company who made it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I am so bummed right now. I spent a month trying to find a treadmill that wasn't insanely over priced or sold out because of the pandemic. My husband and I have been stuck inside our apartment for 5 months and we needed something to help us move around a bit more than our daily yoga routine. I decided to purchase this for my husband for his 30th birthday after again a month of deliberating on which machine to buy. I am so angry that we are not apart of the 68% of people who enjoyed this machine enough to give it 5 stars. There are a multitude of problems so I'll just start here.1. The machine and the parts that are broken are not due to Amazon's delivery and all parts that arrived damaged were things that happened in manufacturing. There is a bar that runs through the machine component where the motar is, this bar is held together at both ends by 2 large bolts (one on each side of the machine) on the left side the bolt is aligned and correctly placed. On the right size the bolt was not correctly aligned and from the looks of it was jammed by force through the machine. This has caused many problems. Most annoying of which causes the entire machine to be off balance so assembling the machine was a nightmare because nothing else could fit right and needed extreme pressure in some circumstances to screw things together. How do I know that the company sent out a defective product that they knew was defective? Great question! Well the lid that covers the machinery is held together by 5 screws (1 on each side and 3 in the front) all 4 of the other screws are just simply screwed into the lid as they should be. However, on the side that was broken the company put a brace or a stint in the screw that holds it together because without it it wouldn't go in at all. This causes the entire right side of the machine to buckle and now and not stay together. If you lift the machine up in its storage function you can see a giant crack down the base of the machine where it was broken.  And the inside of the machine where the bolt was forcibly jammed had 6 pieces of broken plastic just sitting in a pile I don't even know where they came from.2. Due to problem 1 in order for me to stand on the machine at all I have to use wooden blocks to that it is balanced. It doesn't make me, a pregnant person feel safe? It makes me extremely sad because I feel like I'm in prison and I have no way to move around in my tiny apartment and I had to wait a month for this almost 800$ machine that I had to pay for on unemployment to arrive broken.3. I'm trying to be optimistic, I'm trying to keep the moral alive. I want to use this machine even though it's broken, because even though I ordered front door delivery Amazon wouldn't bring it up the 3 flights of stairs to my apartment and I'm pregnant and I could have miscarried walking this over 2 thousand pound box. I don't want to return it because I spent 7 hours putting it together. So I'm trying to find a way to use it because I need this happiness I need the seritonin from walking. And I can't even use the machine because the belt won't stay on straight it slides to one side after 4 or 5 steps and I'm only using it at speed 2.3. What a joke 🤡 😩 and yes I did look up online how to adjust the belt but it only helps adjust the sliding of the belt for about 20 seconds and it just moves right over again.I'm so sad and depressed over this. I waited for a while to have this. It took so much effort to move up the stairs and put together. My husband had to go to the doctor because he threw his back out trying to get this up the stairs alone. I can't believe you sent this product to us defective from the get go. I really hope you fix this problem Amazon.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Bought this about six months ago and LOVE it! I assembled it myself and it probably took a few hours, but it can be done with one person, although it would be easier with two. Also, the instructions claim that the treadmill is "locked" and must be "registered" and when you go to register it, they'll insist that you sign up for a monthly subscription program with various workouts, etc, for an additional monthly cost. I didn't want this, so I contacted them and learned that if you turn on the treadmill and hold down on the ifit button for 20 seconds, it'll unlock your treadmill and you can use freely. Enjoy!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: T6.5S Good all around tread mill, up to 10 mph, large size. Great for Covid-19 excercise indoors.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent:
Tread mill isn't the top of the line, but works for those who want to run or walk briskly. If you have never used a treadmill before, I would caution you to get used to one before you buy. It feels different running on a treadmill than it does running outside. Some people get dizzy using a treadmill, like my wife did.

Like all treadmills, if you run, the landing of your feet on the treadmill is noisy. We set it up upstairs, but ended up moving it to the basement because of this.

Being able to raise the treadmill base up right is a nice feature as it gets 1/2 of the treadmill out of the way when not in use. It is a long base, so does stick up about 6 feet in the air. The mechanism for lowering is nice as you can just let it go, and it will fall at a slow rate, and then goes very slow at about about 2 feet from the ground.

Mine came damaged. The box didn't look too bad when I got it but the plastic front for the motor/electronic cover was cracked. Took awhile to get the bottom and top cover replacement parts due to Covid-19. I was able to use the treadmill until the new parts arrived. The bottom motor pan is not for the faint of heart to replace. You have to remove 3 connectors that are pressure fit into the cover. You have to remove some wires, and remember where they went when you put the new pan on. 2 screws require you to tip the treadmill over to get at them. The packaging is robust EXCEPT for the front of the base where the plastic cover is. The manufacturer could use some better packaging here.

The box with everything in it is extremely heavy. We ended up unpacking the box outside and moving in the pieces (with Covid-19, delivery would not bring inside. This was a warning given when purchased.) Even still the motor-tread-mill-base is not a one person job to move. Assembly takes awhile. Some of the screws are hard to get at. You need 2 people to put the upright display-stand onto the base.

The display is too bright for me, but a "Dim it" sheet did the trick (see picture)

The manufacturer wants you to use the online registration to enable the "custom" workout features on the treadmill. Your first year is free, but after that you need to pay. I bypassed this by holding down the "IFit" button for 15 seconds (not documented anywhere, but found other reviewers who discovered this). None of the 20 programmed workouts, work when you do this, but I have always been a straight-run-for 30 minutes at a constant pace and constant incline person. The treadmill has nice 1 to 10 mph buttons so you can adjust course speed, then get your 10ths of an mph for fine tuning with the +/- buttons.

The heart rate monitor does not work for me. It always reads way low and takes a long time to get a reading (by holding the handles on the top console). This is typical in my experience with treadmills, getting a good heart rate with the hand holds provided is always hit or miss, even on expensive treadmills. I use my Garmin 605 watch and heart rate strap when I want to monitor my heart rate.

The display features are busy. It is hard to see progress of your run with the bar graph that is trying to look 3D. I ignore it now.

You cannot enter your weight so the calories expended I assume is based on a constant weight. For me 175lbs, the calories seem higher compared to more expensive treadmills I have used in gyms.

The documentation requires you to use a UL 1449 Transient Voltage Surge Suppressor, 450 joules or more, 400 volt or less compliant power strip (15 amp). I could find only one power strip that said on Amazon that it was UL 1449 complaint. I suspect most are, but Amazon does not put a lot of info on their pages about the products they sell. The manual says injury could occur if you don't use the correct Suppressor, but they don't say what could happen if you don't: electrocuted? explosion? fire? They really need to give you a link to some suppressors that they know are compliant. This was another $24.

They also recommend a mat. I got a 60" which isn't long enough. Get a 72". Another $31.

Has an Aux input for your "Ipod" and 2 speakers. I have never used these as I use ear buds when running so as not to disturb the rest of the family.

All in all, for the price I paid, it works great. Not the low end that breaks or suddenly halts when you go too fast, but not the extremely robust gym style treadmills ($2000+)

Some reviewers say they have trouble with the surge suppressor or breaker tripping. I didn't have any trouble like this. Others say the belt slips. After 5 months of use, I have no issues like this.

First Pic: "IFit" button. 2nd: "20 Workouts" button that does nothing unless you register. 3rd: Display with "Dimm It" sheet peeled back to see the difference. 4th: Surge protector I bought on Amazon is a Tripp Lite surge protector, 2160 joules. 5th: Treadmill raised up.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Did not find easy to assemble. The iFit requirement is pure greed.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This unit is very heavy and bringing it into the house required a lot of (dangerous) lifting In our case it went downstairs. (My son helped) The instructions for me at 70 were difficult in so that the screw sizes are used in multiple places and exact placement is necessary to avoid disassembly which happened three times. The multiple warnings that I had to register at iFit as the unit was locked until I did were crazy as I did not choose to buy iFit.  It is about 15/month after "free" MONTH. The unit looks and feels sturdy now that four hours were spent on assembly some my fault as I disassembled/assembled a few times to get it right. I am hoping that it will last a number of years. I will update if it does not if the treadmill does not outlasts me.

CommentsTitle: Delivery and quality issues, then fine after repair.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this on a Prime Day deal and loved the price.Delivery promised 9am to noon, and will call 30 minutes before arriving.No message or sightings by 1pm and I went on an errand, upon return several hours later found it on my front porch.  Never got a message.  So I had to recruit some help to get this down the basement (the package is well over 200#).Unpacking and assembly is straightforward.  If you have basic mechanical skills, you're good to go.Tried to start it up, completely dead.  Customer phone line not open on Sunday.  Customer internet chat looks like a bot and unable to provide any help.  Next day, "we're experiencing a much higher than normal call volume, please hold".  Eventually told to remove the motor cover panel.There it is...the multi pin connector to the motor control board was never plugged in.  Unlikely that it came loose in shipping because it has a latch to hold it together once it's attached.  We're good to go.As for the treadmill, it does everything I want for walking 4mph on 1 degree incline, and it's much quieter and softer than the 20 yr old one this replaced.  For 479 bucks I'd say it's a really good value in treadmills.  I'm not using the iFit workout stuff at all, but you activate one time initially with the blue button and it starts up right away every time without doing anything more than putting on the key like any other treadmill.

He had it up and running in less than an hour.  You have to put together the console & handles. It weighs too much to lift.Now that it's up I use it everyday. I'm going for sitting in the morning to walking while listening to stuff or reading.  It will be awile before I run on it.  I love the incline.  It's enough to add interest and difficulty.At $700 price point...I'm happy.

CommentsTitle: Started off good-less than a year in and it's a hunk of junk
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2020
CommentsContent: This item started off good-met my basic needs for a treadmill. I'm a pretty lightweight guy, so I didn't need anything particularly sturdy.However, a little less than a year later, this treadmill stopped working properly. The belt did not stay in place correctly and began to tear as it rubbed against the side of the machine. The machine is on a level surface in the basement and has a mat underneath it. It is regularly taken care of and kept in a child-free, pet-free home. It isn't used daily and is used by a 130 lb male. There is no reason for it to have deteriorated this quickly. Nordictrack is unwilling to fix the issue-unless I pay $160+parts...which makes little sense for a $500 machine.Don't waste your money on this cheap item-pay a couple hundred more for an item that will last longer and ultimately save you money on maintenance.
