CommentsTitle: Cannot recommend product or Nordictrack brand
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Treadmill would probably be OK if it would work as expected.This treadmill was delivered on December 30 and assembled on January 3. The incline would not work.You can only walk at level zero.FIRST-AMAZON Customer service has been amazing. When I could not reach Nordic track through their customer service number I used option on Amazon website to help with troubleshooting issues. Amazon was able to cut through all the red tape and wait time on a phone tree with Nordic track. The Amazon rep did the waiting and called me back once a live person was on the phone. What a difference! When I had tried to call Nordic track, all I got was a phone tree and recording that said if I was having mechanical issues I had to have the motor assembly cover already removed before they would even help (I’m not doing that).NORDICTRACK - most all exercise machines now come with a option to join iFit, which is a subscription service for personal work outs. I don’t know if this is just Nordic track, but you cannot even start your machine until you sign up for iFit. once your iFit account is activated it will send a signal to the machine and it will unlock. For me, it was about 30 minutes before I could turn on the treadmill. Basically you’re being blackmailed to sign up whether you want iFit or not.  On the iFit website there is no option that says I do not wish to join; I just kept pushing through the screens. Once you get to the screen that’s asking for how many months you want to join and payment information just don’t select anything (again there is no option for “No thanks”).  No incline.  Once I was able to speak with a representative at Nordic track the representative did some troubleshooting over the phone and ordered two parts that should repair the machine under warranty and that the repair rep would contact me within a week on delivery. Nordic track said that they would be tracking those shipments and a repair technician will be in contact me once they were delivered. I gave them five days and had to reach out to Nordic track again. It would be another week before the repair person could get here. The repair technician was at my home on February 4, and installed the parts that have been ordered. The technician told  me there were some bad wiring on the motor and replaced it. However that did not fix the incline. The console also has electrical issues and does not send the signal to the motor to engage the incline. Additional parts were ordered, and nordic track now tells me that the console is on back order for another 2 to 3 weeks!  I’m really wondering how long this machine is going to last because it seems like the whole thing has a lot of electrical issues. I have asked Nordic track to simply replace the machine but I’m now outside of the 30 day return window.  I’m trying to be optimistic that once all repairs are made I will basically have a whole new machine but I won’t buy nordicctrack again and cannot recommend.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: On the fence! Buy it now! So amazing I bought two.

CommentsContent: I run usually 4-5x/week, and I usually run 3-5 miles per run. However, in the past I have gone up to 9 miles on this treadmill. I am a male, 190lbs and about 6'0 -- so not huge, but not small, either.  This treadmill is amazing. It's solidly built, runs well, and is dependable. To be honest, I bought one, used it for a year, sold it when I moved to a different house, and thought I would try a cheaper treadmill. Within two weeks, I sold the new one and bought myself ANOTHER one of these T Series - they're THAT good! Absolutely worth the few extra bucks over the cheaper $200-$200 models.  Overall, I can't rate this high enough, and I recommend it to anyone who just wants a good treadmill that's going to just work!

PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm hoping both Amazon and Nordictrack takes the time to read this review. I needed a treadmill for home and ordered the Nordictrack T 6.5 S. I thought it was a good deal and it's a Nordictrack -- a well known and reputative brand name. That was my first mistake. After waiting 10 days for delivery, the box arrived damaged. The shipper assured me it's just the cardboard and shouldn't be any issues. Why Nordictrack would package a 200+ pound treadmill in a flimsy cardboard box was beyond anything I've seen before. Upon opening the box (and I took photos of everything), most of the styrofoam was broken. Not a good sign. I found one small plastic piece broken and snapped off...from something. I started to assemble the treadmill and literally found most of the hardware impossible to screw into the parts -- metal going into metal. Some bad screw hole locations, which made it extremely difficult to even start the bolt by hand. On Step 3 of the instructions (Step 1 was registering the product online and Step 2 was fishing a cable through one of the uprights with a very long twist tie cord), the ground screw wouldn't go in, no matter how much effort and pressure I put into it. The screw wouldn't fit. I had to go into my private hardware stash and find a more appropriate screw, which somewhat worked. Upon installing the left and right uprights (which took way too long than it should've due to the hardware and hole locations), the manufacturer had 4 screws in the handles, in holes that were supposed to be removed and discarded. One screw snapped upon trying to remove. Another screw wouldn't come out at all cause there wasn't enough clearance for the head (I have no idea how they put that screw in the first place -- most likely crooked and at an angle). I managed to removed 2 of the 4 screws. When I was examining the suggested hardware to attach the control console to the uprights, the provided screws wouldn't go into the holes whatsoever. Remind you, all of this is intended to be installed by hand and not with power tools. Nonetheless, I tried a power tool to see if these screws would go into the metal ports, and they wouldn't go in. The holes were machined way too small for the screws. The console itself had screws put in from the manufacturer that needed to be discarded and replaced with provided hardware. At this point, I gave up. The treadmill is seriously flawed and required custom drilling and/or different hardware than what was provided. I didn't even get half way through the instructions, much of the hardware was still sealed, but I was done with this mess and initiated a return online with a few grueling phone calls with Amazon representatives, who didn't speak clear English and was completely unhelpful.I consider myself very good with assembling these type of things, electronics, furniture, systems, etc., but I couldn't believe how poorly engineered and manufactured this treadmill was. Parts alone didn't fit well together. I was also completely shocked it bared the Nordictrack name on it, as I believed them to provide high quality products. Sadly, this treadmill was far from that, if not the worst piece of equipment I've ever had to assemble in my entire life.The repackaging for the return was another disaster, but after strain and sprains, I was able to successfully disassemble what I managed to assemble initially, repackage, lift a 200+ pound box and carefully shrink wrap it. It's ready to be picked up and looks far better now than when it was delivered. I have a 5 day wait for them to get it. Meanwhile, this huge awkward box sits in my livingroom near the front door.Nordictrack failed hugely on this mess of a treadmill. It's quality control and engineering is a disaster. I still need a treadmill and now will have to wait for this return and refund to offset my funds before buying a different brand.Extremely disappointed all around with this experience!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a super old treadmill that was given to me and it finally wore out. I am a "wogger" so didn't need anything super fancy.  The controls are easy to use, the running surface has plenty of room front to back and side to side. It's easy to fold up and easy to lower. There's hydraulics so you aren't having to lower and worry about dropping the platform as it comes down. I love the lip on the face to set my phone or ipad on to keep me entertained. My only small complaint, but it's minor is that the side rails are pretty fat and not great for small hands, can't get a good grip on them but just took some getting used to. Also noteworthy, when you hit the stop button, it stops pretty quick so either hop off and hit stop or have it at a slow speed and hit stop. Very happy I purchased this treadmill!

PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2020
CommentsContent: We researched over 50 treadmills suited for an at-home beginner.  We paid for the assembly technician.  The product arrived on schedule from Nordic Trac.  and the Amazon.com assembly arrived on time with tools in hand and seemed very competent.  The problem was, we live in an apartment and the item was delivered to the front door.  He was able to bring the treadmill in the house and fortunately, there was a construction crew next door who helped him bring in into the office where we wanted it.  The problem occurred soon after when he discovered Nordic Trac sent two left-arm rails, rather than a left and a right.  He had to leave.  I had to register the treadmill with Nordic Trac, chat with their customer service and get a replacement right arm rail and then reschedule the assembly.  While everyone did their job in getting everything fixed, it's a shame so many people had to spend so much time fixing something one person in the warehouse caused by not paying attention to what is called the "pick list" when putting parts in a box.UPDATE: Nordic Trac sent a replacement part for the missing right arm.  It was not the right part.  I had to contact them and start the replacement part all over again.  The second "right arm" arrived and is was also the wrong one.  I examined the part and saw that it would fit into the panel display even though it was longer than the left arm and did not come with the silicon arm sleeve as the left ones did.The assembly tech came out as scheduled and I just hope he could make it work.  He did.  He removed the silicon sweat cover from the extra left arm that was originally in the box, put it on the right arm which was too long.  My machine is FINALLY up and running thanks to the cleverness of the assembly tech.  No thanks to Nordic trac.  No fault of Amazon.com.  My right handrail is installed, has the silicon sleeve on it and it just 4 or 5 inches longer than the left hand rail and the right hand rail is not completely covered by the silicon sleeve.  I could have started round three with Nordic trac, but I ran out of steam and threw my hands up.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Overall seems like a great treadmill for the price. Has everything I need and none of the junk I don't. Love the "speed dial" buttons to quickly set a preset speed and get going immediately without having to tap an inordinate number of touchscreen controls. Assembly requires two people.Why it's not 5 stars:1. The silver screw was damaged on delivery. Based on reviews/comments it seems others have also had this issue. Contacted NordicTrack and waiting for a response. Meanwhile, using screw that was originally screwed in.2. iFit activation could not be bypassed on this model (maybe it's been updated) but there's a free trial with no commitment and manual mode can continue to be used afterwards. Still, would have been ideal to be able to use the treadmill with no activation.3. There is no perfect place to put my phone on this treadmill. The cupholders are large but not in a way where I can place my phone flat, which seems to exacerbate the rattling of my phone during a run.4. A top speed higher than 10 mph would have been nice.5. There doesn't seem to be a way to set weight, resulting in an inaccurate calories burned count.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2021
CommentsContent: I like to run outside but when the weather is bad or I'm on-call for work its nice to get my workout at home so I can quickly grab my things and go. I wanted to stick with a reputable brand so I checked out Nordick Track. Based on my running I thought the T6.5 would work perfectly.Price was OK, assembly was fine, folds easily enough. I bought the 1 year service plan. Not long into having it, all the issues started. Not being a treadmill technician i wasn't sure what was going on but the display was not controlling the speed/incline. I worked with a Nordick Track and they determined it was a computer board issue. They refused to send a technician but did send a new computer board. After installing, the treadmill didnt work right. A few more back and forth phone calls and the Nordic Track tech now says its the motor, so they sent a new motor (again- wouldn't send a technician). After installing the new motor it still didn't work right.I didnt have time to be on the phone all day to figure out the issues so the treadmill sat collecting dust. Then the "your warranty is expiring" calls started. I explained my situation and nothing ever came of it. Eventually the emails and phone calls stopped.Not the best experience- try another Brand.

CommentsTitle: It is what it is for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: They treadmill is locked and can not be used until you sign up for their silly app, the app is laggy and worthless. The installation instruction are ok but fail to mention to put on the covers on the posts before installing them, you won't know this until the end when it would require dismantling the whole thing to put the covers on.  Once you get it working its ok up to 7mph, past that if you step wrong it feels too wobbly for me (210 lb) . The cover upfront is too close to your feet when you are running as well, so if you like being close to the handles when you run your are going to step on the cover and that's also unsafe imo.  Over all its ok for the price, and perfect if you will be doing light running at lower speeds, and it's just barely acceptable if you are doing any sort of medium intensity running. Anything serious I would look somewhere else.

CommentsTitle: Horrible experience from start to finish
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2020
CommentsContent: We purchased treadmill, not understanding that a 2.6 hp won't handle repeated heavy running sessions. It will only handle light walking and maybe jogging or not depending on how much you weigh. That was not clearly presented in the ad (this was first issue). The two guys that delivered it were very big men and could barely get it upstairs, it was that heavy. We finally got an "assembly" person to come out today (DO NOT GO WITH AMAZON HOME SERVICES)!!! You need to have two people do the assembly. The guy that was sent out was rude and nasty, snapping at us, could barely stand and his hands shook violently. He got out a razorblade (we don't know why, as he had finished cutting the ties with scissors), and then he cut his finger. There was blood and I went to get a bandaid, and after he lost a screw and could barely screw in the post, I asked him politely to leave. He became argumentative and demanded to know why. I finally had to threaten to call the police. It was a horrible experience and we are returning the item after making numerous attempts to resolve the situation and get two people out here to assembly, which home services does not understand is needed or the item (to safely hold and support while the other person threads and connects).  I hope this helps others.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This thing was a nightmare to assemble! There simply must be a better way to package this thing! You most definitely need two people (maybe even three) and you have to spend a good bit of time deciphering the instructions. (I still don’t know what all the numbers are for associated with the parts.) Go ahead and pay extra for assembly if you can! However, once assembled, it is a decent treadmill and gets the job done. Our unit has an inaccurate heart rate sensor, but it is not important for us to have this feature in the treadmill itself. Everything else seems to work fine.Our only “complaint” is that the “up” position for this treadmill leaves it leaning quite a bit on a short hydraulic bar. This is very different from other treadmills we have had that raised up completely and then locked in place. It seems to be steady, but the look of it leaning makes us a little uneasy and worried it might fall. However, there haven’t been any functional problems with it and it does let down nice and smoothly.About the iFit lock: Other reviews are correct. You can hold down the iFit button for thirty seconds to bypass the lock with no problem at all. Your treadmill will then start right up. There is no need to sign up for iFit if you don’t want that service.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I've been using treadmills for the past 20 year, this is my 3rd one in that time. I was hesitant to purchase this because it was a tad under 700 dollars and I'm used to paying at least a grand. I figured it would be flimsy but I was way wrong. This treadmill so far (after 2 months) is rock solid. The wife and I have been using it in total for 2 hours a day 6 days a week.Assembly:I have to be honest, the assembly was a little bit tough but if you get stuck just walk away for a few minutes and come back with a clear head. Some of the bolts and screws were really hard to start off but just take your time, also use some WD40. I love that this treadmill uses real bolts for the main connection points (arms attaching to base), my last treadmill used bolts that you needed an allen key to tighten and of course we all know those strip after a while.First Use:Of course we all know from previous reviews to bypass iFit hold down the iFit button for 20 seconds WITH THE SAFETY KEY PLUGGED IN. During the first use I noticed it was really noisy, not clanking but when you walked on the belt it was making a swishing noise. I called NordicTrack and after some troubleshooting I found my belt was too tight, you should be able to lift the belt at the center 3 inches or so. I loosened the belt and the noise definitely got better. The NordicTrack person heard the swishing and send me some lube which fixed the problem.I was hesitant because it only has a 2.6HP motor but it really is solid. I notice no whining when increasing speed, it takes right off.Overall I love this treadmill and learned that you don't have to pay over a grand to get a quality treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2020
CommentsContent: So far, so good. My husband and I set this up in a little less than an hour. There are a lot of reviews that reference being duped into paying for ifit, but I think they must be doing something wrong. This treadmill came with a card that has a code for a year of free ifit membership. I followed the very clearly laid out instructions and had no problem. I am using the membership now and was not charged. I will be charged for another year once this year is up if I don't cancel in time. Cancellation instructions also seem really clear. You just have to read.Other than that, I really like that you can quickly select a change in speed on the right side of the panel.  I was not expecting that to make any difference for me, but I'm realizing it's way better than sitting there and holding down a button when going between sprinting and walking.  The treadmill is relatively quiet and the display is great.  It's a little slow to load when initially turned on and when going between programs, but I have not had any lagging problems in the middle of workouts.  So far, no complaints.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Installation was painful!  Had to go through hoops to unlock yet it didn't function properly
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020
CommentsContent: This is NordicTrack product but it's locked by iFit?  It's not only very challenging to activate, it's very not user friendly - Grandma or Grandpa for sure cannot operate.  Below are issues I had with this product:1) Delivery: Amazon took forever to deliver the product - it was delivered 1+ weeks later.2) The plastic cover with NordicTrack Logo was cracked!3) Installation: #10 metal screw that holds the handle bar does not fit - supposed to be #8 metal screw instead.  I had to buy #8 screw from Home Depot to get the job done.  AND 1.25 inch length is not okay, 1.5 inch is correct spec.4) Activation: Unless you login and activate through iFit, it will not start.  Not sure why NordicTrack did this...this is very bad user experience - certainly a BIG pain in the butt.  AND it's not straight forward either....5) Usage: after activation treadmill started but when you "STOP" you can't "START" unless it's turn-off - very annoying.  I suspect it has something to do with iFIT activation/synchronization.6) In summary:  Not sure why I can't plug-in and enjoy my treadmill after long tedious installation without going through iFit/activation.  For sure it wasn't my best Amazon delivery experience.7) I will not recommend this product due to many installation and activation related issues.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2021
CommentsContent: I love my NordicTrack treadmill. It’s perfect for what I need and I love the iFit subscription too. Since not going to the gym, investing in my own home equipment was the best thing I could’ve done for myself. So far this treadmill has worked really well with no problems and I did purchase the extended warranty through NordicTrack if any unforeseen issues come up in the future.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I tried the free 30 day trial for iFit out of curiosity and have fully bought into the program. There's more than just running or walking in the app....also strength training, HIIT and yoga/pilates. The treadmill was easy to assemble by the instructions. I only needed help holding it up for me to put the storage bar in, as expected in the instructions and the other reviews.  Very smooth motors for incline and speed progression, great machine. Delivery was via a box truck and he helped push it into the house even though he couldn't enter due to COVID. When I called to confirm delivery dates they even gave me the option to move my delivery date up which I jumped on. Great money saver in this unit if you already have a tablet to run ifit on if you're going to use that feature.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I hate exercise with a white hot passion, but I’m ok with walking. I got this treadmill because I wasn’t getting in enough steps since covid hit as I’ve been teleworking. I did my research and this one fit my budget, and independent reviews were good.The instructions said it would take two people about two hours to set it up. This is accurate.Initial operation was easy, I just logged into the website, entered the particulars and off I went.My iPad easily connected via Bluetooth, so I’ve been using the iFit program. I’m not a fan of listening to a trainer yelling at me so I go along on the walks and listen to music or podcasts. The progressively more difficult programs work very well.I have a small house, and while the treadmill isn’t small, it fit into a small room. Folding it up us easy although rarely necessary.The varying incline adds a nice dimension to my workouts, if the walk is flat, sometimes I’ll increase the incline to make the workout more effective. Similarly, if the walk is too slow I can increase the speed.This is very good for people who are out of shape who want to do something about it. I’ve only missed a couple days since I received it in early January, and unlike most workouts, I’m sticking with it.A friend ordered one on my recommendation so I have a sort of virtual “work out buddy”, and we recommend workouts to each other.  It’s surfy, relatively quiet, and I haven’t had any problems with it thus far.My only issue isn’t the treadmill, but the delivery. I paid a bit extra for delivery “to a room”.  It was left on a pallet in my garage, which isn’t “a room”.  It weighs 200 pounds, so it isn’t like you can just haul it into the house. Make sure you have someone who can help you get it where you want it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020
CommentsContent: This treadmill is an absolute steal under 1K. The quality is far superior than what i was expecting. The only word of warning is when I received it a month ago I put it together by myself. I would not recommend that. Make sure you have someone helping you assemble the treadmill. There are some steps where an extra person really helps out. Anyways now that it is assembled I use it to walk run use the Ifit interactive workouts are awesome too. The membership is optional but really makes you feel like you have a trainer working with you. Since I have started noticing myself get in shape I really could not be doing it without such a quality treadmill. At the price they have it at now it is an absolute steal. Period
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Dislikes: Too many little screws during assembly! Auto makers learned the lesson of build it in, don't tack it on years ago. The instructions tell you to run the wire for the screen through the bottom- wrong! The hole the wire is secured to with a screw about 2 inches from the bottom of the inside upright during shipping is the hole for the wiring. During operation the undercarriage squeaks alot, like an old car needing a lube job. There were two plastic covers for the bottom of the uprights that had holes predrilled for screws, but didn't come with any. They just rest on top of the inside uprights loosely.Likes: the motor is fairly quiet. I'm glad I got the bigger belt size, both length and width. It helps keep you centered should you misstep. The software did require a credit card to use, supposedly if you cancel before renewal you get a credit. I wasn't able to find a training video that went more than about 55 minutes max, playing the same route over and over until you reach your time limit is not optimal and would require you to restart which means stopping in the middle of your workout. Being able to que a couple videos to start when one ends would be better. Why not provide an HDMI output so people can connect to their tv's??? That dinky little screen is for the birds. I only used the machine for about 3 weeks till the good weather broke(and the Covid outbreak had leveled off) but will use it on rainy days and when the cold weather comes again so I can't speak to longevity or durability but I did purchase the 3 year extended warranty just in case. Overall initial quality feels good.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Just STAY AWAY from NordicTrack and all ICON products
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Unbelievable.  It worked great for 2 weeks and dies.  Triggered circuit breaker and now won't turn on.  Called local equipment repair person and he laughed when I said it was NordicTrack.  "They keep me in business," he said.I might consider updating this review but for now, stay away.  It's fantastic while it works...too bad it last 13 days...
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: We bought this recently and spent a lot of time looking for the right one. My wife and I are used to the quality treadmills at the gym, but COVID is a mean mean thing. Since gyms are off limits we bought this with hesitation as we’re not sure it could hold up to running or that it would t few sturdy. After a solid week of use, I can tell you I do not regret the purchase one bit. It is solid. It is sturdy. It has everything we need and feels almost as good as the gym. We now have 4 of us using it daily and it holds up well. I had no intention of using ifit as that seems like garbage to me. Just hold the ifit button for 15 seconds and you never have to register nor think of it again. Highly recommend
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: I will never buy any NordicTrack products again...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I was super excited but had the worst experience ever. It was delivered broken parts and missing nuts (just the bolts were present on one side), which shows their low QC. I called them which promptly shipped those but asked me not to use this expensive piece of equipment, so there went another week. When I finally received the parts, I noticed the nuts were old. Still tried to make it work but turns out, to put these missing nuts in place I need access to the bolts, to access the bolts I need to pop the top open which voids warranty....So spoke with Amazon and tried to return it but even that is huge hassle. It's just unbearable with such a big equipment like that.So now back to trying to get NordicTrack to fix this thing. Most expensive headache I ever had...
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2020
CommentsContent: As many people have been doing, my wife and decided to cancel our gym memberships and invest in our own workout equipment. This NordicTrack has proven to be worth the investment. We both feel much more motivated to go for a walk or run knowing we can go downstairs and hop on the treadmill. It is easy to use and many different pre-set workouts. It was easy to put together (definitely requires two people) and easy to fold up if required. If you're looking to cancel your gym memberships and workout at home, this is a great product for you!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Nordic Track software Update fried motor control board - BUYER BEWARE
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Had the product 2 weeks, and it died........ screen reflects everything fine but the treadmill doesn't move.  After talking with the Nordic track Help desk (took 2+hours to get to a live person/ chat was just as bad), they quickly identified that the motor control board fried due to an update they sent out.  It doesn't happen on all treadmills but IT'S A KNOWN ISSUE THATS BEEN AROUND FOR MONTHS (they were debating on issuing a recall).  It sounds like my "NEW" treadmill tried to apply the update and it fried the control board.  2-3 weeks for a replacement part to be sent out (backordered)!UPDATE:After 2+ weeks, the replacement Motor Control Board arrived and it was DOA.  The Vendor is clueless and there warranty is Useless.  Additionally, the 3 year extended warranty was useless because "the fine print" indicates that they don't cover any defects that the manufacturer should cover.....Nordic Track customer service (phone or chat) is UNDER STAFFED; to give you an idea of how under staffed they are; their online CHAT service has a 11 hour and 23 minute wait.  I could understand the issue if this was Month 1 of Covid; however, this is an online service and this is NOT month 1 of Covid.  Nordic Track just doesn't care about the customer AFTER the purchase (BUYER BEWARE).BUYER BEWARE - NORDICTRACK IS SELLING PRODUCTS WITH KNOWN DEFECTS.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Assembly was annoying but not terrible.  The engineering design and manufacturing of the treadmill is poor at best.After assembly we attempted to log onto the ifit website to register and unlock the treadmill.  The web page keeps reverting back to Canada while we live in the US so we were unable to register.  Was not using a VPN.  If this happens to you, hold down the ifit sync button for about 15 seconds and the machine will enable.  Once the machine was on we started the motor and...nothing.  I could hear the motor running but the belt was not moving.  Pulled the front cover off (your toes point to it while running) by removing 6 small screws to access the motor and discovered that the belt was not tensioned properly as seen in the pic.  ALSO, and more importantly, the motor sits at about a 5-10 degree angle to the tread belt arbor (pic 2).  This will cause the belt to prematurely wear and potentially create thrust against the bearings causing them to fail.  The bracket that holds the motor to the frame is welded so there is no way to rotate the motor around the Z axis on the X plane.This machine seems to be designed with planned engineered obsolescence to ensure that it fails at a expedited rate.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Review after Owning for Two Months
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I decided to wait a few months to write a review. I've had this treadmill for about 2 months now and I feel I can give an adequate review (for quick review--go to bottom):The treadmill itself is nice. However, it has a weird feeling under-foot that I have never experienced on commercial treadmills before. Almost as if you can feel the belt rubbing against the surface of the machine as you put pressure from your feet down. Annoying? Yes. Does it affect the workout? Not really. Just a minor agitation in sound and in the feeling for the first few rounds. Going under 2.8 speed makes it almost unbearable though. Running on it is nice. It has a nice bounce so I don't feel like my knees are dying quite as badly.The biggest frustration is the ifit program. I find ifit to be the most annoying app to work with. I like treadmills to have the pre-programmed training exercises so that I can do a good incline workout without having to figure out the incline myself. iFit only offers fitness trainers directing your workout which also triggers the speed. I am okay with a random unknown incline. I am not okay with watching tv and all of the sudden my treadmill is pushing 5mph when I was hoping for a brisk walk.Overall...the treadmill isn't bad, but the program in it is. So, unless you want to be bound to either always manually adjusting speed and inclines or having a trainer have full control of what you're doing...I'd go with something different. I do warn that I've noticed a LOT of treadmills have the ifit program so I'd check that first.Simplified version:Pros:-Treadmill is sturdy-Touch screen is well lit and has good response-Incline and Speed very easy to useCons:-belt feels like its dragging - especially under 2.8 speeds-iFit is awful-the manual option is very limited-No pre-programmed workouts that don't involve an annoying trainerOverall: I think the price is way too much for how strict it is with the iFit program and Google Maps is pretty lacking. A regular treadmill could get the job done a lot better and would probably cost around $1000.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this treadmill for home use. I'm not a super avid runner, and I only usually go as fast as 6.0, but this treadmill does go up to 10 for both incline and speed. I was worried at first that the belt was a little narrow, but after running several times on it I have had no problems. The buttons are responsive and the belt speed is accurate. The heart monitor, as they usually are, does not appear to be super accurate, but I don't rely on the built in one on the treadmill anyway. It does also come with built in workouts, which I haven't yet explored as I mostly use this for running and rucking. When you purchase this, it does try to make you feel like you have to sign up for the iFit trial - you do not have to do that! If you simply hold the down the iFit button on the console, it will let you bypass that. Finally, this treadmill is a beast to put together. The housings for the bolts are not great, and often you have to torque the bolts pretty hard to get them in. It took my husband and I about three hours to fully assemble. I would recommend having a marriage counsellor on call if you want to make it through the assembly phase still happily married. Seriously, it was incredibly difficult, and the treadmill is remarkably heavy to boot. However, I still rate this little beauty five stars, because the performance of the machine has been stellar.  I would highly recommend.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I've upped my stars from 3 to 4 now that I've used it a few times. It works well with just a few caveats. I had to adjust the belt again on my first usage which I did and it now seems to track pretty good (note that the adjustment turn is the opposite of what is described in the manual). The only other issue is the built in heart beat monitor. Its sketchy at best but I'm comparing it to the $6000 cardiac unit I had been using. I will investigate the chest monitor from Nordic Track to see if it might be more accurate. Lastly, the incline does not retract when its stopped so if you don't want to damage the unit when its lifted out of the way, one needs to remember to set the incline to 0!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Skip ifit, hold ifit sync button down for 30 secs.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2020
CommentsContent: As mentioned in a review earlier  you do not need to sign up for Ifit. Just hold down the ifit sync button for 30 seconds and it works fine!It was easy to put together with 2 people, I should have read the instructions instead of my husband because we made it all the way to the end and realized we never put the protective covers on the front legs... whatever not the end of the world.Works great! I purchased a mat to go under the treadmill however if you are planning to use it at full incline the mat scrunch up under it. So we may take it out from under the treadmill.All in all I'm extremely happy with my purchase!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Got it today and I am in love! Exactly what I was looking for! It’s sturdy, the incline is great and the speed. It’s pretty quite and comfortable walking on it. It does cushion nicely on walking and running. This treadmill is close to what you will find in a gym. Believe it or not but my 12 year old son put it all together!!! Took about 3 hrs so plan for some time. Thanks to another reviewer on here, you CAN use the treadmill without subscribing to iFit. The package and the stickers said the treadmill is locked and you need to register and subscribe but that’s not true! I turned it on and held the iFit button down for over 10 sec. And it worked. Now all I do is turn the switch on and start my work out. I would say the only negative item so far is that the on/off button is so far down, but that’s really all I can complain about it! Delivery was fast and it came in one piece and not damaged. Since it is quite heavy, if you don’t have muscle and a heavy duty cart you might want to opt for indoor delivery.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership
