I was having a crazy day and didn't think of it, but he should have offered to do that.The machine is not working and will have to send it back .....AGAIN.What a horrible and stressful experience I mean c'mon 2 machines in a row, I'd say the manufacturer better look into quality control a little more closer.Wow I am still in disbelief what a worthless piece of junk this treadmill is.Now I'm going to have to take time off work to meet someone between a certain window of time to have them come and pick this already assembled machine up  and get it the heck out of my house lovely just what I wanted to do.

I couldn’t get this process to complete even after being on the phone with iFit for over 2 hours. I wish I had waited and got a better treadmill from Costco for the same price that DID have iFit actually on it as well as a free full year of iFit membership, which became available after I already had this one. CommentsTitle: Love the treadmill. Poor first delivery experience.

CommentsContent: I love this treadmill- Nordictrack 6.5S. I jog about 3 times per week and walk very fast the other days about 6 miles per day. After my first attempt in getting this treadmill with VERY poor delivery people (I paid extra to have it delivered to my exercise room and the delivery people were in no way prepared to even get it out of the truck) and a broken treadmill, our second attempt produced great, strong delivery people with an intact treadmill! Yay! My husband and I put it together in about an hour. It went together pretty smoothly and then I adjusted the track to center before getting on it. It works great! CommentsTitle: Gets the job done; set aside hours to assemble

However the one step that's missing something that could result in a bigger issue is around the hydraulic stand. There's a small metal piece holding the hydraulic pole down in place and if you remove it at the wrong time you can't install the pole, which is what happened to me. The treadmill still runs fine but i'm not able to fold it which really sucks because it takes up half of my workout room. Also just to echo what most other reviews say you don't have to sign up for iFit to use it, that's just an illegal marketing tactic that Amazon should honestly make the company remove.

CommentsTitle: DONT BUY THIS! YOU CANNOT JUST WORK OUT-- YOU HAVE TO WAIT AND WAIT AND WAIT ON IFIT FIRST
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2020
CommentsContent: It is IMPOSSIBLE to plug this treadmill in an just start working out. You MUST wait for the iFit stuff to load before you can choose manual workout. That sometimes takes multiple touches of the 'convenient' touch screen. THEN you have to cancel the warm up. It is only after ALL THIS HASSLE that you can select a speed and incline. I WOULD THINK VERY CAREFULLY before purchasing this treadmill because of this. It's very inconvenient.This treadmill is a really great piece of equipment- heavy duty and works great. However, think long and hard about where you will place it in your home. I expected Amazon to provide inside delivery and assembly, but because of COVID-19, they did not provide that service. AND Amazon didnt tell me this-- it was the delivery driver. To say I was disappointed and a bit irritated, is an understatement.I planned to install this upstairs in my home and the deck (or base if you will) to this treadmill is extremely heavy (as you might expect). It took two of us to haul it up the stairs and that was just the beginning. The design is good, but assembly is not easy for one person. Some of the crevices that you have to get a socket wrench into are pretty small and the control panel is very tricky for one person to install. In retrospect, you really need a two person team to put this together. Unfortunately, I was on my own.The iFit guided workouts are pretty much overly talkative people on videos-- really not worth the money or time. You'll need a 20 amp dedicated circuit with this beast or you will trip the breaker.

CommentsTitle: Economical Treadmill for a Well-known Brand
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I can't quite give this treadmill a 5 Star Rating simply because it represents a basic design element that seems to be typical of most, if not all NordicTrack treadmills.  The front edge of the tread is far too close to the edge of the frame platform structure, such that it is virtually impossible to hold the bar to check the heart-rate without kicking or stepping onto the frame platform forward of the actual moving tread while walking in a normal upright manner.  Other brands have designed the tread to travel at least 6 additional inches forward of the bar so that it does not require one to lean forward in an unnatural position to reach the bar.  It has taken a while to adjust to this awkward stance, so I check my heart-rate less frequently.  Otherwise, this model has a smooth tread-run and supports a comfortable impact.  Since I purchased this model as heavily discounted on Cyber Monday 2018, I feel it is still not a bad buy.

CommentsTitle: Sturdy and works well, some things to take into consideration.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I love how easy it is to use the simple features such as the speed and incline. I'm a little confused how to use all the buttons on the center of the console, but I'm content with navigating the simpler features of the machine. This takes two people to set it up. Do not do this on your own unless you are a very strong person, it is an incredibly heavy unit and needs to be kept in a certain orientation when you move it to wherever you want it. It also requires careful reading of instructions, a few of your own tools, and about 5 hours to assemble, but it's not impossible to figure out and I have assembled much more frustrating things in my life, and it definitely was nowhere near that. Getting the iFit to sync with the treadmill WAS frustrating. It was not straight forward and took several attempts. After 5 hours of assembly I was so excited to turn this thing on aaaand I couldn't for another 3 hours trying to get the dang iFit to sync. I almost gave up at about 11pm, my partner was miffed, I was disappointed, and if you don't get iFit for at least a try (which is a separate purchase and not cheap), your machine is locked and will not turn on, which was not clear when I made my purchase but luckily I decided I wanted to try it when I purchased it... other people may have found this a particularly unpleasant surprise. I mostly blame the seller for not making this detail clear about this unit. Just please, please for your own sanity and time, do your homework before you get it on your front door step. You'll have plenty of time, it took almost 2 months to get here. That was the other frustration, when I checked out, I was asked to schedule a time for it to get here. I said some day in June. When I went back to my orders, it said it was delayed a whole extra month. You do have the option with Amazon to cancel an order before it is delivered if you don't want to wait that long, but there really is nothing they can do to speed things up due to Covid delays. However, I don't understand why you have to schedule a drop off when they are going to just leave it outside your door like they do with all of my other deliveries that I don't have to schedule. I was almost expecting someone to come in and set it up. No such luck. Now for the positive side, because ending on a high note is good  and Ido actually love my treadmill after the rocky start :). I am 5'3" , 120 lbs and my partner is 6'2", 190 lbs, and we both use it all the time. I got this one because of how sturdily built it was and how well backed it is by Nordick Track. I wanted something that could be used regularly by multiple people of varying heights and weights. It does this job very well and with all things considered, I would make the purchase again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2020
CommentsContent: My bf and I moved into our DTLA Studio last year and had researched treadmills for 6 months before finally pulling the trigger on this one. We decided on this one because it's compact (and it truly is), has all the basic buttons we need (no big screens, no fans, no extra nothing), and the price point could not be beat. Amazon delivered it in no more than 10 days after purchase and it was delivered inside our home! We don't fold the treadmill up as we don't have much furniture but I would definitely see someone with need of more space or people with children to find this option useful and easy! The treadmill is a bit on the heavy side so rolling this treadmill around from one room to another would be quite difficult. We have ours stationary, so definitely imagine where you'd place this baby before your purchase and read the dimensions. The screen is definitely one touch and buttons are nice and big so very legible. We knew we wouldn't need the iFit program since there are hundreds of YT videos to help with your workout routine at home, but the membership gave us a scope of what great workouts they offer! If you're into one on one trainers, this might be a great option for you. This treadmill does have bluetooth capacity, however it does not connect to your phone/tablet for music on say Spotify or YT. It only connects to the iFIT app and you can only use this app if you're paying for it after the 1 month trial. This treadmill also has an AUX input with built in speakers for your iPod. You may also use this input with your phone if you buy a separate adapter. The Flex Select feature on this treadmill is by far my favorite. When running on this treadmill, you can choose to exercise as if you were running outdoors (on concrete) or run indoors, sorta gliding, as you would at an indoor gym so intensity is an option and you can change it by turning the orange silicone knobs at the bottom of the treadmill. The belt is sturdy and if properly maintained this treadmill will not disappoint you. Lastly, you have options of up to 10% incline with intervals of .5 and up to 10 mph. If you need assistance with assembly, usage, or just workouts don't be afraid to use YT!

CommentsTitle: Bought One of These 10 Years Ago - Bought One Now - They're Still Great!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2020
CommentsContent:
* OVERALL *
I had bought a NordicTrack treadmill similar to this years ago and got a lot of great use out of it. The only reason I sold it is because we were moving and the rental we were moving in to didn't have space for it. We bought a new home recently and I have a big workout space now and tracked down a similar model from Amazon and got it in January when they were running some discounts. Overall it's been a great machine and I've already put 50 hours and about 200 miles on it.

* ASSEMBLY *
I bought the package deal where an installer comes to assemble it, so all I can say is that he didn't have any issues and it took him less than an hour. Been solid since.

* GENERAL USE *
It's a mid-range treadmill but it gives me most of what I need. I do run some of the iFit programs that vary speed and elevation and every once in a while it would be nice to have more than a 12% incline, but not very often. When it comes to speed, I'm rarely sprinting even at the max speed of 12mph, so it's plenty fast. Speed and incline controls are decently responsive but there are times you have to hit the button more than once to get it to react. Transitions to a higher or lower speed or incline are just fine. Wouldn't want them any faster or slower.

The width and length of the treadmill are great and I'm 6' 4" and never feel crowded.

I have some suggestions for improvement, but I'll write those below.

* iFIT *
I've used some of the iFit programs and enjoyed them. Probably a lot more to get out of them, but the screen on the treadmill isn't huge so not as engaging as I'd like. It's more about the automatic program control of the speed and incline that's valuable to me.

The buttons on the touchscreen are kind of small and not super responsive. They work and I get around fine on it, but it can be sluggish and often requires multiple attempts to get a button to respond. Kind of like a smartphone ten years ago. Not perfect.

The other big issue is that I have not found a way to sync the iFit program to a computer screen or TV in any way. My old NordicTrack with iFit allowed you to use the iFit website and sync what was going on with the treadmill on the computer screen. I think that feature has been removed as far as I can tell and there's no way to use an AppleTV, Roku, computer, or anything else to see a larger picture of the screen so you're left with a small screen only. I called support multiple times on this, but it seems this isn't available and only high-end models have an HDMI out (probably a $2 part) that would work perfectly.

Oh well, I'm living with it, but it was a surprise to find out that this treadmill couldn't do what a similar NordicTrack treadmill 10 years ago could do.

* SUGGESTIONS *
Don't want these suggestions for improvement imply that I'm not happy with the treadmill. I am!! It can just get better in a few key ways:

- See my iFit comments above. It's really been crippled in order to convince you to buy a much more expensive version just for the bigger screen. That's too bad.

- There no great place to put a water bottle. There are spots on the side, but they don't work like a drink holder at all and are kind of awkwardly placed. There's a shelf down below the controls, but I'm not quite sure why it's there except to store stuff like a HRM or other gear. Not a good spot for a water bottle while you're walking/running.

- Noises: overall I'm happy with the noise level of the machine, but it makes a strange noise ever time as the incline goes down around 0. My other treadmill did the same thing, so I guess it's normal, but still kind of strange.

- Like I mentioned above, buttons could be more responsive. When you're sprinting above 9mph and you're ready to end your interval you reach for a slower speed and it would be great if it responded the first time every time.

Again, overall I'm very pleased with the machine and it gets me through Idaho winters without gaining 100 lbs. Don't know what I'd do without it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill! Great price! iFit not required!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a fantastic treadmill, especially given the price! Complaining about this treadmill is truly a first-world problem. For starters, it is VERY reasonably priced considering most treadmills start around $1000. Additionally, some have mentioned that it's loud. We'll yes it's a treadmill...it's literally supporting your full bouncing weight as you run on it, so of course it makes noise. The machine itself isn't really all that noisy even when the belt is at full speed. Lastly and most importantly, YOU DO NOT HAVE TO REGISTER FOR IFIT!!! To bypass, simply hold down the iFit button for 30 seconds and the treadmill will work. If you're looking for a basic treadmill with multiple speeds, inclines, and the option for iFit, this is for you!

CommentsContent: Easy to assemble.  Even though instructions call for two people I was able to assemble it myself.  The treadmill is very stable and well built. There is no fan so I purchased a clip-on from Amazon.  Bypassed IFIT.  If they had offered it free for 2-3 months I would have signed up and tried it out.  Could not find data in IFIT and how it would help me on the treadmill..  Maybe later they will offer it free for 3 months to see if it works for you before since you have to give them a credit card.  One assembly problem.  The silver ground screw would not work per instructions so I had to use a substitute.  I have a case number but response is very slow.  Consider this a minor problem.  Bottom line is I love the treadmill and happy with my purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: We enjoy our long walks outside along Lake Michigan when weather permits, but Chicago weather doesn't always allow for that, especially during the cold months. So, we decided to get a treadmill so we could continue walking/running indoors when needed. Build quality is good and sturdy, and it doesn't feel like my 200+ lbs is going to make it fall apart like most cheaper products. I did have to replace a part that was broken when I unpacked it. It's really heavy and bulky and the delivery guys really struggled to get it up to our second floor walkup apartment, so I was surprised not more was damaged. The part was replaced very quickly once I supplied the necessary info.Assembly took a while but the directions are clear and easy to follow. This model has a huge screen and came with a 1-year subscription of iFit included. Both features are awesome! Following behind a hot trainer on screen as they guide you through all sorts of workouts all over the world is like dangling a carrot in front of a donkey. It's motivating and you get to "visit" some really cool places! Plus, you don't have to change any of the speed/incline settings because it happens automatically while you're following the trainer. It's like being right there with them!  Very happy overall with our purchase!

This is a poorly built product in terms of the machining.  I could not say if the treadmill is good in terms of the motor display etc. as I could not get past the problems.  Sure I could have drilled out the holes but who would want to have to do that for a $700 item.  The parts fit imprecisely and overall this treadmill is a joke.  Perhaps it was manufactured during the pandemic peak in China.  Truly this is one of the worst product experiences I've had in some time.  I actually give it zero stars.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I've only has this for a day, so I'll focus on assembly and can update the user experience after using it for awhile longer.Unpacking: This thing is heavy AF. Required two adults and a dolly to get into the house. Nothing was missing or damaged. Be careful when removing the base from the box as the console, including the touchscreen monitor, is stored under the base during shipment. The base is by far the heaviest component in the box. I suspect that most of the complaints on here about broken consoles are a result of crushing the console while removing the base from the box, so be careful there.Assembly: This thing is harder to assemble than your standard Ikea shelf, but no so hard that you need to hire a professional. You will, however, need a second adult to help you out as some steps require a second set of hands. You will also need a phillips head screwdriver and a socket wrench. Everything else is included. As far as instructions, I would have preferred better illustrations. There are YouTube videos with folks assembling these and I strongly recommend watching those along with reading Nordictrack's instructions. It would have been extremely frustrating trying to assemble this thing on those instructions alone without those helpful YouTubers.Ifit: I'll update once I've had a chance to really explore the software. Signing up for my free year was super easy. I read another review indicating that you need to pay for a year upfront with the free trial and then get reimbursed later. That is not my experience. There was a card in the box with an activation code. That code set me up for a year free. I paid nothing on activation. Zero. However, it did require credit card info because, after a year, if I do not cancel, it will automatically charge my account for the next year. This auto-renew feature sucks and they are clearly banking on people forgetting to cancel before the year is up. I will be taping a reminder to my machine to cancel before the year is up so I am not charged.Audio: There is audio input, but not audio output, so you can plug your phone in and listen to music through the treadmill's speakers, but the reverse is not true. You cannot plug in headphones to the treadmill to listen to workouts through headphones. There is also no Bluetooth on this 6.5si. That's a total bummer as my machine is in my living room and everyone in the room now has to hear my ifit videos because there is no way to listen through headphones.Touchscreen: The screen is not as sensitive as I would have liked. I find that I have to press buttons several times to have it recognized. That's a bit annoying.Fan: Because it was brought up in other reviews - no, there is not fan on the 6.5si. I was able able to get a cheap clip on fan off Amazon for ten bucks, so the lack of fan is definately not a deal breaker for me.Overall, I'm giving this one 4 stars. So far, I feel like I got what I paid for, but will update again when I've had a chance to wear it in.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Having to deal with ifit makes this machine not worth it

CommentsContent: For the price, I would think that they would include all the tools needed to assemble this machine. Assembling it requires a wrench, I had my own by i would have preferred the rounded ones that usually comes with the tools when you are required to tighten bolts. Especially in such tight places. Where you have to submit our personal information including credit card info. Then after all that, you still have to download the ifit app and give them all kinds of permissions. I bought this machine to work out, not have to install an app and let it track me. It gave me a 1984 big brother watching you kinda vibe. Again I bought this 700 piece of equipment to exercise, what I got was an app on my phone that wants to track everything i do. No thank, no where on this listing for this piece of equipment did it mention that you need to download the app onto your phone to activate this machine inorder to use it. If you do not agree to the terms of use to let ifit monitor you through your phone then you cant use it. Why does a treadmill need my location data. I am returning this and keeping big brother out of my house.

CommentsTitle: Nordic Track quality at an affordable price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2018
CommentsContent: I couldn't be happier with my purchase of the Nordic Track T 6.5 S treadmill. I upgraded from a 6 year old Horizon T101 that I had some major problems with over the years that included an expensive control board replacement and ultimately the motor quit.Huge pluses for the Nordic Track are the quality of construction, the options for various programs and the 25 year motor warranty. Another design feature I noticed is the tread is trimmed less wide so it won't fray along the edges. This was a problem with my old treadmill that caused dust and lint balls. So, very happy about the Nordic Track quality and design. And, assembly was easy. Highly recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I didn't want to write a review before I had enough time to properly use this treadmill (going on three months now). And so here's what I think:I usually run, walk, and jog 15 to 20 miles a week. So far, I haven't had any problems. The treadmill has performed flawlessly. And for the price, you can't beat it. It's less than $700 on Amazon. And it does everything you would want a treadmill to do. It has a OneTouch incline control--up to 10%. And the speed tops out at 10 mph. Really, how long can someone run at 10 mph? You can set the incline and speed manually, or you can choose from different pre-programmed training options. These options are a nice change if you get into the same-old routine.  I would recommend this treadmill to anyone who is looking for commercial grade quality for a reasonable price.Pros:  Superior options. Great warranty. Reasonable price,Cons: None

CommentsTitle: Great machine, but limiting after a short time

I assumed it would be perfect for me as someone just getting started exercising regularly, but after about a month of use I am starting to wish it had purchased one of the higher end models. I am starting to find the maximum incline of 10% to be limiting. Since I only have room for a single exercise machine, having one capable of a 20% incline (like some of the higher end Nordic Tracks) would be very useful.I have also rigged up a fan to help keep cool while working out. Many of the higher end machines have a built-in fan, so I regret not going up one level to the 8.5 Si, which would have provided a fan as well as a 12% max incline.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Great machine for the extended pandemic
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2020
CommentsContent: A couple of things:- Youll need a Phillips head screwdriver and an adjustable wrench.- Do not pinch the wires- Two strong people to move into place- Get a fitness equipment mat to go under the treadmill- Skip the three red warnings that say ‘activate on ifit.com’ by just pressing the ifit button for 10 seconds.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I LOVE THIS TREADMILL! I am 5'4" and weigh 190 pounds and this treadmill is fantastic in quality! Initially, I was nervous to purchase a treadmill online but this was the best decision I made! I like to use the incline for walking with weights and running at high speed, so I was nervous this treadmill would shake but it doesn't AT ALL. I'm cancelling my gym membership and sticking with this guy.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: We are really glad we bought this treadmill. We bought the 8.5 model. It is well built and good looking. We really enjoy the iFit membership and use it almost daily. The workouts and trainers make the whole experience more interesting. We didn’t have any issues being billed for the yearly membership like others complained about - maybe that used to be an issue but not for us. Fold up and take up very little space when not in use. Had ours for over a month and very happy with it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Good treadmill; ifit "benefit" not ready for prime time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2019
CommentsContent: The treadmill assembly was pretty involved but it's worth it for such a steady (and I hope, durable) unit.  Only drawback is the ifit membership required to activate the machine the first time.  Ifit software is buggy and unreliable and their customer service is weak.  I just quit it but I'm happy to be left with a very good treadmill.UPDATE:  Treadmill stopped working all of a sudden.  The machine would power up and make a grinding noise but the console controls wouldn't do anything.  Frustrating getting service due to long waits on the phone and needing to be near the machine with the motor cover removed.  Finally had everything lined up and the technician could see nothing mechanically wrong with the unit.  Told me to hold the iFit button down for 45 seconds.  I counted down and told the tech that it wasn't doing anything after 45 seconds but kept my finger on the button when all of a sudden the console reset and all was well.  MORAL:  if your machine stops working, try holding the iFit button down for a long time before calling support.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Not all hardware included is the correct size.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a great treadmill, however the hardware included does not include everything needed to actually assemble. If purchasing save yourself a headache and keep the original grounding screw to reuse as the one provided is too large. You will also need to purchase four rounded  #8 x 1&1/4 screws for attaching the pulse sensor bar to the upright posts. The screws included to do this are #10 and do not fit. You may be able to get them to fit if you drill the holes out but i didn’t want to risk that. Even with all these issues it’s a great machine and I would buy it again.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: I would give this 0 stars if I could
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This was the biggest waste of time and money in the entire world. We have spent hours assembling, disassembling, and on the phone with Nordictrack trying to receive parts to make the treadmill work. After owning for 2 months and never even having the chance to use it- we finally decided to return. We called NordicTrack 2 separate times to tell them the tread did not work, and each time they sent us a part, and each time the part was incorrect. At one point the sent us an entirely new control panel- which wasn't even for our model of treadmill. We finally gave up and contacted Amazon for our money back - thankfully they were able to help.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: True to it's description. Wide, sturdy & quieter!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2020
CommentsContent: In comparing all the options that the different products had with what was important to me, this was my best choice. And I've been very happy with it! My compromise in getting this one was that the display area has more buttons and functions and is bulkier than I was looking for, but I'm sure that helps with it's stability. Other things I was looking for that it does have is that it is solid, sturdy, wide, the weight capacity that I wanted, is quieter than my last machine, a price within my budget and speed -which the walking machines I was looking at didn't have.The feature I love is iFit, which I didn't buy it for and didn't think I'd use, but I'm hooked!But for the machine, I gave it all 5 in ratings, because it is true to it's description, what you read and see is what you get. It was easy to assemble, I'm a 54yr women and did it myself. I had a brace to use to hold it up, but after realizing this was only for the hydraulic lift, which I don't plan on using, you wouldn't need the brace or second person if you're just leaving it in place. But I'm impressed, it's easy to lift, feels safe.After using the machine, the only suggestions for improvement is if you are using the iFit option. The machine doesn't have a decline, so when they are going downhill, I just increase the speed to try and offset that and get a better workout. To use iFit, you need a tablet or phone, it's not on the screen. It has a ledge at the bottom of the display area to hold it but I bought an flexible phone attachment to hook it to the top so it's more eye level and then sometimes when doing a CrossFit where you hop off the machine I can just flip the direction of the phone and continue following along!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This machine is full of problems. it's super heavy, loud, the footboard comes out so far you hit it while jogging if trying to stay close to the screen area, it's loud, and just old school. You might as well spend a bit more and get something of quality. It gave me the worst shin splints of my life after just light jogging. The best use we've gotten out of it is my cat sleeping on it.  Also, it was 800 bcuks when i bought it, it dropped to  629, and amazon wont refund me the difference--but will let me return and re-buy. Might as well buy from a more trusted, experienced seller (like a wholesaler or gym equipment company).
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2020
CommentsContent: got the treadmill really quick, took me about 45 minutes to put it together, but I took my time. I couldn't start it without setting up an ifit account and downloading the app on my phone to sync it... however, it didn't force me to put in my credit card information, it asked but I just left it blank, so I'm guessing after my 30 day trial ill be getting an email asking me to renew it, which I won't..iFit is sort of a rip off.. it works well, a bit noisier than the treadmills at my gym, the belt seems to make a lot of noise, but it works fine. I will update if anything goes haywire.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2019
CommentsContent: This is undoubtedly the loudest treadmill I’ve ever set foot on to exercise.  It’s in my finished basement, where there’s a pool table, ping pong table, and television.  I installed a Sonos Beam on the TV and still can’t hear the programs due to the loud creaking that’s heard on every footstep I take.  I do not recommend purchasing this product.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Customer Service is very bad, no support, & keep delaying ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this on Oct 2019. I realized the noise problem & report to NordiTrack on 2020-4. Each phone call takes 40 min hold time (why not provide a call back?). So far I have called them 6 times & email back and forth of 14 emails. Problems still not resolved!My requests were:1) Repair my noise problem (something to do with the belt).2) Need annual Maintenance / Tune Up.3) Verify with me that I have 3 years of additional maintenance contract.They know how to do them, but just delay & delay.Sorry for bad review.David L, seeDavid101@gmail.com, 2020-10-2
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: **Update**Part took 3 weeks to arrive. Installation was quick and now treadmill works flawlessly. I had numerous interactions with customer service. I finally found someone who went above and beyond to track down my part order.Ordering was easy. Delivery was fast. The delivery people even brought the treadmill inside, which I was thankful for because it's heavy!  It took a few hours to put together but wasn't difficult.  My wife and I used it for walking 20-30 minutes at a time and with incline. Treadmill worked great for 1.5 months and then the motor controller malfunctioned. Nordictrack customer service was quick to diagnose the problem and quoted 7-10 days for the part to arrive. I checked their website and the part is listed as out of stock.  It has been 3 weeks and no part and customer service is giving me the run around. I do not recommend this treadmill and customer service is terrible.  I will be returning.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Perfect for at home workin outs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a peloton before this and HATED it. I've had my treadmill since August and I use it everyday! It's super sturdy and dones't feel cheap at all. I would buy this again- it was exactly what I was looking for and I'm so happy!! =)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using this for a couple months and it has been great. I get to work out whenever I want and don't have to think about driving to the gym or getting someone to watch the kids so I could go to the gym.It is quite heavy so you would want it delivered to an entrance close to where you want ut installed. Due to COVID, the delivery guys only dropped it off in the living room door way. I and my husband had to take it down to the basement. As an afterthought, it would had been best if we had told them to drop it off at the back porch close to the basement.Assembly is best for 2.The purchase came with 1 month free ifit  subscription and signing up on with ifit was required but credit card details was OPTIONAL. I had read a lot of reviews regarding this and since it was optional, I didn't enter any credit card details so I don't need to call anyone to cancel.The manual is quite handy and don't forget to put the KEY on the treadmill.Also, when done with workout, take the incline down to 0 and speed down to 1, otherwise, the treadmill would take a while to start up during your next work out.Its truly been an awesome experience.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: I've been trying to get more exercise and have been upping my daily steps. Since we're all working from home, sitting has become the norm. When the weather was nice, I'd walk around the neighborhood, but now that it's winter... I'm back to sitting. Thus, the treadmill.Set up wasn't too bad. It was just my wife and I, and it took us more than an hour. In retrospect, I wish I had sprung for the set up service. Once assembled, it seems to be a nice machine. Sturdy and comfortable. It has a lot of features - most that I don't use. I basically use the speed and the incline, but it can do SO much more if that's your thing.It folds up and down very easily, you don't have to be exceptionally strong or coordinated to do it. It moves with ease, too, but I'd recommend 2 people.The deck is pretty comfortable. Even though I'm on tile, I bought a padded mat to keep it from scooching, and it seems to help with the shock absorption, too.All in all, I'm very happy with this purchase, and expect many years of use from this treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I contemplated to buy this treadmill and its newer sibling, T7.5, but I eventually reasoned that I wouldn't need a screen or  iFit software.  I need a basic treadmill that is well-built, quiet, and just easy to use/maintain.  Also, I thought about a trade off of signing up for a gym, or buying a treadmill.  At this price point, I think this treadmill was a great deal that checked all the boxes that I cared for.  It came in a big and hefty 6'x3' box that you would need another person to carry.  Assembly wasn't so difficult, but I recommend building this with another person to help you hold the treadmill handles, front console, etc.  A cross bar that connects two handles and a front console was challenging to install.  You would have to push hard two vertical arms and handles inwardly to place the cross bar and screw it down.  You may even think that the cross bar would be too short and It took two people to install this.  Besides this part, the assembly was easy if you faithfully follow the instruction manual included.  There are other reviews here about bypassing iFit, but I didn't bother to look for that.  I just quickly signed up on my phone, then cancelled the membership right away.  I do agree that this is a nuisance and I don't approve Nordic Track is making people to sign up for iFit just to activate this treadmill.  If iFit is as awesome and effective as they advertised it to be, then I don't think that they have to force consumers to sign up. I think this rather displayed iFit's insecurity and failure in marketing. (of course this is my opinion).  Using this treadmill was as easy as using a treadmill at a gym.  Once you can look past this iFit annoyance, I think this treadmill is a great buy.  It is sturdy, slick looking, quiet enough to hear your wife (or too quiet), and super easy to use.  You simply hit start, set speed/incline, then run.  I think if you are average Joe like me who just want to run without thinking much about advanced features (though it still comes with several presets and workout options),  then I think this treadmill would be a great option for you.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this treadmill four months age and I have used it less than five times and it broke.I called NordicTrack tech service several times and they had me on the phone for over an hour and they had me do the troubleshoot for them, send the picture, video of the issue and they agree to send me parts, BUT I received nothing no parts. Had to call them every week until I got the parts in the third week, now I am on the call with their customer service to schedule a tech appointment to replace the bad parts.this is been going for too long and no results.DO NOT BUY this product it is cheap and not worth it, with horrible customer service. It is not worth the time and the stress you will go thought if you have any issue with this treadmill. Be smart and invest your money wisely. This is the second month  my treadmill is still sitting in the garage waiting for their tech to get fixed.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Wife and daughter love it, hold the ifit button for 30 seconds to bypass signing up on line for the monthly payments
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve had this treadmill for a couple of weeks now, and have used it regularly for walking and running.Assembly took two people, but wasn’t too bad at all. No issues.The treadmill is sturdy and sound, great for running. The controls are easy to use, easy to access, easy to read and very responsive. I bypassed the iFit boondoggle and use it in manual mode.So far, I am very happy with it. My last treadmill was a much more expensive Sole treadmill, and I am just as happy with this treadmill as I was with the Sole.If you’re on the fence, I recommend this treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2019
CommentsContent: Great price and super assembly service.  This treadmill is so modern to me, my last treadmill I bought was over 20 years ago.  I love the Fit feature!  Syncs with phone app and keeps track of how far you walk, calories and heart rate.  I find that some of the walking/running features on the app are too much for a senior like me, so I put it on manual work out and it shows walking laps on an oval track - like that a lot.  Belt is wide enough to be comfortable and I don't have to worry about stepping off either side while walking.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m sure the product was fine but delivery was GARBAGE.The product came damaged and dented and when I opened it you can see the giant cracks on the base. When I first called Amazons customer service they wanted to know if it was still usable even though it was cracked. Or if I wanted to keep it even though it was cracked… What?They were not able to come and pick it up until three days later wasting more time or window that I needed to be around for. This will make a total of seven hours I will need to make myself available for a piece of damaged equipment.They were also not able to issue me a new one right away and that I would have to wait for my refund to be processed in four days.Not waiting around to order a new one, garbage customer service Amazon.**update: a new one could not be reissued because they didn’t have any more at what I paid. Everything is now 500-1000 more! Not ever ordering something of this size from Amazon ever again
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought my first NordicTrack in 2000.  It's been a great machine but it was time for a new one because the display panel was failing.  I did a lot of research and decided to stick with NordicTrack.  I purchased delivery, setup, and an extended warranty with my purchase.  I was so excited when it came.  The machine doesn't seem as well built as the previous one but the display and Ifit are amazing.  After a few uses, the machine started making a clunking sound.  I went onto the web and submitted an online form for service.  I received a confirmation email but never heard from anyone.  I called about 10 days later and was trapped in their IVR.  It kept wanting me to go to their website to find helpful videos on fixing my treadmill.  I spent a lot of money, I have a mfg warranty, and an extended warranty so I don't want to fix the machine myself.  I called back a 2nd time and got to a customer service rep.  They seemed nice enough but couldn't help me because I needed to be at home with the treadmill so they could help me isolate the sound and then (fix it myself?).  A few days later I removed the hood and found a loose screw that was causing the clunking sound.  I tightened it and it was fixed.  .... until I walked on the treadmill again and there was some other sound.  I don't really use the treadmill now because the sound drives me nuts and I haven't had time to call customer service again.  NordicTrack - just come and fix the damn thing since I paid for that service.  I am very disappointed.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Good product but extremely deceptive company
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I really hope people are reading these reviews. The product itself is okay. Delivery was quick and I was able to assemble it by myself with no issue and it does what it needs to do. It's a well-built treadmill and looks sleek.My issue is with this iFit subscription they are pushing. All over the packaging, instructions, and the product itself are these little warning labels saying the product won't turn on until you've activated your iFit subscription which of course costs money. What they don't tell you, anywhere, is that you can activate your product by holding down the "iFit Sync" button for 20 seconds without having to sign up for iFit. The only reason I knew about the bypass is because I read the reviews of all the people who figured that out after the fact. Completely deceptive business practice. Would buy again, the product is very nice, but the company does not deserve a positive review.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Been using it for 5 days, so far, an excellent treadmill.  Quieter than my old Pro Form treadmill, though volume has to be turned up, I'd say it's better than normal.  Changing speeds is smooth, and elevation is smooth, too.  You need 2 people for assembly - it takes about 2 hours.  Shame on Noric Trac for pushing the ifit connection.  Thanks to other reviewers, by pressing the ifit button for ~20 seconds you avoid the hassle of "you must sign up with ifit to unlock the treadmill".
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I received the treadmill today and took about 3 hrs to put together.  If you can, please the extra $18 to have the box delivered in the room of your choice since the box is very heavy.  There were two large cracks on the bottom of the machine and after I called customer service,  they gave me a discount.  One thing I don't like is that each time you start the treadmill you have to go through the ifit screen and select start manual.  You can start the membership and cancel it but you have to do it from your computer,  tablet or phone, not from the treadmill. It's a pretty good exercise machine but I wish there were no scatches/cracks considering the  price you pay for it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2020
CommentsContent: We used an Amazon Installation service along with the purchase of this treadmill. The gentleman that came to install the treadmill was great and gave me some information during the set up. Once the treadmill was put together he said it looks re-furbished and not NEW. He showed me a few parts are loose and when folding- the treadmill isn't closing the same way a NEW one does. THIS IS VERY DISAPPOINTING. At this point, I don't know if they sent me a refurbished one but I paid for a NEW one. I am a true amazon prime member and have ordered tons of items through out the year varying in prices. I WOULD EXPECT THAT WHEN BUYING AN EXPENSIVE NEW TREADMILL I WOULD RECEIVE JUST THAT. At this point what can I do? I have it. It works just fine. (Its been a week or so)oh and also, you can bypass the ifit subscription.... my service technician was able to do it. I appreciated it a lot!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: A machine that does what I need well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: Received in December so it has been more than 2 months.Delivery and installation: the package was much bigger than I thought. I have asked the customer service, the entire package is about 300lbs with the heaviest piece a little over 100. So yes, if you really want to, you could move the box yourself but strongly recommend buying service to deliver to the room of choice. Similar applies to installation. We are reasonably handy and assembled the machine by ourselves in a little over 3 hours. It does require 2 people as somewhere in the middle it asks one person to hold the console while another person screws. I would do professional installation if I buy it again. Assembly manual is somewhat hard to read but after the fact I do think they are doing the best to be accurate. The tools/hardward kit is very neat and easy to find pieces.Now onto the machine:Pros: works exactly how it's supposed to. Good amount of area to run and iFit helped me to start running again after 8 years. I like to follow the trainers and it makes workout easier and more fun. Given it's Covid time, it also gives me a mood boost to "travel" in Europe or South Africa. The incline is pretty steep and I definitely think I worked on different muscle with the hiking session. I used to work out in the gym and other than this might be a tad shorter and narrower than commercial treadmills, it satisfies my needs to run 40+ mins around say 5.5mph without me feeling any different than running on commercial treadmill.Cons: I gave up on the heart rate monitor, which showed 70 sth when I was huffing and puffing. iFit takes a couple minutes to boot every time but I have learned to turn on the machine before I start changing into my running outfit. The clip on the safety key snapped in a couple days but we sort of MacGyver'ed it and still serves purpose. I also wished that I can mirror ipad onto the treadmill screen or can maybe just put the ipad on the console but it doesn't really work as then the ipad will block the fan.In summary, there are a bunch of places that I wish it could be better but I think it already does what I am looking for really well. Happy that I got the machine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I was hesitant buying this treadmill due to the negative reviews but took a chance anyway. As for the ifit the only way to contact them is thru email they don't answer the phone. When I purchased the treadmill it came with a one year membership and when signing up it gave me only one month. I had to threaten to file a complaint with amazon and the govt for false advertising to get what i was promised. They quickly responded with correct 1 yr membership. Ifit doesn't ask for a cc for signing up.As for the treadmill it does everything I needed it's reliable and I've had no problems. For the price it's a great buy. Not noisy, size a little smaller then some. I recommend this item
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: 4 star but really a 3.5 star because the machine will cause your circuit breaker to trip. You will have to get a good surge protector because it is definitely needed. I do see it as a fire hazard but the only way you can return it is keeping the huge box after it's set up. Which I didn't because theres not enough space in my condo for it. I see as as a way to keep people from returning it. The box shouldnt matter and if the freight company is providong you with the return sticker then they should also provide you with the box even if it cost. It was installed a month ago but didnt use it right away which is my choice. No one keep boxes that big just sitting around especially since so many reviews say that the warranty department is no help. I can see a Class action in the near future if this continues. Sometimes it will override me and incline when I turn it on. Il have to wait till it goes all the way up and back down before I can do anything.  Not sure if it's some kind of mechanical glitch or not. Works fine when I'm walking and jogging but it does make a sound. The sound isnt too loud but it's not quiet so playing music will help override that problem.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I did quite a bit of research on treadmills before Christmas with the features I wanted, but not too expensive (if I end up not using it as planned) and I wanted it delivered ASAP. This has not disappointed. I have used it almost everyday since it arrived. It did take two of us to put it together because of the size of it, but wasn’t too complicated. I did to the 1 month trial of iFit and I really liked the walking tours and various other walking workouts. I really like that the iFit workouts vary the speed and incline for you. I have not renewed the iFit subscription since it expired and the treadmill has also worked perfectly fine starting it manually. I’m very happy with this purchase
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2021
CommentsContent: So far, it’s amazing. I was able to assemble by myself in about 3 hours. The coolest part, it comes with a year of family iFit. I had a few questions getting all set up, and activated, and was able to use the tablet built into it to chat with Nordictrack support, right from the treadmill!!! Love it, love it, love it! One piece of advice, skip the Amazon offered maintenance package, and buy from the Nordictrack website when you registered. You get better choices, for a better price.My only complaint, the delivery crew brought the box to me upside down, even thought the box clearly said, “this side op”. Nothing was damaged, but it still left a bit of unease for such a heavy, expensive item.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve read some not so good reviews, but I’m very happy with this treadmill. First let me say, you DO NOT have to sign up for ifit to get it to work. Just hold down the ifit button for 30 seconds to unlock it.My husband & I were able to put it together ourselves in about 45 minutes. Directions were easy to follow. I didn’t need anything fancy as I mostly walk but I wanted an incline & this works great. Lots of speed & incline settings, has 2 very large cup holders, a ledge to put my iPad on if I want to watch something. Walking on it feels great, doesn’t hurt my knees like some treadmills can.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2019
CommentsContent: This machine was much sturdier than I thought it would be for the price. It did take my husband a bit of time to put it together, but he said the shrink-wrapped package with the screws in it was the best packaging job he has ever seen. It was really organized and easy to see which part went where. This treadmill is way more powerful than I will ever need. I am 71 with some health issues. I love to be able to use the Nordic Track at my pace. The one 'con' I will mention has nothing to do with the machine but with the iFit personal training. They need to make programs for Seniors. All in all, this is a great treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Good treadmill for the price. Not top of the line but very good for the home. Many people crying about the iFit thing. I agree that it is shady to try to get someone to think that they must sign up for a service to use their physical product, but it's even stated somewhere on this product listing that it is not required. Maybe if people read things through a little better they would not be so surprised when they think they've hit a dead end. It is quiet enough for a treadmill. Haven't used the speakers so can't comment on that but I just set up a tv in front of it so didn't matter to me. 5 stars from me.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2019
CommentsContent: Delivery people left it on a pallet in my front yard not an awesome start.  Heavy as sin took two of us strong men to get it inside.  Parts I received were not drilled properly at the factory so I had to get replacement parts which was pretty simple from nordic track they came fast and free.  Once you are up and running like other reviews say you have to sign up for this bs monthly package to even start using the treadmill, you can cancel right after but its a sneaky shady tactic.  The tread mill as far as use is ok it's a treadmill with incline, speed and etc.  It squeaks a little but after awhile you learn to ignore it.  Once it was all put together and I used it I've not had issues since then.  It's my only treadmill purchase so I don't know how to compare it to others but for the money I paid I would not say I'm overly satisfied with the experience.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Relatively easy assembly and seems great for the price point.  Less than stellar delivery driver.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2020
CommentsContent: We just received this today.  It definitely take two people to handle.  The delivery driver was supposed to deliver this to our entrance way. Instead he dropped it off in front of our garage and took off before I could even get out the door.  My husband and I had to unbox it and carry it in in pieces.  Thank goodness it wasn't raining!The assembly was relatively simple.  It took two people to strong arm some of the pieces into place.  It runs.  It's quiet.  I am super impressed with how easily and softly it folds up and down.  I'm not sure how I feel about the ifit app yet.  I am a walker, not  runner, but we'll see...  I'll add to my review once I've had time to put the treadmill and app through its paces.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: A membership is required to use this equipment.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I assembled the machine and when I went to the ifit.com  They required that you subscribe to a monthly membership of 30.00 per month.  You can not even use the machine. When you call the number for customer service they won't even let you talk to customer support until you register your account.  You can not register your account unless you provide a credit card number and they charge you a subscription fee.  There is no way to use this machine at all until you pay then. And if you cancel subscription they will lock your machine out.  Amazon should ban this company from doing business.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Love the iFit workouts on the 10" screen!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: My favorite part of this treadmill is the large screen that has thousands of iFit workouts that make time on the treadmill fly by! There are walks, hikes, runs, HIIT workouts, strength training, and yoga. Beginner to advanced and easy to difficult intensity. All four members of my family have profiles and can do whatever type of workout they want, with their own unique stats stored in their profile. The treadmill itself is sturdy and I love the feature of being able to fold it up for more floor space. I had to hire a professional to put it together for me ($125) because it takes two people to assemble and I didn't have a second person to help me. I highly recommend this treadmill!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: So GLAD that I bough this treadmill!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I am so very glad that I bought this Nordic Track treadmill.  It is of high quality and is solidly made.  It was pretty easy to assemble, I even did most of it by myself.  The very last part of the installation I needed a second set of hands but that was it.  I love the way the iFIT works with it and I even purchased the 1 yr plan.  It is awesome how you can work along with the trainers and see all of the beautiful locales (that I'll probably never be able to afford to go to -- lol) in the world like Hawaii, Miami, and St. Lucia etc.  It has been a fantastic experience so far.  I haven't had it 6 months but so far I am THRILLED with this purchase.  Thanks Amazon/Nordic Track!  :)  :) :)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This has been a lifesaver during the covid quarantine/living in the desert during the summer. Shipping was not great but that doesn’t apply to the treadmill. Assembly was easy. Use is intuitive. Push and hold the iFit button to bypass the membership portion. I did not have to enter a credit card number at all. I mostly walk on it but I have run a few times and I have had no knee pain, which usually happens with treadmills.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2019
CommentsContent: When this product first arrived it wouldn't turn on. After 1.5 months of going back and forth with tech support, the treadmill would turn on and function at a snails pace. At the time, I didn't care, as I felt it was a good price to deal with its' slow response. As time went on, less and less functions would work. I am now 5 months out from buying this treadmill and 70% of the time it won't turn on. When it does turn on, the buttons don't work. Needless to say, this is not a good buy. For your sanity, and the health of your body, DON'T BUY THIS TREDMILL.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Saved me from myself this quarantine.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought the original NordicTrack WalkFit in 1994 and have regretted selling it for years. Well, NordicTrack has come a long way, baby! This treadmill has saved us this dreary and cold winter and helped us cope during quarantine. No one had to walk on treacherous, ice-covered sidewalks or wade through knee-high snow that Tom on the next block over didn't shovel yet. Instead, we were able to hop on the NordicTrack and work off the stress of the workday, the monotony of being inside for a whole fricking year, and, oh, work on our fitness too. ;)I don't use all the bells and whistles that come with the NordicTrack, and I don't use iFit. I did a trial run of iFit without giving CC info as some reviewers have mentioned is required. Just hold down the iFit logo for 30 seconds and manual mode is activated.  I'm happy to manually adjust my speed and incline rather than using any of the pre-programmed workouts built into the machine too. I'm short and have asthma, so what most people consider a leisurely walk has me huffing and puffing. I'm able to hop on for ten minutes for a quick metal break from editing all day, or I can do a full workout. It's my choice, which I love.Delivery was smooth. Setting the thing up took us a few hours, so plan for that. It's a large machine, so make sure you measure your space before you order the T series. It works great for us in our family room. Overall, I'm really glad we took the plunge and invited NordicTrack back into our home.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: First treadmill that hasn't been relegated to holding my laundry.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: This was a great purchase. It was assembled quickly and easily. Everyone in our family of 5 uses it, including our 6 year old (with a spotter). We really like the easy fold stand underneath for storage. The iFit app that pairs via bluetooth is really great and well worth the fee after the free month. I love how it seamlessly changes the settings on the treadmill without having to touch it- because I would have no clue how to build a "proper" work out. It takes the guessing out. It runs very smoothly and is easy on my bad knees. Would highly recommend!

Trainer talk to you all the way through your workout. There are also 30 day programs as well. Much different than my last machine that would only turn on and off. Great product and customer service as well.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Decent entry level treadmill, instructions not clear, beware of iFit registration

CommentsContent: The treadmill overall seems decent for at home moderate use. CommentsTitle: Nordictrack/iFit now forcing ifit registration or we can no longer use our treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: UpdateIcon updated the software to allow manual use of the treadmill so I have increased the stars from one to three.While I am still concerned by the actions noted below, I have increased the stars since that issue was resolved.  I had a previous Nordictrack treadmill for almost ten years, it felt sturdy and while it did need a couple of repairs over the years I would give that previous model 4.5 stars.  Our new T 7.5 S works, but feels less sturdy and less well made -- a number of the pieces do not cleanly fit together, we had to have the belt replaced a couple of months after we received the treadmill, and there is a squeak from the deck when we run even after the service to replace the belt.  (we paid for setup with the treadmill, so these are not due to us improperly setting up the treadmill).  Overall the T 7.5 S is ok, but does not feel like the same quality as our previous Nordictrack.------Original Submission------I purchased the treadmill in September 2019 after confirming that I was not required to sign-up for the ifit service, as we prefer to just use the manual settings.  For the past nine months we have been able to use the treadmill in manual mode, skipping the ifit logon (it took a few extra steps and some delays to get out of the ifit sign-on screens each time, but it could be done).  This morning the screen looked different and would not let us use the treadmill.  I submitted a support request on their website and eventually received an email informing me that I am required to create and ifit account to use the treadmill.That the company can simply prevent us from using our treadmill until we provide them with additional personal information is very concerning.Since it has been nine months since I purchased the treadmill I cannot even return it to Amazon for a refund.  I am following-up with the company and hope they will fit the issue, but given this deceptive and unethical behavior I recommend looking for a different brand.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Okay... this is a solid treadmill! I love it so far... it has an auto incline and loud speakers! :) you can totally override the iFit activation and use the treadmill without it. The build part was a little tough... 2 people are suggested. This machine is HEAVY! I think it weighs around 200lbs but it is still compact compared to other treads. When building the tread, the grounding screw provided was the wrong width and screwing in the console bar was a little tough without the use of a drill (even though it suggests not to use one). The Bluetooth function only works through the iFit app but you can still connect your phone and listen to music via the aux connection. It is pretty quiet and no squeaking like other reviews.  So far so good... I am very pleased and the delivery via prime was super smooth and fast.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I was a bit nervous buying what seems (by price) to be a lower end treadmill.  I'm 190lbs and between my wife and I, we like to run. But running outdoors can be challenging in Va so we decided to enter at the lower price point.  We couldn't be happier with our purchase and are easily putting 20-30 miles a week on our NordicTrack T 6.5S.  The thing was delivered on time (actually a day early, I believe) and was pretty simple to put together.  The box and base are heavy and awkward...definitely a 2-person job!  Directions were easy to follow an everything was in perfect shape coming out of the packages.Really enjoyed the iFit trial we recieved with our purchase, but we haven't renewed.  There are enough workouts built into this treadmill that I can simply use them while watching a show on my 10" tablet that fits nicely on the control "shelf."  I've even set my open laptop on it, but it covers the controls completely.Regarding the "ride" of the treadmill - very impressed.  It's really smooth with no jerky motions like I've experienced on some older gym systems.  It's not a quiet machine, but probably similar to any other.  When done, the treadmill folds up very easily to give you a bit more room and keep cats and dogs from walking over it.Overall, very happy with NordicTrack. Recommend that they provide some basic maintenance tips with assembly instructions, but found them easily enough online.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve owned this for a little bit now.  It’s done it’s purpose thus far.  It took a bit to put it together by myself but it is not something you need two people even though it’s recommended.  Directions are pretty straight forward and easy to read.Using the treadmill I opted to use iFit just because I think it’s a fantastic program with oodles of resources and trainers(I recommend Tommy Rivs Puzey- Iberian Portugal, to start running!) I only wish I would have gotten the bigger screen instead of the 15 because some of the runs I have been on are just beautiful in location and a bigger screen would immerse you more.  It’s still suits and I’m ok with the smaller screen.  The cushion adjustments are fantastic and you can tell the difference while running from soft or hard.  It’s super quiet and out of the last 2 treadmills I have owned, I am very pleased with this product and highly recommend.

It takes up 3/4 of a small office. Once assembled operation was easy. I skipped the iFit membership setup, you don't need it to enjoy the treadmill. The treadmill is very quiet compared to other models i've purchased in the past. It's also very stable if you decide to run at top speed. My only gripe is with the sheer size of the treadmill and installation.

CommentsContent: It was slightly more complicated assembly than anticipated -- needed a helping hand to hold vertical parts in place, and one of the lag screws don't engage.Treadmill works as intended mostly, but I find that it misses achieving the set incline ~half the time.e.g. iFit or manually set to 6, and the treadmill attempts to raise incline for a few seconds and stops.  It reads as 6, but I can tell it's clearly not there (almost 0).  This is usually fixed if I brings down the incline manually to 0 and manually (using ^ button) to the right setting.  Kind of annoying, but not a show stopper.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m a fan of Norditrack. First time owning one.  I will and have recommended buying a treadmill to others who are looking to lose weight or maintain weight loss if unable to go back to the gym. I was so pleased with my 30 day trial IFit app that I purchased a membership to keep my goal If losing weight going.I would give it 5 stars but...The only advice I will offer  is to get a surge protector, several times it tripped my circuit when connecting to WiFi. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This has been a great investment. I have been able to get the exercise I need and walk/run though New Zealand, Scotland and more thanks to the iFit program. Would definitely recommend to anyone. I put this together myself - did need someone holding a couple of pieces so it isn't a completely one person job but had no issues figuring it out.
