PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2018
CommentsContent: Original review:Very nicely packaged to protect the components during shipping, expect to spend ten minutes or more just unpacking and laying out the components. Assembly was straightforward and easy enough though the supplied allen wrench was a bit short handled to make torquing down the bolts easy.  You will need a good grip or a small cheater bar to get them tight without a struggle.  All of the bolts had locktite applied to them so they aren't going to wiggle loose any time soon. The assembly instructions were very clear.  It took me two hours to assemble it. There are a couple of points in the process that will be made easier and safer with two people and that might cut your assembly time.The unit powered up easily enough but popped the ground fault outlet in the circuit immediately when the motor started.  If you are going to plug this unit into an outlet on a GFI protected circuit you are going to either need to remove the GFI outlet from the circuit or buy an arc filter. The instructions state that the treadmill will perform on a 15A circuit, which is a typical lighting circuit, but a 20A circuit might prove to be better in the long run so that you aren't popping the circuit breaker every time something else on the circuit turns on while the treadmill is running... like a vacuum cleaner or space heater.The motor is relatively quiet and definitely smooth and strong enough to handle a 220lb load.  The goal being to drop the load down from there. I've only tried walking on it so far.  I'm going to have to work my way back up to jogging as I haven't done much of that in years and I've had surgery on both knees.  Walking at speeds 2 or 3, even without upping the incline, provides a great workout.  The incline controls are easy to reach and operate smoothly. The unit is rock solid on our floor.  The tread is long enough for jogging, no doubt. The controls are ergonomic and clearly labeled. The screen isn't huge but it is clear and provides all the data I need.  The heart rate monitor matches my apple watch exactly.So far, so good. Couldn't be happier with the quality of this machine for the price that I paid.Update:My wife noticed that the left hand pulse sensor didn't work when she tried it for the very first time... the same day we completed the first review/set up the treadmill.  The product is registered and I followed a link to customer support on NordicTrack's site. I reported that the left pulse sensor didn't work, and that the track was squeaking with every step when my wife sped up the track to jog on it.  I received an email reply with a case number and was told that I would be contacted by email or phone with next steps "shortly".Bottom line: Works fine for me as I'm just walking fast. Track lube cured the squeaking problem. Amazon's customer service did respond and took care of us. Thank you Amazon.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Mechanically sound, garbage interface and service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2021
CommentsContent: The treadmill itself runs great. Smooth, long belt with lots of cushion and I never get shin splints, aches in my feet, or any other pains I've gotten previously from running.But the operating system is horrific. It's some ancient form of Android used by Neanderthals. Everything is slow, even with Bluetooth and location services turned off. It saves my workouts half the time, rarely can connect to iFit, and most of the programs run only with an iFit subscription. So you have to pay to use most of the built in programs, and then get to watch them not work.At the end of the day, I don't really care about the touch screen and programming. The treadmill itself runs great, and if that's all that matters to you like it does to me, then maybe get it. But if you care at all about your programs, recording your stats, or having a fully functional product that doesn't aggravate you, don't get it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I'll admit, I was VERY skeptical of this treadmill because of the price and issues I'd heard with NordicTrack in general. So I'll start from the beginning. I initially ordered this treadmill and the technician assistance in October. The technician discovered damage as he was putting it together. Amazon refunded me for everything because they did not have it in stock to replace. Days later, the treadmill was in stock again so they sent the replacement. The replacement arrived in the morning and technician in the afternoon. It took maybe 45 mins for him to complete the set up. He tested it out for me and showed me the workaround for iFit.My skepticism was the price compared to quality. I thought me being 250lbs would have me feel like I was going to break the equipment. That is not the case! I've run at the highest speed (10 mph) and highest incline (10%) and it felt safe and stable. Now if you're jumping up and down at 10% grade you should expect to break the hydraulics. I love this treadmill. It is used at least every other day with no issues.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2019
CommentsContent: The treadmill is good, the work outs are nice the yearly cost after your 1 yr membership to ifit is up is  389.00 a year.l and you have to put in credit card to even begin your workouts. It isnt worth that a year. There are some nice work outs but it is nothing like the virtual reality one, easy set up. Very smooth running quiet machine. Just expected more from ifit.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: We are still using it even though it's good outdoor running weather. Nuff Said.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2020
CommentsContent: My teenage kids begged for a treadmill at the start of lockdown and my daughter selected this Nordictrack model because she wanted the iFit classes and large screen to watch them on. I was skeptical - I like to run outdoors - but I agreed and a couple of weeks later a truck dropped it off at our house. Assembly was a a pain point for sure, but after a trip to the hardware store I managed it. The good part is that the whole household has been using it, even as the weather has warmed up and we can exercise outdoors again. I actually like the steep incline hikes and runs a lot as we live in a fairly flat area, and it's fun to go up Mt Kilimanjaro or Mt Baldy with a guide. Good buy.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I've never liked treadmills with massive screens that I'm forced to stare at, so this one was perfect. My husband and I assembled it together, however it is VERY heavy and definitely a little difficult to assemble. If you can afford to have a professional do it, I would recommend that, and wish that we had hired someone to do it for us. I say this because the heart rate sensor bar doesn't work very well, and at times it was difficult to figure out which screws to use. It was extremely time consuming and just difficult. Aside from assembly, the treadmill works great, we've both used it for running and walking. If you're ok with not having super fancy tech on a treadmill, then this is a good one to choose. It does a good job of measuring distance, my Fitbit is usually recording the same distance or something within a tenth of a mile.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I've only had it for 2 months but so far so good. It seems like a quality treadmill for the price. Larger than I had expected it to be too, which is a good thing! Normally a treadmill in this price range would be much smaller. This isn't much smaller than the treadmills at my gym. It did take my husband quite a while to put it together by himself, around 2 hours but overall it was still a great buy!Update: it's been 10 months since I purchased this & it's now making a weird noise, possibly the motor or belt. I'm not sure yet. It's still working perfectly fine but I'm a little nervous now that it's making a noise. I have put a LOT of use into it with quarantine last year but I had hoped it would last much long than this so hopefully it's nothing major.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: First, it’s HEAVY. It took me, my wife and college student son to lift the belt section upstairs. Consider paying extra to have it delivered to the room where it’ll be used. Second, follow the assembly instructions carefully. You’ll need someone to help for a few parts. Third, you do need to activate iFit but no credit card is required. However, you can bypass the activation if you look it up online. I did have a problem with the treadmill tripping my GFCI circuit breaker. I bought a heavy duty appliance 12’ extension cord to plug into another non-GFCI outlet. It also holds your clothes nicely over the console when you’re too lazy to hang them in the closet. :-)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I wish i could tell you about how the product performs however i can't even get passed the assembly process due to the screws that were provided being damaged and unable to fit appropriately in the base. Contacted customer service as i purchased the 3 year warranty and they provided new screws however the screw that was sent was the incorrect one (didn't even match any of the screws that come with the hardware kit provided).  Contacted customer service again which this time around i encountered very rude sales reps who didn't seem to know about the product or bring up my account info. I finally was transferred for the 5th time and was told they will send me a new hardware kit replacing all the screws and tools needed. When I asked for a technician to help service i was told it would depend on their discretion if they can make house services (still waiting for a tech to call).  It's been a little over a month and now i cant even return this product!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: This is a basic but reliable treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this treadmill, my family's first, to overcome our over sedentary lifestyle during the corona virus work from home times and in anticipation of reducing outdoor walking during the winter months. The treadmill was particularly attractive vs. the "no-name" competition when offered at ~$250 off and finding online videos to explain the trivial was to bypass the iFit subscription service. The treadmill is very solid, but amazingly easy to fold up. The control console is basic and cheap components, but so far (6 weeks of constant use) reliable and functional. The assembly was more complicated than it needed to be because the instructions in the first few steps contained several errors and some improvisation was required - quite frustrating. If not for the assembly issues I would have given this a 5-star rating.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought the treadmill so that we wouldn't be dependent on the weather and to save our joints. Been using it for a little over a month. There are multiple settings on the treadmill to workout without using the iFit app, but they're not very customizable or give you the option to create profiles, which is why I'm putting a lower rating than 5 stars. The only way to personalize it is through the app, which requires a pricey subscription. The other issue is the treadmill is really large even folded up. The pictures make it look really slim but the handles and legs stick out a lot so just be mindful it won't be neatly tucked away. The performance, however is great and I love having this piece of workout equipment at home. Especially now that gyms are really not all that safe with Covid.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: You do not need IFIT membership
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I personally am thankful for the people who left reviews saying that you do not need an IFIT membership. They're right, but you do need to know how to  Google and read help forums. If you are not comfortable doing this, then you will not be able to even use the treadmill unless you provide a credit card to NordicTrack.The treadmill works fine for me. I do walking. It does what I want from it.Assembly was mostly easy and clear instructions. You can tell they had to do a lot of re-work on the product after it left the assembly line, because there are a lot of instructions that say something like "remove and discard these screws, and use these other ones we supplied." I did about 90% of the assembly by myself. I needed help when it came to the headboard; I just didn't have a way to balance the headboard while working to attach it. If you can move it on your own (and yes, it is heavy. I mean really heavy. If you don't lift and move 100lbs+ regularly, don't expect to be able to move it on your own), you should be able to assemble most of it on your own.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: My Nordic T series Treadmill was a great investment, especially since the gyms are currently closed in my area because of the Pandemic. I use it 5 days a week. More features than alot of treadmills in some gyms. It is built to last.The auto incline is a great feature, just like treadmills at the gym.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Amazing value, couldn’t be happier with a treadmill.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Just got it delivered today. It takes a bit to assemble, but it’s not as difficult as I expected. Very sturdy, solid treadmill from the first time using. iFit seems to include a ton of different options with all level, and although you have to acclimate to the placement and navigation of the system, it’s set up fairly intuitively. The speakers are louder than I expected with pretty good sound via Bluetooth. I am 6’, the wife is 5’ 2” and it’s large enough for my stride without being too large for her to reach the controls. It is also much more quiet than I expected. If I’m going to be super-picky, the fan is not very strong. Again, that’s being picky and not a complaint. Off to a great start so far!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I am so happy I bought this treadmill. NordicTrack has a great reputation and they did not disappoint. Assembling the treadmill was not too difficult - directions were easy to follow. The weight is what was difficult to deal with. Lifting it out of the box was not easy. But other than that, I had it together fairly fast. The bottom of the treadmill comes intact. All you have to attach is the front legs, arms and console. I was able to do a workout once it was all together. I love the way the treadmill speed and incline will go up or down with the trainer - but you can also choose to do your own pace. I had a blast. Not only does iFit offer treadmill workouts, but it does a ton of other workouts. I'm looking forward to getting fit.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: The treadmill was exactly what I was looking for.  Works with iFit app which allows the speed and incline settings to automatically adjust with the trainer in the app.  I use the app on my phone and screen share to a separate tv screen while running.Treadmill was delivered on time.  There was a little assembly but nothing difficult.  My wife and I use it almost every day.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: We paid the extra to have “room delivery.” And I’m glad we did it is very heavy. My husband and I assembled the treadmill. I can’t remember how long it took I’d guess @ 3 hrs. I was so worried it wouldn’t work... assembling the electric panel stuff was intimidating but actually pretty easy. Best part - it works!!! This is the perfect mid grade treadmill. Definitely not flimsy! My husband runs 2-4 miles 2-4 times a week on it and I walk or jog on it 2-3 days per week. My husband is about 230 lbs and I’m 165  so it’s proving durable! We have not tried to fold it so I can’t speak to that. I would recommend this treadmill to others.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020
CommentsContent: You can't find a better treadmill for the price. The assembly is very complicated, it took my husband four hours to put it together. iFit is used to activate it but you do not have to purchase it, you don't even need to enter your credit card on the app. I'm not crazy over the iFit app for a few reasons, it's far too focused on the trainer and workout and not on the location, feel and experience. You are really paying to workout with the trainer, which means you would be following his pace, incline and time. Thus, should you want to slow down, you have to manually do so.The machine itself is great, I'm addicted to it. The folding mechanism isn't great but it works well enough. It's not huge, so it's not in the way really anyway. There are ten incline levels to the left and ten speeds to the right. Despite it's size, it is very sturdy. Me and my husband are pretty stout individuals and it stays put as you run. I've tested it up to the 6 speed and it holds together well. For some reason, I do feel like it is a bit faster than the time/speed marks. For example, in the gym I can typically do 3 miles in 36 minutes if I start at 4.9 and increase in two minute increments. On this machine I had to start off at 4.0, with the same increase increments and I barely finish 3 miles in 45 minutes. Either way, it's a really good workout.This treadmill is a very worthy investment during COVID-19 and I suggest it for anyone!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I love my nordictrack 6.5si. It has great screen quality for my ifit workouts. Its smooth and I love the impact reduction. I used to walk 22 min miles and now I do 14 min in just 2 months! I love the ifit and it makes a huge difference. It seems really good quality and I use it everyday. With covid I needed a workout from home. This is my first treadmill and I am very happy. The 10 incline is high enough and I've only made it up to 6mph but I'm sure it can handle 10.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm 5'6", 125 pounds and this treadmill works very well for me. It has basic functions but I use the manual mode mostly anyway. No fan.....which is a bummer. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because it's difficult to move the treadmill when I want to store it upright.  It has 2 small wheels on the distal part of the rear support that frankly do nothing. To get the treadmill to move it leaves marks from the front end all over my flooring. I've tried those mover cups underneath the front but to no avail. Anyway, I di like the treadmill so far for what I need it for.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: This treadmill has proven perfect for the entire family (mom, dad, and 2 teens).It came quickly from Amazon and was delivered on time via Amazon freight.  Assembly was straight forward and took approx 30mins from start.The treadmill is sturdy for walking, hiking and running, and has plenty of incline (12deg) and speed for everyone.The best part, however, is the iFit.  I was a little dubious at first, but these workouts have proven a favorite not only for our family, but for out of town guests and family as well.  It is simply amazing that you can hike the Scottish highlands or run the Boston marathon in the comfort of your home.  Additionally, the machine keeps track of all your workouts so you can compare past performance.In sum...we are all very pleased with the NordicTrack.  Highly recommended!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Day to day use is perfect.  Fantastic treadmill.  The only negative is the assembly.  It is not too bad but some bolts feel too tight after starting them. You must carefully read the directions because there are screw numbers and step numbers on the screw package.  The deck is completely assembled which is great.  Be sure to adjust the tracking per instructions.  To unlock from iFit without signing up, hold in the iFit button 30 seconds.  Worked for me.  Some say to press iFit on the screen, but this treadmill is not a touch screen.  Well worth the price!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill for the casual runner

If you are handy you can assemble it alone but I would recommend two people for a much easier assembly. after MUCH research i found this one to be the best value for the money spent. there are a lot of options but i didn't want to spend $$$ for a treadmill but i also didn't want to get something very cheap that may break easily. so far so good....
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Make sure you want this item!  It will take weeks..

CommentsContent: This has nothing to do with the product... If you want this product be sure you want it... It will take weeks for you to get your money back... CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I received this a few days ago.  My  husband set it up for me and only took about an hour in a half.. after using it for the first time I loved it.  I work out 6 days a week but when it's raining I can't go out, this is exactly what I needed to not miss a work out day!.. Easy  on my knees, incline is great, speed is perfect.. if you are thinking about getting this you won't regret it.  It's a great investment if you are committed.I don't need or will I be using the ifit (get free videos on you tube) so this doesn't affect my purchase.. and yes you can bypass the set up.. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my first big purchase on Amazon and was a little hesitant after reading some reviews; however, I gave it a chance. The treadmill was delivered timely, kuddos! Assembly was included and the technician did a fine job. Upon assembly, it was discovered that the digital display is damaged from within. The treadmill motor and everything works so it's still usable. My low rating is for #1 being delivered a damaged product and #2 Amazon Customer Service. I've been bounced around and spoken to several different departments and representatives, each telling me different information about how to resolve my broken digital display. Initially, I chose a full refund which would require another technician to come out and disassemble the treadmill and pack it up..then I would need to schedule a pick-up time..all before receiving a refund and interest keeps on accruing on my credit card. Yes I'm aware I could pay cash but I like my Amazon Points! After much thought, I decided to have the broken display swapped out since everything else seems fine. Simple process right? Ha! I asked the Amazon rep what the process was three different times and he brushed me off stating "please hold while I call the manufacturer" and finally I pointed out to him that I've asked the same question three times and he's not answering it. I'm fine if someone doesn't know the answer...it really is okay BUT find someone who does..don't just steamroll the customer who is trying to understand the process in hopes that they will give up asking. REALLY?!?!? I'm told that I will receive a call to talk about my options tomorrow. When I asked about the options, they were different than the other three Amazon Reps told me prior. How frustrating for the customer and I've been super patient thru this process. If you only knew all the different things I've been told in such a short period of time, you would be super confused too! Do I think I'm really getting a call tomorrow to talk options? Nope. I'm pretty sure I'll need to call Amazon Customer Service AGAIN and go over everything AGAIN especially since the "notes" they are reading are selectively including only bits and pieces of the conversation. Would I order a large item from Amazon again? Nope. I should've gone with my instinct but I'll try anything once. My suggestion to Amazon, in situations such as this, do not put the burden on your customer to fix the problem. As I stated to the Amazon reps, I paid for a fully functioning treadmill, not a damaged one so the burden should not fall on the customer to fix it. Cross train the different departments so they are educated and empowered to respond to customer issues, rather than bounce your customer to multiple departments. There is a breakdown in knowledge, skills, and communication within Amazon's Customer Service Department.. easily fixed. For now, I guess I'm waiting for a call???
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: This is a solid, sturdy machine capable of handling a housefull of runners/walkers!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: With gyms closed due to the pandemic, and the weather less hospitable to outdoor activities, our family decided to bite the bullet and get a treadmill for our basement. So glad we went with this model. Its sturdy frame, pared-down screen and incline features are exactly the experience we were looking for, and at a very reasonable price. Not a day goes by without one of us on the machine. NOTE: AND THIS IS IMPOIRTANT--- YOU DO NOT HAVE TO REGISTER WITH IFIT!!! Luckily I followed the instructions of a previous purchaser (Push the iFit button for 30 seconds to skip the iFit registration process and start using the treadmill immediately.) The iFIT registration is a feature that will lock you into a membership, and it's not clear anywhere in the paperwork you get that you can bypass this registration (they ask for a credit card and you are locked into a several-month contract). Other than that irritating iFIT scam, the treadmill is a dream!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: I’ve been frustrated during Covid because I don’t trust the gym and the temperature  here in southern Nevada  has been over 100 every day since June. Once the new parts were installed it runs like a champ. I waited a few months to write a review to verify all was well.  It is a smooth running machine and I enjoy it much more than my previous-not NordicTrack-treadmill.

CommentsTitle: Mostly works, but customer support is not supportive
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2018
CommentsContent: Treadmill works, but the settings are all off. In English mode, the speeds act as though they are in Metric mode and vice versa. I spent over an hour on the phone with customer support and they told me that there is nothing wrong with the treadmill and the issue is that I just "feel" like the speeds are off. I have used a lot of treadmills (I still belong to a gym (for now) and use the treadmills there) and I know my running speed (I run *a lot*). The issue is that support's tests only test the display on the screen, but the issue I am experiencing is a disconnect between the displayed speed on the screen and the actual speed of the belt. I am quite irritated that they are not trying to fix the issue and basically blaming it on me.  I mean, I *can* use on the treadmill and get to a running speed, but the displayed MPH is so off that I have to guess what my speed needs to be on this machine. I have never had this "guessing" issue on any other treadmill.

This is shady and underhanded but from what I’ve learned most all exercise equipment like this is in cahoots with iFit (come at me, Illuminati). Construction took a little while so be patient and follow the plans exactly (especially the part where it tells you not to torque down the bolts until later) and you’ll be happy with the outcome. Haven’t gone through every mode or all the functions but I love this thing.

We mounted an iPad Air 2 to the treadmill use that to interface with the iFit training app features. Worth the $15.00 monthly fee.Great machine and great value.

CommentsTitle: Customer service not honoring warranty terms as listed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2020
CommentsContent: After 14 months of moderate use, our treadmill belt developed a tear. Expecting to be out of warranty for covering labor, I contacted NordicTrack to have them send me a replacement belt under the 2 year parts warranty terms. They refuse to honor the terms listed on Amazon.From their last reply:"We honor the warranty information that is in the manual not on the AMAZON website. If you wish to have someone come for maintenance on your machine, the cost of the first visit would be $159. If additional parts are needed after this visit you will need to pay for them, then pay an additional $65 for the technician to come back and install the parts."If the information presented at the point of sale is wrong, correct it. By not correcting it, you are intentionally misleading customers. With lots of options in the exercise equipment market, I will not be purchasing NordicTrack or related products in the future. Fine machine, shameful customer service and support.

CommentsTitle: Good machine but some really annoying features....and/or lack of good features.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Firstly, this seems like a good, solid, smooth-working machine.  I was able to put it together by myself (although having a helper would have been nice at a few points) in an hour or so.  Love the pneumatic track lift.The annoyances started upon opening the box to find an attached sheet (picture shown) that says the treadmill is locked and will not start until you activate at ifit.com, which of course requires you subscribe to their services.  They offer a free month, but of course you have to give them your credit card anyway.  In my opinion, that's REALLY bad after I spent $600 to purchase it.  That's my main beef, but there are a few minor things that I think they could have and should have done:  A USB power outlet to keep your cell phone charged; allowing your cell phone to output audio through the treadmill speakers via bluetooth (it connects to it with bluetooth anyway, why not allow audio as well?); a separate volume control for the beeps and the audio (if connected via cable)...if you have your music playing pretty loudly the beeps are just ear-piercing.  Also, I used to have an older NordicTrack treadmill that allowed you to select a pre-programmed track, but then also use the up and down keys to adjust the overall speed of that track, it was great because you could dial it in to exactly the workout you wanted.  That feature no longer exists, you're just stuck with the pre-programmed tracks period....and NONE of them are geared towards a nice relaxing stroll, they are all aimed at people who are already in reasonably good shape and want a good brisk workout.  If you are an elderly person who decided he/she better get back in shape or someone who's doctor told him/her to lose some pounds and get in shape or else, you will have to stick with the manual mode, at least for a while.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: I am SO happy I bought this. I have a smartphone, so I didn't really need the treadmill with the built in screen (though I can see how that would be nice). The ifit membership I thought would be superfluous is probably one of my favorite things about this treadmill (I LOVE being able to select the workouts and the interactive platform & app - will prob continue to use once my free trial is up lol). My husband likes using the preprogrammed setups and is very happy with them too so if your deadset on not using ifit- it's got you covered. Sound system is decent, treadmill is quiet(ish) (I mean...your running indoors... ) half the time we can't even hear it from the other room. Setup was intimidating, but once I started it was pretty easy and I was able to finish it within a couple of hours (used 2 kids to hold pieces in place at times, but other then that did it solo). Yes, would happily buy it again. Absolutely. Very happy. It is making quarantine bearable!!!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: When assembling, be very attentive to where the wiring cable should be located. It must not run on top of the half-round bracket that holds the console/hand rail assembly because that sits on top of the bracket and will squish the wiring cable. Once connected the wiring cable is very difficult do disconnect, especially when the console has to be held aloft by a 2nd person while you're disconnecting and re-positioning the wiring cable. Otherwise, assembly was straightforward. I did need to move the treadmill belt a bit to the left because it was rubbing along one edge. It's a solid, well-functioning unit. Although it has several pre-programmed routines, I prefer the manual option. I recommend this item.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2020
CommentsContent: The screen size (14 in) is perfect and the picture is crystal clear - I worried about both of these before buying, but I was blown away by the screen’s clarity. Also, iFit has been great and a few updates have made it even better - you’re able to choose a ton of workouts (walking, running, hiking, HIIT, etc.) from various trainers. Choosing to run without an iFit trainer is also a great option - the Bluetooth speakers are decent quality and pretty loud and I usually either listen to music (which you can also play in the background of your iFit workout) or put my tablet on the console and watch something using the machine’s speakers.The treadmill itself is pretty quiet compared to an old Nordictrack I had and it feels a lot sturdier - no shaking or rattling around. The only complaint is perhaps my own fault as I opted to assemble it myself - there were only a few really difficult steps but the right side of the console is not as seamless as the left side, which is only slightly ascetically annoying.Overall, this treadmill has made early morning runs a lot easier and a lot more fun.

I really like this treadmill, works well, quick speed up and down and same with incline, something my prior one was a bit slow about.My biggest problem is with the preset programs. My LifeSpan had in the manual what each preset looked like including speeds and heights based on level. None of these have a way to view the whole rundown. If you go to a preset and wait, after a few seconds the bottom of the screen will list a speed and incline but is that for the first interval, the hardest interval or what?? And how come none are speed only or incline only? They all seem to be a combination of both, something I don't always want. I also can't make a customized program as I could with my own treadmill. This is my main complaint but otherwise I am happy with the quality of this treadmill.

CommentsTitle: Solid hardware, Annoying software, Unit shipped with defective incline motor
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Solid hardware. Cushioning keeps noise level down and motor runs smooth. Online registration with iFit to activate the treadmill is actually NOT required. The treadmill is not an internet connected device, so it cannot check some database to see if you it has been registered online. You can easily bypass the initial activation required screen. When first turning on the treadmill, just hold down iFit button on console until the normal user interface appears. The treadmill is should then be completely usable.Assembly was straightforward enough, but It definitely goes smoother with at least 2 people. Required screws, washers and hex keys were provided and were sealed and labeled nicely. Be careful not to lose or strip any as no extras are provided. The only other tools you’ll need that are not included are a larger bit size Phillips head screw driver and an adjustable wrench. Some screws, particularly those that secure the arm handles, will require a good amount of force to drive all the way in. Just be careful to not strip the screws in the process.My unit’s incline functionality seems to be dead or malfunctioning out of the box. Setting the incline value on the console does not do anything. Incline motor does not even make a noise to indicate a jam or broken motor. No matter what value is set, the console just sets it to max value 10, but the incline motor does not do anything. Incline is just stuck at minimum value (parallel to ground). I suspect this may be an issue with the onboard computer or internal wiring not communicating with the incline motor.Not a big deal for me since I prefer training without incline, but this kind of issue would be a serious headache for someone who makes heavy use of incline. This issue and the scammy iFit software is the only reason why I would not give this treadmill a 4 or 5.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2020
CommentsContent: When I received this treadmill it was really heavy, it did have damage on the box like others have mentioned but it’s packaged so well there was nothing wrong with anything inside. One person was trying to lug this box out of his van so I feel like the outside of it getting damaged is a given. My Husband and myself put it together. Simple precise directions, easy to understand. I have used this treadmill twice a day since I purchased it. I am so glad I bought it because of the mixed reviews I was nervous to spend the money. It’s not any louder then a treadmill at the gym. Sturdy. Well built. It’s not a scam when you go to active your treadmill you just decline to put your credit card on file for the iFit. You still get the 30 day trial (which I think is kind of cool). PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2019
CommentsContent: Good, sturdy treadmill, and great value for the money, but the manual is useless- spends more time telling you how to put it together than using it, and there is almost nothing in it about all the features this unit has.  One other thing, the display constantly cycles between time on the treadmill and distance.  I really don't give a flip about how long I'm on it, and I'm sure there are other people who just want the time.  Since I change elevations at specific distances or quit with the same parameters, it find this irritating.Motor went to boot hill about two years after I bought it, started making a loud rattling noise which became progressively worse.  No way to lubricate it, sealed unit.  Called Nordictrack for replacement and was told that they would send out a tech for about $160 to replace it for me.  Told the girl on the phone (she was nice) that an idiot could replace the motor- it's only four wires and two bolts, and in fact I had already removed the motor to verify that it was the part making the noise.  So they sent me the part- I installed it- and now I'm able to work out each morning without ear protection and a fire extinguisher handy.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Scary and dangerous, our unit speeds up randomly!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2020
CommentsContent: We purchased this treadmill and loved everything about except for a strange issue that has made it unusable and dangerous. It randomly speeds up from a lower speed to a much higher speed without warning. We contacted the manufacturer and they sent a replacement controller board which took a month and a half to get and still did not solve the problem. Working on a return... will update with results.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this while stuck in the house(thanks Covid!) and have used it nearly everyday for a few months.  I love it and it does the trick.  I had the Ifit app, which is pretty cool as it automatically will adjust your treadmill to the speed and incline without having to stop and do it manually.  I cancelled that subscription though because I didn't use it like I thought I would.  My husband hated putting it together and things didn't go together smoothly but now it's together and will come as part of the house when we sell someday haha!  I love it and like i said, use to at least 5x a week.  And I also love that it's not a tiny treadmill but a decent size.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2021
CommentsContent: I was able to put this together in very little time with just a little help at the end.  Very simple instructions.  I use it every morning and so far after 2 1/2 months it's been great.  Just fast paced walking for now but will get up to running soon.  The cup holders are nice and big and hold a big water bottle, phone, channel changer... Just a little noise from belt running but not loud like some reviews I had read.  Over all I'm completely satisfied with this product.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: This is a basic model.  It is perfect for seniors who just want to walk.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The delivery process was a fiasco. (I don't know if the problem came from Amazon or UPS.) After waiting three weeks, the product came with damage - it looked like it had lost a battle with a forklift.  The carton had 3-4 punctures, the walking belt was slightly torn, and three of four screw receptacles for the motor hood were broken.  I discussed the situation with an Amazon representative, who wanted me to repack it and ship it back and wait another three weeks for a replacement.  Finally he offered a substantial discount, so I decided to keep the machine (contingent upon proper performance).  My son and I got it assembled (which took a couple of hours), and it worked after I discovered I could activate it simply by pressing the iFIT button on the console.  After three weeks of use, the incline sensor failed, but a replacement was shipped within a few days.  Installation was very easy.  The treadmill has been working well since then.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a really great treadmill. It's easy to use (as far as buttons and what they do) and I love that it is so easy to fold. My dad put the treadmill together, so I don't know first hand how easy it was putting together but he said it wasn't too bad. The only thing I don't like is that the arm rails are really low for me, as a woman who is 6'1. I have to sort of hunch over to hold on. But, I'm sure it's perfect for people off average height. And hopefully eventually, I went need to hold on, after I get over my fear of flying off the back. LOL
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: A life saver during pandemic times. Literally.Pretty straight forward use. The belt slips on occasionally . Presumably do to my heavier weight (though I’m already down 15!)Screen has plenty of videos. The free year of iFit is nice to track but I mostly watch on my iPad.Screen is essentially an android tab but it is limited and wo t let you install apps. It would be cool if I cooked just watch net flux or stream Spotify.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Appears to be well built  model 7.5S
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2020
CommentsContent: So far the treadmill works as advertised.  The base is the heaviest part and you will need help moving it into the house.  But it can be assembled by one person if needed.  I like that it automatically syncs with my Polar OH1 heart rate sensor.  I had to jump through a few hoops to get it to pair with my wireless headset but that is also working now.  That should be made easier, I am not sure why pairing to a headset is hidden from the user.  Not everyone in the house needs to listen to the coaches instructions.After a few months things are still working OK.  I like the iFit training better then expected.  So far I lost a few more pounds.  I was stuck at my current weight for a year or more, so the extra push was needed.Update:  With the last firmware update they added a Headphone connect option to the warm up screen.  so you no longer need to get into admin mode to connect a bluetooth headset.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: bad purchase, not recommended, go to a gym or go for a run in the park
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I am disappointed with this purchase, I am going to list several problems of this machine, first: the machine does not support 250 pounds, second: the machine makes noises, third: you have to pay a subscription it does not matter if you bought the machine, fourth: the machine weighs a lot and it is very big, to put it inside the house you need 3 people, fifth: the engine of the machine does not have much power, good luck if you want to buy this machine
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Pain in the A$$ to assemble but I did it pretty much by myself. The screen is really lovely. Speaker is good. Fan is good. Easy to fold up and down. Wheels are good enough (mine is in the garage on a mat so I don’t move it around). Wherever you assemble it, that’s where it’s gonna be b/c it’s not gonna fit through the door okay? :)It came with the trial iFit subscription but i haven’t activated it yet. I just do manual mode. There are some free guided runs but they’re not in English haha. I like that it has a warm up and cool down. Buttons are responsive. I do run outdoors but it’s way too hot in Cali right now so I use this to do sprints before/after I lift weights. Could run for awhile on it though. Most I’ve done is 30 min.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Almost three months since receiving and still waiting to see it operate
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Delivered four days after ordering. But it has been inoperable since day one. They were helpful over the phone and tried troubleshooting, sent a new motor and reed switch, installed motor and waited couple of weeks for switch, installed  with no luck. The next call they said it must be the controller, waited couple of weeks for that, installed with no luck. Next call they finally agreed to send a tech with the next controller since the new one had gone up in smoke when powered on. Waited couple more weeks for controller, than another week of phone tag to get the tech. He installed controller and had no more luck than I did. Another controller was ordered and another tech came out. Installed another controller, swapped motors and nothing. Then he wiggled some wires coming down from the console and this caused the controller to go up in smoke again. When checking the wires he found three of them burned out. So now I have been waiting another 10 days for a console and controller with no information than in process. Almost three months and this thing has n to moved yet.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Don't listen to negative feedback, this treadmill is awesome!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021
CommentsContent: I prefer running outdoors and needed a little push to be "happy" using a treadmill as I find them all incredibly boring. The iFit technology is so totally worth paying for if you're like me who needs incentive to get on this thing. Although I still prefer running outdoors, this treadmill has been a godsend as I log in miles in between meetings and run 5ks all over the world with some of their awesome coaches. If you're going to cheap out and not pay for iFit, that's fine as long as you don't mind running on treadmills in general. They do give you a year of free iFit to try out. I certainly plan on continuing that membership as I feel it is totally worth it. I believe there are workouts within the system itself without iFit, but I've yet to try those. The treadmill itself is awesome too. I just dust it often to make sure it's clean and that's it. I've had it for over three months and love it! I only wish that I bought one that had a decline too, and not just an incline. Still, go for it!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 14 InchesStyle Name: T 9.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm a daily runner training for 2 marathons a year and run roughly 160 miles per month. Needed to find a good enough treadmill that could accommodate speed work at 6:30 paces. Box came late which created a problem with the installation group. Opted to build it myself which was fairly easy to do. Solid treadmill and as good as anything I've used in the gym. Folding action is smooth and easy. Not crazy about the iFIT software and how long the machine takes to boot because of it, but this is still a 5 star because of the solid running UI and excellent quality of the machine. Had been worried that I should have gone with the Pro level, but this was excellent. At 5'6" the smaller width is actually preferred. Highly recommend.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: Very satisfied with this purchase. I was honestly overwhelmed with all of the choices when searching for treadmills but I knew I wanted a quality brand and I didn't want to spend a lot of money. This fulfilled those requirements.It is a well built sturdy machine that does it's job. I was impressed with the purchase once it arrived based off of how much (little) I spent. I was able to put it together almost completely by myself, just needed a second hand at the end.I usually hate using treadmills because I am an outdoor runner but weather limits me in the winter, have had this around a month now and use it daily. I can easily mount my tablet and watch my shows while running.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: Awesome treadmill (looks, features, functionality) foe the price.Pros: interactive or manual mode, has Bluetooth and folds to save space.Cons: assembly, heavyI did not see the option to pay for assembly so I (very “not handy”) was tasked to put this together. All of the necessary tools were included with the product, but for some steps, (2) people are required and you will need a ratchet set to make things go faster (not supplied).I would suggest to be absolutely certain on where you choose to install this because moving it (although it does have rollers) will not be easy.All in all, I am pleased with the treadmill and very happy with the purchase.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2020
CommentsContent: First of all let me warn you anyone who buys this, do not fall for the iFIT warning that you have to get in order for your machine to run. This is not true. Once you have your machine built and ready to plug-in go ahead and plug it in turn the switch on in the back, and be sure to add on the safety button to the front of the machine. After that press on the blue, or it’s blue on my machine anyway,, iFIT logo holding it down for 15 seconds, your machine is ready to use!!It takes two people to put together, although my husband did it by himself in 3 hours, he said it would’ve been faster with help.I’ve not used it much since it’s only been an hour when I walked in and found he’d assembled the treadmill! Good luck! It’s a beautiful machine!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased the NordicTrack brand for its reputation as a great quality company and product.  I also paid for the assembly of the item and installation as I wanted to start using it ASAP.  We received the item a few days after purchase which was great.  When the folks assembling it tried to put it together, the wrong parts were included.  We called NordicTrack and after a long wait, we were able to order the replacement parts that were due in 2 weeks.  That was 2 weeks ago.  Called again today, waited another long time only to hear it is another 2-3 weeks out.  I have a half assembled treadmill and a large box sitting in the middle of my basement for close to a month now and it looks like it will be another month.  Horrible quality (wrong parts) and service.  I can't comment on the experience with the machine yet for likely another month at least.  Super frustrating!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Keep on  N O R D I C  Track ;-)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Excellent product for the price, top value for the money.The shipment with my NordicTrack T 6.5 S arrived as scheduled on January 13, 2020.Assembly took approximately 45 minutes, did it myself and took my time. The instructions are very easy to understand.Operation and set up is easy and he noise level relatively low.I decided to sign up for the optional iFIT subscription and it is well worth it. So far, I haven't tried the guided and coached training sessions - it is on my to do list.I really like the detailed tracking of the workouts via the iFIT app, already reached 736 miles, approaching 1000 miles.Due to the COVID-19 restrictions, I am more than glad and happy to have my own gym, being independent from the weather conditions. Very helpful, especially since my employer has allowed working from home ...My overall summary: Highly Recommended!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: The assembly is complex but instructions are clear. Thank goodness my husband is handy.I'm so grateful to have read about the workaround to iFit. It doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles but I didn't need those and didn't want to pay for them!One little issue: sometimes when I turn it on, the incline starts rising on its own. I have to unplug it then plug it back in to reset. No biggie, just a little annoyance.

This is now just a basic treadmill and not worth the extra money

   It doesn’t have wheels to move it.  But even worse: I can’t make it run. It has a subscription program that turns it on. Reading the ways to bypass. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I went back and forth on buying this. after having it for about a week now I am so glad I did! I can't believe how quiet and stable it is. I've ran a few times on it and it's been amazing. Had a friend put it together and it took about two hours. I bypassed the ifit program just because I don't like to give out my personal info by holding down the ifit button to get it started and it worked right away. Super simple! My only regret is that I didn't purchase it sooner. I also used to work out at equinox so I'm surprised how happy I am with this purchase at this price point. CommentsTitle: should have listened to the worst review we read
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2020
CommentsContent: The unit arrived and was assemmbled, which we paid for. It was fine until 30 minutes in when the display fried and the unit stopped. We thought it was the motherboard. A call to Nordic Track with a video of what was happening resulted in Nordic Track sending a new DISPLAY and saying it was "easy to assemble". It wasn't that easy. So after figuring it out and assembling it, voila - same deal. Yep. Motherboard. Nordic Track had not offered to do anything to assemble the display and clearly diagnosed the problem incorrectly anyway. They were only interested in ending the phone call. So this all resulted in a return and a really negative experience. Amazon was more or less OK - Nordic Track was a complete and utter joke.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2021
CommentsContent: We just got this treadmill yesterday. Amazon delivered it with no problems. There was a big dent in the box, but everything was packaged so good, there was no damage to the actual treadmill.  Beware, it is HEAVY. You will definitely need two people to move it. It took a couple hours (with a pizza break) to put together. While tedious, we didn’t have any problems.  Going off advise from another review, you can hold down the ifit button for about 10 seconds and it will “unlock” the machine so you don’t have to go through the register process.  So far, we are very pleased. For the price, you can’t go wrong. I would definitely recommend this treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: The GOOD:- iFit, which is the main selling point- Pretty easy to assemble- Fairly quiet- Great interfaceThe BAD:- Will not connect to external device via iFit’s Bluetooth sync instructions (you can Screen Cast with compatible TV’s but only in Privileged Mode. The Smart TV we purchased (TCL Roku) is not compatible)The manufacturer was very short sighted to think that just because the app is built into the console tablet, that their customers would not want to screen share to other devices.  This was a major disappointment for us and something we will take into consideration for future purchases of this type.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: My nutritionist recommended a Nordic Track. I found this one and was so excited. It had everything I needed. I was able to get it, a 3 year warranty, and have it delivered/assembled for almost a $1000 less than their lowest model on their website. It doesn't have a TV screen but it has a ledge for my IPAD. The guys that assembled it were fantastic. They set it up completely and I did not have to sign up for the IFIT trial. I ended up signing up for the IFIT trial just to see. It was easy to sync with the treadmill from my IPHONE. My whole family is using it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2020
CommentsContent: My girlfriend is certain NordicTrack purposefully made it so hard to assemble so that you will give up and pay the extra hundred to have a professional come and do it. Her reasoning is that it's so bad that it can not be attributed to mere laziness on NordicTrack's part, but must be a product of conscious effort.Here are some of the highlights if you're foolish enough to attempt it:-You will need at least two people and six hours to complete.-You will need power tools as some of the screws are too big for their sockets and must be forced in.-There will be screws in corners that no screwdriver can get at. You will need a specialty tool for them.-You will on several occasions have to undo the work you just did and reassemble it a different way.I'm not kidding about that last one. See on step 5 it will say something like attach A to B, but what it won't say is that you need to first move A as far to the left as possible - much further than A should reasonably go. If you do it wrong, you won't notice anything until you get to step 8 at which point you will realize your mistake and begin to curse yourself, anyone standing nearby, and maybe a deity or two for good measure.Once you finally get it built it runs pretty fine. The only problem is the tread keeps slowly creeping to one side and rubbing against the edge. Surprisingly they actually predicted this problem, and there's a good YouTube video online that tells you how to adjust it back to the center. Still it's annoying to have to spend 15 minutes of doing this once or twice a week, which is what I've been doing.One last thing, before I bought this treadmill I bought a $200 treadmill that was (I soon realized) too small for a person of my weight. The only reason I bring this up is because that assembled perfectly as you would expect most things you purchase online would do. So it is perfectly possible to create this thing better. NordicTrack simply didn't want to. I would definitely not buy again, and suggest you don't either.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Treadmill is great. It goes up to 10 MPH, which is well above what I need, and does an incline up to 10%( I think it’s 10%).My wife and I usually just use it for brisk walks with a high incline. We only use the manual controls and  never the pre programmed workouts.  Note that they try to get you to pay for an Ifit subscription but it is not required.Folding up is fairly heavy, but not hard, same with folding down.Setup was a bit time consuming and one of the screws wouldn’t  go in until I used a drill( which the directions expressway said NOT to do).
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I do not recommend trying to assemble this alone, which is what I did. Yes, I did it, but it took nearly 4 hours and every ounce of energy I had. It was easy to assemble for the most part, the pieces are just really heavy. I had to adjust the belt but it works perfectly. I did not have to instal or download the software that it says is needed. It was a great purchase overall.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great Treadmill, Hassle free support, Highly recommended!

CommentsContent: It's been almost 6 months since we purchased this treadmill. We are so happy as we made the decision to go with this. Only bottleneck we faced was with installation, it's little difficult to do it and will require help of an additional person or two to get it completed properly. CommentsTitle: A God send during this time.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm in my 50s and decided to improve my cardio during this pandemic. This treadmill has been just what the doctor ordered now that I'm working out at home. Treadmill assembly was pretty straightforward. It's sturdy and pretty quiet at higher speeds. Only a few minor concerns. 1). The plastic motor cover sits pretty low on the belt causing the user to step on it now and again so you must train yourself to run further back on the belt. 2). EZ to fold up but sticks a little when trying to lower it. 3). Heart rate monitor is not very accurate but to be fair I've yet to find any fitness equipment of any kind to have an accurate HRM. IMO, a very good purchase.

CommentsContent: Ridiculous that you have to jump through hoops with their stupid IFIT program just to start the treadmill.  Zero customer service available as well.  Would not recommend.  Would not buy again.

CommentsTitle: GOOD PRODUCT SO FAR BUT BEWARE
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Received treadmill in a timely manner. Not any damage besides a small plastic piece when it arrived(was insignificant).  Set up took like 5 hours but everything did fit. When you turn it on, nordic tells you that you that you HAVE TO REGISTER the treadmill before it will unlock. This is a SCAM to try and get you to pay their monthly ifit fee. You dont have to do it. If you press the manual button on the treadmill, it should unlock the treadmill. You may have to hold it for a while. Holding ifit button didnt do it for me.  Holding the manual button did it for me. It is crappy thought that they dont tell you this but rather they tell you that "product registration required". Thats BS and misleading and a low thing done by the company for unsuspecting people. Otherwise, the treadmill works great so far(day2) and have gotten good workout from it. Will update if it becomes faulty and does not work or malfunctions.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using the NordicTrack T Series 6.5S Treadmill since day one. This is my first treadmill from this brand, I had two provioulsy from other brands I could feel and see the difference in quality at first glance. The material is high quality, the pieces fit together perfectly when assembling the machine and the screws fit perfectly with minimum effort. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great Value! Quality Treadmill and great bang for your $$

CommentsContent: We purchased this treadmill a few months ago, and waited a bit before writing this review. After using it for several months quite often we think it was a great purchase. CommentsTitle: Lack of product quality and customer care
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve never experienced such a disregard for a customer care process and focus. Let me be clear, the people I finally got through too about multiple parts missing were nice and very helpful in one case. Two phone calls where I waited in excess of 45 minutes each. One for missing handrails which arrived separately by a few weeks apart and the second for the rubber handrail covers that took 30 minutes each to heat and stretch to fit. Unable to get them on fully, no surprise as they are no doubt added by machinery to the handles, I ended up cutting them short by 4 inches. The icing on the cake was when I completed the installation some 5 weeks after receiving it and proudly removed the clear plastic protective sheet on the console only to have it remove with it, chunks of the “satin finish” on the console. I realized I made a huge mistake buying my second and last NordicTrack product from Icon Fitness.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: ARC Adapter likely needed for newer homes.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: Like many of us, the pandemic has caused some restraints with our normal life patterns such as going to the gym and enjoying the equipment that is readily available to us.  With that being said, we decided to purchase the Nordic Track T Series.  It was easy to assemble, my husband assembled it by himself.  The incline and speed features are easy to maneuver.  I read many reviews that indicated you must sign up for iFit to operate the unit, however this is not true.The bluetooth feature is easy to activate.  We are able to jog and exercise while watching our favorite television shows in our home gym.  The only reason why I didn't give the purchase a rating of 5 stars has more to do with our initial customer service experience.  The unit blew a fuse and stopped working.  We have a newer home so the surge protector was doing its job, the manual indicated that an ARC Adapter would help with this issue but it didn't give any other details regarding the same.We chatted on the vendor's website and the agent kept asking if we wanted to return the item after being on hold for over 20 minutes.  We explained that we didn't want to return, we simply needed information on the type of adapter needed to use the treadmill.  We were the told that we would have to be transferred to another department.  After being transferred and placed on another long hold, we received a message that they were closed.Frustrated, we called the toll free number and reached an agent who ran a diagnostic test over our phone and shipped the ARC Adapter within a week.  This representative was patient and resolved our complaint.So far, we love it!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Not for the faint of heart
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020
CommentsContent: From delivery through assembly this is not for the faint of heart. The delivery schedule kept us on the hook for 3 days, waiting for the scheduled appointment to yield results. When the item finally arrived, the assembly process began. First, we received a screw that was deformed. We replaced it. We contacted the company about ways to attach the ground wire correctly. It took a week to get a response. And that did not include an answer nor any assistance, only an inquiry for more information. We proceeded on. It takes a socket set to tighten the screws, which is not in the instructions. And we also took the advice of others about avoiding the scam of IFit membership. However, note that you need to use the key before pressing the IFit button. Ours squeaks but functions, so that’s the good news. Looking forward to using it now!

I have to give a big thumbs up to the seller because they exceeded my expectations with delivery. My treadmill came in a day earlier and the delivery guys called me when I was not home and even waited a few minutes for me to reroute and get back home. They were very polite and courteous. CommentsTitle: Sturdy, great features - assembly is difficult

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2021
CommentsContent: Edit: This saga gets worse as time progresses. I contacted the manufacturer to get the replacement part for the storage latch. I exchanged multiple emails and the manufacturer’s request grow and grow as I continue to provide them more information. After providing them a page of information, they want to know the part number of the item I need. I go to the user manual and give the part number per the manual. Well that’s not sufficient.  Now they need a photo of the faulty part that is located under this 200 lb treadmill. That’s where I pushed back. I’m not lifting this treadmill. I’m not “proving” myself to a company that should have provided me with a working product to begin with. If this nonsense continues I will gladly load this treadmill up, all 200 lbs of it, place it in its original box and return it to Amazon. I absolutely do not need this level of nonsense in my life over a stupid treadmill. All I wanted was a product that worked correctly. I’ve now gotten myself into an interrogation over a storage latch and the demand to provide the manufacturer evidence of the defect. Zero stars is an appropriate review for this item due to being defective and having horrid customer service.What a mess. I felt like I received half correct parts and half incorrect parts because this was such a pain to put together. Screw holes didn’t line up. The left handle was so odd that I can’t even describe it—it was so screwed up that we had to trim about an inch of the rubber coating off just to get the pieces to fit together right. And when we were almost finished we had only the storage bar and clip to install and realized the part we received was broken. So it can’t be folded until we get the correct, unbroken parts. This is one of those items where it’s apparent that each part is manufactured at a different location and without regard to whether it fits together as a whole. I was so exhausted after we were finished fighting with assembly that I didn’t even have the energy to try it. Luckily it does work. But getting it haphazardly put together was a nightmare. Save your sanity and avoid this product or pay someone else to put it together.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: We have the Peloton bike and are huge fans of Peloton, hardware, exercise content and experience.  I am using my Nordic Track while watching Peloton classes on my iPad.  We considered and tested out the 2 more expensive peloton treadmill options.. and chose Nordic Track because it was immediately available and slightly more reasonable price wise.  Peloton had a 2-3 month wait at the time.My family use the treadmill weekly and get good exercise on it.  It's well made.  Sturdy.The heart rate monitor doesn't work well, so we don't use it.  The controls to adjust speed/incline are tough to see in dim lit room, but usable.  Nothing as well designed or user friendly as the Peloton.  Cheap plastic buttons, not dials and toggles.  The LED is nothing like the Peloton monitor.The treadmill works fine.  Works well.  But compared to other purchases in this price range, it's not even close quality or design wise.

I purchased this Nordic Track in 2019, and I'm on my second repair.  The first time I had it repaired it was maybe 6 months old and it needed a new belt.  Now the console has broken and needs to be replaced.  Keep in mind that I use it 5 days a week, walk at a speed of 4.1 and an incline of 1.5.  Save your money and don't buy this version. I've contacted customer service and like the others posted, they are slow to respond (if at all). It started squeaking a month after purchase.
