CommentsTitle: Rough arrival but Treadmill works great.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I’d really like to rate this 3.5 stars but I suppose I’ll round up because the machine works fantastic. Product was dropped off at my house with one end of the box flapping open. Box was very damaged. Luckily I didn’t have any pieces missing. Base of the machine came with a crack in it so it doesn’t seamlessly close on one side of the end where the motor is stored.Putting this together will require at least two people. If you aren’t already someone who has a knack for assembling, I would definitely recommend getting someone who is. I consider myself great at assembly and even this has its moments of difficulty. Have a wrench on hand for sure!Despite the initial disappointment, the machine worked fantastic. I really lucked out considering how it arrived. Inclines all the way to its level 10, very slowly but it does. Ran a little bit at a 5.5 rate and had no problems. As far as loudness, I felt that it gave off a normal treadmill level of sound? If that makes sense? Didn’t bother me, and if you’re listening to music with headphones it should not be a problem anyway. Easy to navigate electronic display. Looking forward to great workouts!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: We bought this because my mom has a 15 year old proform (same parent company) treadmill that has lasted 15 years without maintenance.Excellent for walking/jogging without any fancy or unnecessary features. I'm 6 foot and ~220 pounds and have no problems with walking/jogging, very tall people may have problems with a full sprint. The treadmill is quiet and very sturdy with a clear display.Don't expect any fancy features or for the heart rate monitor to be even moderately accurate, just buy a smart watch and tablet with your savings over the expensive treadmills.Expect assembly to be 1-2 hours and there are steps that really need 2 people.Note: Bypass ifit setup by holding ifit button for 20-30 seconds (only the first time you setup), no big deal.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: So far so good, makes home-fitness easy.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2020
CommentsContent: After years of contemplating buying a treadmill but always deciding it wasn't worth the money since I had access to them at the gym, I started looking seriously a few months ago after several months of COVID lockdown kept gyms out of access, and even after they opened, I was leery of going into one. I had a tough time deciding on a treadmill. I was looking at budget treadmills in the 300-400 price range but every time I read a review it said things like "belt too narrow", "not sturdy enough for running". I didn't need anything with bells & whistles like a huge display or TV or speakers or fans. So I kept raising the price range until I found one that I was able to find the qualities I was looking for. I came upon the NordicTrack T Series 6.5S, and I love it so far! I like the spacious 20”x55” tread belt running surface, I like that it is sturdy. The speeds are 1-10 and most of the time I can't even go past 5.5 to 6 for my fast jogging. The panel has plenty of options to keep track of all kinds of stuff. I only use time, or distance,  I wanted something that could be folded up. This thing is HEAVY - I had to hire someone to put it together for me. Thanks to other reviewers, I was able to figure out how to bypass the iFit registration to activate. I have had this treadmill for over 3 months now and so far I am very happy with this purchase.  My only regret is that I paid $789 for it and have since see it list for around $600/-, a price that would have made this an even greater value.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

   This is exactly what I was looking for! It's perfect, just remember when you put it together to start it without ifit subscription you just have to press and hold the blue ifit button on the treadmill and it will by pass it. I highly recommend this treadmill!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this treadmill and opted to assemble it myself to save the 100 bucks. The assembly was difficult. The treadmill comes with certain parts screwed together for shipping purposes I guess, but they're not permanent screws. The instructions neglect to mention to remove these screws until after you've assemble a part causing you to have to un-assemble that part, remove the screw, and re-assemble it, which is annoying and wastes time. Other than that, the assembly was going okay until I realized they forgot to send me a part. It was the bar that attaches the two handles and that the console screws into, so kind of a key component. It took three weeks to get through to ICON Fitness to get my replacement part ordered. Every time I tried to get in touch, they were experiencing longer than usual wait times. Even first thing in the morning. And when I would get through to somebody, they said they couldn't help me with my issue. Finally, I thought I had the part ordered, but a week passed, and I never received a confirmation email. So, I ordered the part again. A few days later, both parts showed up. No idea why the first part took so long to ship but the second one only took a few days. Seems inconsistent. But anyway.. neither part fit! Both were too short to reach from one handlebar to the other and if even they did, the treadmill wasn't built squarely, so the screw holes on the bar were nowhere near lining up with the holes in the handle bar.  So after much frustration with reaching customer service over three weeks, I got duplicate parts and neither fit. Waste of time. I sent this treadmill back and ordered a ProForm treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2019
CommentsContent: The package arrived damaged. The motor is making a rapid tick, tick, tick sound while running.The belt has a huge oil stain from assembly at the factory that you can see whip around when in use.Really disappointed in this purchase and the lack of customer service.

However, once together it works well and it a great piece of workout equipment.  I don't use all of the features like the incline and the programming for different courses, but it seems well made.  I love the built in speakers where I can plug in my phone to hear music or watch a video much easier than having to have my earbuds in. I did have to purchase a compatible cord to connect it though as it does not come with it. CommentsContent: I received this from my Amazon order on April 18. It did not come with any of the hardware parts to install! Since this was a Saturday, I had to wait until Monday to call customer service. I was on hold for over an hour, and then was hung up on. I got ahold of someone the next day, who put in an order for my parts. It is now 2 weeks later (May 6) and I still have no parts. CommentsContent: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife. We have both been using it. It works great! Love it! The box came in good shape. All the parts were undamaged. Assembly went perfectly. PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2020
CommentsContent: We don't know how we could have coped without the Nordic Treadmill during this coronavirus pandemic. With the closings of parks and some rainy days we are able to exercise anytime on any day. We constantly talk about how ordering this treadmill was the best/luckiest thing we've done to prepare (wink-wink) for this time in our life. The treadmill has been flawless and the iFit programs have taken it to a level we never imagined. Picture (literally) you are able to world travel during this time of isolation and being able to work out at the same time. Well, that's what you get—an assemblage of super trainers to lead you through exercise routines geared to your abilities with the backdrop of some of the most beautiful locations in the world. And the trainers are so knowledgeable about the history and culture of these locales, besides the techniques and conditioning needed to achieve your health-related training goals. My wife and I have found this to be invaluable. You also have the ability to develop your own routines. There is a website where you can adjust the speed, the intervals, the incline for any timed workout you want to create. And then when you are ready to workout it miraculously shows up in your favorites on the treadmill itself. It's like magic, well not really. Your treadmill needs to be connected to your home wifi for internet connection. But that's pretty much it. The only thing you have to do is to make exercise part of your daily routine. This Nordic Track treadmill has taken exercise to a new level of enjoyment.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this treadmill! This treadmill was easy to put together. My family tried it out for the first time last night.My teenage boys loved it and that's saying a lot right there because they hate to exercise. This machine was very fun and easy to use. The only thing that was kinda funny about it we didn't know it was that huge lol. We had to move around furniture to make room for this giant treadmill. It was a good buy and price.

CommentsContent: So far the treadmills excellent I'm happy with it and the delivery was so cool thank you very much.... just one other thing about assembling the treadmill you do need the special tools like the mechanics use I don't know what they're called wrenches or you could buy that and Home Depot for about maybe $20 cycle little set and and it'll be much easier instead of just using like like pliers or you know little pools that you have any in your house plus it will be a little difficult to do it on your own but I did it on my own it took me about 4 hours but if it could get done but it's better if you have someone to help you some of the parts some of the treadmill is how can I save this you just need two people to help you figure it out you know so anyways good luck out there

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021

CommentsTitle: Three catastrophic failures in less than a year
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2020
CommentsContent: In less than a year this treadmill has had three catastrophic failures.After about 8 months the belt control module died.  At that point the treadmill belt no longer moved.It took 2 months to get a replacement part, which was covered by the warranty.A week or so after replacing the module, the walking deck cracked down the middle...the actual wooden deck has a foot long crack caused by 8ish months of normal use.  Keep in mind, I weigh about 150 lbs, which obviously isn’t pushing the upper limit of treadmill’s weight rating.  However, the walking board was also covered under the warranty, and took another month or so to arrive.That takes us up to the year warranty that comes with the treadmill.Everything worked well for about a month, until the motor started making a clicking noise.  Softly at first but over the next week it continued to grow louder.  Additionally, the treadmill could no longer maintain speed and would jerk randomly while in motion.  Finally, it completely died.  The entire treadmill went black, everything shut off and no amount of unplugging or resetting would get it to turn on.Since it was no longer covered by the warranty, and considering in less than 1 year, I had only been able to use the treadmill for about 9 months, I abandoned it.So, I have some additional thoughts that I’ll go into below, but if you don’t care about my personal opinions/experiences with Nordictrack, the above list of problems should be enough to give you pause before spending money on this treadmill.Ok, so I have some additional thoughts related to, but not specific to my series of problems.  NordicTrack customer service is a joke.  I’ve seen other reviewers mention this, but you won’t be able to talk to anyone personally.  I sat on hold for 2 hours before hanging up.  I tried calling a few other times and sat on hold for 45 minutes before giving up...the point is, it doesn’t matter when you call...or how long you wait, you won’t talk to anyone.  It’s not worth your time to try.That being said, the online customer service was fine.  They responded relatively promptly and for what it’s worth, sent me the replacement parts I needed.  I do understand it isn’t personally their fault that it took 2 months for a computer part and another month for the walking deck to ship.Keeping in mind the numerous calls and being on hold for as long as I’d want to sit and wait...never personally talking to anyone throughout the entire multipart ordeal....the single most annoying part of my entire NordicTrack experience was receiving a call from NordicTrack trying to get me to renew my warranty!  All of the sudden when they want more of my money, they have people available to call and talk.  Amazing.  Needless to say, I didn’t extend my warranty.Sadly, what this all means is that I wasted $1500 bucks and the only thing I got in return was a crummy, poorly made, 300lb clothes hanger.If it’s relevant to any other runners:  I usually run 40-45 miles a week..so, if you’re looking for a treadmill that will hold up, this is not that treadmill.TL;DR  Don’t be like me.  Don’t buy this poorly made treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020
CommentsContent: The NordicTrack T Series treadmill has been excellent as I've canceled my gym membership due to COVID-19. The treadmill is heavy and assembly took about 2 hours so I recommend having 2 people as assistance was required. The grounding screw was defective but we had no issues with contacting NordicTrack and getting a replacement screw shipped. The belt can slip a bit at higher speeds, but just make sure to properly adjust the belt with the allen wrench. We did this using YouTube videos for assistance and it's working great. The treadmill isn't too bulky and fits nicely in our basement. It folds easily. I do recommend buying a treadmill mat.The absolute best feature of this treadmill is how it syncs to my iPad to use iFit. The treadmill came with a free 30-day iFit subscription and I was hooked. iFit has a wonderful library of workouts. I started with power walking and now I'm jogging for the duration of my workouts. With the iFit sync, trainers can control your speed and incline which tends to give me the extra push I need. This has helped to motivate me to keep consistent workouts at home. I'm enjoying this so much that I don't anticipate another gym membership post COVID.

CommentsTitle: NordicTrack T8.5S: Great Treadmill, Great Price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had the 8.5S for a little over a month, and I think it's a solid machine.  I needed to replace my old ProForm CS, which after ONLY 18 years of use gave up.  I was looking for a foldable unit, and one that would fit in a tight space, about 38" width available.  This one fit the bill, and had good reviews.The assembly took a bit, and does require two people at certain points, but generally speaking it wasn't too difficult.  Once up I created my iFit account-included in my price was a free one year membership.  I was a little skeptical of iFit, as my old CS had "iFit" probably v1.0, so 18 years ago that pretty much consisted of running dvd's through an attached computer.  Shockingly, things have changed a bit since then, and I can say I'm really enjoying the guided runs.  There's enough variety and skill levels that you can always find the type of walk/jog/run you want.As for the treadmill itself, very smooth belt, good controls for both incline and speed; the tablet screen is responsive, the speakers are loud enough to hear when you're running at a good pace.  Lots of good metrics are available through the screen, and the information on the tablet during the workout is easy to read, and all the controls are big and easy to read.  Ample storage areas on the treadmill.  The fan is nice, it does a nice job of circulating the air.  My knees have become less forgiving on certain outdoor terrains, and the deck on the 8.5S has provided enough cushioning to allow my to run without any major pain issues that I would normally have running outside.The bluetooth connectivity works fine, but I haven't really listened to my music much, as I'm running mostly with a guided run.All in all, I'm quite happy with the 8.5S, and I can only hope I get 18 years of runs out of it!  🙂
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019
CommentsContent: First time buying a treadmill. Bought a used one in good condition. Delivery guys didn't properly carry the item and dropped it once. The package had handrails missing, together with a damaged belt. Tracked out to Amazon techincal support. Best way is to register your product and bring up any missing parts and issues in a service ticket on the support website. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm overall very satisfied with this purchase. I wanted to buy a treadmill so that I could go running inside (without a mask!) for both physical safety and COVID-related reasons. This is my first treadmill, so I don't know too much about different treadmill brands/features, but it's a great deal for the quality of treadmill, with many different incline and speed buttons and a nice screen display. It's not too loud when running on it and it has nice shock absorption, plus it has built-in speakers so you can plug in your phone to listen to music with an aux cord. I used the iFit app with the treadmill and really liked it, but unfortunately the subscription was so expensive that I stopped using it when the free trial ended. I will say that assembling the treadmill was not easy, and it took several hours, but I didn't want to pay an extra $90 for assembly. I did pay the extra $20 to get the treadmill box delivered to a particular room of the house, which I am very glad I did because it was extremely heavy. Overall I would highly recommend this treadmill for the price!

(I suggest getting an allen attachment for electric screw driver or a drill)  I used a pole to prop up the deck while I attached the hydraulic pole.  I held down the ifit button for about 14 seconds and that overrode the "free trial" that was supposedly mandatory.  It turned right on and the belt started right up.  I plan to walk/run on it tomorrow so I can't say whether or not is has good cushion.  By the looks/feel of it it's not that great but for the price I'll just invest in more cushioned running shoes. p.s.  I'm about 5'2", 125# and I was able to maneuver it just where I wanted. CommentsTitle: Just what I was looking for!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: As a 6'4", 215 lb runner, I was having a difficult time finding a treadmill that sits low enough that I could comfortably use in my basement, without sacrificing machine performance.  After doing my research and selecting this model, I couldn't be happier!  The box it arrives in is big and heavy - plan on having help getting it to the room you want it (I believe I paid for the delivery service to bring into my basement & that was worth every penny!).  Everything was packed well and arrived in good shape.  With the help of a YouTube video, I was easily able to assemble the treadmill by myself (likely not recommended, but certainly possible!).  The iFit videos are a great way to get lost in your workout whether it's a leisurely walk through a German Christmas market or interval runs through snow-covered mountains.  The treadmill itself is large enough to run with a full stride, the belt is among the quietest I've come across, and (unlike cheaper, lighter off-brands) provides a sturdy base that you can run confidently on!  It folds up nicely and has several places to hold any personal items you need nearby.  Would definitely recommend this & am very happy with my purchase!

CommentsTitle: Great durable treadmill - not necessary to sign up for their IFIT program which are additional fees
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a great and durable treadmill for daily workouts. Slight squeaking noise on the first day during the first 5 mins and then it went away.My only complaint is their big removable sign on the screen that says you must sign up for their ifit program to turn the machine on. No thank you.Thank you to previous posters for posting the workaround for that. Push down on the IFIT blue icon on the screen and hold down for several seconds until the machine turns on. Viola! Good to go and no need to pay any additional fees unless one chooses to and would like to access additional programs. I just need a standard treadmill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2018
CommentsContent: The treadmill arrived on time and was well packaged. Two delivery men placed the treadmill in my house where I asked.them to. The treadmill is VERY HEAVY, so I emphatically suggest putting it near where you expect to use it., or at least move the individual parts a couple at a time. If there are two of you putting it together, no problem. Hopefully, one of you is somewhat handy with reading directions and using hand tools. There is a hex wrench, but it is only good for starting the screws. You WILL need a better hex wrench because of torque needed to fasten the screws down. Also a correct Phillips screwdriver is needed. The instruction booklet is very good. Just slowly and carefully read the instructions. Don't RUSH the installation. I was missing one little star washer, no big deal as I always save extra hardware. Now the good part, the treadmill is very heavy and stable with all kinds of options on using it. I got it for my cardiovascular workout and not wanting to put a lot of pressure on my hips and knees. This treadmill is perfect for me. You can do a lot of different exercises on this unit if you really want to. I usually turn the radio on high,incline to 2 and speed to 3.0 mph for 30 minutes. Absolutely perfect for me!!! As a postscript, this unit isn't really meant for moving around.  (Did I mention it is VERY HEAVY). I also don't plan on lifting the deck up anytime soon. I did install by myself.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

Delivery directions were a bit misleading with set-up being implied including demo and clean up but I found out that was not true...not sure why it was stated without a disclaimer but that is a separate issue. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I was hesitant to purchase this treadmill because I wasn’t sure just how much it relied on the iFit app subscription, but I needed something with the gyms closed, and outdoor temps of 110 or higher, so I decided to chance it on this treadmill because of the affordability and NordicTrack reputation.  The iFit app does offer a lot in terms of workouts/training, but is not necessary to use this treadmill. There are 20 built in workouts to choose from, or you can just run in manual mode. Any of those options still allow you to change speed and incline at any time. You can adjust the softness/fitness of the tread platform, and at 6’2” 190 lbs the platform is plenty long enough where I don’t feel like I need to crowd the front for fear of coming off the back. Also no issues of the belt stalling, or stuttering, with any footstep landings.  The only cons I really have for this treadmill is that you can’t input your height/weight setting, and you can’t create custom workouts (other than manually adjusting on the fly while running in manual mode).
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Frustrating set up experience - REQUIRED MONTHLY CHARGE
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2019
CommentsContent: Please note that before you are even allowed to turn this treadmill on you are FORCED to log into an "Ifit.com" website and enter your credit card number and sign up for an auto renewal monthly membership of $15/month.  There are warnings all over the treadmill and STOP and BEFORE FIRST USE you must "activate" your machine.  Meaning you have to log onto this website and "activate" your monthly subscription - you are allowed to cancel anytime but this is a ridiculous bait and switch tactic and entirely unacceptable.  I already paid for the treadmill - If I wanted the monthly subscription I would sign up; but forcing new purchasers to sign up before they can even turn on their treadmill (you need an activation code) you are forcing something on us we may not want.  If these were easy to return I would - and I suspect that's part of their reasoning - people are just going to do this b/c they don't want the hassle of returning a heavy treadmill.  Well you got what you wanted but I want to make clear every prospective purchaser - Beware of this forced requirement.  Buy at your own risk.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill. Great value. Easy to assemble.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Edit to add - I've had the treadmill for a little over a month now. I've done over 50 iFit tours/programs and the treadmill is still holding up beautifully. This was definitely worth spending a little extra on, and I am pleased with my purchase! Definitely recommend and will likely purchase more equipment from NordicTrack in the future. - And I've lost 10lbs so far, so that's also nice!Granted, it's only my first day with it, but this treadmill is fabulous! It was easy to assemble, it was done in about an hour. We did need a couple of tools of our own, but nothing out of the ordinary. Nothing was damaged, scratched, or missing. And it's performance was great! I got 4 miles in and didn't notice any issues. And I love that it came with a 1yr iFit membership, I love their virtual tours! Absolutely fabulous!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The 9.5 T Series treadmill by NordicTrack was well worth the price. The price was actually $200 less on amazon. The worse part about this purchase was that due to COVID-19 it’s very hard to get someone to assemble it for you. And getting it delivered in a 3 floor walk up was also challenging. But now that’s it here and up and running, we absolutely live have it. Now we have it, we canceled our gym membership as well.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 14 InchesStyle Name: T 9.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Buyer Beware! We had nothing but trouble with this treadmill since we received it. We paid for the professional installation, but from day one, there was a really loud squeak from back roller. I contacted Amazon and the rep suggested that it may have been a problem with the installation. The installer came back out and took a look and just confirmed that there was a loud squeak at the roller. Then, while my teenage son is running on the treadmill, it just cuts out and loses power. I called NordicTrack this time and they suggested that I get a professional electrician out to check that the treadmill is on a dedicated circut. I had an electrician come out and everything was set up the way it was supposed to. He even measured the amps for the treadmill and we had plenty of power to run it (20 amp). Four days later and now the belt just stops moving when you step on it. I finally had enough and just called Amazon. AMAZON OFFERED A COMPLETE REFUND ON BOTH THE TREADMILL AND ASSEMBLY. I really appreciated that, but I cannot recommend this machine to anyone. Now I have to find a way of disposing of this piece of junk. Probably have to pay to have it moved to the dump. Frustrating!  Love Amazon, but will never order or recommend any product from NordicTrack again.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: Dont get scammed by NordicTrack. Dont give them subscriptions. Avoid by holding down ifit button for 30 seconds. I read it's a absolute nightmare to cancel subscription after your credit card is inputted

CommentsTitle: Great starter treadmill for your home

I also appreciate that the treadmill can be set to a specific speed up to a tenth of a MPH. Assembly was easy (was able to do it with my husband at home). The treadmill was also a very, very reasonable price for the quality. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a starter treadmill, and who may have limited space for the equipment.

CommentsTitle: Great product. Slow, but effective customer service.

After the repair was complete, it now works flawlessly on the incline. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this machine for nearly 3 months, and use it 3 to 4 times a week. I'm not a big guy at 215 lbs, just have a little spare tire from quarantine. Unfortunately, this machine louds croaks and groans several times during a workout when changing inclines. It is very noticeable and causes some anxiety when I start interval running or high-incline hiking. I'm just waiting for the support structures to crash down mid-workout and take me with it.The interface is pretty easy to use and understand. The iFit program is the greatest part of the workout though, since you can select a video and the program will adjust your speed and incline while you focus on the trainer and scenery (or tv).Would I buy this again? Maybe, if the price point were lower and more in line with quality of the machine I received. It is overpriced for the lack of quality.

The only issue that I've had is that it's not bluetooth compatible on the revision I bought, and the aux cord is for input only...so you can't jack in to hear the iFIT audio (I just run the app and the machine at the same time to hear the audio). CommentsTitle: Great treadmill that has helped me stay in shape while staying home this year
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a fantastic home treadmill that has all of the functions, speeds and features that I could ask for.  It was relatively easy for two of us to put together in about an hour (you definitely need two people). The hardest part was getting it from the front door to the basement because of how heavy it is.  My only complaint is the attempt to force us into signing up for an ifit membership.  There were big, bold notices on top of all of the paperwork and the treadmill itself saying it won't function until you register for an annual ifit membership, which I did not want to do.  Thankfully I read a lot of reviews ahead of time and learned that I could get around this loophole by holding down on the ifit button on the console for 15 seconds the first time I turned it on.  Thank goodness this worked because I would have been upset to have to register and pay for a membership that I didn't want AFTER spending hundreds of dollars on a new treadmill.  Hopefully NordicTrak will reverse this strong-arming practice with ifit for future customers.

CommentsTitle: Bad start, but will wait and see!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2018
CommentsContent: We received the treadmill in time and in good condition. Appreciate the packaging from Nordictrack.I gave a 3-star as I ran into some problems, and havent had the chance to start up the treadmill. My $600 investment has to wait for another week to experience the ROI!!1. The equipment is heavy, so you need 2 adults to help with the initial assembly.2. Strange that the pre-attached screw for grounding at the bottom of the Right handrail fits better than the one provided in the pack.3.  The equipment comes with some pre-attached screws. I am still not clear why screws are pre-attached when they anyway need to be discarded!! Maybe there is an engineering reason?4. While setting up the handrails, there are 2 sets of pre-attached screws on each handrail. I could remove 3 of them but the fourth one wont budge. Its seems to have got stuck in the body of the handrail or the threads are stuck. Unless I remove it, I cant fit the console with the screws provided in the hardware kit. I reached out to their Customer Service chat and after a few minutes of online conversation, they ordered a new Left handrail. I have to wait for 5-6 days for that part to arrive.So, eagerly waiting to receive the part and experience the treadmill!=====Phase 2: Received the part but was the wrong one !! I had an issue with the Left Handrail and after speaking with the Customer Service agent, she ordered the same part. However, ended up receiving the Left Upright. Anyway, I then ended up going to Home Depot and remove the screw with a power tool with their help.So far, the treadmill's been running well.

CommentsContent: Great treadmill. The guy who assembled it said it was one of the good ones. He stated that some of them are rickety, not stable while you’re working out.I advise you NOT to use Amazon’s assembly company. They changed my appointment 3 times. Treadmill was delivered in September. Assembly was scheduled for October, then rescheduled for November.I canceled and found someone who came the same day!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Sadly had to end my gym membership recently, but wanted to continue running...this was the perfect choice.  Set-up took a bit of time and ability to follow directions, but it can be done.  Treadmill is heavy, so beware that it may take 2 people to move the box/parts.The only issue I have so far is with the pulse monitor....it only works some of the time...sometimes good, sometimes it fails.Otherwise very pleased with this purchase.  And...it is less expensive than the version with the video screen, but I don't need that for home use.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Easy assembly and ready to go!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2019
CommentsContent: We purchased this after comparing to other makes and models. The NordicTrack T 6.5s is all we could ask for at this price point.I was able to assemble this completely by myself but would probably be better with one other person if possible.The one thing that was not in the instructions was getting the console out of the "iFIT activation" screen, which you cannot get past without holding the iFIT button on the console until the screen changes to manual mode.Nowhere was this in the instructions and I was lucky enough to come across the tip searching Google for "4 beeps when any button pushed on NordicTrack T 6.5s console".One thread had this tip buried in the comments.That was the only hiccup in the assembly and start up.Very pleased with this treadmill!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

I’m sure it would be a little more fun with the workouts activated, but it works just fine without it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2020
CommentsContent: First, when assembling, the drilled holes were too small for the screws. After an hour on hold for customer service, I was told "just use all your body weight and really shove them in - I can send you new parts but they won't work either". WHAT? Then, as we lifted the treadmill for the final steps of construction (every step was labored) the entire bottom metal bar is bent! It is where the metal is super thick, so I don't even know how that could have happened except maybe in the factory, it's much more than someone dropping the thing or anything. I am so frustrated! Now I'm going to have to go back to square one...
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2020

I just finished my 4th week running on the beaches of Costa Rica with ifit trainer Ana Maria. It was amazing, and the treadmill runs smoothly, mostly all the time with the exception of some skipping. Which is the reason for it not getting a full 5 stars, when the machine is at a higher speed over 5rpe then the belt skips. I keep meaning to call Norditrack about this issue because it should not be having this problem being so new. I got the warranty just in case. Aside from that its wonderful and I love it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Defective Treadmill with no Customer Suppor

CommentsContent: This purchase has proven to be one of the worst I’ve ever done on Amazon. The treadmill never worked after assembly. CommentsTitle: Great Product! Great customer Service! Great way to workout!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2019
CommentsContent: This Nordic Track T series treadmill performed as expected and better. First of all, right out of the box it seemed slightly overwhelming to put it together but with the simple installation instructions it made it simple and quick to put together. I did not have any problems. Took about 30 min. My family and I all love it and we have had it for a couple of months now. It has worked flawlessly.  Out of the box there was a small cut in the belt and I contacted customer service and they were really polite to work with and they quickly sent out a replacement part. As for the folding and storage it is surprisingly easy to fold up, even my 10 year old can do it. So far the product has been great, the customer service has been great and it has been fun for me and my family. I definitely recommend this product to anyone thinking of setting up an in home gym.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Overall great unit, with some downsides
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Great unit overall.  Quiet and comfortable except for rails/motor cover.  Motor cover is too close to step pattern when short armed 5 ft 4 in person holds onto rails with monitors.  Arms being square are not comfortable to hold onto in lieu of monitor rails.  With nothing to comfortably hold on to, it is not possible to walk with higher speeds.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Awesome treadmill for any level of athletic ability!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had this treadmill for about 3 months now, and absolutely love it. It replaced my old Nordic track that I purchased in 2002 and used regularly for 18 years before I decided it was time for an upgrade (it is still working fine and I plan to donate it to charity!). The big selling point for me purchasing this particular treadmill was the sturdiness of the device and the online reviews that had nothing negative to say about it, plus the iFIT capability, to which I am now addicted. Due to COVID I miss the ability to travel, and with iFIT I've been able to visit and do hikes and walks from coast to coast as well as many foreign countries and exotic islands. In short, it's awesome. I am also thrilled that you do NOT have to be a runner to enjoy the iFIT products or this treadmill. With the ability to do a 12% incline, plus the variety of iFIT programs, I can walk and incline hike until my heart is content. I have nothing short of praise for this treadmill.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this treadmill as soon as COVID-19 took hold and all the gyms closed. So glad I did. I use this treadmill everyday. I did not think I would have any use for the ifit classes that come with the ifit membership, but boy was I wrong. These classes are great and give me a great work out. I have had the treadmill for about 4 months so far and its been great. If your on the fence about purchasing it, just buy it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: The worst purchase of my life.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I've maybe left one or two negative reviews in my entire adult life, and I wish I didn't have to leave this one. The only reason I went with this product was that similar treadmills from other brands contained toxic chemicals known to cause cancer and birth defects. (Probably the only good thing I can say about this treadmill.)Assembly is a nightmare. I'm guessing they expect you to pay for professional assembly. That's the only reason this could be so difficult. The assembly process is confusing and convoluted. Screw holes are not threaded and need to be tapped, screws are painted over and so do not fit easily. They did not include the hand rails and so I had to get in touch with Nordic Track and request the missing parts. When they arrived, half of the parts were still missing. And when I finally got it assembled, it seems the treadmill is locked and cannot be used without downloading an app. Thankfully, I found the hack to bypass this here on amazon. Started it up and the belt seems a bit loose. Wonderful.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill but not safe around children
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I really love this treadmill for working out BUT I’m really disappointed that it’s not childproof for little kids. I have to keep my treadmill folded up because it’s in a tight space.. and it’s SO EASY for it to unfold. You literally just lightly kick the bar underneath it and the track starts to come down. That’s a little worrisome when you have a curious toddler who likes to touch everything, she could easily push that bar and it would come falling down on her so for now we have a temporary box around it when I’m not using it for her safety. I’m really surprised there’s no way to lock it when it’s folded up :/
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I got this treadmill 4 months ago and it has been doing great for me. Assembly was pretty easy, the manufacturer seems to have thought out the assembly well. I'm able to fit on this treadmill in my basement (not full height, probably just shy of 7') with no issues, and I'm 6'2".As far as using the treadmill, I have only experienced some minor creaking from the unit when it tries to increase the incline. I bought the extended warranty after the purchase, so I'm not too worried about this. Power wise, the speed seems very consistent and gets there quickly. I've had no issues of it slowing down on me while running, despite me being a bigger guy (6'2", ~265 lbs). I've been using it several times per week as I'm trying to get back into shape to do some triathlons. I don't foresee me exhausting the 10 MPH speed maximum for quite some time.The iFit experience was OK, but not worth the 15$ a month to me. I used it during the free trial and enjoyed it, but did not continue.Overall I'm very happy with the treadmill and have recommended it to several friends.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: great treadmill and good value for price!

CommentsContent: I have had this treadmill for a few months now and it's been a game changer! I was also able to hook up a stand to hold my laptop so i can use this as a "walking treadmill" during work meetings but then take the stand off and use it as I would a treadmill at the gym.  This was a very good investment.

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill at a great price

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2020
CommentsContent: The NordicTrack NTL17915 T 6.5 S Treadmill replaces a 16 yr old Nordic Track model which provided excellent service until the motor finally failed. Technician assembled unit in under two hours, provided good instructions for initial usage, and cleaned up prior to departing.If I could be certain that it will perform to the level of my previous Nordic Track , and if warranty service (should it be necessary) is prompt and convenient, I would certainly up the rating to 5-star.

CommentsTitle: Treadmill is geat, but the service really sucks
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2019
CommentsContent: This treadmill is great for $600, it has great support for your knees with the adjustable cushioning and you can customize and automate your workouts with the nify iFit app.My issue is with support.This treadmill worked great (almost daily use) but it stopped working after about 4 months. The display would blink and the motor stop within 10 seconds of starting a workout. I got in touch with their customer service guys and they were able to diagnose the issue within minutes. The console had fried, I needed a new one.They were to ship me the console and the upright wire. The wire arrived probably less than a week after I talked to them. The console has not arrived up to now. I have been in touch with their customer service to get an estimate when I can receive it, all they say is "Out of stock".Waiting 41 days for a part to arrive is insane. It might be OK with iFit, but if you have a plan to get fit, it definitely throws a wrench in your plans.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2020
CommentsContent: The treadmill has good shock absorption and we love the free iFit trainer programs for one year, so much we will probably renew. If you don't want to use them or get the renewal, the treadmill can be used without those programs, despite the reviews. The heart rate monitors are placed in an inconvenient position so we don't use those at all, plus they don't seem very accurate when we have used them. The arms of the treadmill are also pretty short, but probably so it folds more compactly. Assembly was fairly simple, but there were some screws that didn't go in properly due to manufacturing of the screw holes.The one thing we're not happy at all with is that the display where all the speed and incline buttons started peeling almost immediately, trapping what looks like moisture inside (see photos). Not sure if we just have a defective layer on our display, but if not, it's very low quality.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this treadmill in April, it came half assembled, I only had to assemble the poles and controller (display). The instructions were clear and I was able to assemble it within less than 1.5hrs myself. Then I was excited to operate it, thanks to other reviewer who mentioned that iFit account is not required, so I long pressed the iFit icon next to the display and thats it, the treadmill is ready to use. Me and my wife have been using it for almost a month (everyday) and I really like it, I am yet to explore all the settings, but it does what is supposed to. As I work from home as everyone else due to pandemic, I often use it whenever I have meetings :-). I almost lost 4kgs in about 3 weeks (with some diet control too) and I am really happy about it.The treadmill is sturdy and it is not shaking much even when I run, not so noisy. I can easily jump to any speed and incline level directly without keep pressing the plus (+) icon. It has a wide holder that can hold the iPad Pro too. Overall, satisfied purchase!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Get the app!!! Lots of fun.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2019
CommentsContent: Excellent product, very high quality. Better quality than most treadmills I've used at the gym. Simple to adjust incline and speed. It syncs with iFit cardio which is a subscription service, but if you own an iPad I strongly encourage the use of the app as it is very immersive and fun. Using the app you won't have to do any manual adjustments at all. There are a ton of videos for all levels of training from beginner to experienced. My wife and I had so much fun we ran a combined 8 miles the day we set it up. The training videos are engaging and shot from a first hand view in locations all around the world from Italy, to France, to south america, beaches, cities, and mountains. As well as group training sessions. I never like running on treadmills because of the tedium. But these videos are a beautiful distraction and allow me to get a great 20 minute run in simply instead of having to leave my house and add travel time.Set up its easy if you follow instructions and take your time. It helps to have another person just because this is a sturdy piece of equipment and tough to maneuver before it's completely assembled.Con: You do need to activate it initially and put a card on file to use it. But you can cancel immediately. I didn't like this feature because if you don't have a card or easy internet access it would be frustrating for a person to setup. It's really my only complaint and it has nothing to do with the equipment.

CommentsTitle: This isn't what you think it is.

CommentsTitle: A passable treadmill that I’ve used quite a bit. Most features work as expected.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve had this treadmill for 3 months. I get a lot of use out of it and it performs to expectation. However, I have 3 complaints.First, it apparently comes with a free 1 year subscription of their digital fitness program, but they still want me to enter my credit card. So I didn’t end up using it.Second, I find it to be a bit pricey to not have built in fans on the main console like most treadmills, stair masters, etc nowadays do.Third, and this one is the one that actually really bothers me, the heart rate sensors absolutely unequivocally do not work. I can be at the end of a 6 mile run and the sensor reads 65bpm, which of course is poppycock. This part never worked properly.If that part is important to you, you might want to check to make sure that works right away and if it doesn’t, call their customer support which frankly isn’t something I ever did since I assembled it myself out of the box and didn’t want to hassle with returning it (box was incredibly heavy).Overall, it’s a treadmill with a digital screen that has some cool features that I mostly never use, and it largely works as a home treadmill should.

CommentsTitle: Difficult to assemble, but good basic treadmill
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021

I was not looking for anything fancy, but just wanted one that could incline, was at least 20 inches wide, and was a reasonable price. This checks all of those boxes so I am pleased with the treadmill itself. However, the assembly was a real pain. Many of the bolts are impossible to screw all the way in because of the angle or tools provided, and some holes don't exactly line up. There are some screws that come screwed in, that you have to take out and replace, which are extremely difficult to remove. The instructions specifically say not to use power tools, but it is impossible to remove or screw in some of the hardware with just a traditional wrench. We searched for assembly videos of this model online, and some people had different types of bolts/screws, so it might vary on the one that you receive.

I tried to bypass by pressing down on the ifit but it wouldn’t work. So I called customer service and they guide me.  The representative stated that the equipment needs to be fully installed,  the safety key needs to be on or it will not work. So I tried that method and boom it worked. CommentsTitle: Not sure what is up with how they damage these in shipping but otherwise looks great on first look.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2018
CommentsContent: EARLY REVIEW.The NordicTrack arrived yesterday.  After reading all the comments about shipping damage I was worried what shape it would be in on arrival. Sure enough the box had significant damage from what appears to be a forklift tine. There was also some secondary tearing/damage. That said, the device itself had no obvious damage so I accepted it from the shipper.Assembly was pretty straightforward with what may be the best set of instructions for assembly I have seen. The only hitch was getting the hydraulic lift into position. That took some work and expletives.Took it for a half-hour test drive and no problems emerged. If no issues arise I may come back and alter the rating upward. Nonetheless, the persistent reports of shipping damage should make one careful to inspect on delivery.

CommentsTitle: Nordictrack gives you the best run for your money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: We had an older model of Nordictrack that gave us a good run for the money (twenty years). Thought it was time to get a newer model. So when a good deal came up on Amazon we jumped on it. The package was delivered on time, and up two flight of steps! The box was a bit battered and I was apprehensive, but everything inside was intact. Assembly took two people and two evenings, but was straightforward – we watched a couple of Youtube videos and those were very helpful.We didn't turn on iFit. Treadmill started up without it. The treadmill was whisper quiet. And it gave just the right amount of feedback when walking and running. No bounce, no creak. The controls were intuitive and simple. All family members are very happy with the experience and we use it every day. It has only been three months, we hope we won’t need to replace it for another twenty years!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I really enjoy this treadmill! I share it with my mother-in-law, who uses it for 30 min walks 3 times a week, and my wife, who goes on moderate runs for about 15-20 min twice a week. I use it whenever I can about 2-3 times a week for 20-30 min runs. Don't have any troubles with it. Very easy to calibrate belt since it can move slightly to the left or right, my guess is because we all have different running forms. I enjoyed the iFit trial it's very cool to see different landscapes when you run. Don't think it's worth it to keep the membership though. HR sensor doesn't seem very accurate, but it's okay because we all have fitbits. All in all, good dependable treadmill!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I was really nervous about this purchase because of the negative reviews.  However, I’m loving it. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2019
CommentsContent: For the price, this treadmill is worth every penny. I bought this for our home gym so that we don’t have to run outside around the block during our HITT workouts (Florida Mosquitoes are terrible here).The package arrived on time. Our carrier called the day before and gave us a 3hr window of when he would show up, they showed up on the earlier side of it. The box wasn’t damaged what so ever, the padding inside the box seems to ensure of that as well. We ordered just before Christmas on the 23rd and it arrived on the 29th, so we were worried of the “rush deliveries” getting sloppy. Definitely not the case. Assembly took me and my wife about 90min in total and we weren’t in any rush. It comes with an Alan Wrench for most screws, but you’ll need a Phillips Screwdriver and a wrench for a few of the connections. Other than that, if you’re competent and can follow instructions in order, the assembly shouldn’t be hard at all.Once the treadmill was together it’s been pretty awesome. It vibrates a little bit when you really get running on it, but not too bad. Everything works great, the functions on it are great and very useful. It goes up to a 10 speed and also a 10 incline. It has an auxiliary connection to play music from if you choose to do that, obviously if you have an iphone7 or higher you’ll need that adapter piece for it. For the price of this treadmill you really can’t beat it. We opted to get the warranty on it, but hopefully we won’t need to use it. Better safe than sorry though. I read some reviews of people that got it damaged and couldn’t return it because they didn’t purchase the warranty. Thankfully that wasn’t the case for us. We will get a lot of use out of this machine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Good mid-grade treadmill for home use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2020
CommentsContent: First, you DO NOT have to register for iFit to use the treadmill - thanks to another reviewer on this thread, you just hold down the blue iFit button for around 20-30 seconds and it will bypass the requirement to register and pay the monthly fee. Now, you will not be able to access the workouts, but if you just want to do your own workout, you don't need to pay the fee. The treadmill was easy to assemble - you really need two people  - it took my husband and I about an hour to set it up. It works great for what I need to do. On my first use, I ran 16 miles on it and it worked just fine - not as fancy as the gym treadmills, but a great price for a sturdy and reliable home treadmill for a decent price. I plan to use it for my very early morning runs or days when I don't want to go outside. I did purchase the three-year warranty for around $80 just in case, but great purchase so far.

CommentsTitle: Really good buy for the money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2020
CommentsContent: This treadmill is great so far. It has tons of options and the touch screen and iFIT make it seem really high end. My only couple of complaints are really nothing that should deter you from ordering this. However, for review purposes I'll list my minor dislikes anyway. Although this treadmill folds, it doesn't fold completely upright. It still sticks out quite a bit, making it a little bulkier than most foldable treadmills. My husband put this together in about 2 hours while I was at work, he said it wasn't too hard. Although, he did have a time getting the belt to line up perfectly, so that it did not rub the sides. My last annoyance is the plate that is directly in front of your feet when standing on the treadmill. It seems like it should be further back and it's slightly in the way. I think NordicTrack could easily re-position this in future models. These things are truly just personal dislikes. They would in no way cause me to re-think my purchase. I'm very happy with it overall.

I don’t have any pain or aches in my knees or joints and I use it every single day. I’m a heart patient, so I mainly use it for cardiovascular exercise (45 minutes - 1 hour power walking or light jogging). I don’t miss a day of use. So far, so good with this treadmill. I absolutely love the customer service. They sent out a maintenance technician, just to make sure it was set up and the belt was aligned properly, because I wasn’t sure about it once we assembled it. CommentsTitle: God help you if you need customer service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: My machine was sent to me with a part meant for another model, making it useless. I have now waited for a month and a half for the defective part to be replaced and the return window has closed. So now I have a machine that won't work, no replacement part, and no recourse. Amazon tells me my problem is with the manufacturer. Manufacturer tells me my problem is with Amazon. I have now lost 12 hours of my life trying to resolve this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021
CommentsContent: Per title I really love my NordicTrack.  Easy to use, not too big but not too small (this is rarer than you might believe), and surprisingly not too loud.It is a bit of a hassle to assemble, but I would not doc points on a review (it is what it is and I can't imagine how to make it easier).  My issue is that you HAVE to create a nordic account & sign up for "free" workout plan to get started.  Yes, you can opt out of the "free" trial but note that if you will be paying.  Opting out is not as easy as it should be, and honestly speaking it should NOT be a precondition to start using your track.Once you are past this hurdle though, you will love this nordic :)
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2018
CommentsContent: I would not recommend buying this product if you plan on using it to run on a regular basis.I bought this machine at the beginning of 2018.  Within a month or about 15 uses, the control panel shorted out.  After several days of navigating through customer service and tech support, they sent a reset key and then eventually a replacement console panel (which I spent a couple hours installing) and the unit worked fine.I stopped using the treadmill when the weather got nice.  I resumed using the treadmill when 2019 started.  Within a month or about 15 uses, the console shorted out again.  This time, the treadmill and the replacement console were no longer under warranty.  Customer support offered to send a repairman ($150) to put in a new console ($300).  In summary, the repair would cost almost as much as buying a new unit and would most likely only last another month or two.  Did I want to buy a different Norditrack treadmill?  No thank you.I don't know why my treadmill console shorted out twice each time within one month of use.  I was running 3-5 miles daily, enough to break a sweat.  I suspect liquid may have entered the console through the speaker units.  Whatever the reason, the treadmill does not seem to handle regular use and would caution buyers against purchasing this unit if they plan to use it regularly.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m so in love with this machine. I have 2 small children so in the midst of this pandemic I am home all the time during this pandemic. It’s nice that they have hikes and things to feel like I went outside. The app is AWFUL for picking workouts though. You can’t filter and they are by location, not difficulty or time or even activity which just kills me. I also have the peloton app and I have to use that one if I don’t have about 15 min to sit there and search the random categories. The machine itself though is great. It folds up easily and securely, it’s not too loud, and it’s user friendly. Nice size cup holders, etc.

In terms of Amazon's delivery, it's horrible. It took over three weeks to get the package delivered and I am a prime scriber, supposedly two days or 7 days delivery. Their delivery system is broken where Amazon' site texted me I missed the delivery. But in reality, the vendor said they didn't even tried yet.  It turned out Amazon's tracking system sent the wrong text.

CommentsContent: The arms that mount to the base of my treadmill are crooked. They should be at a 90-degree angle to the base, but they are at an 85-degree angle or so. When I fold the treadmill up, the right side rubs against the right arm, while the left side has a big space between the track and the arm. A good product overall, but I am disappointed the product is not as it should be.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: great treadmill, difficulty setting up ifit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2019
CommentsContent: PROS: I am picky when it comes to treadmills (I've used many at various gyms and have owned two others), and I love this one! It's very stable and comfortable to run on, the screen is very clear, the touch screen works great, and the sound is good also. ifit is very fun, there are SO many different workouts you can do other than just running (HIIT, yoga, etc) which makes it a versatile machine.  So, i like that there is a lot of different things you can do with this treadmill, which makes it's fun to play with. I look forward to my workouts.CONS: My treadmill came with a broken fan. The fan is very important to me so this has been a major inconvenience. Fortunately, NordicTrack sent me a new fan (free of charge). It took 10 days to get here and I had to install it myself. UNFORTUNATELY, installing the fan myself wasn't an option. The directions were garbage and not for my model specifically, so I have to get a technician to come out and fix it for me. It will be another 3-5 business days until I hear from one to make an appointment. By the time this gets fixed, I will have lost 1 month of my ifit membersip.I was also disappointed that getting the ifit account setup has been difficult. The treadmill came with an activation code that is basically useless...you have to call ifit and they will get you setup. Not a huge inconvenience, but rather an annoyance. I will need to make another phone call to get my husbands account setup.ifit is great, but I do hope to see it improve to make browsing and scheduling workouts much more convenient.All in all, I would recommend this treadmill because it's great. It may take time to get it setup. Hopefully your luck is better than mine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 7 InchesStyle Name: T 7.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Nice, but very difficult to assemble.

CommentsTitle: If you're a runner, this not the best option
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2020
CommentsContent: What do I mean by "runner"?  You'll know who you are.  Anything above 7 mph makes the treadmill rock back and forth, even after multiple adjustments, tightenings, and reallignments.  My water bottle basically rattles back and forth in the built in cup holder for my entire run.  It's not like the treadmill isn't sturdy, but it's not the same experience as a commercial grade treadmill you would find at a gym.Also - THIS TREADMILL CANNOT DISPLAY SPEED IN MINUTES PER MILE, ONLY MPH.  This should be a basic function of any treadmill, so it's really disappointing.  I know I can convert using math, it's just not what I want to do while I'm trying to get through a workout.

CommentsTitle: A sturdy, quiet and stable platform.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the first treadmill I've ever owned and I'm glad I went with this brand. It's a solid, well built platform. The information screen and input buttons are conveniently located and easy to read. The added value option of the iFit program is an interesting plus. I have yet to use the iFit program myself as I'm recovering from open-heart surgery but the demos look interesting.As mentioned, I'm recovering from O-H surgery where a Mitral valve was repaired, a bypass graft was installed as well as having a hole between the right and left ventricles repaired. the local Cardiac rehab was going to charge me a co-pay of 50 bux a session with three sessions a week.That equals 150 a week x four weeks a month for three months for a total of 1800 bux. All that for three 30 minute sessions on a treadmill per week. Soooo... I decided to buy my own treadmill and save 1200 bux. Now, I don't have to get myself ready for the day and  drive over to rehab in inclement weather. I just grab my T-shirt, shorts and  running shoes and have at it. As mentioned before, the machine is quiet, built sturdy to last and a stable platform able to accommodate the beginning walker as well as a marathon runner wannabe.My only complaint thus far, is that the pulse meter readout is a bit flaky It flashes BPM in a somewhat erratic fashion. Being a heart patient, this was a feature I truly wanted/needed for my rehabilitation. Perhaps someone at support can walk me through a fix. We'll see. It was this issue that kept me from giving five stars instead of four.Regards,John F.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: I do enjoy my Nordic Track treadmill.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I like this machine.I am 73 ,so I don't want to run,but like following the walking trainers between 2.5 and 3.5 miles an hr. or less with higher levels.Obviously at my age I just want a decent workout,but will never run.As much as I love the machine I sometimes have a hard time to fine different walking places on the places offered. I wish I knew where the best walking areas are with the trainers for people my age. Maybe someone can help me.I like John Peels Costa Rica beach walk very much and did the mountain climb in the Alps,and a lady in Hawaii on the beach. Like I said,I am having a hard time finding many places to fit my level.There also is a great Scotland mountain with an older gentleman.  All in all I love the machine as they have changed so much since my last machine of 20 years ago(Pro-Form) which is still working,but antiquated.Glad I decided to get a new one.It stimulates me more with the video. Linda N.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this treadmill.  We have had it for about 2 months.  I was able to assemble nearly all of it by myself, in about an hour. I run on it nearly every day, and have had no issues- the convenience of having the treadmill during winter cannot be overstated.  The screen is bright and easy to read, and it is very easy to switch speeds or inclines.  The interface with iFit was also great when we used it, and I'd recommend it for those who want that extra motivation or to change up the workouts / scenery / coaching each time.The only downside is that there is no pace info (miles per minute) on the display, but through time I've learned what the speeds (in mph) are for my goal paces.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2020
CommentsContent: For one, the iFit thing in general is a scam. I even made an iFit account before I discovered that and had to confirm my cancellation about fifteen times before it finally let me.  I got in a good half mile run to test the waters and it was nice and quiet despite being on the highest possible settings.  I turned it on the next morning only for the display to light up and go out entirely.  I tried turning it off and back on.  I even tried unplugging it while in the off position, then turning it back on, but nothing.  I literally got half a mile's worth of use before running into my first major problem.  I usually love the quality of NordicTrack, but this model truly disappoints me.

It takes a while to boot up from pressing the power button, then I have to press "continue without signing in", then "manual start", and by the time I'm actually running it usually burns about 2 or 3 minutes of my lunch break.  I could just leave it powered on between uses, however, the display remains on and I imagine that over time that may wear it down so I'd prefer to leave it off.

So anyhow, I spent a half hour waiting for customer support gave me a work around. The treadmill itself is very sturdy and has proven to be easy to fold when needed to save space in the home gym.  The tablet/iFit features are very useful and the different programs help to break the monotony when distance training.The assembly was a bit of a bear but nothing too strenuous; it did require two people for some steps.Overall no complaints, well worth the price (especially considering the included 1 year iFit membership).  Would definitely purchase again.

CommentsTitle: Most of the buttons do not respond
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Once I built this I noticed none of the buttons worked except the speed controls. I read other reviews that said you could bypass the iFit, but the Bluetooth button you need to hold to bypass wasn't responding. I figured this was just that the iFit was locking the treadmill so I signed up for iFit reluctantly. After that my phone connected to the treadmill and unlocked it, but still the buttons other than the speed ones did not work. So I think I received a faulty control board. Was such a pain to work through the iFit that I would not buy EVER again even if the buttons did work as intended.... One of the most deceptive marketing techniques ever and should be illegal.

CommentsTitle: Heart Rate Monitor Does Not Work
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2021
CommentsContent: The treadmill itself is good but the heart rate monitor is horrible/very inconsistent  When I called Service they said that is just the way it is and they know it does not work well. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Having this treadmill has been a lifesaver!  I run on the treadmill several times a week during the winter and don't know what I would do without it. I have gone running all over the world with a variety of coaches.  It really helps take the grind out of a long run on a treadmill.  So far the NordicTrack has functioned flawlessly.  I assembled it myself, it is easy to move and to fold, simple to use and smooth and quiet to run on.  I highly recommend it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2018
CommentsContent: I would have rated this treadmill much higher but I did not receive the expert assembly that I selected when I made my purchase. Thankfully it was a free option because if I paid for the expert assembly and didn't receive it I would be pretty livid. And luckily my husband was able to assemble it for me. This beast of a treadmill weighs 200lbs and can be tricky, (we had to take a door off the hinges to fit it in a particular room) so make sure you have at least two able-bodied people around to assemble it and do not count on the expert assembly. With that being said, the treadmill is great quality and perfect for my needs. It also has this pretty neat hydraulic mechanism that allows it to easily unfold from the upright position. You just press on the bar underneath and it sort of slowly falls into place. And it appears to be able to take a beating as well. My husband is a little over 200lbs and he ran on it at it's top speed of 10 and it was able to handle it just fine. My only gripe about it is that it's very large so if space is limited this may be an issue for you, even when folded up and the speakers are very basic. Best to use earbuds if music is important to you during your workout.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2019
CommentsContent: This treadmill seems to work well enough and, as expected, was very difficult to assemble. Before use you have to sign up with a service called iFit, wherein you are required to start a free trial and provide credit card information. Beware that once you select "start trial" you give iFit permissions to automatically bill your account once the trial has expired. THE NUT ON THE BOLT ON THE LIFTING CROSS BAR NEEDS A 13MM/1/2" SOCKET .  SOME OF THE SCREWS THAT GET THROWN AWAY WERE HARD TO BREAK LOOSE.  A #2 PHILLIPS TIP AND RACHET WORKS WONDER. CommentsTitle: Side foot rest was already shattered right out of the box
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2018
CommentsContent: I had high expectations for this treadmill. I had thoroughly researched a few of them and I decided to go with this NordicTrack because of the generally positive reviews.Unfortunately, my unboxing experience was quite unpleasant at first. Even though we applied extra care when removing the items from the box, we could hear some broken lose pieces falling from the belt back down to the box as we were lifting it.The first impression, therefore, was that it felt ‘cheap’. The right side bar (foot rest next to the belt itself) was shattered in various locations, causing it to completely unatach from the belt. The screws that kept it together tore apart. This also caused the front ‘shell’ that covers the motor to detach on the right side of the belt. So yeah, things felt a little lose.With some patience I applied some super glue to the little pieces that could be reattached, but it wasn’t feasible to do so with all the pieces. I’ll have to see how to continue it fix those issues.We still went ahead and finished assembling- good news is that the treadmill did turn on!! That was one huge worry we had given all the hard work we put in to asssemble it.The attached pictures are just some of the broken pieces.It is a little noisy, but I think I could live with that.Now it’s there. Already set up. Now I’m afraid to use it because of the lingering fear it’ll continue to break. Kind of an unhappy customer here...
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

I thought I could put it together by myself but did need some help near the end. I liked how the parts were labeled with the step number rather than just a part number.
