CommentsTitle: This is not a Treadmill - this is a paperweight
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2019
CommentsContent: To be clear, this was not a treadmill I bought, it was a paperweight.  If you buy the treadmill and an IFIT membership, then you have a treadmill.  It is the same if you bought a car, but you can't turn it on unless you goht a service like OnStar.  Any comments that suggest you can start up or in anyway use the treadmill without first getting an IFIT membership are incorrect.  You have to register, give them your credit card, etc.  Also to be clear, you can't contact them with a question until you first register with IFIT.  I tried the phone number in the front of the NordicTrack owners manual and was told by the computer that they didn't recognize my phone number as being registered with IFIT so they couldn't take my call (both companies are owned by ICON.)

CommentsTitle: Saved my sanity during COVID pandemic

CommentsTitle: I love it, especially paired with iFit.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2017
CommentsContent: My primary concerned based on other reviews was that the motor would be noisy. That depends entirely on the speed.  If you want it as a walking treadmill, you will definitely hear your footfalls much louder.  You could whisper above the motor, no problem.  If you are a casual runner and want to take it to say 6 miles an hour (that's pretty much a 30 minute 5K) it's quiet.  You can sort of hear it, but not a lot.  If you are a pro athlete and want to take it to 10 miles an hour, first off, respect, and second off, you will hear noise about the equivalent to a car engine on the highway.The iFit attachment, which I recommend, doesn't come with it.  You need to buy it, and the subscription, separately.  It enables you to download a series of training programs via WiFi including what may be the world's easiest C25K program.  They call it Beginner 5K.  It's 4 times a week for 12 weeks. It starts with you casually strolling along on the treadmill for half a mile in 15 minute (think the average walking pace of a senior citizen) but it ends with you running uphill at about 5 miles an hour (at that rate you could finish a 5K in roughly 40 minutes) and there are no sudden transitions.  It just creeps up the incline a little, then the speed, and soon the fast pace of the old level is the resting pace of the new, but it feels like a resting pace.  You build fitness gradually.  The treadmill has some pre-programmed routes and workouts built in, and the site has a great many more.  My only complaint is there is no way to preview the list before subscribing, to know if it's worth it.  Set up for that was a bit of a pain, more so than I'd expected.I found the left speaker a little weaker than the right, but that could be an audio trick used by Zombies, Run!  Otherwise, the sound system is nice.  It plugs in via a standard audio cable, not Blutooth in an era where standard audio cables are going out of fashion.  There are adapters if that becomes an issue.  There are holders for water and phone, etc, and a nice ledge for an ipad.I like the cushioning, and it is adjustable.  I like how easy it is to fold up.  Mind, assemble this where you mean to keep it.  You're not going to fold it and stuff it in a closet.  It's way too heavy for that. Installation takes two people, especially at the end when you have to hold the bottom unit up to install the hydraulic lift.  I needed to check a video for that part.The off switch is to take the little key off the panel.  You can use the reset button on the bottom, if you've set it up to be conveniently accessible, but it takes a lot longer to come back from that.  It actually takes longer to come back from that, than from shutting of the surge protector it's plugged into, which makes me think it is doing some sort of reset processing.  It definitely needs a surge protected, and I recommend the NordicTrack brand for this, just to be safe.Overall, I'd say this is a high quality treadmill at a reasonable price.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2016
CommentsContent: Works great, easy to set up. I have to create my own workouts. The automatic ones don't seem to offer much diversity and I haven't figured out how to adjust them or even if they can be adjusted. The idea seems to be to get you to purchase another electronic trainer device that allows for adjustment and has a variety of choices. The speed control doesn't do much for me. When I push 3, it starts at 4.8 miles per hour. I end up using the manual adjustment which works fine. I'm almost afraid to push the other numbers for fear of what might happen. That said, all the basic functionality works fine. I've got an Alexa, but not an MP3 player, so I let her play music and haven't tried the on board speakers. I start my workout at 4.5 miles per hour and 0 incline. After the first song I go to 5 mph and 2 degree incline. After each succeeding song, I go up two degrees until I reach ten. I stay there through 10 songs at 5 mph, and then come down to 9, 7, 5 and so on. It takes about an hour. It's easy to vary speed and incline to build an interesting workout. My songs vary in length from 2 minutes to 8 minutes, so using them to time my workout gives me some variety. When I was building up, I'd drop back to less incline until I caught my breath, increased speed for a song, and then increased incline again. I'm doing manually what fancy workouts would do. I have issues with balance so I tend to hold onto the handles. I'm very happy with the system. It folds up easily and comes back down easily once you figure out that you have to lift a little, push with your foot and then drop the bed. It's cushioned on shocks so it lifts and lowers pretty much by itself.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: so delivery was great! And the package was in pristine condition
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2018
CommentsContent: When I ordered this treadmill from Amazon, they let me choose the delivery date and time slot.  Everything went as planned.  They called me the day before delivery and then about half an hour before delivery, and they were right on time.  Two men delivered it and they put it in my office exactly where I asked, so delivery was great!  And the package was in pristine condition.My husband put this together in one afternoon.  He only occasionally asked someone to hold this or that, but it's pretty much a one-man job.  You have to know it must have been easy, because he's not one with mechanical aptitude.  Instruction sheets tend to fluster him, but he had no trouble with this machine.This is set to be my husband's treadmill.  He's not interested in the bells and whistles.  He just wants to run.  His only complaint is that the display does not show time and distance together.  It toggles back and forth constantly.I like the treadmill because this sits in my office and it's not as loud as some of the other treadmills we've had here in the past.  Yes, I've walked on it, too (running isn't for me).  I don't care to use the iFIT app or anything like that, so I can't tell you how that goes, but the treadmill runs fine.  The belt doesn't slip and there's plenty of cushioning with each step.

However, even without cover, the noise continued. With further inspection, I found the the plastic cover behind the motor was cracked as well.Imagine how uncomfortable it will be to make the cracking sound under you while running. I stopped running because of the noise.Well, I submitted the support request on their designated site, but No Response.  I called their customer service on Friday, 11/16, only receiving the message "no agent is available for the training for the better service".  It sounds joking!!Not Durable Product! CommentsTitle: Overall good treadmill for the money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2017
CommentsContent: I've had my treadmill for 4 months now. I do love it. It came with a pretty damaged box which was the evident cause of a crack in a non-functional piece (only there for looks). That same plastic piece that was cracked is apparently also put on via 2-sided tape and it often pops up on one side.  This doesn't affect the function of the treadmill but it does get on my nerves. Apparently not enough to simply apply another piece though. I opted to leave it alone (the damage)  so I can't speak to customer service. My husband put It together in roughly an hour but he's blessed with a bright mind and alot of common sense. I did have to help hold some heavy parts while he bolted them together. That said,  it's a 2-person job to put it together.  It is louder than I would like.  My husband can't sleep in the next room while I'm on it. I don't have any trouble hearing my show or music which I stream on my tablet.  That leads me to mention the terrible speakers! They are just that... terrible.Honestly,  they are absolutely shameful! I will never make any attempt to use them again.  If that's an important feature to you, keep looking. This is not the treadmill for you!  It serves no function here. Max volume is not even remotely audible to any degree of clarity while the treadmill is running, even at a slow pace.  This is, in my opinion,  the biggest negative on this treadmill.  Back to the positive....I walk and run and the transition between speeds is both easy and smooth.  The incline is fantastic albeit slow. There are lots of programs but I'm a simple girl but a bit of a control freak so I tend to stay in manual mode.  The machine is moveable with its 2 wheels but it's very large,  very heavy,  and quite cumbersome to move in and out of rooms. It is quite easy, however, to lift it and lower it for the space-saving feature. The price was great for the features. And at the end of the day,  I get my cardio in every day in the comfort of my home and it didn't break the bank.  All in all, I'm satisfied with the purchase.  Good luck to you!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: I absolutely love my treadmill.  It is perfect for running in it daily and the iFit program has been amazing!  It motivates me every day.

CommentsTitle: Amazon service is wonderful and so is my Nordic Track.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2018
CommentsContent: This is actually my 2nd Nordic Track. I waited almost a week to review it because I wanted to be sure it was working correctly.The first one arrived promptly and was assembled correctly however, while the machine worked well and I loved it, the belt kept sliding to one side and it left a fine black dust on everything. My husband readjusted the belt with the tool provided but the next day it went back again. I was afraid the belt was degrading and would eventually break. Also every time I used it I had to sweep and dust the room. Kudos to AMAZON, truly an amazing company. One word to them and promptly, the same day, another machine was on it's way and both times the shipping and assembly costs were refunded within hours not days. All through the process, Amazon kept in touch to assure me that things were going smoothly and I would be satisfied. And I am. I'm not a fitness Guru, I'm just a senior citizen trying to stay in shape.  The extra programs are great but honestly I don't use them. I adjust the speed and incline to my own tolerance not a preset program. Best thing is the cushioning. My old treadmill did not have it. Feels like you are walking on a cloud

CommentsTitle: Great set up service, sturdy machine.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2018
CommentsContent: I can’t believe I got this for $449.00 on a daily deal. Immediately after the complimentary expert assembly, I got on for a test run. This machine runs smooth and fairly quiet, we’re talking quieter than a vacuum cleaner, probably as loud as an idling newer model automobile. The bells and whistles are all within reach and it appears to be able to withstand my purposes of running to get back into shape. I used to run regularly, now, I plan on jumping on the treadmill to run at regular intervals again. I’m confident this machine will take the miles. I also want to add the review of this model on TreadmillReviews.net is very misleading and unfairly discouraging for runners shopping for this treadmill. That review site states that this machine is not designed for runners. In my estimation, a 3 time marathon runner and a 3 time half marathon runner, along with countless other charity runs, they are wrong. The top speed is 10 mph. That equals a 6 minute mile. That, in and of itself, is fast enough, to not only compete in an elite marathon event, but it's good enough to win. Come on now, you have the presence of mind to say this machine is not designed for runners. I totally disagree. You will be running once the speed gets up to around 3 mph... I guess the top 7 speeds are for really fast walkers.UPDATE: About one month into ownership I experienced a motor failure. This was apparently due to Amazon selling an older model. I called NordicTrack and was immediately sent a new motor which was fairly easy to install ( note, take a picture of the wired connections before taking the old motor out). Since then this machine has performed flawlessly now for 5-6 months. I am loving the steady runs and my wife and kids hop on to get some exercise as well.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: Great to use!

CommentsContent: I'm giving it three stars because it performs its primary function - you can run up to 10 mph and get an  incline up to 10 "whatevers", if you weigh less than 300 lbs. Great. And the price was pretty good. All extra features are garbage.The heart rate monitor is absolutely useless. Speakers are not loud enough to get any sound across when running above 6 mph. There's no built-in cooling period after a run. (This can probably be fixed with a $0.01 software upgrade by the manufacturer.) Calorie counter doesn't take a runner's weight into an account. CommentsContent: It's difficult to give this treadmill a 5 star review for one simple reason, iFit. iFit is a horrible program that is confusing and not intuitive in any way. It will fight you at every step. The treadmill is great. Excellent quality, but the control panel is a complete joke. Several times I have touched the wrong button and messed it up so that if you press the 3mph button it goes 4.3 mph?? And press the 4mph button and you get 6.8?? Then after several minutes of trying to reset the unit it will go back to being able to press the 4mph and getting 4mph...but I still don't know why or how...and I was an IT GUY!!!!! I have had two iFit compatible units now and I will not spend another dime on anything associated with iFit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2017
CommentsContent: This treadmill was such a disappointment.  We thought we were getting a great deal on the Black Friday sale, based on the price and reviews of the treadmill.  After putting it together, which didn't take too long, the first thing we noticed was that the control panel was much lower than our Horizon treadmill we were replacing. The lower height made the view of an iPad or book an uncomfortable distance to read while walking (I'm only 5'4").  Our major complaint was the inconsistent speed/drag felt while walking at lower than 3 mph.  We called NordicTrack and they sent a lube kit which didn't work.  My husband also tightened the tork adjustment with no luck.So, we packed up the treadmill thinking we got a lemon and asked for a replacement.  I do love Amazon's return policy.  The new treadmill was delivered today with a crack on the front panel.  We will return and NOT try another one.

CommentsTitle: We stronly recommend Nordic Track from Amazon, a great combination!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2016
CommentsContent: I was happy to see that Amazon now offers Nordic Track products since my experience with them through the years has been great! We are extremely happy with our T 6.6 S Treadmill and found it the perfect product to help us improve our cardiac and general health. The system was delivered extremely quickly, needed two of us to easily set it up, but was assembled quickly, and it worked immediately. We found that we needed to place a surge protector in our electrical line from the wall to the Nordic Track to protect from surges and ARCs that might trip the breaker, so we acquired an Isobar Premium Surge Suppressor and arc /noise filter available from Amazon to supply the added protection and as suggested in the manual. Great and inexpensive product from Amazon. We continue to love Nordic Track and Amazon!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2016
CommentsContent: I almost downgraded this machine for one reason...We have to use a package forwarding service because we live out-of-country. So, it's a bit of a crapshoot to buy things since a product might have a defect, shipping problems, etc. Unfortunately, one other reason is when a manufacturer doesn't do a basic package check before a box is sealed and shipped, as was the case for us.First the good...--The machine is awesome! I did a pretty major search for treadmills w/an incline and a few extra features that wouldn't break the bank. This definitely filled the bill.--It was great to use my MP3 player and have music loud enough to hear, but soft enough not to bring out the wrath of the neighbors. For me, any distraction while walking, such as TV or music, helps. While we haven't yet signed up for Ifit, that's next. I have no doubt it will be another bennie.--I was surprised at how basic the assembly was. I'm totally useless at figuring out putting things together, but even someone as non-mechanical as I am could do it. Everything was labeled, listed in order, and placed on a sealed piece of cardboard that it made it nearly idiot-proof (I say that because there's always that one person...).--The packing was very well done. A great deal of care and shipping materials were used to protect everything.Now, the not-so-good:Inside the box, there was a yellow sheet for lubrication instructions. It told us what to use (included applicator and lube) and how to do it. Well, the sheet was the only thing included. While someone may say that we probably threw them out, nope. Hubby broke down the entire package before we began (all parts separated so that we knew what they were, putting the waste aside, etc, etc). Then, I went back over all of the packing material a second time before we boxed it all up for the garbage. Yes, we really did that since it's too easy to misplace a part if you're not careful. While this is EXTREMELY annoying, I finally decided I didn't want to downgrade a 5 star machine over some packing wonk's one star check-off performance.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsContent: She wuv's it!
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Basic Treadmill, Don't Expect Much More
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2016
CommentsContent: WARNING: Other reviews have stated that the delivery people will take the treadmill downstairs. This is not my experience. The company that delivered my treadmill only sent one person to do the job. He couldn't even get the package up the front steps because it was so heavy, and he refused to help get it down the stairs. If you are going to buy a heavy item from Amazon, don't assume that the delivery people will deliver it anywhere besides the front door.Pros:-Easy to assemble. It took two people about 1.5 to 2 hours.-Hydraulic arm enables the bottom section of the treadmill to lift up, saving space if necessary.Cons:-The belt moves inconsistently at speeds below 2.5mph. It feels jittery, like it's having trouble moving.-The build in speakers deliver low quality audio, and the max volume is not that great. It's difficult to hear podcasts or videos over the sound of the treadmill. Music listeners shouldn't have any issues with volume.-The build-in software have an additional monthly charge.-Heartrate monitor is inaccurate.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

However, it was not as easy to put together as I had read in some reviews, one claiming to have ut it together by himself in an hour! NO WAY!. It definitely takes two people. I had a friend helping me who is one of those who can fix or build anything and it took us about 2 hours to put the treadmill together. It is a BIG treadmill. It is solidly built. I didn't like the fact that it did not come with the means to lubricate it. I just purchased lubricating packets. Not sure if I am supposed to wait until I use the lubricant or go ahead and use it and worry about lubrication later. No biggee I guess. The incline works well and all and all it seems to be a good quality treadmill. Will know more after a couple of weeks of use.

In order to get Nordic trac to talk to you be aware that you must have your treadmill registered!!  use the smart phone sticker on the display. i tried to do it on my computer and could not get it done. but the smart phone way was easy. Fyi, the housing code where i live requires the gfi breakers on bedrooms as a safety device. according to the licensed electrician i paid $75 bucks to, if i move the treadmill to the living room it would probably work. :(

CommentsTitle: Do not buy it for the features.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2016
CommentsContent: I ordered this treadmill back in March of 2016 and have been using it regularly so far. The main reason I chose to purchase this model is because it has a higher weight limit, allowing all of the members of my household to use it instead of just me. That is honestly the only reason I would purchase this model. Here are the reasons I am not really impressed: -I have found the heart rate monitor has no idea what my heart rate actually is. Usually my heart rate is high (resting is in the 80s, but when I run it is in the 180s), this monitor says that after running a few miles my heart rate is in the 60 to 80 range.-The speaker also seems to get louder at random times for just a moment or two before going back to normal. The speaker only goes up to 16, which with some devices I find to be extremely quiet. Sometimes I just leave my tablet unhooked to it because the tablet speaker gets louder anyway.-About two months ago the treadmill began to squeak and I can't figure out why. The belt does not need lubricant and it squeaks on and off. If it is changing the incline the noise stops, after a minute or two it comes back. It usually squeaks every step, but sometimes it randomly stops and I think it fixed its self. Then it will start back up for no reason. I am honestly baffled as to what is causing this noise and have no idea how to fix it.All in all, I would only buy this if you require a higher weight limit (this machine is limited to 300 pounds where most cheaper units are 250 pounds). The other features on it seem to be vastly lacking.

CommentsTitle: Very sturdy, very heavy treadmill but well built.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2016
CommentsContent: It's a great treadmill for the price. The construction is very sturdy and the electronics are sufficient for customizing your own workout. It was well packed in the box and it's VERY HEAVY. The delivery guys said it felt like it weighs a lot more than 200 pounds. I can see why it had to be delivered by common carrier. It took me about 2 hours to put it together and that was a workout in itself. The instructions were very clear and the hardware was shrink wrapped and numbered according to the steps in the assembly manual. The hardware includes the key but you will need a phillips screwdriver and some wire cutters to clip the zip ties from some of the packing material, and there will be a lot of packing material. The unit doesn't look that big in the video but it's really HUGE, so it's not really suitable if you have a small apartment. There are some design issues that can be improved. The display and stands could be improved to allow it to collapse or removed for easier storage. The unit only has 2 wheels and if you're moving it in one direction then only one person is required, but to move it in the opposite direction you'll need help. It you look at the end of the video, it shows the model lifting the base with no effort. What is not shown is that the reason it's so easy is due to the gas charged strut like you see on the hoods and trunks of cars. Moving the base to the ground is very easy and the strut will ease it to the ground with no hands.The base is extremely heavy without the strut. I estimate that about 95% of the total weight is in the base which is at least 200 pounds. The weight alone gives the impression that it is a really solid piece of equipment on par with commercial models. The instructions don't go anywhere near a workout routine. You will have to do your own research based on your own fitness level and goals. It is compatible with iFit but that's an expensive endeavor. Once assembly is done then you are on your own in regards to a suitable workout routine. As far as the electronics, there are no input parameters for gender, height, weight, age, and fitness level, so I don't know how the calorie burner could possibly be anywhere near accurate. Considering that other more expensive NordicTrack models this one is very good for the price.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2016
CommentsContent: Update: I’ve now had this treadmill for over 4 years and love it! It’s still working great and I love the no-slam feature for releasing it after I’ve had it folded up. I now have a TV with my treadmill soo I don’t use the speakers, and never got the iFit to work like I was hoping, but for a just a good treadmill with incline I love it!Review from 2016:  Overall I enjoy this treadmill so far. The right side plastic cover at the bottom of the treadmill was broken when it arrived at my house, but the treadmill works great besides this cosmetic fracture. It has instructions regarding how to lubricate the belt, but it doesn't come with the applicator and lubricant to perform this. It also doesn't have the best instructions, and I have yet been able to figure out how to connect my IPad - IFit program to work with the treadmill. I know it is possible, and I plan to search YouTube for clear directions.The only true complaint I have about this treadmill is that the speakers are very quiet. When I am walking I am able to hear the music, but when I am running and have the music turned up all the way, I can barely hear it. I prefer louder music and better speakers, as the belt is about equivalently loud to the speakers when running. I have enjoyed several runs on it so far, and am pleased. I hope that this treadmill lasts me a couple years.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a negative review.I wish I hadn't bought it sight unseen. It is poorly designed in the following ways.  I am a 5'8 woman with fairly long arms. However the short stubby hand bars on the side are too short for comfort.  My hands have to be resting on the outer edge of the bars and even then the tips of my sneakers hit the edge on the protective cover over the belt.  Thus every time my sneaker hits the cover there is a clatter. If you are running you have to step back in order not to hit the protective cover.  When you step back you are out of range for grasping the side bars.  This is a potentially dangerous situation. In addition the hand bars are not designed for easy grasping, they are short, thick, tapered, and smooth.Another design flaw is that when holding the cross bar where  you place your hands to have information transmitted  regarding heart rate etc. it requires that you stand fairly close to the front of the machine, thus more clatter when your sneaker hits the protective cover.  My husband has the same difficulty with both situations I have described.I am appalled that a company with a reputation for quality and design slipped up this way. Given the cost of the machine it is even more reprehensible. Unfortunately Nordic Track is not shown in most sports stores store anymore, according to the company representative I talked with.What I like about the machine is it is sturdy, the belt is wide and it is quiet.

CommentsTitle: The tereadmill is fine but the delivery service has left fuming mad.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2017
CommentsContent: The treadmill is functioning as expected.  I've only had it a couple weeks and everything works as advertised, but the delivery service left me angry.  Since they give a 12 hour window, 9am to 9pm, I had my elderly mother stay at the house to sign for the delivery.  She opened the door and said to put the box just inside the door, as the shipping rules stated they were only responsible to bring the box inside the threshold of the house.  They flat our refused to bring the package into the house then lied and said they were not allowed to enter.  When she asked again to bring it in they were rude to her and, as she put it, "yelled at her" for asking.  Keep in mind this package is very large and nearly 200 lbs.  I wish I had been there to defend her from this lazy, bullying behavior but I have a feeling they would not have acted like that for me nor would I put up with it.  Its sad to see employees taking advantage of elderly people because they know they are more timid and less likely to argue.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2016
CommentsContent: So far I have been pretty impressed with this product.  I spent a lot of time going between this one and a newer, spiffier model, and decided to forego some of the bells and whistles to save myself some money, hoping I was not also sacrificing quality.  When the product arrived, Amazon delivered within 20 minutes of their top-end estimate, which was REALLY nice.  This is heavy (somewhere around 200lbs), especially on the end with the motor, so I would definitely recommend two people to carry it and to assemble it. My husband and I were able to unbox, move the pieces from our garage and into the house, and assemble within an hour.  Everything worked great when we turned it on without any hiccups.  This is not exciting in its digital display or it's programming options, but it's not total bare-bones, either.  I am usually watching something on my ipad while running so I don't care much about the lack of a screen to capture my attention, but the speakers on this unit are definitely lacking in output.  I end up just using my bluetooth speaker and set it next to the machine instead of using the jack.  I am a recreational runner, usually running 3 miles or doing moderate sprint work/intervals.  For myself, this machine most definitely meets my needs and I am very happy with it.  I haven't purchased the optional IFIT or whatever it is to use with it and just boop the buttons manually and don't do much with the included program options.  It's a comfortable run and that makes me happy.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2016
CommentsContent: I was in pulmonary therapy for a while  and once it stopped I noticed a difference in my breathing and lung function. So I decided to purchase a treadmill. I didn't want the best machine out there and I sure didn't want a cheap one. I came across this one being middle of the price range and being a brand name I have hear of, I decided to buy it. It was delivered buy a guy in a truck and in my case I had to help unload it and bring it in the house. Remember I have lung problems and I'm trying to help carry a 200 pound machine up a bunch of stares to get to my door. So have someone available to help you out. The idea was to put the treadmill in an upstairs second bedroom.....yeah not happing. Now I have a treadmill in my living room. Thinking this really is not a bad idea because I have no excuses for not using it. My lung function has increased, I can now walk faster than 1.5 mph and I have lost 30 pounds. Not bad for buying this back in august of this year. Like others have said it did not come with lube but, there is a sheet that says it don't need it. I highly recommend this treadmill.

CommentsTitle: RATING ON DELIVERY AND PURCHASED ASSEMBLY ONLY (Assembly notes included)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2016
CommentsContent: First, on DELIVERY.  They showed up when scheduled and called ahead.  All good.  Unfortunately, they do not bring the box inside of the house.  I had my mother (80 years old) wait for delivery.  I assumed they would at least carry it inside of the door.  Nope.  They are only required to leave it at the door, outside of the house.  Thankfully, an incentive can still be used to get help (read not a free delivery).Second, on PURCHASED ASSEMBLY.  My appointment was Thursday morning between 8 and 11.  I wake up to an email from the company that they have rescheduled for between 2 and 5.  Well, how convenient for them!  Fortunately, I was able to move my personal schedule around to accommodate the new time.  As it turns out, that was unnecessary.  They never showed or called.  I spoke with Amazon Customer Service who said they would work on getting someone in.  No emails, no calls.  I go online and see that my rescheduled appointment was made without consulting me for a week later than initially scheduled.  That didn't work for me.So, I ASSEMBLED MYSELF.  Let's do introductions...  I am a moderately fit single woman.  I grew up trailing my father around the house fixing things, and have a tool bench.VERY TOUGH ALONE I managed to assemble this myself, but would highly recommend having a second set of hands.  I was able to use pieces of wood to lever things in upright fashion, but it would be safer to have someone hold things in place.PIECES AND INSTRUCTIONS ARE GOOD AND EASY TO FOLLOW.  A couple of pertinent notes.When installing the HANDRAIL (step 6 in my version), there are 2 bolts in them.  These get in the way.  They tell you to remove them later (step 8 in my version).  They should tell you in step 6.The CROSSRAIL was attached to the console in my shipment.  It is a little confusing when looking at the instructions and not finding a separate piece.  You can just pluck it out of the console.The LATCH CROSSBAR can be put on upside down (guess how I figured this out! ;).  There is a sticker to show which side goes toward the belt, but you need to make sure that the holes are toward the ground to attach it to the STORAGE LATCH.Hope this helps!  The machine itself is relatively easy to assemble and based on a quick start and test looks great.  I will add more on performance later, but thought this was critical to know when ordering.  It took me 2.5-3 hours while multitasking (coffee and conference calls).

CommentsContent: This company is as slimy as they come as referenced by hundreds of reviews on this Facebook page alone. We bought a NordicTrack Treadmill 4 years ago, we like it when it works but has broken several times and is under warranty. On our latest issue we called NoridcTrack as we have before and the representative asked if we could video chat so he could examine the problem more closely. We complied, he instructed me to start taking certain part of the treadmill apart so he could look at  the components, I foolishly complied  even though I had  no obligation to take my tools to a product under warranty.After about a half hour the representative realized out treadmill was in the garage. Yes-it’s in the back room of a temperature controlled garage in as area set up as a gym. He immediately canceled our warranty based on “Unsuitable environmental conditions.” What an invasion of privacy after we agree’d to a video chat. He refused to let me talk to a supervisor or send someone out to reassemble the now dismantled machine that now doesn’t work at all based on his instructions. He then discontinued the phone call. This company is for profit only, be warned.

CommentsTitle: Nordick Track trades product quality/customer satisfaction for short-term profit
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2019
CommentsContent: Earnestly, I'd give about a 2 and a half star rating, but who reads 2-3 star reviews when trying to figure out what's objectively wrong?Issues:1. So Nordick Track is a household name-brand, and they've decided to capitalize on that getting rid of the sturdy metal frames that established their brand and convert to cheap, flimsy made-in-China plastics. I assembled it out of the box and found the plastic frame pieces all warped and ill-fitting with random corners and edges popping out. Customer Support did get around to sending out a technician (due to other issues) who professionally assembled it with newly mailed replacement plastic frame pieces... and there's still unjoined corners that stick out and look like garbage. Congratulations on saving a few dollars on materials while sacrificing product quality NT.2. My heart rate monitor will not work, and Nordick Track says it's a feature, not a bug. Giving me readings of 44 (bradycardia), then 10 seconds later 163 (tachycardia), then back down to the 60's, then who knows where. Either my treadmill is malfunctioning or I need a pacemaker. If NT had advertise it as a random number generator, I wouldn't have a complaint, but they very clearly brag how their smart system utilizes your heart rate and other metrics to science, but garbage in, garbage out. I contacted them multiple times, they tried replacing the heart rate bar, that didn't work, they did the math on shipping a new console, decided that was too expensive, tried to buy me off with a chest strap heart monitor (wat?), then ultimately decided to piss on me and tell me it's raining. "You can't expect medical grade accuracy," that was their line. So my heartrate is somewhere between 44 and 163, well thanks, that covers just about the range of survivable human heart rates, thanks NT. It's bull**** and insulting. Nordic Track did their best to convince me they're incapable of designing a functioning treadmill instead of paying to ship a replacement console, but I'm not as stupid as they clearly think I am.3. You'll notice the absence of a convenient tray for a book or a tablet present in earlier models, they even designed their heart rate bar to be rounded to ensure anything you try and rest  on it ends up falling to the ground (so, smart phones, tablets, enjoy shattered screens.) Now why would they possibly do that? Previous versions had it? Could it be that they're moving to a subscription model for their iFit content? Maybe they want to make it difficult for you to provide your own jogging distraction material so they can sell you theirs at $468 a year. Sure they give you a year free, what better way to get you hooked on their product. It's a cynical cash-grab, taking away functionality to breed dependence.Somewhere, corporate efficiency experts are advising companies to cut corners, convert to plastics, out-source labor, engage in shady micro-transactions, and otherwise squeeze every last dollar out of their cow-like consumer base. If we as consumers want to be treated any better, we have to hold them accountable, change the mathematics and demonstrate that their are consequences for underestimating your customers. Otherwise, shoddy, valueless products will be the future. Millenials are a lot of things, and willing to see through corporate exploitation, finding offense with crooked business practices, adjusting their spending preferences accordingly, and communicating their dissatisfaction to other potential consumers within their peer group numbers among them.*sigh*As for objective strengths, it hasn't broken yet (I've had it for a few months now, so that isn't saying much), it feels good to run on, the fan is strong, my children love the music selection, iFit programming is legitimately engaging and productive for quality workouts.A feature I would like to see would be a boom arm in the console that can raise, lower, tilt the embedded tablet. Only having one small screen at a fixed distance and angle is very limiting (although, an excellent impetus to have people pay $1,000 more dollars for the larger embedded tablet that probably costs $20 more in fabrication costs, sorry, I can't stop myself)At the end of the day, it comes down to what $1,400 means to you. If it's nothing to you, chump change, and you just want a cheap, enjoyable play treadmill you have very few expectations of? Go for it. If $1,400 means a lot to you, and you think such a sum qualifies as an investment for your future, be prepared to be very disappointed.

CommentsTitle: INFERIOR quality...HORRENDOUS customer service...HORRIBLE "white glove" delivery.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I ordered the white glove delivery service, which included assembly of the treadmill.  After they left, I reviewed the user's manual and found MULTIPLE assembly errors.  Some that may be potential safety hazards.  I discovered multiple screws missing, star washers not installed, screws over torqued, and the plastic housing overlapped and not properly seated.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, the power cord was not fully placed inside the right support arm and the wire was pinched between the frame and the bottom metal base.  It does not appear that the ground wire was properly attached.  My wife and I have unplugged the unit due to a concern for potential fire hazard or electrical issue(s).I was going to dissemble the unit myself and assemble correctly, however I discovered that the "Patch screws" used to attach the crossbar to the left and right uprights had been completely stripped.  The manual states in several places not to use power tools for assembly.  A power drill was used throughout the assembly process by the delivery personnel.  The "Patch screws"  will need to be cut for removal.  Not certain what else is missing or improperly instaled, as I could not disassemble the unit.Before unplugging, attempted to use the treadmill, but found it to be VERY unstable.  Not certain if that is due to the inept installation or the unit itself.  The other unit we had started smoothly.  This treadmill JERKS abruptly when it starts and stops.  Concerned about wrenching my back and/or knees.  Also discovered that you CAN NOT access the (50) preinstalled programs.  A complaint has been sent to customer service and waiting for a response.  We are requesting a replacement.  DO NOT use the NordicTrack website or their "white glove" delivery service at $259.00.  Amazon is much cheaper.  Amazon lists a (4) hour assembly time for their service.  The delivery people from Ryder were in and out in 30 minutes.

CommentsTitle: Great buy one of the best on the market. Do your research and be patient with delivery times.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2019
CommentsContent: For this price I think it was great! I researched for about two months, looking for a treadmill that was within my price range and had everything i wanted: automatic incline, good for long legs, touch screen, not too loud, foldable.  I’m 7 1/2 months pregnant and put it together myself. I’m 5”9 and the length of the track is great. I waited a few weeks to write this review after setup/use to make sure it was honest. The package upon initial arrival was heavy. Luckily the delivery guy brought it inside my house (small front stairs) without paying that extra $40 fee that they charge to bring it inside and not leave it on the front step (you can usually just give the delivery people a cash tip and they’ll do it without the fee). The package itself was a bit torn or holes in some places. I didn’t take off any stars for that because that’s a delivery problem not Nordic’s. My treadmill wasn’t broken or cracked like other reviews. It took me like three hours to put together. I used a tall chair for the parts that it said to use another person to hold certain parts while you screw in. Took off one star during this because one bolt in the front wouldn’t screw in. The pre made whole was too big. They also didn’t include the tool needed to tighten the front bolts. I have a standard tool box that didn’t come with the wrench size needed and I had to order it off amazon. I followed the given manufacturer manual to assemble and also followed along with a YouTube video from a professional that gave me tips and tricks, highly recommended.The iFit was included free for a year which I actually enjoy. I set it up before I turned on the treadmill. I love the programs and the ability to run with a trainer. This system is constantly updating itself and bug fixes which is nice. It records all your runs and progress too. I’m not a marathon runner by any means, I just enjoy the daily 30 minute run so it works for me. The treadmill isn’t very loud. My infant daughter can’t hear it down the hall when i run in the mornings. The manual does suggest a surge protector so I would definitely pick one of those up before the treadmill comes. The treadmill also comes with “springs” that help create a bounce while you run. You wouldn’t notice it at all if they weren’t bright orange. However; I’m in love with them. My knees and hips usually hurt from running longer runs or too many days in a row. This seriously takes that away! It’s awesome. You’re not constantly coming down on hard surfaces like cement. I think of it like shocks for a Jeep.I ordered this treadmill off the Nordic site because after some googling I found coupons and they offered better iFit membership deals. I also sprung for the model with the bigger touch screen. Totally worth it. It took over a month to get to me after ordering, which wasn’t an issue after reading other reviews and mentally preparing for that. Don’t expect it within a week.This is just my personal opinion so if you’re some professional runner and think my opinion is garbage, don’t be a snob and comment. *insert nobody cares gif*
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Great treadmill at a fair price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I’m really surprised by all the negative reviews! We receive our 8.5s, assembled it ourselves in about 2-3 hours (CAREFULLY follow the directions) and have been using it for almost a week now. We received a gift card with our purchase with a code for the free year of iFit and have enjoyed it as well! Unsure if we’ll keep it after the year, but have liked it so far. We also found a video on how to fully use the screen and Android system functionality to better serve our workout preferences.This was an upgrade from a (very) old treadmill from a cheaper brand and I’m very happy with the upgrade! I would absolutely recommend this treadmill for low to moderate in-home workouts! For reference, we use our treadmill (2 people) for brisk walking, jogging and running/strength training almost daily.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Didn't like the advertisement style but....
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2020
CommentsContent: So despite deciding not to buy this product, I simply couldn't find anything comparable for the price. Especially not with the trusted brand name. so even though I hated the nonsense they were doing with the ifit, I ordered it anyway. So minus one star because of the iFit controversy, it's amazing how much work they've went to to convince you you can't use this thing without iFit. Seriously, a giant stop sign 8 in across right on the front of the machine that says "stop, your machine is locked, you must register with iFit" See the picture. A total lieSo if you're wondering if the other people are correct, they are, you do not need ifit. Place the magnetic safety turn off switch in place, hold down the iFit button for 30 seconds. Machine never asks again, works perfectly. What's funny is, I wanted to try ifit. DummiesOkay, minus second star because of assembly. Yeah I knew it would be a complicated assembly, and that's fine. But I do expect things to fit better. I guess that's just the price we pay for still relying on China to build our products, and yes I know, that will never change. So just remember not to tighten things up until you've got all the screws started other than alignment things it really doesn't go together too bad.If I haven't changed this rating, the equipment works fine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Warning: iFit not necessary to activate!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2020
CommentsContent: While the treadmill seems like a sturdy piece of exercise equipment and so far seems to run well, we were disgusted by NordicTrack force feeding the iFit subscription and extended warranty to the consumer.  First, it is not necessary to activate the treadmill using iFit, but NordicTrack says nothing about that in their directions, preferring to push the iFit subscription instead by claiming that the user must go through the activation process using iFit, which, after the free month costs $15 a month.  We had to find out via the internet how to activate without iFit.  After spending $600 dollars for the equipment, why should we have to pay to activate it?  Second, in order to simply register the treadmill, you have to bypass their extended warranty offers, which cost money.  It is not intuitive as to where you go to simply register for the basic warranty.  You have to poke around the website to figure out how to register without giving them your credit card! Both of these things are, to my mind, scamming the consumer.  The equipment seem sturdy, moves well, etc, but NordicTrack is not doing themselves any favors by pushing the iFit activation the way they do.  It certainly did not set well with us.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I know we are in a pandemic but I wouldn't anticipate a new treadmill belt to snap at the seam after 6 months. The only reason I got this model is because I can't fit a huge one i my home. I am beyond disappointed. I am stuck with this thing and there will never be another belt available while the warranty is good until 2/11/2021. I will never buy equipment from iconfitness again. 6 months for $1300. I am going to have to get this hunk of junk out of my home myself.I bought directly from Nordictrak.com. They don't have any belts available and no estimates for arrival. 6 months!

PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Delivery was good. I started unpacking this behemoth and putting it together with the wife. We assembled the arms with ease and went to attach the console crossbar...Its 2-3 inches too short.Its not wide enough. I would assume it was packaged with the wrong console. You can't even bend the bars inwards to attach the console (pro-tip: They are metal). So after hours trying to get a hold of Nordictrack we finally spoke to a human. They told my wife she got the wrong department and to call the same number we just called 3 times then hung up on her.  When she called back they were closed.SO....We called Amazon and they are replacing the unit. We tore up the box because its really heavy so we are unsure of how to return it? Hopefully the replacement will be properly engineered and fit together.....I will post again when it is delivered. PS: If you made a video on how to put this together, please do not skip steps so the audience doesn't have to see you wrestle a piece in or screw a screw. Its actually helpful to watch you put it together!!! That's why you made the video right? Took me forever to find a video wherein a person set the piece in question on the arms... and it fit perfectly in the video! So thnx for that.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this to replace a treadmill purchased in 2004 and that I heavily used until it wore out.  I ordered the Amazon assembly service when it arrived and highly recommend that service.  Two technicians put it together in 1 hour and it worked perfectly on startup.  I am impressed by the clarity and color of the touch screen that opens when I turn the system on.  It offers a quick-entry workout video program that changes each day and displays images actually recorded at sites all over the world. The belt incline raises and lowers according to the terrain being displayed.  There are also many additional videos available with more different workout scenarios that are impressive in their detail and interest.  An example: a workout with a "partner" on the sidewalk along the Seine River in Paris; the workout winds in and out of other runners, pedestrians, sidewalk cafes--a constantly changing scene of visual and audio activity as though I were actually there doing the workout.  This is a fantastic improvement over my old treadmill that only displayed  an oval track and provided no visual stimulation at all. I highly recommend this product.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsContent: Arrived broken!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Bought the T57 4 years ago. Within a year of buying it, had to get a new motor. The new one was  also faulty and it would shut off after one hour and 40 minutes every damn time.  It was also super noisy!  Less than a year after that, it needed a new Display board.  Now here it is four years later and the motor went out again. I am 62 years old so I am not an avid super athlete you know! They've got some serious problems to figure out. It would be nice to find  A way to contact them by email to discuss my complaints and hope for a miracle whereby they could send me a 50% off coupon if I were to ever buy again. I was on the phone with them earlier today  and on hold for a good hour.  Considering the money I spent on that piece of junk it cost me $200 a year/$16 a month to call it my "own piece of junk".

CommentsTitle: So worth the purchase! Awesome solid fun stylish Treadmill.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2019
CommentsContent: This review is for the T65 Si updated series. IT IS AWESOME! Was delivered in a timely manner. They called the night before to make sure someone would be home. Helped my husband drag it in the house, ( thank God the box has handles.) It is heavy because of the motor. Everything was in the box, parts tools including the i fit code card for the free 1 yr membership, easy set up online. It’ll ask for your credit card, but will not charge it. Thankfully nothing was damaged, was packed very well. It only took my husband an hr to assemble the treadmill. Average instructions. Very solid machine. We are very very impressed with the console. The 10” HD screen is just as big as my iPad! Touch screen features are very cool. Several classes to choose from on the i fit. Love how the incline and speed automatically adjust with the instructor’s workout pace. Speakers are really not that bad. You can adjust volumes separately on both the instructor and the music in the background at the same time, which is another cool feature. Not a real noisy machine. Am satisfied with the comfort level walking on the belt. This treadmill with the added i fit personal training and wide HD screen has definitely revolutionized the walking/jogging experience! Helps put motivation with disciple in your workout. All in all a very solid, stylish and fun treadmill, was worth paying a little more. Hope this review helps, it took my husband and I a few days of reading reviews to help us decide on the right one. And we did a lot of comparisons as well. We are very happy with our purchase.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsContent: Flex Select.After months of using the treadmill, I love it, except . . .They tout the Flex Select feature. They refer you to iFit (my favorite scam with Nordic Track).iFit didn't recognize my registration and said they'd only talk to me if I registered the unit. One of the things you need is the serial number. I have no idea where that's at. Ditto, other information.Great. They're selling you a feature, but don't tell you how to use it.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Great treadmill. Quiet, but that is subjective so check this out: My 12 year old ProForm was so loud I couldn't hear the TV at full volume, with this I can hear fine at 80/100. So, I still have it on the loud side but it is a huge treadmill, I don't know how quiet it's going to get. Assembly wasn't a big deal. The deck was alligned and lubricated from the factory. I was a little turned off that I to register it and download the app to get it to work. You only have to use the app once to activate it. After that it works like any other treadmill. There might be a way to use it without downloading the app first but I couldn't figure it out.I was deciding between the Horizons T101, which I had seen in person, and this, which I had not. I really happy I went with this one.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: I shopped for quite awhile before I finally decided on this treadmill. I just got it last week and I've been on it every day since I got it. It seems very sturdy, is a good size without being too small or too big and is not noisy at all. I have no idea how easy it is to assemble because I paid extra to have them assemble it. I'm not a runner so I don't know what it would be like to run on but so far it's perfect for me just for walking. The only complaint I have about it is when you pause it to go to the bathroom or whatever, you can't re-start it without the clock and distance starting all over but that's not a big deal for me. I just remember how much time I had on it before I get off it. As others have said, to start it without subscribing to I-fit just push the I-fit button for 30 seconds and it will start. NOWHERE does it say this. I found this out from these reviews. So far I am very satisfied.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m GRATEFUL to previous reviewers who tipped me on how to bypass iFit by pressing the app button down for about 30 seconds. Otherwise, I would have believed all the WARNING signs plastered all over the packaging.  What a SCAM.  Very deceptive, Nordictrack. I thought you were better than that. This may scar your reputation and, frankly, I hope it does. I don’t like feeling forced to buy something I simply don’t need. I may eventually purchase the iFit module but only when I’M ready.It took my boyfriend an hour to assemble and he said it’s a well built machine. Everything fit as expected.  I’m pleased so far. I’ve only had it 3 days, so I hope my sentiments are the same at least a year from now.It does squeak and it’s disappointing you can’t connect your music via Bluetooth. However, reviewers didn’t care for the speakers so I’m using my AirPods instead.  Despite the highest set volume, I can still hear a little of the squeak.  That’s a little annoying.The belt is fantastic! My running shoes don’t slip, it’s nice and wide as well as long - I’m really leggy for someone who’s only 5’6”.  Aside from the intermittent squeaking, it’s a great platform.I’m a bit disappointed with the user manual. My console is not the one that is in the manual so I’m going to have to figure out some of the buttons and features on my own.  I don’t know if the console is for an older model or newer model. I’d hate to think I got an older design. $600 is not small beans.Overall, I am pleased so far.  I’ll remember to update my review in a few months. Hopefully, nothing changes.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: NordicTrack T 6.5 Si Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Treadmill seems ok, iFit subscription is a scam
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Took about an hour to assemble. Seems to work fine but beware! What they don’t tell you is that the iFit subscription isn’t a perk, it is a requirement or else the treadmill won’t work. It won’t even work unless the phone is paired with it.  Luckily there is a fix. To get around this, press and hold the iFit button until it resets and then you will be able to use it like a regular treadmill.  You will NOT find the direction to override this anywhere in the instructions. Very  unprofessional for a company with this amount of a presence in the fitness community to scam customers into an unnecessary subscription when they have already spent $600 on this treadmill. I won’t return this because it took too long to assemble, but I will not be buying from preform again.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Highly recommend a NordicTrack Treadmill Service Plan
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I have owned my NordicTrack treadmill for several years. I typically do not purchase service plans, but because I use my treadmill at least 5 times a week, I decided to take the chance and I am so glad I did. It has been super easy to have my treadmill serviced every year and parts replaced whenever needed, and I have never had to pay a dime for any replacement parts. The service plan has more than paid for itself. I am at the point where I now renew for 3 years at a time just because I am so pleased with their service plan. I highly recommend a NordicTrack treadmill WITH a service plan.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Don't forget to get the service contract.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I've been loyal to the NordicTrack brand for the last 18 years. In that time, I've had two Treadmills (currently an Elite 7700), two Ellipticals (currently an Elite 14.9), and one Upright Bike (GX 4.6 Pro). Except for the no-maintenance/easy-to-assemble bike, I've always had service contracts on my equipment. Why wouldn't I? They're mechanical. Anything mechanical is going to need maintenance and eventually repair. The service contracts I've purchased that are backed by ICON Fitness have ensured that I don't have a huge repair bill when I least want it, and that I don't have to go without my equipment for an extended period of time. And I always enjoy the certified repair people that ICON sends out. I always learn from them. And, at all my homes in those 18 years - Colorado, Michigan, Wisconsin and now back in Colorado - all the service folks have been great to work with. Having the service contract also means I don't have to go out and buy new equipment. Which is good for me because I don't always like the newer versions being offered. I was able to keep my first NordicTrack treadmill for 13 years and that's the one I liked the most. Upon reflection, I'd say the service contract has greatly influenced my loyalty and overall satisfaction.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Like the treadmill and love the iFit trainers.

CommentsContent: Overall I really like the t7.5 S. A few things I think could use improvement.1. Fan is useless. Even at full blast. I'm waiting for a clip-on fan to be delivered.2. The side foot rails seem narrow and I have very small feet. If you have large feet I think you'd either have your feet hanging off or be stepping on the belt.3. The 7" screen really is small due to black bars in the screen and that the stats appear in a thick bar across the top. I wish I'd sprung for the upgraded model for a larger screen. Or Nordic Track should give you a larger screen. It's not a cheap machine.4. Some of the components feel a little cheap. If you tripped on the front belt cover it feels like it would break.I had no problem with iFit as some other reviewers mentioned and really like the workouts. My only feedback is that there isn't as much to choose from as I had anticipated so I wonder if I'll get bored at some point or if they cycle new ones in regularly.

CommentsTitle: Be Wary of Required iFit Subscription!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2019
CommentsContent: The treadmill itself offers a great workout but I do not choose to use the iFit programming. My husband got it for me as a gift so I can exercise indoors and avoid gym fees. It does not take up too much space and is foldable. Amazon provided a technician to assemble the treadmill, which was very helpful. However, the iFit subscription requirement is a downer, so that removes one star. After assembly, we could not use the treadmill until we registered and activated an iFit account. They took our credit card info. We understood we were ordering a 30-day trial of the iFit program, which I never used. Then about a month later I received a “congratulations” email notifying me about my “purchase” of an iFit program subscription. It was a one-year fee of $180 plus tax, which I had not received advance notice of. When I emailed their customer service to attempt to cancel the subscription and get a refund, they said they could only refund a portion (about half) of the amount since I had agreed to their terms earlier. I am very disappointed in this process. It should be an option and not a requirement and consumers should be warned in advance of the additional costs! I also took one star off because I am unable to pause my workout for a couple of minutes (such as when needing to go answer the phone, etc.) and pick up where I left off on the distance, timer, and progress of my workout. I have to start all over each time. I have the treadmill on a mat on carpet and there seems to be too much bounce when I am working out. Other than that, it is a good machine.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership

CommentsTitle: Fits My Basic Needs Very Well
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2018
CommentsContent: I was looking for a very basic treadmill, to use once in a while- particularly during the winter months.  This is a fine machine for my needs. My needs include brisk to moderate walking 1-3 miles at a go, to sometimes a low jog. I don't really care about any of the exercise settings, though my husband does.  My only gripe- I wish it wasn't so loud.  It's not horribly loud, but I can hear it mildly on the main floor when my husband is walking on it in the open basement.  Nonetheless I would definitely recommend the product so far and possibly buy through Nordic Track instead of Amazon; when I ordered through Nordic Track, I got a "free" fourth year warranty included by the representative, instead of the three year that was promoted.  Also- I went ahead and paid for the installation through Nordic Track; well worth the money, in my opinion.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This review is more about the iFit applicationFirst the iFit PRO's- The graphics are fabulous- The trainers are also fabulous (Some celebrities show up to)- There is a wide range of workouts for the treadmill- everything from easy hikes to endurance runs... up hill and down hill- if you don't feel like running you don't need to follow the trainer, put it on zero incline and 2.5 speed for an easy walk- Great for the grand parents- You can play your own music or listen to theirs or listen to the trainer or not at all or listen to all 3 each has there own volume controlCONS- It is a subscription service ... I like working out with the trainers so I pay for it; but if you don't want it, there is a manual process and it works- iFit requires an internet WiFi connection- if your WiFi Connection drops, there is no way to get back to the middle of your workout, you would think a programmer could fix that in a couple of hours- Some of the trainers can be a little intimidating when they say keep it up and the machine is going faster then what the trainer is doing (That is when I do not follow the trainer and slow my machine down)- It shows your work out compared to others and you can swear that some person put the treadmill on the fastest highest steepest setting and then jumped off to get their name at the top of the list
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 10 InchesStyle Name: T 8.5 S Treadmill + 1 Year Membership

CommentsTitle: Moral of the story is to get a gym membership or...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Purchased it from Sears (with a *3 yr Extended Service Plan) on 10/2015.By 01/2016 the FIRST motor finally went. I called NordicTrack and they immediately placed an order for a new motor that I had to install. No problem. It was pretty straight forward.By 09/2016 the SECOND motor went. This time I insisted that they send a technician to install it. He came and replaced it and I was, once again, a power walking madman.Fast forward to today.Motor number THREE has gone. I called to their delight and found out that not only is the treadmill getting a new motor it is also getting:ASSY,LUBE,WLK BELT,D&C,W/RI; WALKING PLATFORM;WALKING BELT;MOTOR BELT;CONTROLLER.All for a grand total of $0.00Moral of the story is to get a gym membership or an Extended Service Plan when purchasing exercise equipment.*Service plan ends 10/2018.
PurchasemModel_Size: Display Size: 5 InchesStyle Name: T 6.5 S Treadmill + 1-Month iFit Membership
